And they have a section on "driving", which sort of makes sense, except what is there to know about driving in France?  It's the same as anywhere else in the West with no particular dangers or pitfalls.Lonely Planet is no longer a couple of happy hippies, they're a giant corporation who want all your money, even if it means manufacturing an entire new line of books right from the desktop with staple footage.  I'm continuously amazed how many books repackage the same material.It's really okay.  It's fun to look at for a few minutes.  But why bother?

In this 126 page book, mostly lifted From France country guide and France Discover, 18 pages in the back are exactly the same as that of "Chateaux of the Loire Valley Road Trips" (Ok, so one line is off, pushing back the formatting a bit to hopefully fool you).  Also a few pages in front are the same stuff you get in every LP.  After an extended version of their typical itineraries section, which looks a bit like their Discover series because of the extra pictures, it just moves on to "Destinations", which is a condensed version of their regular country guide (when they were in color for a short time).Also, these few hundred km max drives don't really strike me as a road trip.  "Road Trip" has me thinking exciting 6000km loops around the top half of Argentina or most of Turkey, not a spec of France.  And they have a section on "driving", which sort of makes sense, except what is there to know about driving in France?  It's the same as anywhere else in the West with no particular dangers or pitfalls.Lonely Planet is no longer a couple of happy hippies, they're a giant corporation who want all your money, even if it means manufacturing an entire new line of books right from the desktop with staple footage.  I'm continuously amazed how many books repackage the same material.It's really okay.  It's fun to look at for a few minutes.  But why bother?

Basically what you'd expect:  smaller than the red plastic solo cups found at glass-free parties, but big enough to hold a pint comfortably.  The quality and thickness are similar as well.  The printing is okay, but imperfect: you do see some bleed and sometimes white space between the colors, but only if you're examining closely to do a review.

This is a great puppet.  The eyes look fairly real, I like the material of the nose and claws, I love how the wings hook together via Velcro to create a totally different look, and - most of all - the 360-degree rotating head is fantastic; it is not detached from the body and yet you cannot see the plastic mechanism that keeps it attached and allows it to turn.  Very well done, and a great addition to any puppet show.

Works as advertised. Amplifies the signal plenty to hook my cameras, hard drives, and accessories to my TV from the back of the room with the cable under the floor. I like to have everything accessible from the back of the room so I can hook anything up conveniently.

While some people complain that these thicker types of paper leave dust and residue more commonly than the thinner (more sheets per roll) brands, I think that problem is minimized with this Ultra Strong Charmin.  I also think this is good for drying, if using a bidet.I also appreciate that it is scentless and just white.

This is an excellent machine for the current price of under three hundred dollars.  Thinking of someone who just wants a basic machine for web browsing and common computer tasks (I'm thinking of my mother here), they included all the things I would have included, and I understand where and why they made their cuts.It is thinner and lighter weight than most entry models, and while it doesn't look like a three thousand dollar machine, it is sleeker than I expected.  I like the full keyboard with number pad and basic touchpad.  The HDMI port allows watching full HD videos on your TV as applicable, while the included monitor is roughly (the computer version of) 720p.There are three USB ports, but only one is USB 3.0 (on the front of the right side).  So get used to using that one for removable drives, and leave any permanent low-bandwidth devices in the others..  The SD card slot (front of machine) is not spring-loaded, so you just shove it in there, and it sticks out halfway, so don't intend to store one in there permanently.I don't want to lose myself pontificating about Windows 10, but we can all thank God MS isn't sticking with the Win8 atrocity.  Windows 10 still really wants to control your life like Google and Apple, pushing things on you that you never wanted and trying to get you to sign up for all kinds of crap that will track you, control your life, and make it "clickably" easy to spend money, but through the control panel (which does still exist if you search for it) and the phone-style settings, you can turn everything off and make it more or less tolerable.  It is still sort of the two operating systems in one thing, but at least it's mostly back to normal (I still sort of miss Win7, which was so nice).Speaking of making your computing more tolerable:  this is slow if you're used to solid state memory and more RAM, especially since the operating system is a real resource hog.  Take some time to turn off all the crapware that comes on this machine, i.e., all the software put on not to help you, but because the companies paid MS and/or Toshiba to push it on you.  There are a lot of wasted resources right off the bat (as with almost any new computer, sadly), but getting rid of it all really makes a noticeable difference, especially in this case.Adding RAM would be your best upgrade to this, but I'm guessing they include 2 chips of 2GB, so you'll have to throw them both away if you wanted to upgrade to 8GB or more.It's missing a touchscreen and that crazy gesture reader they were trying to get consumers to desire.  Frankly, I don't want these things on a laptop, and I recently told my dad that these gimmicks (particularly the gesture reader) were a waste of money, and that's the last thing you want to pay extra for in a laptop (unless for some reason you really think you need them).  Kudos to Toshiba for offering a machine without these things and passing on the savings.I will say that you can hear it working all the time.  Just Windows Defender keeps this thing busy.  It's just a testament that computer speeds and specs need to keep growing if the operating systems and software keep becoming more greedy.Overall, I think that you can now get a decent machine for 25% less than you could previously.  And no Windows 8!

I remember when I was younger, wearing Skate clothes, finding it ironic that these guys were using their funny name to try the switch from work clothes to "cool" clothes.  Years later, having not thought about it once except to giggle at the name, I see they have made it full circle to the fashionable market.Seems like they're doing a good job.  These jeans are clearly of good quality, have a great color (slightly darker in person than the current picture), and are in line with what I see dudes wearing today.Be aware that these are what I would call "Skinny Jeans" - the type that chicks can pull off only if they have the appropriate body type, and very few dudes can pull off without looking weak or silly or girly - more than "slim straight".  I expect slim straight to be just that, but these (32x32) are fine around my waist but tight around my calves, tight enough that they feel different (uncomfortable a little, but just because I'm not used to that).  They won't cover the tops of most shoes.

I liked this book a lot.  It manages to give some good insight through localized stories not captured in most books or news, while at the same time offering a broad history of the region that so many other books on Israel I've read have managed to leave out, assuming the reader already knows about those items.  I really appreciated this because I have read a lot of books on Israel since having lived in neighboring Jordan, but I managed to miss out on some of the basics along the way (my pre-college education was poor and my college was very dominated by Engineering).But that's not to say it is all-encompassing.  He talks about checkpoints, walls, the Palestinian Authority, and all this stuff without much explanation.  I specifically remember not understanding what the deal was with all that before having visited Israel myself and looking closely for the answers I needed.Anyway, I really enjoyed following a few diverse families on this street and their versions of what happened through these minor historical events, most of which will not be captured in history books or other offerings.  One of the eight chapters - the one with the foreigners - was starting to annoy me for some reason.  I guess I was just tired of hearing about them, but really, it makes sense to hear ALL sides, even if that means throwing in some Americans' points of view.Easy to read, even with a lot of quoting and the poor language skills - primary, secondary, or not - that come with it.  I find all those quotes work for this book, to really get a feel for and understand what it might have been like to live there over the years.  However, from chapter to chapter and even within some chapters, it's sometimes hard to keep the chronology of everything straight.Overall, a very enjoyable book

This is a nice extra to have, but it is unfortunate that it is an add-on rather than thought up and manufactured at the same time as the tool.  That is because it uses the same holes to mount as the blade itself, meaning you have to use the included (flathead screwdriver-using) hardware in lieu of the nice thumbscrews that came with my Hayate.  This is unfortunate because now you need to carry the screwdriver AND the thumbscrews if you think you will want to remove this at any time - and you may want to because it makes it harder to maneuver the pole in tight spots.Otherwise, it is well made and a thoughtful idea.I assume the other screws are for the other poles it fits.

This thing is totally awesome.  Seriously.  I spent about four hours trimming my fully mature black walnut tree with it the other day.  First I did some branches off my second story balcony, with the pole fully extended and just 20-30 degrees from horizontal.  At one point, I got my blade stuck and it was flexed so badly that I was afraid I ruined the blade.  But no...it's perfect.And then I did a bunch more branches from the ground.  I hate how they say this thing is 20' long, but gives you a 25' reach, depending on your size.  I was out there with just the tip of the butt in my fully extended arms, completely vertical at times, sawing by going from tiptoe to flat and back, giving me approximately a 28' reach, and more like 32' once I stood on a wooden structure.I also did some branches that were sticking straight down just by angling from underneath.All this went surprisingly smooth.  Yes, it is easiest to go at a 30' angle from vertical, but I was comfortable the other ways as well.  Some muscles were tired afterword...It may seem extreme to buy this for one large tree, but it would have cost more to have a "professional" come out for the afternoon.  And I am a man who appreciates perfection in tools and the ability to go trim some more on my own time, anytime I like.BTW, Japan has so many amazing things that haven't made it over this way.  I was always fascinated to find these treasures while I lived over there, and I'm continually impressed with their traditional woodwork and the fact that they often use manual saws even for fine woodworking and architecture.  On this saw, I think even the pop-up buttons are more than meets the eye:  I noticed they don't function as you would expect unless you unlatch all the latches, as per the instructions (which come in English).Really fantastic tool.

I have never in the past given astrology  a second thought or cared much about it, beyond thinking it was the work of Satan as a youngster thanks to my mother's brainwashing "not for profit" church.  I saw this book, and thought it would be interesting, as I am a Scorpio.  It helped me to give astrology a second thought and, indeed, I believe there is something to it.  Not sure I'm on board with psychics and all that yet, but the signs and their associated personality types certainly seem fitting.So it's a very interesting book, and easy to read.  The writing is fine, but it is her second job, so it is not sublime.  I know she does it to keep track of who is who, but she keeps calling you, Aires, by your sign, which seems a little forced at times.  Also, there are sections for each sign on how to deal with Scorpio, which means a lot of repeat (yes, yes, always enjoy sex with Scorpio, and don't critisize him) reading or - if you're not interested in how the other signs need to interact with Scorpio -  a bunch of unused/unread material.She does a pretty good job of cluing you into the basics of astrology, although I missed the part in the book where it tells you what sign is born when, so I had to look that up; that part seemed like an oversight.All in all, worth a read if you're interested.

I bought some smoke/CO alarms in Jan 2015, the earliest of which were manufactured in July and Aug of 2014.  They all came with Duracells with a "guaranteed charge holding date" of Dec 2023.  I've since found some Energizers in my house from at least two different products with dates of Mar 2023.  These green/yellow batteries, ordered in Aug 2015, came with "guaranteed charge holding dates" of December 2021.  This matters pretty much when you're buying a large pack like this.They work, and are fairly inexpensive in this large pack.  It's nice to have a large pack of AAs, even though I try to not buy stuff that needs batteries when possible.Batteries aren't good for the environment, especially when they end up in the fire, trash, or enhancing some third-world addict's beer.  I really don't want to sacrifice expense or quality to be green, nor do I have the ability to tell what - if anything - is actually "green" about these batteries.  I just know they tell you on the package they'll come get the corpses for free, but later you find out you have to buy a lot more to get that deal.  Stupid...

This is a good, inexpensive helmet that reminds me a lot of my clear Uvex face shield in its adjustability and weight.  It has the Z87 polycarbonate piece on the outside protecting the filter, both of which can be removed and replaced.  Despite the Z87 rating, the manual still asks you to wear safety glasses underneath, which seems to be a standard request.You can also replace the lens with one that is auto-darkening, but I suspect in that case, you might instead consider an all around higher end helmet.  The filter is not appropriate for oxy-acetylene welding or plasma cutting, and if you replace the lens with one that is auto-darkening, you need one specifically designed for that use.The headpiece is similar to a (decent) hardhat, with the plastic band, padded front, turn-knob tightening, and very adjustable (to include angle and closeness to face, in addition to typical hardhat adjustability).  As another reviewer mentioned, you can tighten/loosen it just enough that you can make it drop with a quick nod of your head.If you want to wear it with a hard hat, you need an accessory, sold separately.  Even with a hardhat, it is not suitable for overhead welding (because no splatter protection).Overall, it feels safe and not at all a bad choice for the occasional hobbyist.

This is too tall to get under my '97 3er BMW.  But I have a floor jack for that.I used this multiple times over the past two weekends to replace columns on my porch.  I put a piece of 2x8 on the end of a 4x4, drilled a 1.125" hole on the other end to fit over the head of this thing, and got to it (put some plywood or other boards underneath to distribute weight and keep the metal from marring surfaces).  The 1.125" hole was extremely helpful at keeping my 4x4s in place during the process.This thing is awesome.  It was worth the twenty bucks just to not have to haul my floor jack out from the garage to the porch, put all that extra weight and rusty wheels on my new PVC porch that I was at first concerned about, and deal with the lateral movements you get with a floor jack.I had no problems getting the piston to retract.  I just push down on it lightly with my hand while turning the release valve.You can top this thing off with oil if need be, so I suspect it should always work as long as you don't actually break it open or let it rust away.  Nice product.

This is a pretty nice bag.  I don't see being content with it for a multi-day mountain journey or anything like that, because I know more compressible, lighter (and warmer, if you need it) models are available, but it seems to have everything else you need in terms of comfort:I'm ~73"+, and have no problem with the length.  It's not like a California King size bed in that some top cover pressure will be on your feet, but you don't want it loose when trying to stay warm.  I like the neck padding, the fact built in hood (which can be a makeshift pillow under warmer circumstances), the Velcro that keeps the (cold) zipper out of your face, the fact that there are two zippers heads for versatility, and that the carry bag covers all sides to keep the dirt out (you can even pull it small enough to get it back in the original box).For casual camping, it's a great pick.

Crazy to actually see a different formula for vinyl protector.  You have to put some work into this to get it to dry, almost like buffing something with wax.  I recommend you don't use it on your seats or steering wheel until you are comfortable with how dry you can get it.  Works well, though:  seems like putting in some work always means you get results.

This is a pretty neat grill.  It's a good size - large enough to cram a bunch of food on, but small enough for camping or otherwise keeping in the car in most situations.Although grills without open flame are never quite as good, the propane is at least better than electric, and you really can't have open flame leaking grease all over this thing, or it would reek up your whole car for the rest of the trip.  A good compromise, I think.  Well done.

Good toothpaste.  It's strong and feels like it's getting its job done.  It has that biting feeling that some lesser toothpastes do not have.Note that it does contain triclosan, which is a chemical that some people believe to be harmful to your body's good bacteria.  That may be what provides the "biting" feeling mentioned above.

I am sorry but I cannot recommend this product.  It is very light and has a reflector, but it does not retract we at all and difficult to lock, when you can lock it.  The leash is thin and I wouldn't put a dog on it that weighed more than about 12 pounds.  The construction. Is cheap, the leash is more like a cord, and it is tied to the end of the hook. 2 star rating is kind. There are much better products out there.

Another pair of high quality sunglasses from Duduma, this is my second pair. This pair is black with black and medium grey sides. They are both conservative and stylish.  The shades are attractive, stylish, durable, lightweight, comfortable, and fit securely (unlike other glasses that feel like they are going to fall off, or hurt your ears, or have semi-sharp edges. None of that with Duduma.)  Lens  are of a quality that provide a sharp viewing image.Glasses are UV 400 polarized and said to be unbreakable. The lenses provide 100% UV protection according to the seller.  Duduma provides a 30 day money back guarantee and lifetime warranty on frames and lenses.  Glasses come in a nice drawstring bag with a cleaning cloth.  Just to mention it one more time, they are EXTREMELY comfortable. They make a great gift for yourself or someone else.

Looks exactly as shown in the picture, it is an excellent belt, sturdy, well made, double-stitched at top and bottom, all leather, with sturdy metal buckle. Buckle is reinforced in back for extra durability.  This is an great belt for jeans, but attractive enough for regular slacks.Belt width/height is 1 1/2 inches. Depth/thickness is 1/8 inch all leather. 6 punched holes, it fits true to size.  This belt is an excellent purchase and gift. It is well made and should last a very long time.

These 6 washcloths are pretty and silky soft and are 70% bamboo fibet and 30% cotton.  Each is slightly less than 10 inch by 10 inch.  Cloths arrive in a sturdy plastic zip lock pouch, suitable for reuse. They feel so nice on the skin, like silk, and would be a nice gift for yourself, baby, or someone with sensitive skin.  The advertisement also states that bamboo fiber cloths naturally prevent microorganisms  and mildew from growing and have a natural deodorant effect. They are said to retain their softness even after repeated usage and washings.  They are so very pleasant to the touch.Made in China. Email and website provided.

I have same knives, colors slightly different.  Mine are blue, purple, and green. The colors are bright and gorgeous. They are very sharp.  Handle is comfortable and the protective hard plastic shield is a big plus. They are coated carbon stainless steel.  The largest is 7 inch blade, 12 inch total length, the middle is 6 1/4 blade and 11 1/2 total length, the smallest (paring knife) is 4 1/4 inch blade and 9 inch total. Sturdy shield covers entire blade. Theses are very nice knives and make a nice gift for a shower or for yourself.

I think this is a great buy for the price, it all depends on the level of expertise and needs of the user.  For a child or a senior to be "in touch" it is an affordable buy.  It works like a regular PC tablet, and with your WiFi hookup, you can be on line and operational. It was a quick aand easy set up right out of the box.  The device came with a protective caseand keyboard for easy access and portability.  It includes a USB charging cable and small operating manual.  Screen is about 7 inches by almost 5 inches.  It is inexpensive and makes a nice gift.  I was very pleased with the product.  So far, it is performing well.  I have been using it for about 2 hours so far and my charge is at 66%.  You will need to purchase a wall plug  (power adapter) to accept the USB cable, so you can charge, but many folks already have several.Now, if you are already a frequent PC user, this is not up to that same level of quality.  When you compare to the screens of a high-price tablet, the clarity and back light is less, as is the respnsiveness on the keyboard and screen.  But if you want something very nice, and a lot less expensive, this was a great product.

High quality, stainless steel, dishwasher-safe scissors wont rust (according to supporting materials). Handles have a built in screw driver, bottle opener, and nutcracker tools.  They chop herbs, cut seafood, scale fish, peel fruit, and cut through chicken bones.  They come apart and go back together easily, with just a turn, for easy and thorough cleaning.  Scissors have a nice weight and padded handles feel comfortable in the hand.  They come in a heavy pastic magentized shield for protection, but the magnet should be a little stronger so the shield could stick to the side of the fridge without sliding down.  the scissors are awesome. Bonus 101 recipe book available via email. Website provided for support.

Form fitting shell case, access to buttons and features, leather exterior and interior and 4 sides finished coating to provide better grip.  Matt finish.  Packaged nicely in hard cardboard box and inside bag. stitched leather back. Sides seem to be hard plastic with a matt coating.  Comes with a screen protector.
Baked, no artificial flavors, colors, or preservatives, no trans fat, non GMO, and gluten free. A1 oz/28g bg has 140 calories, and 230 mg sodium.  Excellent taste.

A very different type of bib, this one is made from 100% food grade silicone and designed for age 6 month plus.  The silicone is very soft and it is designed to hook around baby securely, more like a vest, and without neck strain.  The silicone is easy to wipe and reuse and it provides a built in crumb catching tray.Nice idea, very soft and flexible, the pink is a bright pink with a cute little bear stamped on the front. Bib coverage area is about 7 inches long X a graduated 5 3/4 X 7 inches wide.  Sid to be anti-microbial safe silicone, and more comfortable for baby (because it comes across the shoulders instead of around the neck), it can easily be cleaned under running water.  This product is a nice shower gift.

I love this series.  If you haven't seen it, you really need to start with Season 1 and work your way through.  The show is now in its 11th year for a reason....it's GREAT!  Sam and Dean Winchester are brothers, traveling the country and fighting demons.  The series began with Dean as a young boy and Sam as a baby, when their mother was whisked away by a demon.  Dad went demon hunting, Dean looked out for Sam, and the show began.  The boys grew up and followed in Dad's footsteps.  Even into the 11th year, there are still plenty of demons to fight and enough variety to keep it all interesting.In Season 10, especially with the awesome blu ray clarity, Dean and Sam, along with Angel Castiel, continue to fight demons, while searching for a cure for Dean's Mark of Cain.  Season 10 continues with the same quality as before. Crawley, Mama Witch Rowena, Metatron, and many others travel in and out of episodes.  23 episodes on 4 CDs provide many hours of scary entertainment, even a confrontation with Cain himself.  The Winchester boys have also developed their own distinctive personalities.Whether you believe in demons or not, this series is well done in a believable way in that the characters have emotions and display lots of "human qualities".  Special features include:  3 episode commentaries, a memory share from seasons 1 - 9, a preview of season 10 from 2014 Comic-Con, behind the scenes for the 200th episode, (200 EPISODES and counting!), a piece on the Mark and the Blade (a special killing blade goes with the Mark), a piece on Supernatural fans, unaired scenes, and a gag reel.

I am very pleased with this product.  It works well, leaves my teeth bright and feeling good, the taste is good, and it does not have all the crummy stuff in it I try to avoid.  This 6 ounce/170g toothpaste is said to "promote healthy teeth and gums, freshen breath, and is sulfate free....Exclusive blend of 7 oral health botanicals".  It smells nice, tastes nice, minty, cleans nice, and teeth feel great.The Antioxidant Dental Blend includes cranberry, pomegranate, white tea, grapeseed, aloe, ginger, and bisabolol.  It contains calcium and baking soda.  It is flouride free, paraben free, no sodium lauryl/laureth sulfate, no artificial flavors or sweeteners, contains no animal biproducts or testing.It is cruelty free and vegan, made in the USA.  Phone, address, and website are provided for support.I don't know about you, but I hate finding flouride, saccharine, sulfates, parabens, and other garbage in my toothpaste.  That is why I went searching for something better and that is why I love this toothpaste.

Knife is super thin, to fit in wallet for emergency.  It has metal sides.  Knife is sharp and locks in place on card until you are ready to use.  "Card" fits inside its own plastic sleeve for added protection and safety when not in use.Paracord bracelet clips securely  with heavy duty plastic clip.  It has a small compass and a sharp-edged tool.  It clips and unclips easily.  Measures 9 inches closed and is 1 1/8 inches wide.  Appears securely made.

Very nice product.  Hard plastic knuckle protection and hard pieces atop fingers where they join hands.  Extra protection across the top of hand.  Elastic upper part of fingers and wrist.  Many reinforced areas, such as finger tips.  Velcro allows you to pull them tight at wrist.  There is even a small tab to help you pull the glove on securely. They are anti-slip, impact resistant, sweat-absorbant, breathable, quick-dry, wear-resistant.These gloves are a plus for outdoor folks.  They can be used for tactical and shooting training, air pistols, outdoor sports, mountaineering, etc.  The advertisement states that soldiers in many country now use this glove.  They come in a plastic, reusable zip lock bag and make a nice gift for the outdoor guy in your life (or, outdoor girl).Note -- important to buy your true size, so the knuckles fit directly behind the hard plastic shield.  Do not oversize like you may do on other gloves.

Nice sized jewelry bags, bigger than I thought.  They are transparent and good for keeping jewelry separated.  Folks in jewelry business also use them as gift bags.  Colors are good.  They have many uses.

My son's goldfish love these food disks, because they really gobble them up.  He gives them as a treat, in addition to the goldfish food.  They are little colored disks.  He must be doing something right because these goldfish are huge -- pan size..... (shhhh.  Don't tell the fish I said that.)

This paracord bracelet is 9 3/4 total length and looks just like the photo -- bright orange and lime green on a black background, with a secure, sturdy heavy-duty plastic clasp and biohazard symbol.  Good to have as emergency tool for outdoor activities (or the zombie apocalypse, whichever comes first :).  Strong paracord, appears well constructed and finished off.  My 42 year old son loves biohazard symbols and loves this bracelet.Do not disassemble unless you need to.

This is a very well-written book of Della's personal tragedy and how she coped, and continues to cope with the death of her 29 year old son.  It is NOT just a meditation book, as the cover might suggest.  Interwoven within the story are meditations to use as tools to help with the grief.  This is a very nice book for someone who has lost a loved one.Della's son died as a result of an auto accident.  One minute he was there, so full of life, the next he was gone.  This book touches on the spiritual aspects of death and provides practical meditations, using visualization techniques, to help one ground and center.  Della's studies in psychic awareness have obviously served her well and what she learned was there when she needed it the most.These are excellent meditations and I am in complete agreement with her perspectives.  Your loved ones are closer than you might image.  Many folks have experienced hints that their loved ones are still around.  It is so, if you open yourself up to believing.I highly recommend this book for someone who is grieving the loss of a loved one.  If you can get this book to them early on, all the better, especially in the first months of passing, when they feel the loss so greatly.  Della's story should make a lot of sense to the reader and provides practical advice and coping tools.  And, yes, you MUST grieve to release those feelings, but there are practical ways to grieve.Thank you, Della, for sharing your personal story to help those in pain.
I love this stuff.  Been taking it for years to help with my blood pressure.  It is a blend of hawthorn and garlic.  As a matter of fact, I will be reordering soon.

Easy to set time, alarm, month, date, year.  Temperature was pre set to celsius.  There was a switch for farenheight, but that didn't seem to work (or I couldn't figure it out --not in instructions, but no big deal on temp).  Snooze and light bar on top.  Can set light for back light to on or off.  Can set alarm time for on and off.  5 3/8 length x 3 height x 1 7/8 deep.  Nice for travel, desk, countertop, etc.  Works well. Alarm is loud enough.  Alarm starts with a few spaced apart beeps, escalating to multiple beeps.  The clock also has a snooze button.  Mine is on my desk at work.Uses 3 AAA batteries (not included) -- available in 5 colors.

This product is a very nice alternative to a full vest, providing Visability for runners, bikers, walkers, traffic directors, dog walkers, and anyone else who wants to be seen at night. Highly reflective,  it is easy to slip on and clicks at the waist. The product will fit most people and is adjustable. It is non-restrictive, well made, and sturdy. It requires very little sturgeon space, so you can easily fold it in a bag and keep it in your car. Don't put a price on your life. This is a product for those who need to be seen in the darkness.

Very nice bracelet for man or woman, this one is not as heavy and is about 3/8 inch wide. It is all silver in color and very flexible stainless steel.  Approximately 9 1/2 inch total length, it is shiny and attractive. It comes in a sturdy black cardboard box suitable for gift-giving.

I really like these glasses. They are stylish, lightweight, and comfortable. I have the white frame (all around the lens) with blue lenses and blue side accents.They are said to be unbreakable and "100% of UV400 coating blocks 100% of the harmful UVA and UVB rays." Also said to be impact and scratch resistant.I used them while driving in bright sunlight and found images to be sharp and clear without distorting object colors, only making them slightly darker.  Comes in a soft fabric draw string pouch with a cleaning cloth.

The RFID blocking is in the large pocket. It is slim, comfortable, and made of water resistant, rip-stop nylon with double-stitched, reinforced seams.  The entire unit is 6 X 11 1/4 inches. The front pocket is 4 1/2 X 8, tapered to about 9 inches at base. The back pocket opens to a full 6 X 11 1/4 . Both pockets zippered. The back pocket also has separate sections, one about 3 1/2 inch wide, the other about 6 inches wide. There is a all clip inside on a hook for a key. The black belt clip fits inside the right side. There is a hidden pocket in the back of the unit (where it touches the body). The hidden pocket is large, about the size of the whole unit without a zipper. The fabric against the body is soft. The elastic belt is about 27 inches and can stretch to about 31.

I am writing on my phone and don't see a way to upload a photo, so will try to do that later, BUT, when comparing the old part with the new part, there are noticeable differences in the Microsoft lable, specifically,  the UL symbol and all the Microsoft writing is missing. There are also 2 bar codes on the old lable, one bar code on the new one. When you hold both units end to end, you can see there is a plastic shield on the old one. But you can see right through the new one. Very suspicious to be that different. You can also see a slight size difference and it feels like a slight weight difference.  And, the new part is not fixing the problem with the Xbox.  The missing UL logo is what caught my eye right away. I thought that HAD to be on the product if sold in this country. I have to wonder, with all the differences, if this is a knockoff.

These are 9 inch, heavy duty, industrial grade, high carbon stainless steel scissors.  They have rubberized handle grips to make cutting comfortable on the hands. The advertisement says the blades stay sharper longer. They are a nice heavy weight, well balanced, cut smoothly, and comfortable to use.  They cut easily through an Amazon shipping box.  A big winner and recommend everyone have a pair.They come in a heavy black cardboard box with a small plastic shield. Makes a real nice gift for anyone, male or female, because everyone needs a good pair of scissors.

I love this brush. A friend gave it to me, so now I have to buy one to carry, too, while the other one waits for me in the bathroom for a morning and evening brush. I have long, thick hair and it takes a little bit of detangling after my shampoo. This brush cuts right through tangles, without ripping out my hair. If my hair is dry, it fluffs it out very nicely. I have to say it's the nicest brush I've found to date. If it works on my hair, it should work on anyone's.

Set of 50 multicolored, 1 inch long clips, these are great for holding things in place while you are doing something. Whether you are gluing craft items, quilting, making clothing, or stitching a seam, there are many uses for these little clippies. Much easier on the fingers, and a lot easier to see than straight pins, these clippies can also be used by teachers,  day school teachers, crafters, seamstressers, and parents with small children.  The sturdy spring-press clip works along the same principle as a clothes pin. Clippies come packed in a plastic container 3 1/8 high x 2 1/2 diameter.

Nice toy! The page says designed for ages 3 to 5, but I say ages 3 to 83, because you are never too old to play with toys.  The bat has a nice little weight and has a plastic core, covered with 1/2 inch foam. The handle has a thinner foam wrap. The bat comes with a foam ball. Bat is 21 1/2 inches long, and 2 inch diameter across top.

Pretty neat-flexible, easy store and travel, FDA approved. This is said to be food-grade silicone. Pop up and collapse down. The pack of 3 bowls is dishwasher, microwave, and freezer safe. Each bowl has an extended piece with a pre-punched hole and the set comes with one belt clip to hand bowl from belt loop, backpack, etc. Each bowl expanded is 2 1/4 X 3 5/8 diameter at the bottom, and 5 1/8 diameter across the top. Bowls fold flat to 1/2 inch high. One of each color: red, blue, yellow/green.  Apparently can be used for dog or person. Colors make it easy to tell which you previously used for what.

Excellent product. 9.5W (replacement for 60 W incandescent bulb). Nice and bright. Life expectancy 50,000 hours. "Daylight white". Claims to save more than 80 % electricity.  Standard bulb type base. Highly recommended.Received in exchange for a review. Would definitely buy these.

This is a thinner black braided leather bracelet and is very nice for a man or woman. The stainless steel clasp is easy to open and close with a slight push on the slide-in clip that locks it in place. The stainless steel is resistant to corrosion, fading, etc. Makes a nice gift. Comes with a draw string fabric bag.

The entire base of the unit is approximately 3 3/4 X 5 . The light portion contains 12 LEDs  and that section is 2 3/4 X 2.  The solar panel on top is about 3 3/8 X 2 3/8. 2 mounting holes are cut into the heavy duty plastic and the mounting hardware is included. The unit turns on with a small key, included, and then you can leave it on/active if you choose.  There is a built in dimmer, and it will brighten when you walk by it.Again, very nice for walls, deck posts, trees, wherever you want some bright LED motion sensor lights. Also is said to be waterproof and is wireless.I got this free, in exchange for a review. I like it so much, I plan to purchase about 9 more for the house.

Very nice product. Product is said to be 100% pure, unrefined and cold pressed, organic Moroccan argan oil, imported from Morocco and bottled in the USA. USDA and eco-certified. All natural, nothing added or removed. 4 oz/120 ml glass, pump bottle.Oil can be used to hydrate face, skin, hair, soften beard, nails, hands, feet. You can also add shine to hair and smooth frizzy hair. Product is non-greasy and does not irritate my sensitive skin. It has a 90-day money back guarantee.I have been using on my face, hair, hands. The pump bottle works well.  For the face, I pump a tiny amount into my hand, dot on my face, and rub in, in small circular motions. The product goes a long way because you don't need much. This 4 oz bottle is almost 6 inches tall, counting the top. Product was provided free in exchange for a review and I will buy a replacement bottle when I run out.

What a great buy these scissors are!  They are so nice that EVERYBODY should have at least one pair in their home. If you have a camper or boat, I suggest another pair.  The scissors are a heavier weight, have many functional uses, and can be easily taken apart to clean, and put back together, with a simple twist.  The ergonomic soft-grip handle makes them easy to hold and use.  They come with a hard-plastic, magnetic shield holder, but the magnet is not strong enough to hold the scissors up, but you can arrange the shield to hold them at the base of a magnetic unit.These scissors would also make an excellent gift for the person who has most everything. They open bottles, scale fish, crack nuts, peel vegetables, separate into 2 slicing blades, has screwdriver blade. Made of stainless steel.  Website and email for support. How-to Guide also available on website. They were provided in exchange for a review.

Nice men's leather wallet, size 3 1/2 X 4 1/2 folded, and looks just like the amazon photos.  When opened, it sports 4 credit card slots on each side. Left side also has a fold-over flap to hold driver's license. Inside $$$ pocket is separated into 2 compartments.  The wallet has a nice feel. Another reviewer checked out the RFID protection on a scanner at a local police department and said it passed.  Nice feel. Stitched leather. Comes nicely packaged and in a sturdy cardboard box, suitable for gift giving. -- This product was provided in exchange for a review.

Nice soft leather combo wallet phone case, folds over to close, has magnetic clasp.  Fits phone 2 5/8 X 5 3/8. Especially nice for the price.  Phone lays inside a plastic insert that is attached to the lining. All the normal case holes are precut for taking photos, charging, earphones, etc. You can slide fingers under the phone case on its left side if you need to. Inside the case are 4 slots, one for ID and 3 for credit cards. Pocket behind the cards can hold some folding money.The multi color, block leather pattern is pretty. There is also a small metal ring reinforced hole at the top for a key ring.  Stitched leather wallet comes in a heavy black cardboard box suitable for gift giving. Nice gift for a young lady, especially if she carries either a very small purse or no purse. Whole wallet is only a hair larger than the phone and has a closed thickness of about 7/8 inches.  Could possibly fit in her pants pocket.

100 mg, 150 soft gels, only 1/2 inch long with rounded edges, so it is a small, easy to swallow gel cap. Serving is one softgel. Also contains 5mg BioPerine black pepper fruit extract. Other ingredients include extra virgin olive oil, gelatin (bovine, hatal), vegetable glycerine, beeswax, purified water. This product is said to promote powerful cellular defense that supports the body's production of energy in each cell.  The label also says it is especially critical in maintaining a healthy cardiovascular and circulatory system. The added BioPervine is said to help with bioavailability and absorption. This supplement is said to also improve energy levels and stamina, fortify cognitive and immune function, provide antioxidant protection to support healthy aging, and assist in exercise recovery. MADE IN THE USA! Website provided for additional info and support. "USP pharmaceutical grade CoQ10,  100% naturally fermented.

I am very pleased to say I have been taking this supplement for about 3 weeks and it seems to have noticeably helped with my arthritis (bone to bone) in both knees. And, being honest, I usually only take 2 capsules a day instead of 4 (because I usually forget in the evening) and it has still helped.There are 240 soft caps, each about 7/8 inch long. Recommended dosage is 2 caps, twice daily, so this bottle is a 60 day supply. A serving is 2 caps. A serving contains 750 mg glucosamine sulfate 2KCL, 600 mg chondroitin sulfate, and 500 mg methylsulfonylmethane  (MSM). Other ingredients are hypromellose (vegetarian capsules), rice flour, and ascorbyl palmitate.  Glucosamine is obtained from the shells of shrimp, according to the lable. Made in USA, I am happy to say. This supplement is said to improve joint movement,  function and integrity, and increase collagen production for healthy cartilage and improve hair, skin and nails. Easy to swallow.I am very pleased with this product. It was provided to me in exchange for a review.
This is a nice, bright, small LED keychain light. Slide on/off switch on bottom side. About 7/8 inch diameter X 1/4 inch thick. You get 10, so you can share with family and friends.

I like the idea of having a portable, convenient way to bring salad with dressing around on the go. And the fact that it is in an unbreakable container without dangerous BPA plastics or the hazards of glass. Plus, It's certainly big enough to hold plenty of yummy, nutrient-dense greens and a fatty dressing as part of my low-carb diet. There is one challenge with this--getting a utensil down into the jar to eat it. The color is nice (purple is my wife's favorite color!) and very decorative. I'll likely get more of them soon.

Believe it you guys--these washcloths are SO soft! My wife was greatly impressed when she used them to wash her face that is sensitive to the typical fibers in a standard washcloth. Yes, they're smaller, but the tradeoff is worth it. GET THESE!

It's difficult to give a review of a supplement purchased over Amazon, but I've been taking CoQ10 for years since I took statins over a decade ago. When you take cholesterol-lowering drugs like Lipitor or Crestor, it depletes your body of an essential hear nutrient. That would be CoQ10. There are a multitude of other reasons to take CoQ10 and this one is VERY well priced compared to what you get in stores. This Viva Labs brand includes a pepper extract that is supposed to help absorb the CoQ10 better. I dunno. But it's worth taking to keep your heart functioning well.

My wife is a big Transformers fan and I was excited to get this Transformers Robots in Disguise Super Bumblebee Figure for her. And when she opened it, the sheer size of this figure is certainly impressive. But unfortunately that's about the only thing impressive about this. For $50, I expected a whole lot better than very thin plastic, cheesy sound and light effects that aren't great quality, and a complete inability to transform well with the big plastic parts all discombobulated. It was like performing surgery to get the car to look like a car. It's too bad, Hasbro. This is a strong brand that could have many more fans if you made toys that lived up to the billing. This one very clearly did not.

My wife LOVES being able to know what is happening in the weather when the power goes out. She has weather apps on her iPhone, an electric weather radio, and other such emergency situation devices--but this Motorola Solutions T480 Talkabout Rechargeable Emergency Preparedness Two-Way Radio has now become her new favorite technology for peace of mind during a disaster. It's super-easy to charge, compact, and ready to go when you need it. Very user-friendly and fits the bill for you when the power is out and you need to know what's going on. This seems like a no-brainer to have on hand for when the unthinkable could happen.

I've been needing a bag to take to the farmer's market and this little tote bag was the perfect size. And with the pretzel on the outside of the bag, it was PERFECT and ironic for me--I eat a low-carb diet. HAHA! I love the funny looks I get for my "Do The Twist" bag walking around buying fresh veggies, meats, and other real food from my farmer's market. LOVE THIS BAG!!!

Let it go...of your delay on getting this book for your favorite little fan of FROZEN, that is! My 7-year old niece absolutely LOVES that movie and all the characters in it. So this book full of hairstyle and other beauty tricks was an absolute must. Not surprisingly, she loves it. I think I'm the best uncle in the whole world to her right now. HAHA! Get this book and you won't be disappointed. And it's excellent for those years where little girls turn into young ladies.

I'm not preparing for the AP exam, but am an American history buff (I was a Political Science major in college with lots of history classes). So I was intrigued to check out the latest information being taught to students about U.S. History and got this book. As you can imagine, this book gives a lot of assistance on taking the test itself, including LOTS of practice test questions, which could be useful for students needing to pass the exam. The companion DVD gives some excellent instructions on improving your ability to score well on the test.The only downside of the book is that it doesn't go into great detail on any particular part of American history. Important dates, events, and other items of historical significance are mentioned but not detailed. Perhaps that is by design to prevent this from being a 100-volume encyclopedia but anyone can easily Google these to learn more. The chronological and thematic organizing of the information is especially helpful to know what happened in what order. As for the information's accuracy, it's okay. I'm sure there will be people who have certain opinions about what happened in our nation's history. But the facts are the facts and they should speak for themselves without any editorializing. All in all, not too shabby a book to learn about American history.

WOW, where has this ZealSound Magic Cube Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker been for so long? This is by far the best  economical Bluetooth speaker out there on the market. The sound is louder than most this size and plays out of the front and the back for a full, rich sound with good bass. And unlike other similar products, you just switch it on, it says "Hello" and you're connected. Easy peasy!

Utter and complete garbage. It turned on once and was very difficult to turn off (you have to hold down the power button for over 10 seconds to turn off). The second time I went to turn it on, the light blinked over and over again and never synced to Bluetooth. Too many other GREAT Bluetooth speakers to be bogged down by these major flaws. I'm ashamed of the iHome brand for putting out something like this. Atypical for your usual quality.

My friend didn't realize how amazing a memory foam bed topper could feel like until she watched our house for us while we were on vacation recently. She plopped on our bed that had a 3-inch thick topper and fell in love. So to surprise he we got her this topper--needless to say she LOVES it. It's been over two decades since she has been able to sleep in a bed and now she can. THANK YOU!

I can't get enough of this book. As an English major in college and a huge pop music fan, this Pop Sonnets book mashes together both of these loves and passions into one glorious and hilarious masterpiece. These sonnets written Shakespearean-styled take a modern pop song like "All About That Bass" by Megan Trainer and, well, dignifies it a bit. I won't spoil how they do it, but Erik Didriksen definitely had too much time on his hands to come up with this idea. But the execution is brilliant. Great to read out loud at parties and watch the faces of the people trying to guess the song. Now I'm just waiting for someone to take these sonnets and record them on an album. HA! I'd buy that!

What an awesome idea for a backpack putting a hard shell zipper container to store glasses, sunglasses, and other fragile items you want to take with you while traveling. My wife has a very expensive pair of prescription glasses and sunglasses she brings with her and she's always concerned they will get crushed. Now this Thule Departer Daypack takes that fear away because we know it's safe and sound away from damage unless a boulder falls on it.

This is an awesome case. VERY easy to open, seal shut, and feel confident it will be safe around water. My only complaint is the difficulty in getting it to recognize you finger typing and swiping. It may take a few times. But all in all a great case.

As a professional podcaster, I am a bit of a headphone snob. But I do love trying new ones to see how the technology has progressed. When it comes to this kind of product, the quality tends to be in the more expensive ones like the Bose headphones I use for my podcast. But with the rise in live streaming social media like Periscope, I've been looking for a headset to use with my iPhone to give better sound. These Panasonic on ear headphones looked like they could fit the bill. So far they're working okay. They have to cradle the ear well and cancel out the outside noise--these don't do that perfectly. But for less than $40, they're good enough. And you definitely can't miss them with the bright wacky colors. Mine are orange so you can't miss 'em! HAHA!

We've slowly been moving over to more natural products in our household to get rid of the toxic substances in most of the junk we've been using. More and more people are doing this which makes products like the Thrive BodyShave Oil a viable alternative. My wife Christine has always used lotion to shave her legs, but this stuff is awesome. She feels better knowing that there aren't any funky ingredients she can't pronounce in it. And oh yeah, by the way...it works and nourishes the skin EVEN BETTER than what she was using. We're now fans of this stuff and you really don't need to use a lot of it for it to be effective. Smooth touchable skin is always sexy on a lady. Thank you Thrive!

I gotta say, I'm SUPER-impressed by this BLU Energy X Plus Smartphone. I'm an iPhone user, but like to keep up with the alternative devices out there that are less expensive and still offer quality. This one delivers. The camera phone is stellar and anyone familiar with the Android format will LOVE this phone. I personally DON'T like that format as an Apple guy, but this phone is easier to use than the Samsung Galaxy. GREAT JOB!

I am a bona fide Bose fan because they make audio products that are the highest of quality. I own a nice pair of headphones that cover my ears for my podcasting, but these in-ear headphones were intriguing. So I put them in my ear with the little plastic thingy that helps keep them in your ear and---WOW! When they were in my ears, all outside noise became immediately silent and when I pressed play on my music it was so crystal clear. This is EXACTLY what ear buds are supposed to be like. GREAT JOB Bose!
A great blowdryer with a great feel holding it, excellent heat control, and a cord that doesn't get tangled. My wife is happy so great job, Remington!

Finding that balance between work and your real life can be a challenge. And far too many people think they can balance both of them in perfect harmony. I have a word for people who say they do that--LIARS! Deirdre Maloney brilliantly explains why it's impossible and how you can set the appropriate boundaries to find your own personal bliss in the day-to-day of life. If you struggle with where work ends and your real life begins, then you need to read this book!

My wife loves 3-ring binders for her drawings and she ADORES this protective binder and carrying case. She loves the ability to carry around a good amount of her drawings, with pockets for holding her drawing supplies, and a strap to easily carry it from place to place. I couldn't be happier with this and we'll very likely be getting several of these for her most prizes drawings. If you want protective and style, then this is your product!

I love a good heavy duty pair of kitchen shears and these looked to fit the bill. But the Fiskars brand is very odd. They are difficult to grip with just one opening for fingers. Perhaps I'm just used to my shears having two openings like traditional scissors. They are indeed powerful but they aren't very stable and feel clunky. Maybe you'll like them, maybe not.

I'm always on the lookout for more natural products to use in my everyday life and this Bamboo Toothbrush seemed like the perfect fit to replace my old plastic ones. I was excited to give this a try until the first time I brushed my teeth with it--YOU MIGHT AS WELL USE YOUR FINGER! The bristles are way too soft to do any good cleaning. I tend to like my brush on the moderately firm side and this was more like super soft. I suppose if you like that, then you'll love this product. But I was great disappointed. I'm giving it two stars because I do appreciate the natural materials. But somehow they've got to make it firmer for me to use or it's useless to me.

I've been having trouble sleeping with the sunlight coming through the blinds at 5:30AM. So I've tried investing in a good sleep mask to give me blackout from the light. The problem with most is they are incredibly uncomfortable on the face. So when I saw this one made of silk, I was super excited to try it. And the mask itself didn't disappoint with silky smooth softness. My main problem with this mask is the strap that wraps around the back of your head. That also needed to be made of silk or have a silk cover around the elastic band because it cuts into my large ears. Add in a cushioned sleeve to make the mask more comfortable and this is a 5-star review all day everyday. It's a basic flaw in an otherwise pretty good mask

I have daily breakouts in my early 40's and so I'm constantly battling this issue. That's what led me to try this Benzac Acne Eliminating Cleanser to see how it does. After I washed my face, I tried this product...it was very runny (expected thicker), had a strong chemical smell, and offered very little "feeling" it is working. I suppose it's doing something but I still breakout. Bummer.

Wow, these really suck--and that's a good thing! Our cats like to throw up a lot and these are PURRRRRFECT! The absorption power of these is unmatched and you get a ton of them. Much better than paper towels.

I started my own home garden this year and have had issues with the neighborhood cats climbing in it. Was hoping this product would deter them but it's too soon to tell. I'm giving 4 stars and will change up or down depending on how well it works or not.

Got this mouse for my wife and she loves it. It was simple to set up, is comfortable, and gives the convenience of no wires. The only downside is that it takes up one of the two USB ports on her computer. Minor issue not worth downgrading the review from a solid 5 stars!

Anyone who has owned an Apple iPhone or iPad knows the frustration of the crappy charging cord. As quality as their products are, you'd think the accessories would be too. Nope! That's why I'm grateful for Belkin getting it right. This bad boy is super reinforced like a vacuum cleaner cord. Perfect and a foot longer than the standard Apple cord. Get this sooner than later.8-18-15 UPDATE: I have changed this from a 5-star to a 1-star and here's why--the 30-pin side broke off in my iPad. WHAT?! Come on, this should NEVER happen, Belkin. Please make this more sturdy. This is completely unacceptable and needs to be fixed.

Simply stunning! That's all I can say about this incredible 2-carat ring that nearly made my wife cry because it was so gorgeous. Her reaction alone was worth the price of this amazing piece of jewelry that I'm so glad I got for her. The idiots who say it's too big are just that--IDIOTS! What do you expect from a 2-carat stone?! If you want to wow that special little lady in your life, GET THIS RING!

OMG, whoever made this is a complete idiot apparently. 2105 instead of 2015? Chef instead of Steph? 4-X instead of 4-2? If I'm gonna pay you $100 for this plaque commemorating the Warriors winning the NBA title, then you need to make it look like something an adult put together and not a toddler.

If you enjoy sleeping on your back, then this Sklymit Inertia O Zone Lightweight Camping Air Pad can provide an added layer of comfort for your camping sleeping needs. Putting it inside of a sleeping bag will offer you added padding and protection for as good a night's sleep as you can get. But if you sleep on your side or stomach, then this product is probably going to be a lot more uncomfortable than not. The pillow feature on this is a great addiction, but the rest of your body is meant to be flat on your back. Not everyone can sleep that way and you learn very quickly that lying on your side or stomach hurts laying on top of this thing. Too bad.

Pistachios are amazingly healthy and the problem with eating them is getting around the shell. But Diamond Nuts is a reputable brand who took the shells away and leaves you behind these beautiful green delicacies to enjoy. These are perfect to snack on straight up or to put in salads or anything you want to add some healthy fats and flavor to.

Very easy to apply, leaves the skin feeling fabulous, and provides a silky smooth, soft skin feel without any greasiness on the fingers applying. Proactiv+ has established itself as a respected brand and this product doesn't disappoint.

I've been looking for a quality waterproof Bluetooth speaker to pair with my iPhone 6 and was hoping this Miomix brand would do the trick. I was able to get it to sync after initial problems. But the sound quality is hollow, lacking bass, and distorts the quality of the music I enjoy. Any other Bluetooth speakers do a better job. Too bad.

It's a bit hard to tell if this stuff works or not since we applied this product and haven't really seen the results of it yet. But Ortho is a well-known brand name which is why we chose them over all the others. Kill these fire ants and you've got a winning product! We shall see.

Resists scratching, was easy to apply (after a little trial and error the first time), maintains full control of the screen, and feels very protective of this expensive gadget I've invested in. Why wouldn't you want all of this?

After two months of use, the wires became exposed with sparks regularly appearing. Worked well until then but had to dispose of this to prevent a fire. They can do better than this! I want my money back!

Any good nail job starts with a solid first base coat. This one from essie go on well without messy spills and dries quickly. To have an effective nail polish application, you really need a reliable base. The essie First Base Coat does the trick!

It's difficult to find a good metallic nail polish, but this one is pretty good. It maintains a sharp gold color when paired with the essie clear base product. Those who are complaining about this product chipping are attempting to wear it for days at a time. Hmmmm, here's a thought--use a solid clear base, apply the product daily, and you'll have few problems at all. My only complaint is the gold isn't as vibrant as I expected it to be. But it's not bad for something a little different in nail polish.

If SpongeBob has belly button lint, it would look like this product! I was kinda taken aback when I saw what this looked like. But I sprinkled it on the bare spots in my yard and watered it--pretty easy to use. Haven't seen any growth yet, but if I do I'll return to update the review about what happened.UPDATE: OMG, this stuff is horrible! After several rains and attempts to see these bald patches filled in with beautiful grass, alas, it's all gotten much worse and the belly button lint remains weeks later. EPIC FAIL! Downgraded to a 1-star review. :(

When I ordered this, I thought it would work to extend the wifi capacity of all my devices in a room that didn't have a strong signal. But what I got was ONE singular device (my iPhone) that connected and nothing else. What a ripoff! This was not indicated anywhere in the description of this product and the Linksys AC1200 product doesn't even show up on my iPad or Macbook Pro at all after I connected to my iPhone. On a positive note, it connected very quickly to my iPhone and is performing well. But this isn't at all what I expected.

I have been using this sewing machine nonstop for the past three weeks and I can't very much I don't like about it! The threading is super-fast and the bobbing winding seems to be pretty foolproof. I am even impressed with the 4-step button hole because of how professional it looks and performs. I'm not a beginner by any means, but if I were, the instructions are easy to follow and understand. In fact, I'm going to show someone how to use this machine over the weekend to show her how easy it is. My one teeny tiny complain is I wish it had more decorative stitches. Great sewing machine!
Hasn't killed anything yet and the signs of a mouse in our cupboards is still happening. Useless product!
It's okay but clunky. Not easy to bend and difficult to adjust when it's crooked. Not shabby but could be better.

You get a very small bag of this stuff, so it's difficult to know how well it will do. I had a hole dug in my yard last year and needed to regrow grass in that area of my yard. It's hard to tell if it's really doing anything so far, but Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed tends to be a better brand. If it doesn't perform as well, I'll update my review to reflect that. However, if it grows well, then I'll make this a 5-star. We shall see.

If you dream of writing a cookbook, then glean from the experience of Kim Yorio. She's the rock star behind many of the popular cookbooks that are out there in bookstores today. She arms you with strategies for taking your love for making food to the masses by offering good coaching advice to pitch your proposal to a publisher or even going the self-publishing route. I'm currently working with a publisher on a new cookbook coming in Summer 2015 and this book had so much great wisdom and advice for doing it well. Want to be a famous cookbook author? GET THIS BOOK!

I assume it works pretty well. Easy to hook up to my hose and spray across my weedy lawn. Looking forward to seeing if it truly does what it claims to do. I'll post an update if it goes above and beyond or below my expectations for this kind of product. Ortho is a trustworthy brand in this field of products.
What a cool concept for an iPad case. This is perfect for people doing presentations, playing games or just want another vantage point for looking at the screen. Novel concept!

While these sugar-free soft caramels have the taste and texture you exoect from Werther's, there's one MAJOR problem--they use the most inferior artificial sweetener there is in the sugar alcohol called maltitol. This causes incredibly explosive gas and stomach distress. Diabetics and people eating no sugar in their diet would be better served with stevia instead. Werther's can do better than this.

You may have heard the term sustainability in the context of the food supply and healthy living in the past few years but didnt quite know what it meant. But the author of this book is a Boston, Massachusetts-based RD-in-training and organic animal and vegetable farmer named Diana Rodgers. She's a highly-respected Paleo health blogger from [...] who has made it her personal mission to spread the word about how to attain optimal health by focusing on nutritious and delicious eating with humanely-raised animals, organic vegetables, and being willing to get your hands a little dirty to reconnect with your food again. This new book reveals the passion she has for helping others do just that.THE HOMEGROWN PALEO COOKBOOK is so much more than a book of recipes. I'd say it's more of a primer for how food is supposed to be, why the way the food supply is done in modern times is so far removed from what life was life just a half-century ago, and what we can do to return to the old template of living and eating. Diana pours her heart and should into the pages of this book that discusses the key role of sustainability and real food in the future of how we live. You might get inspired to get some chickens for your backyard, owning your own bees for fresh honey, and even playing a few games like Chicken S*** Bingo...it can't be all work and no play, right?Get this book and put the power of real food back on your dinner plate again!

I so wanted to REALLY like this book. And truth be told, there were some really great nuggets of wisdom in there that people can apply into their own lives. My expectations were high that it would be written in a conversational tone for the lay public to provide an endless array of funny and heart-wrenching stories that would inspire readers to become the best possible person they were meant to be. Unfortunately, that's not what this was.The author Dr. Charles E. Dodgen, PhD is a clinical psychologist working with the elderly patients he features in his book. But his publisher really should have encouraged him to take off his professional cap and connect these stories on a more emotional level with the readers. It's all well and good to share about these amazing human beings as he does throughout the book so we can glean from their life experience and, as the subtitle suggests, find "inspiration" from that. Unfortunately, the reader is left to imagine that connection through the stuffy vernacular used to paint the narrative throughout the book.The difference between a good book and a great book is all in the presentation. So many things could have made Simple Lessons For A Better Life better than just a below average read for the intended target audience of the general public looking for uplifting prose: direct stories from and about the people featured rather than curt second-hand psycho-speak about them; a more positive tone in the presentation of the words of wisdom than a drab, methodical, clinical recount; and perhaps a recap in a nutshell of the overall intended message attempting to be conveyed at the end of each chapter instead of leaving the reader to wonder on his own what it is.SUCH high hopes...but sadly it fell so short. Let this be a lesson learned for the next book if you're given that opportunity again.

I'm always game to try new toothbrushes when they are available. This Colgate Sensitive Enamel Health Toothbrush looked really nice and so I decided to give it a try. Promoted for people with sensitive teeth and gum pain, it had such potential. And while it seems to have the "cool" factor with the hidden compartment in the bottom of the brush for hiding the Sensitivity Relief Pen, it all just seems a bit too fake for a $14 toothbrush.There are other numbing products on the market that cost less than this and it seems silly to fork out that kind of money for something you can get cheaper elsewhere. Furthermore, I understand Colgate is targeting people with sensitive teeth and gums, but these bristles are way too soft to adequately clean the teeth.If their goal was to give you a super-soft toothbrush and a numbing agent to give you the illusion that your teeth would be thoroughly cleaned without pain, then mission accomplished. But the reality is this is just another product attempting suck in innocent people to slick marketing.

This is a lesson in being very careful about what you order on Amazon. When I saw this product available, I was immediately drawn to it as a great heater for my front porch. So I ordered it. When I received a very sturdy, bulky cover for the heater in the mail, I remember thinking this had to be a very nice heater if the cover came in a separate shipping.After waiting a few days, I came back on to realize my boneheaded mistake--I ordered the cover! Oops. Well, lesson learned in being very certain of what you're buying and it's not the fault of the Classic Accessories manufacturer that this happened.The cover itself is very professional, thick, and would withstand pretty much any weather that might potentially cause harm to your heating unit outdoors. It's like a permanent raincoat to protect your investment so that the heater will work when you need it to. If you have a pyramid heater, there's no reason why you shouldn't own this cover. Now I need to go buy the heater!

With the rise in popularity of Greek yogurt, it was only a matter of time before a product like Jarrow Formulas Greek Yogurtein Coconut Cream product was created. The front packaging boasts of being hormone-free, high in fiber, gluten-free and lots of various proteins. They also claim that it tastes great and mixes easily and I have no doubt that's true. They instructions recommend you mix two scoops of this product with water, milk, almond milk, rice milk, soy milk, or your favorite beverage. Okay great.But looking at the ingredients and Nutrition Facts in this "health" product, I was appalled! While it does indeed have Greek yogurt powder and whey protein in it, the so-called VitaFiber concoction as this ingredient called isomalto-oligosaccharides which is a really nasty, cheap sweetener product known as a sugar alcohol that can impact your blood sugar and stomach issues. And the coconut meal has a HUGE amount of sugar from sucrose, fructose and even the corn-based maltodextrin. There are several other sweeteners, proteins and flavors in this product to make it what it is. Incredible!The product has more carbohydrates (17g) than protein (15g) and there is virtually no healthy fats in the dry product. Adding in their recommended liquid besides this product adds in even more carbohydrates making this very dastardly on your blood sugar and insulin levels as well as increasing inflammation. None of this is good for metabolic health. Don't be duped into thinking this is a serious health product. It's not even close.

When I got this Conair YOU Pro Cordless ThermaCell hair straightener in the mail and gave it to my wife, she looked at me with excitement about a product we could use on cruises and while traveling. We had high hopes it would be a great way to take care of her hair while on the go. But reality quickly sunk in when attempting to put the wacky battery into this thing became a huge ordeal. It's not exactly user-friendly. Once we finally figured it out (the instructions were not very clear at all), my wife let this thing warm up to try it on her hair. Completely and totally useless! As others have noted, it doesn't get anywhere close to being hot enough to straighten her hair. What a great idea for a product, but this one is very poorly executed by a supposedly respected hair product company like Conair. SHAME ON YOU! Customers deserve better.
EXCELLENT mix of humor and practical advice for any speaker worth his salt. You can never know too much about delivering a quality talk. Get this book!

Juvenile, poor writing, jaded characters, and a hapless attempt at creating drama. It was a nice premise, but poor execution. Take some fictional writing classes and learn from this mistake. There might be potential there with some fine tuning. Good luck!

Pleasant scent (more tropical than citrus smelling), silky smooth, lathers up very well, and leaves your hair clean but moisturized. I've never liked Head & Shoulders before but there upped their game well beyond dandruff control.

Obscene from the very start. I couldn't bear to watch it after 15 minutes of non-stop nonsense, nudity, and no plot I'd ever want to follow. I'm sure the filmmaker meant well for his intended audience, but unfortunately I must not have fallen into his demographic.

My wife was skeptical this would stay up on the wall, but I peeled the sticky things to put on the back and pressed firmly against the wall--and voila! Stays up on my wooden cabinet next to my kitchen sink. So convenient to clean my hands with Purell anytime I need it.

It's a baby moisturizing body wash, but I'm TOTALLY in love with this stuff. I like using body wash on my loofah, but this Cetaphil Baby Ultra Moisturizing Wash is now my go-to. Silky smooth skin, pleasant smell, and a bit of luxury in a bottle. Can't imagine using anything else.

I just upgraded my Macbook Pro operating system to the OS X Yosemite and you're literally flying blind trying to navigate through all the bells and whistles that Apple has built into it. It's a crying shame that no guidance is given by the Apple developers whenever a new update is made. That's just bad business if you ask me. But thankfully the Missing Manuals series is there to step in where Apple falls short. If you own a Mac and use this operating system, then GET THIS MANUAL! You'll find all sorts of nuggets to learn and apply.

The Seek Thermal UT-AAA Thermal Imaging Camera is very small and plugs into the port at the bottom of your phone.  There are no batteries to charge, no special cables to use, nothing like that--that's a good thing.  All that's needed to get started is to install the Seek Thermal app from the Google Play or Apple Store. As the app was downloading, I could help but imagine what would happen if I dropped my phone with the camera attached. No doubt it would be toast!The software itself is not user-friendly at all. Despite being pretty technologically savvy, it took me a long while to understand how to use it once I downloaded the app. It does take photos, record videos, has various colors to choose from, includes a spot meter function that is supposed to display the surface temperature of whatever you're pointing the camera at, and a few other options.  But I wasn't impressed with the resolution of the images and here's why. The Seek Thermal website claims this device has a "206 x 156 Array" and "32,136 Thermal Pixels."  Given those numbers you'd think the Seek Thermal camera would produce a much better image, but that's definitely not the case.I can't help but wonder about the validity of judging an IR camera by the resolution. Thermal sensitivity seems like it would be a nice metric to use, but I can't figure out what the sensitivity of the Seek Thermal camera is. I wished they would have provided a second optical lens option which blends optical images with infrared images to give an easy-to-understand hybrid image that outlines the high contrast images. Unfortunately, the Seek Thermal camera doesn't have that option.My bottom line thoughts about the Seek Thermal UT-AAA Thermal Imaging Camera is that the images don't look nearly as good as I they should. While the camera on my smartphone takes 13 megapixel photos, the photos on the Seek Thermal aren't nearly as nice as the photos I take with my camera set to a lower resolution than this device. In my opinion, the Seek Thermal isn't a substitute for a dedicated infrared camera. This is a device to buy if you want to play around your house or to find a quick fix leak or use it as a handyman tool around the house to have.If you're in the market for an infrared camera for your phone, I think there are MUCH better infrared devices that are worth paying the extra $50 simply because of the MSX technology that makes the images look so much better than the Seek Thermal. I hope this review helps you.

We got a Tribble! Since my wife Christine is a bona fide Trekkie and a half, I couldn't resist getting this for her. What's funny is when I opened the package and took the Tribble out of the plastic bag, I quickly tore off the cardboard tag. She was devastated because she wanted to put it with her Star Trek collectibles in mint condition.Thankfully this was inexpensive enough for me to buy her another one that has yet to be opened. We love playing with the first one I got her. A hearty laugh, a swift clap of the hands, or touching the Tribble makes him wiggle and purr out loud. There's another alternative sound that is the distressed noise when a Tribble is near a Klingon. As a non-Trekkie, I don't know what that means, but my wife does. And that's all that really matters.Star Trek fans would be ecstatic to get this Tribble!

I got these Spock Ears socks for my Trekkie wife and I told her the surprise I got for her was something that will make her laugh.
