Let me end this review with a quote Mr. Rhodes used in the postscript to this book which well sums up the attitude Mr. Rhodes showed throughout this book.  Mr. Rhodes takes this quote from J.C. Ryles book on Holiness:  I must enter my protest against the sneering, taunting, contemptuous language which has been frequently used of late. To say the least, such language is unseemly, and only defeats its own end. A cause which is defended by such language is deservedly suspicious. Truth needs no such weapons. If we cannot agree with men, we need not speak of their views with discourtesy and contempt.

How to Change the World in 63 Days is a practical guide for living in this modern age. Drawing from his own life changing experiences the author David Jesse provides a step by step plan of action which takes the believers faith from mere knowledge, to using his or her talents to further the Creators purpose for their lives.Using Yeshuas ministry as a template, the author explains how obedience, faithfulness and compassion are key ingredients to a life which will honor God and his purpose for you. If you are willing to take the first step this wonderful little book can make a life changing difference in these challenging days before the Messiah returns.

Keeping the hot Arizona sun off our fruits and vegetables during our year-round farmers market is a must. Our old White Caravan Canopy has done the job great for over 5 years now. Recently we've had a need to purchase another canopy and we are just as please with the new one. The canopy has the same quality balanced with easy setup  that makes it great for any outdoor occasion.Sturdy, dependable and easy to set up, qualities which have kept us happy owners of our Commercial 10x10 Caravan Canopy, qualities which we are happy to say are still built into their new generation of products.

You know, the older I get the more I am awed at how often our Creator uses our often difficult circumstances in this life to bless others and further His purposes in this age. Even more amazing is that often the beneficiaries of those blessings are people we dont even know. Marci Julins new book When You Cant Trust His Heart: Discovering the Limitless Love of God is a good example of this rule. In this touching story, the author describes the challenges she faced which left her questioning her faith in Gods love. Im not talking about the new exciting faith which comes when a new believer professes faith in Christ but rather the faith of the one who had grown and matured to the point where we have peace in this life knowing that despite the difficult circumstances Gods love has not forsaken us, but rather it is His love which sustains and strengthens us through those challenges. So many things spoke to me personally in this book. Ive been a self employed contractor for nearly all of my adult life and if my phone does not ring there is no work. Ive personally often struggled with trusting that God would provide the work needed to feed my family and take care of my responsibilities, but you know, in looking back despite all the ups and downs YHWH has provided for us every step of the way even when I couldnt see where that provision was going to come from. I can say from personal experience that there are valuable insights and wonderful encouragement in this book for those who have or are currently struggling with relying on the love of God and his faithfulness to help you get through lifes challenges. Take an hour or two and read this book. I think you find, like I did, that it will bless and encourage you.

CONTENT:Joe South: Golden Records 1961- 1966, released by reputable reissue label Rare Rockin Records from Australia in 2015, contains 32 songs. This is not a Greatest Hits album, but instead it is a collection of hits and rarities from the pen of Joe South  legendary writer, singer and producer, reflecting the Early Songwriting Genius of Joe South. I have compiled a detailed song listing (including label & number, chart position, year of release, plus personal comments)(BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100):01 SILLY LITTLE GIRL  Joe South*from album The Joe South Story (MGM LP MSG 1100)(1971)*stereo; the charted version by the Tams should have been included here.02 DOWN IN THE BOONDOCKS  Billy Joe Royal (Columbia 43305)(a-side)(BB Pop 9/1965)*stereo.03 UNTIE ME  the Tams (Arlen 7-11)(BB Pop 60/1962)*rare gem.04 FELL BY THE WAYSIDE  Pat Powdrill (Reprise 20,166)(uncharted a-side, 1963)05 CONCRETE JUNGLE  Joe South (MGM 13196)(uncharted a-side, 1964)06 LONG LONELY WINTER  the Chips (Joe South)(Tollie 9042)(b-side, 1965)*a-side Party People track #11.07 DEEP INSIDE ME  the Tams (Arlen 7-17)(uncharted a-side, 1962)08 GOLDEN RECORDS  Judy Thomas (Tollie 9021)(uncharted a-side, 1964)09 I WANT TO BE SOMEBODY  Joe South (Apt 25084)(uncharted a-side, 1964)*stereo.10 DEVIL MAY CARE  Ray Stevens (Monument 45-927)(uncharted a-side, 1966)*b-side Make A Few Memories track #25.11 PARTY PEOPLE  the Chips (Joe South)(Tollie 9042)(uncharted a-side, 1965)12 DARK GLASSES  Billy Joe Royal (Fairlane 45-21013)(uncharted a-side, 1962)*b-side Perhaps also written by Joe South not included here.13 BIG BROTHER  Vince Everett (ABC-Paramount 45-10624)(uncharted a-side, 1965)14 JUST TO BE WITH YOU AGAIN  Joe South (Fairlane 45-21015)(uncharted a-side, 1962)15 HES MY HERO  Barbara South (Capitol 5692)(uncharted a-side, 1966)16 THAT SAME OLD SONG  the Fabulous Dinos (Musicor MU 1025)(uncharted a-side, 1962)17 WHAT A LIE  the Chips (Joe South)(Ember E-1077)(b-side, 1961)*a-side Bye Bye, My Love track #32.18 MASQUERADE  Joe South (Fairlane 45-21010)(uncharted a-side, 1961)*stereo; b-side Im Sorry For You track #23.19 SHOULD I COME BACK  Jay Lewis (Capitol 5095)(uncharted a-side, 1963)20 SPRINGTIME IN MY HEART  Bob Collins & the Diamond (Tuneglow 1)(uncharted a-side, 1961)21 REALLY YOU  Billy Joe Royal (Players 1)(b-side, 1965)*a-side Im Specialized not included here.22 STANDING IN  the Tams*from album Presenting The Tams (ABC-Paramount LP-481)(1964)23 IM SORRY FOR YOU  Joe South (Fairlane 45-21010)(b-side, 1961)*stereo.24 I DONT KNOW YOU  Judy Thomas (Tower 131)(uncharted a-side, 1965)25 MAKE A FEW MEMORIES  Ray Stevens (Monument 45-927)(b-side, 1966)26 TO HAVE, TO HOLD AND LET GO  Vince Everett (ABC-Paramount 45-10624)(b-side, 1965)27 POLLYANNA  the Classics (Capitol 5710)(uncharted a-side, 1966)*stereo; later became the Classics IV.28 LEANING ON YOU  the Yo Yos (Goldwax 303)29 BLUE SHADOWS  the Tams (Arlen 7-20)(b-side, 1963)30 STANDING INVITATION  Joe South (MGM K 13145)(b-side, 1963)*a-side Same Old Song not included here.31 I KNEW YOU WHEN  Billy Joe Royal (Columbia 43390)(BB Pop 14/1965)*stereo.32 BYE BYE, MY LOVE  the Chips (Joe South)(Ember E-1077)(uncharted a-side, 1961)POSITIVE POINTS:1 It should be pointed out from the beginning that the title Golden Records is misleading. This set does not collect the Golden Records of Joe South. But instead this set is a collection of songs written by Joe South from 1961 to 1966, performed by himself or other artists. There are many rare gems, making their CD debut. The editor has done a good job compiling this collection.2 The sound is very well remastered. As stated in the booklet, due to the rarity of some recordings, it was necessary to remaster from both analogue tapes and vinyl sources. Still, the remastering job is good.3 There is a fantastic 16-page booklet, with an excellent liner notes. 8 rare singles labels are included. There are also many rare pictures of Joe South.4 32 songs. Good value!NEGATIVE POINT:1 The misleading words Golden Records should be removed from the front cover.FINAL THOUGHTS:In 2013, Rare Rockin Records issued a CD of the songs written early in the career of David Gates, called The Early Years. (my review elsewhere) There is a lot of similarity between David Gates and Joe South. Both began their careers in the late 50s and even issued recordings under their own names in that decade. The 60s followed and both were esteemed studio musicians and sought after guitarists. They wrote and produced many songs, even gracing the charts from time to time. At the end of the decade, both finally got the recognition they so deserved: David Gates as a member of Bread and Joe South as solo artist with his LP Introspect and the Grammy winning hit single, Games People Play. This set demonstrates just how talented Joe South is, with so many rare gems, making their CD debut. Because of lack of many charted singles, I am afraid this set is more for collectors and Joe South fans.

CONTENT:Heart of a Woman, released by Private Music in 1999, contains 12 songs, dedicated to Women. I have compiled a song listing, which is as follows (US=US Singles Chart; US R&B=Billboard Rhythm & Blues Chart):LP HEART OF A WOMAN (Etta James)(Private Music 82180)(1999):01 YOU DONT KNOW WHAT LOVE IS*original version by Earl Hines & His Orchestra, featuring Billy Eckstine; big hit for Ella Fitzgerald (1941).02 GOOD MORNING HEARTACHE*original version by Billie Holiday (1956)03 MY OLD FLAME*original version by Guy Lombardo (US 7/1934)04 SAY IT ISNT SO*original version by George Olsen (US 1(2)/1932)05 AT LAST*Ettas own big hit (BB R&B 2(1)/1961)06 TENDERLY*original version by Sarah Vaughan (US 27/1949)07 I ONLY HAVE EYES FOR YOU*original version by Ben Selvin & His Orchestra (US 2/1934)08 I GOT IT BAD AND THAT AINT GOOD*original version by Benny Goodman (US 25/1941) and Duke Ellington (US 13/1942); Etta chose this song to celebrate Dukes 100th birthday.09 YOU GO TO MY HEAD*original version by Larry Clinton (US 3/1938); vocal: Bea Wain.10 SUNDAY KIND OF LOVE*original version by Jo Stafford (US 15/1947)11 IF ITS THE LAST THING I DO*original version by Tommy Dorsey & His Orchestra (US 4/1937)12 ONLY WOMEN BLEED*recorded by Carmen McRae in 1976; Ettas original version also found in Deep in the Night album (1978)By recording this album in March, the month of Womans history, Etta James is helping to mold the fold of the new millennium. She asserts and expresses her true feelings in every song through new exciting arrangements. She claims a respectful signature tribute to her female idols: the late Billie Holiday, Dinah Washington, Sarah Vaughan, and Carmen McRae. All the songs are produced by Lupe De Leon, arranged by Josh Sklair, with a great supporting band, including Dave Matthews on electric and acoustic piano. Both her sons, Sametto and Donato, were also involved.POSITIVE POINTS:1 This is a concept album of Etta James, celebrating The year of the Women and at the same time, her personal tribute to all her female idols. All the songs are nicely done.2 The sound is very well remastered.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with a forward written by Etta James and short essay by Pat Kannas. Members of artists in each song were identified.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Heart of a Woman is Ettas 27th album release and 6th on Private Music label, following Life, Love & the Blues and 12 Songs of Christmas both in 1998. Her soulful, romantic, tender voice delivers one of her richest and most satisfying collections ever. She bumps and slides into a groove exceptionally glamorous for her seasoned fans ears, like ours, while setting the stage for a stampede of new fans to emerge. The entire set is totally enjoyable and very satisfying, and is highly recommended to all Etta James fans.PS: Please note that this current album is NOT included in the "Complete Private Music Album Collection" box set.

CONTENT:12 Songs of Christmas by Etta James was released by Private Music in 1998, her 26th album so far and her 5th on Private Music, following Life, Love & the Blues in the same year. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows:LP 12 SONGS OF CHRISTMAS (Etta James)(Private Music 82166)(1998):01 WINTER WONDERLAND02 JINGLE BELLS03 THIS TIME OF YEAR04 MERRY CHRISTMAS BABY05 HAVE YOURSELF A MERRY LITTLE CHRISTMAS06 SANTA CLAUS IS COMING TO TOWN07 WHITE CHRISTMAS08 THE CHRISTMAS SONG (CHESTNUT ROASTING ON AN OPEN FIRE)09 THE LITTLE DRUMMER BOY (CAROL OF THE DRUM)10 SILENT NIGHT11 JOY TO THE WORLD12 O HOLY NIGHTThis album was again produced by John Synder, the songs arranged by Cedar Walton and recorded at Conway Recording Studios, Los Angeles, CA, on May 7-9, 1998. As usual, there is a great supporting cast: Cedar Walton (piano), Josh Sklair (guitar), Sametto James (her son, on electric bass), Billy Higgins (drums), Red Holloway (alto saxophone, tenor saxophone), Ronnie Buttacavoli (trumpet, flugelhorn) and George Bohanon (trombone)POSITIVE POINTS:1 There are 12 well-known Christmas songs, done Etta James style.2 The sound is very well remastered, using high resolution 20-bit technology, encoded with apogee UV 22.3 There is a colourful 8-page booklet, containing details of names of artists for each song. There are two young children with Etta, probably her grandchildren.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:12 Songs of Christmas is her 26th album release, following Life, Love & the Blues in 1998. Christmas is not exclusive to Bing Crosby, Perry Como or Andy Williams. I feel that every major artist should have a Christmas album for completeness sake. This Christmas album is a welcome addition to my Etta James library.PS: Please note that this current album is NOT included in the "Complete Private Music Album Collection" box set.

CONTENT:Time After Time by Etta James was released by Private Music in 1995, her 23rd album so far and her 2nd on Private Music, following the very successful Mystery Lady: Song of Billie Holiday in 1994. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows (US=US Singles Chart prior to 1955; BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100):LP TIME AFTER TIME (Etta James)(Private Music 82128)(1995):01 DONT GO TO STRANGERS*original version by Etta Jones (1960)02 TEACH ME TONIGHT*original version: Jo Stafford (US 15/1954) and Dinah Washington (US 23/1954); inspired by Dinahs live performance watched by Etta after a verbal spat at Ettas live performance. (see Positive Points below for details)03 LOVE IS HERE TO STAY*original version by Larry Clinton (US 15/1938); vocalist: Bea Wain.04 THE NEARNESS OF YOU*original version by Glenn Miller & His Orchestra (US 5/1940)05 TIME AFTER TIME*original version by Frank Sinatra (US 16/1947)06 MY FUNNY VALENTINE*original version by Hal McIntyre (US 16/1945); this song inspired by Chet Baker; Ronnie Buttacavoli on trumpet.07 IMAGINATION*original version by Glenn Miller & His Orchestra (US 1(3)/1940); vocal: Marion Hutton.08 FOOL THAT I AM*Etta James original version charted in 1951 (BB R&B 14/1951)09 WILLOW WEEP FOR ME*original version by Ted Fio Rito (US 17/1932); pop version by Chad & Jeremy.10 EVRYBODYS SOMEBODYS FOOL*big hit by Connie Francis (BB Pop 1(2)/1960); not to be confused with a similar titled song by Dinah Washington.11 NIGHT AND DAY*original version by Fred Astaire & Leo Reisman (US 1(10)/1932); also made popular by Frank Sinatra (US 16/1942).12 SOMEONE TO WATCH OVER ME*original version by Gertrude Lawrence (US 2/1927) and George Olsen (US 3/1927) and George Gershwin himself (US 17/1927)This is her 2nd jazz album done in a happy and relaxed manner, produced again by John Snyder, arranged by Cedar Walton (also on piano), Josh Sklair (guitar), John Clayton (bass), Paul Humphrey (drums), Eddie Harris (tenor saxophone), and Kraig Kilby (trombone).POSITIVE POINTS:1 This is another wonderful collection of well-known jazz ballads done Etta James style: a worthy follow-up to Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday.2 The songs are very well remastered.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with an informative essay by autobiographer David Ritz. From his essay, I enjoy reading about the encounter between Dinah Washington and Etta James: In the 1960s, when Etta James was performing, knowing Dinah Washington in the audience, she started with Dinahs Unforgettable. During the song, Boom: someone swept the glasses off the tableit was Dinah Washington. Etta cried off the stage. After the show, Dinah met Etta in the dressing room, and politely taught her Never sing another artists song if shes in the house. Dinah then kissed Etta on the cheek and apologized for losing her temper and invited Etta to her own show the next day. That was the time when Etta heard Teach Me Tonight that inspired her to put that song in her new record. Thank you, David, for such an insightful story.NEGATIVE POINT:1 It should be noted that in the CD, track 7 Imagination and track 10 Evrybodys Somebodys Fool are reversed.FINAL THOUGHTS:Time After Time was Ettas 23rd album and the second on Private Music. All the songs are well chosen and nicely performed with excellent band with great soundindeed, a worthy follow-up to her Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday. Her next release is Loves Been Rough on Me in 1997. This album combines her powerful, bluesy voice with cool jazz, the best of both worlds. This set, with great sound, is highly recommended.PS: Please note that this current album is NOT included in the "Complete Private Music Album Collection" box set.

CONTENT:Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday by Etta James was released by her new label Private Music in 1994. This is the breakthrough album that reignites her career to new high. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows (US=US Singles Chart prior to 1955):LP MYSTERY LADY: SONGS OF BILLIE HOLIDAY (Etta James)(Private Music 82114)(1994):01 DONT EXPLAIN02 YOUVE CHANGED03 THE MAN I LOVE*original version by Marion Harris (US 4/1928)04 I DONT STAND A GHOST OF A CHANCE (WITH YOU)*original version by Bing Crosby (US 5/1933)05 LOVER MAN (OH WHERE CAN YOU BE)*original version by Billie Holiday (US 16/1945)06 EMBRACEABLE YOU*original version by Red Nichols (US 2/1929); later by Jimmy Dorsey (US 23/1941)07 HOW DEEP IS THE OCEAN*original version by Guy Lombardo (US 4/1932)08 (IM AFRAID) THE MASQUERADE IS OVER*original version by Jimmy Dorsey (US 4/1939)09 BODY AND SOUL*original version by Paul Whiteman & His Orchestra (US 1(6)/1930)10 THE VERY THOUGHT OF YOU *original version by Ray Noble & His Orchestra (US 1(5)/1934)11 ILL BE SEEING YOU*original version by Bing Crosby (US 1(4)/1944)According to Etta James, the Mystery Lady was her mother, Dorothy, Billie Holiday or Etta herself. A gentle mist fell over the recording session, a study in subtlety and understatement by a singer whose overpowering successes have come chiefly in the field of hard-hitting rhythm-and-blues. Mystery Lady is a departure, a reflective journey looking back and forward at the same time. This album was produced by John Snyder, arranged by Cedar Walton, and recorded at Ocean Way Recording Studios, Los Angeles, California. The band was also outstanding with Cedar Walton, piano, Tony Dumas, drums, Ralph Penland, drums & percussion, Josh Sklair, guitar, Kraig Kilby, trombone and Red Holloway, tenor & alto saxophones. In 1996, this album won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy.POSITIVE POINTS:1 A simply outstanding album 11 unforgettable jazz ballads, done Etta James style. Her mother reminded Etta not to try to copy Billie Holiday, because nobody could, but simply sing the songs in such way to express Ettas own innermost feelings. I guess this is what true singing and jazz music are all about.2 The sound is very well remastered.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with an excellent, informative essay by her autobiographer, David Ritz.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday is an outstanding album with unforgettable songs and performance by Etta James that both simply soothe the soul. This is her debut release on new label Private Music,  a label that she will have another 9 albums until 2003. Her next release will be Time After Time in 1995. This current set is her 22nd album release, and is one of my all-time favourite Etta James album, combining her powerful, bluesy voice with cool jazz, the best of both worlds. In my opinion, this set is very highly recommended and a Must-Own.PS: Please note that this current album is NOT included in the "Complete Private Music Album Collection" box set.

CONTENT:The Right Time by Etta James was released by her new label Elektra in 1992. This is her only release on Elektra label. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows:LP THE RIGHT TIME (Etta James)(Elektra 61347)(1992):01 I SING THE BLUES02 LOVE AND HAPPINESS03 EVENING OF LOVE04 WET MATCH05 YURE TAKING UP ANOTHER MANS PLACE06 GIVE IT UP (duet with Steve Winwood)07 LET IT ROCK08 NINETY NINE AND A HALF (WONT DO)09 YOUVE GOT ME10 NIGHTTIME IS THE RIGHT TIME11 DOWN HOME BLUESThis album was produced by Jerry Wexler, who also produced her Deep In the Night album in 1978. Jerry was determined to produce this album that he sent Etta over 100 songs (by cassette then of course). The songs were recorded in Muscle Shoals Sound Studios, Sheffield, Alabama, where Etta cut her Tell Mama smash in 1967, and the same period  when Wexler brought Wilson Pickett to this quiet hamlet to record the raucous Funky Broadway and Mustang Sally. Working with the motivation of hungry teenagers, both producer and singer share the belief that in this over-tech era of bloodless syntheses, soul music is an endangered species. To remedy the situation, prior to meeting in Muscle Shoals, Jerry and Etta have dedicated six months to laying the foundation of a record described by Wexler as immaculate funk. Not just right, adds Etta, but righteous.POSITIVE POINTS:1 This is a very strong, funky album, made with blood, sweat and tears. Every song is outstanding, with a great supporting cast, like Clayton Ivey on keyboard, Lucky Peterson on guitar and Hammond B2, Steve Ferrone (of Average White Band) on drums, Willie Weeks on bass and Steve Cropper, one of the chief architects of the Southern soul sound, on rhythm guitar, plus Hank Crawford providing the horn section and sax solos. We also have Steve Winwood providing strong vocals.2 The sound is well remastered.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with an informative essay by David Ritz. Details about names of the band were included. At the back cover, we have a beautiful coloured picture of Etta with her two sons, Sametto and Donto James. One notices that she still looked overweight, before her reduction in weight by gastric bypass and rekindling of her career to follow.NEGATIVE POINT:1 None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. The Right Time is her 21st album release, following Stickin To My Guns in 1989. Her next album is break-through album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday. This current entire album is making its CD debut with good sound. The entire set is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally, this set is highly recommended.

CONTENT:Stickin To My Guns by Etta James was released by her new label Island Records in 1989, her 2nd and final release on Island Records. Barry Beckett, whom Etta James called his Moses, was the producer and also on keyboards. This album was recorded in Digital Recorders by Justin Niebank. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows:LP STICKIN TO MY GUNS (Etta James)(Island 210 715)(1989):01 WHATEVER GETS YOU THROUGH THE NIGHT*featuring Arik Marshall, lead guitar.02 LOVE TO BURN*featuring Arik Marshall, lead guitar; written by Dobie Gray, on background vocal.03 THE BLUES DONT CARE*featuring Jimmy Pugh, piano; written by Etta James and Brian Ray.04 YOUR GOOD THING (IS ABOUT TO END)*featuring Jimmy Pugh, piano; written by David Porter and Isaac Hayes.05 GET FUNKY*featuring Def Jam, vocal, & Bobby Vega, bass; written by Danny Rhodes, rhythm guitar.06 BEWARE*featuring Leo Nocentelli, lead guitar.07 OUT OF THE RAIN*featuring Jimmie Wood, harmonica; written by Tony Joe White.08 STOLEN AFFECTION*featuring Josh Sklair, rhythm & lead guitar.09 A FOOL IN LOVE*featuring Gene Dinwiddie, tenor sax solo.10 IVE GOT DREAMS TO REMEMBER*featuring Jimmy Pugh, piano; written by Otis Redding.POSITIVE POINTS:1 This set was her second and final album release on Island Records. Again, Barry Beckett produced another funky record. It should be noted that Dobie Gray was one of the background vocals. In the booklet, she thanked the Toronto Chicks. Being from Toronto, I wonder who they are.2 The sound is well remastered.3 There is a 6-page booklet, detailing all the artists involved. There is a nice picture of Etta with her two sons, Sametto and Donto James.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Stickin To My Guns is her 20th album release, following Seven Year Itch in 1988. Her next album is The Right Time. This current entire album is making its CD debut with good sound. The entire set is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set, with lack of hit singles, is recommended to Etta James fans.

CONTENT:Seven Year Itch  by Etta James was released by her new label Island Records in 1988, after 7-8 years following her last album release Changes. Barry Beckett, whom Etta James called him his Moses, was the producer and also on keyboards. This album was recorded in the FAME Studio. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows:LP SEVEN YEAR ITCH (Etta James)(Island 91018)(1988):01 I GOT THE WILL (Island IS 418)(uncharted a-side, 1988)*rare gem; CD debut.02 JUMP INTO MY FIRE03 SHAKEY GROUND04 COME TO MAMA*featured on James' live album Burnin' Down the House: Live at the House of Blues in 2003.05 DAMN YOUR EYES (Island K-891)(Australian b-side, 1988)*rare gem; CD debut.06 BREAKIN UP SOMEBODYS HOME07 THE JEALOUS KIND08 HOW STRONG IS A WOMAN09 IT AINT ALWAYS WHAT YOU DO (ITS WHO YOU LET SEE YOU DO IT)10 ONE NIGHT (Island IS 418)(b-side, 1988)*rare gem; CD debut.POSITIVE POINTS:1 During the 7-8 years hiatus, Etta James was fighting drug and alcohol addiction. In 1984, she contacted David Wolper, asking to perform in the 1984 Summer Olympics opening ceremony, where she sang When The Saints Go Marching In. Then in 1987 she was seen performing "Rock & Roll Music" with Chuck Berry on his "Hail! Hail! Rock 'n' Roll" documentary. In 1988, she was signed to Island Records. This set is her first release on Island Records, now making its CD debut. The album title may reflect the 7-8 years absence from album release.2 The sound is well remastered.NEGATIVE POINTS:1 There is no essay about the album.2 There are no bonus tracks.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Seven Year Itch is her 19th album release, following Changes in 1980. The entire album is making its CD debut with good sound. The entire set is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set, with lack of hit singles, is recommended to Etta James fans.

CONTENT:Allen Toussaint Sessions: It Takes Love To Keep A Woman by Etta James was released by Fuel 2000 Records in 2014. This set with 10 songs has the same song listing of her album Changes released on MCA in 1980. At first glance, it seems an unlikely pairing: gritty, bold, occasionally salacious blues and soul queen Etta James, just about midway between her 60s hitmaking heyday and the heartwarming revival she experienced later in her legendary career, and elegant New Orleans piano mater/producer Allen Toussaint. Nevertheless, the two teamed up for the current album Changes done for Toussaint Sansu Enterprises. I have compiled a detailed song listing (including album and singles label & number, chart position, debut date, plus personal comments):LP CHANGES (Etta James)(MCA 3244)(1980):01 MEAN MOTHER (MCA 41264)(uncharted a-side, May 1980)*rare gem; CD debut.02 DONKEY03 CHANGES (MCA 102.693)(b-side, 1980)*b-side to Mean Mother in Netherlands.04 DONT STOP05 WHOS GETTING YOUR LOVE06 NIGHT BY NIGHT07 IT TAKES LOVE TO KEEP A WOMAN (MCA 41264)(b-side, May 1980)*rare gem; CD debut; there is another acceptable title It Takes A Lot of Love To Keep A Woman08 WHEEL OF FIRE09 NIGHT PEOPLE10 WITH YOU IN MINDPOSITIVE POINTS:1 Even though the entire album is fascinatingly funky and unlike anything else she ever recorded, but somehow the set fell through the commercial cracks.2 The sound is very well remastered. Of course, Allen Toussaint was featured on acoustic piano.3 There is a four page booklet with an informative essay by Bill Dahl.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Changes is her 18th album release, following the now still very expensive Deep In The Night. The entire album is making its CD debut with good sound. The entire set is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set, with lack of hit singles, is recommended to Etta James fans.

CONTENT:Etta Is Betta Than Evvah! originally released in 1976, now released on CD by reputable reissue label Ace Records from UK in 2013, was the final album of Etta James tumultuous 16-year tenure at Chess Records. I have compiled a detailed song listing (including album and singles label & number, chart position, debut date, plus personal comments)(BB200=Billboard Album Chart; BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100; BB R&B=Billboard Rhythm & Blues Chart; CB Pop=Cash Box Singles Chart; RW Pop=Record World Singles Chart):LP ETTA IS BETTA THAN EVVAH! (Etta James)(Chess ACH-19003)(1976):01 WOMAN (SHAKE YOUR BOOTY)*a funky rewrite of a song Etta had recorded, as W-O-M-A-N, for Modern in 195 and again for Chess in 1971.02 A LOVE VIBRATION*original by Ann Peebles.03 ONLY A FOOL (Chess CH-2148)(b-side, February 1974)*was also previously released in album Etta James (Chess CH-50042)(BB200 154/1973).04 LITTLE BIT OF LOVE05 GROOVE ME*featured in Ettas live set, and redone by Etta in her farewell album The Dreamer in 2011.06 JUMP INTO LOVE (Chess ACH-31001)(a-side)(BB R&B 92/1976)(July 1976)*rare gem; CD debut.07 LEAVE YOUR HAT ON (Chess CH-2148)(a-side)(BB R&B 76/1974)(February 1974)*previously released in album Etta James (Chess CH-50042)(BB200 154/1973)08 IVE BEEN A FOOL (Chess ACH-31001)(b-side, July 1976)09 BLINDED BY LOVE*written by Allen Toussaint, first recorded by Johnny Winter.10 AINT NO PITY IN THE NAKED CITY*minor hit for singer/actress Pat Lundy.BONUS TRACKS:11 YOUVE LOST THAT LOVIN FEELIN*recorded in 1973; never released until The Chess Box (2000)12 DOWN SO LOW*from album Etta James (Chess CH-50042)(BB200 154/1973)13 ALL THE WAY DOWN (Chess CH-2144)(a-side)(BB Pop 101/1973; BB R&B 29/1973; CB Pop 70/1973)(September 1973)14 GODS SONG (THATS WHY I LOVE MANKIND)*from album Etta James (Chess CH-50042)(BB200 154/1973)15 POWER PLAY*from album Come A Little Closer; written by John Kay of Steppenwolf; Etta displays some of the angry emotion she was feeling at the time.16 COME A LITTLE BIT CLOSER*from album Come A Little Closer17 FEELING UNEASY (Chess CH-2153)(b-side, July 1974)*from album Come A Little Closer; this wordless song was cut when she was ill from withdrawal, barely able to speak, and the one she never finished. In her autobiography, she stated that even when she hit emotional bottom, her singing did not seem to suffer. If anything, she was belting it out like her was on the line.18 ST. LOUIS BLUES*from album Come A Little Closer; has the same choral background arrangement similar to that used by Bessie Smith four decades earlier in the movie of the same name; this song was nominated  for 1974 Grammy for Best R&B Vocal Performance, won by Aretha Franklin for her stunning Aint Nothin Like the Real Thing19 LETS BURN DOWN THE CORNFIELD*from album Come A Little Closer; Ettas favourite song in that album; she considered Randy Newmans view of sin and salvation both funny and true.20 LOVIN ARMS (Chess CH-2171)(uncharted a-side, April 1975)POSITIVE POINTS:1 By 1976, Chess Records had been purchased by All Platinum. This album was her final one for Chess Records, mostly produced and arranged by the former Motown baritone sax hero Mike Perry, at the All Platinum Recording Studio in New Jersey, backed by the All Platinum house band, otherwise known as funk/disco hitmakers the Rimshots. All the songs are funky. This is the set where you will find the studio version of her concerts favourite Groove Me. This current set is making its CD debut.2 There are 10 additional bonus tracks.3 The sound is very well remastered.4 There is also a first class 12-page booklet, with an informative and a very moving essay by her long-time make-up artist, Rudy Calvo. But best of all are 7 colourful singles labels and 2 album labels, plus album covers. Labels and numbers are included. As far as booklet is concerned, Ace Records has the best booklet, even better than Real Gone Music (US). Jasmine Records and Sepia Records, are you listening?NEGATIVE POINT:1 The bonus tracks are not as attractive as those in Queen of Soul CD. My only complaint is that 4 out of 10 songs were from an earlier album Come A Little Closer and 3 were from album Etta James.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Etta Is Betta Than Evvah! is her 16th album release, following Come A Little Closer. The entire album, with great funky sound and many hit singles and rare gems, is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

CONTENT:Come A Little Closer by Etta James recorded in 1974, released by Chess/MCA in 1996, contains 10 songs, plus 2 bonus tracks. At the time when this album was recorded, both Etta James and the Chess Record label were undergoing periods of crucial change. At that time, Etta James was incarcerated at a drug rehabilitation center, the Tarzana Psychiatric Hospital in Southern California. She was issued limited passes to leave the center to attend her scheduled sessions. The recording sessions for this album were fraught with extreme personal difficulty and it was a wonder it was ever finished at all. Chess Records was unsuccessful to keep up with the vagaries of the contemporary music scene, at one time going so far as to have several of its older blues artists cut misguided, inappropriate "psychedelic albums. Most of the major artists were either dead or have left. This album was produced by Gabriel Mekler, who also just produced a charted album just before this one simply called Etta James. I have compiled a song listing (including album and singles label & number, chart position, debut date, plus personal comments):LP COME A LITTLE CLOSER (Etta James)(Chess CH-60029)(1974):01 OUT ON THE STREET AGAIN*album version sports a lengthy synth intro; guitarist was Wah Wah Watson.02 MAMA TOLD ME03 YOU GIVE ME WHAT I WANT04 COME A LITTLE CLOSER05 LETS BURN DOWN THE CORNFIELD*Ettas favourite song in this album; she considered Randy Newmans view of sin and salvation both funny and true.06 POWER PLAY*written by John Kay of Steppenwolf; Etta displays some of the angry emotion she was feeling at the time.07 FEELING UNEASY (Chess CH-2153)(b-side, July 1974)*rare gem; CD debut; this song was cut when she was ill from withdrawal, barely able to speak, and the one she never finished. In her autobiography, she stated that even when she hit emotional bottom, her singing did not seem to suffer. If anything, she was belting it out like her was on the line.08 ST. LOUIS BLUES*has the same choral background arrangement similar to that used by Bessie Smith four decades earlier in the movie of the same name; this song was nominated  for 1974 Grammy for Best R&B Vocal Performance, won by Aretha Franklin for her stunning Aint Nothin Like the Real Thing09 GONNA HAVE SOME FUN TONIGHT10 SOOKIE SOOKIEBONUS TRACKS:11 LOVIN ARMS (Chess CH-2171)(uncharted a-side, April 1975)12 OUT ON THE STREET AGAIN (single edit)(Chess CH-2153)(a-side)(BB R&B 84/1974)(July 1974)*rare gem; thank you for this single version.POSITIVE POINTS:1 As noted above, this album was made under a lot of duress for both Etta James and her label Chess Records. The final result was indeed a labour of love. When you listen to her singing very carefully, you could almost feel her pain. A very emotional album indeed.2 The sound is well remastered. According to Etta James, she stated that Gabriel Mekler was the first producer to have her punch in her vocals line by line to piece together a seamless performance  a precursor to the digital console we have in the recording studio nowadays.3 There is an 8-page booklet, containing an informative essay by Mary Katherine Aldin. After reading, one gains a lot of insight as to how this record was made.NEGATIVE POINT:1 None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Come A Little Closer is her 15th album release in 1974, following Etta James in 1973. The entire album is pure Etta at her emotional best, and is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended, but more for Etta James fans.

CONTENT:Queen of Soul by Etta James, her 9th album from 1965 now released by reputable reissue label Ace Records from UK in 2012, contains the complete original album (10 tracks), plus 13 more bonus tracks. I have compiled a detailed song listing (BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100; BB R&B=Billboard Rhythm & Blues Chart; CB Pop=Cash Box Singles Chart; RW Pop=Record World Singles Chart):LP QUEEN OF SOUL (Etta James)(Argo LPS-4040)(1964)*stereo:01 BOBBY IS HIS NAME (Argo 5485)(b-side, December 1964)02 I WISH SOMEBODY WOULD CARE03 THAT MAN BELONGS BACK HERE WITH ME (Argo 5477)(b-side, June 1964)04 SOMEWHERE OUT05 BREAKING POINT (Argo 5477)(a-side)(RW Pop 143/1964)(June 1964)06 FLIGHT 10107 LOVING YOU MORE EVERY DAY (Argo 5465)(a-side)(BB Pop 65/1964; BB R&B 7/1963; CB Pop 84/1963; RW Pop 85/1963)(March 1964)08 DO RIGHT09 I WORRY BOUT YOU (Argo 5452)(b-side, September 1963)(BB Pop 118/1963; CB Pop 118/1963)*double sided hit; correct title I Worry Bout You not I Worry About You in the booklet.10 MELLOW FELLOW (Argo 5485)(a-side)(BB R&B 34/1964; CB Pop 127/1964)(December 1964)*rare gem; CD debut.BONUS TRACKS:11 YOU GOT ME WHERE YOU WANT ME*previously unreleased12 ONLY TIME WILL TELL (Cadet 5526)(uncharted a-side, January 1966)*stereo13 PUSHOVER (Argo 5437)(a-side)(BB Pop 25/1963; BB R&B 7/1963; CB Pop 24/1963; RW Pop 24/1963)(March 1963)14 YOU CANT TALK TO A FOOL*previously unreleased; stereo15 WOULD IT MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE TO YOU (Argo 5430)(a-side)(BB Pop 64/1963; CB Pop 68/1963; RW Pop 70/1963)(December 1962)*stereo16 STOP THE WEDDING (Argo 5418)(a-side)(BB Pop 34/1962; BB R&B 6/1962; CB Pop 22/1962; RW Pop 29/1962)(July 1962)17 HOW DO YOU SPEAK TO AN ANGEL (Argo 5430)(b-side, December 1962)(BB Pop 109/1963; CB Pop 146/1962)*double sided hit; stereo.18 BE HONEST WITH ME (Argo 5445)(b-side, July 1963)(RW Pop 134/1963)*double sided hit; rare gem; CD debut.19 PAY BACK (Argo 5445)(a-side)(BB Pop 78/1963; CB Pop 91/1963; RW Pop 75/1963)(July 1963)*stereo20 LOVER MAN (OH, WHERE CAN YOU BE)*previously unreleased; stereo21 TWO SIDES (TO EVERY STORY)(Argo 5452)(a-side)(BB Pop 63/1963; BB AC 16/1963; CB Pop 90/1963; RW Pop 71/1963)(September 1963)*stereo22 TOMORROW NIGHT*previously unreleased; stereo23 I CANT HOLD IT IN ANYMORE (Argo 5437)(b-side, March 1963)POSITIVE POINTS:1 This is a first class CD with the original album making its CD debut in stereo. In addition, there are 13 more bonus tracks, with a few rare b-sides and 4 previously unreleased tracks, all making their CD debut. A few tracks are also in stereo.2 The sound is wonderfully remastered.3 There is also a first class 12-page booklet, with an informative essay by Garth Cartwright. But best of all are 15 colourful singles labels and 2 album labels, plus picture sleeves and posters. Labels and numbers are included. As far as booklet is concerned, Ace Records has the best booklet, even better than Real Gone Music (US). Jasmine Records and Sepia Records, are you listening?NEGATIVE POINTS:1 No chart position was provided.2 Misspelling of song title: should be I Worry Bout You instead of I Worry About You You can confirm this by looking at the singles label for this song in the booklet.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Queen of Soul is her 9th album release, following Etta James Rocks the House. The entire album, with great sound and many hit singles and rare gems, is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

CONTENT:Blues from the Big Apple by Etta James, released by Music Avenue label from US in 2007, contains 10 songs: 9 of which were live recordings from concert in New York in 1980, plus one bonus studio track. I have compiled a song listing (including label & number, chart position and debut date of the original single, plus personal comments)(BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100; BB R&B=Billboard Rhythm & Blues Chart):LP BLUES FROM THE BIG APPLE (Etta James)(Music Avenue 250177)(1980):01 INTRODUCTION/RESPECT YOURSELF02 I CANT TURN YOU LOOSE03 DUST YOUR BROOM04 ROCK ME BABY05 STORMY MONDAY BLUES06 ID RATHER GO BLIND (Cadet 5578)(b-side, October 1967)*a-side Tell Mama07 ILL DROWN IN MY OWN TEARS08 OUT ON THE STREETS AGAIN (Chess CH-2153)(a-side)(BB R&B 84/1974)(July 1974)09 SHAKE YO BOOTYBONUS TRACK:10 ROLL WITH ME HENRY (THE WALLFLOWER)(Modern 45X947)(a-side)(BB R&B 1(4)/1955)(January 1955)POSITIVE POINTS:1 Just like Etta James Rocks The House, this is another wonderful exciting live recordings from Etta James, recorded in concert in New York in 1980. She was doing small clubs at that time. No exact location was disclosed. As a blues singer, she is at her best singing live.2 The sound is good.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with an informative essay by Alfie Falckenbach.NEGATIVE POINT:1 I would like to know more details about the location and the supporting band.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Blues from the Big Apple is her 34rd album release, following All The Way in 2006. The entire album is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

CONTENT:Delirium (Deluxe Edition) by Ellie Goulding, released by Polydor/Interscope Records on November 6, 2015, contains 2 discs: disc 1 (16 songs) and disc 2 (7 songs). I have compiled a song listing (including singles & chart position)(US=Billboard Hot 100; BB200=Billboard Album Chart; UK=UK Singles Chart; UK ALBUM=UK Album Chart; AUS=Australia Singles Chart):LP DELIRUIUM (Polydor/Interscope Records B00241060)(BB200 3/2015; UK ALBUM 3/2015):DISC 1:01 INTRO (DELIRIUM)02 AFTERTASTE03 SOMETHING IN THE WAY YOU MOVE (UK 51/2015; AUS 90/2015)04 KEEP ON DANCIN05 ON MY MIND (US 18/2015 & rising; UK 5/2015; AUS 3/2015)06 AROUND U07 CODES08 HOLDING ON FOR LIFE09 LOVE ME LIKE YOU DO (US 3/2015; UK 1(4)/2015; AUS 1/2015)*from film Fifty Shades of Grey10 DONT NEED NOBODY11 DONT PANIC12 WE CANT MOVE TO THIS13 ARMY (UK 81/2015; AUS 87/2015)14 LOST AND FOUND (UK 57/2015; AUS 70/2015)15 DEVOTION16 SCREAM IT OUTDISC 2:01 THE GREATEST02 I DO WHAT I LOVE03 PARADISE04 WINNER05 HEAL06 OUTSIDE (Calvin Harris, featuring Ellie Goulding)(US 29/2014; UK 6/2014; AUS 7/2014)*from album Motion by Calvin Harris.07 POWERFUL (Major Lazer, featuring Ellie Goulding & Tarrus Riley)(US 83/2015; UK 54/2015; AUS 7/2015)*from album Peace Is the MissionPOSITIVE POINTS:1 This is a great album of pop songs with a good dancing beat. A nice follow-up to Halcyon which topped the UK Album Chart in 2012. Ellies voice is very distinctive, and somehow, her singing will grow on you. In the standard album, it is nice that she includes Love Me Like You Do from film Fifty Shades of Grey. But you should really get the Deluxe Edition, with 7 additional songs, including Outside with Calvin Harris and Powerful with Major Lazer. In my research, I discovered that Powerful was not supposed to be included in the UK Deluxe Edition, only in the Target version. No complaint here.2 The sound is perfectly remastered, with Ellies sexy voice well centralized and in full display. The backing instruments are clearly defined. Great beat!3 There is a fantastic 20-page booklet, containing all the lyrics. Plus there are many beautiful pictures of Ellie Goulding.NEGATIVE POINT:1 It should be pointed out that in the Target deluxe version, in addition to Powerful, two other new songs were included: Let It Die and Two Years Ago. And why are those two new songs not included in the Deluxe Edition, when on disc 2 there is ample empty space? Slightly disappointed.FINAL THOUGHTS:I have followed Ellie Goulding from the beginning of her career, with her two previous releases: Lights/Bright Lights and Halcyon/Halcyon Days. (Note: could there be a Delirium/Complete Delirium coming next?) She is multi-talented, writing all her songs. Her songs are very catchy and her singing is simply very mesmerizing. She stated that she is going to make a pop album this time, and I feel she is very successful with the results. This album will grow on you with repeated listen. And please get the Deluxe Edition. Of course, this set is very highly recommended.

CONTENT:The Very Best of Bert Weedon, released by EMI Gold in 2002, contains 30 songs, covering the period from 1959  1967. I have compiled a detailed song listing (including album & singles label & number, chart position, debut date, plus personal comments)(UK=UK Singles Chart; UK ALBUM=UK Album Chart):01 GUITAR BOOGIE SHUFFLE (Top Rank JAR 117)(UK a-side)(UK 10/1959)(April 1959)*first charted single.02 APACHE (Top Rank JAR 415)(UK a-side)(UK 24/1960)(July 1960)*although written by Jerry Lordan, Bert has the original version; the Shadows released it after, but took it to No. 1 in UK for 5 weeks; the American version was by Jorgen Ingmann from Denmark (Billboard Pop 2/1961).03 MR. GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 559)(UK a-side)(UK 47/1961)(April 1961)*his last charted single.04 NASHVILLE BOOGIE (Top Rank JAR 221)(UK a-side)(UK 29/1959)(November 1959)05 TWELFTH STREET RAG (Top Rank JAR 360)(UK a-side)(UK 47/1960)(May 1960)06 BIG BEAT BOOGIE (Top Rank JAR 300)(UK a-side)(UK 37/1960)(February 1960)07 SORRY ROBBIE (Top Rank JAR 517)(UK a-side)(UK 28/1960)(October 1960)08 GINCHY (Top Rank JAR 537)(UK a-side)(UK 35/1961)(January 1961)09 SWEET GEORGIA BROWN*from album Honky Tonk Guitar (Top Rank 35-101)(1960)10 CHINA DOLL (HMV POP 946)(uncharted UK a-side, November 1961)11 THEME FROM LIMELIGHT (HMV POP 1355)(UK b-side, October 1964)*rare gem; CD debut; a-side Tokyo Melody track 20 below.12 HIGH STEPPIN' (HMV POP 1485)(uncharted UK a-side, October 1965)*b-side East Meets West not included here.13 MALAGUENA (HMV POP 1592)(UK b-side, 1967)*rare gem; CD debut.14 RED GUITAR (HMV POP 946)(UK b-side, November 1961)15 TWELVE STRING SHUFFLE (HMV POP 1387)(uncharted UK a-side, February 1965)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Colour Him Folky not included here.16 GIN MILL GUITAR (HMV POP 1302)(uncharted UK a-side, May 1964)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Cant Help Falling in Love track 26 below.17 THE JOLLY GIGOLO (Parlophone R 4315)(UK b-side, May 1957)*rare gem; CD debut.18 PRETTY BABY *from album Honky Tonk Guitar (Top Rank 35-101)(1960)19 KICK OFF (HMV POP 1535)(uncharted UK a-side, June 1966)*rare gem; CD debut.20 TOKYO MELODY (HMV POP 1355)(uncharted UK a-side, October 1964)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Theme From Limelight track 11 above.21 RIPPLING TANGO (Parlophone R 4446)(UK b-side, June 1958)*rare gem; CD debut; a-side Big Note Blues not included here.22 POINCIANA (SONG OF THE TREE)(HMV POP 1077)(UK b-side, October 1962)23 TWIST A NAPOLI (HMV POP 989)(uncharted UK a-side, February 1962)24 SOUTH OF THE BORDER (HMV POP 1077)(uncharted UK a-side, October 1962)25 CHARLIE BOY (HMV POP 1141)(uncharted UK a-side, March 1963)*rare gem; CD debut.26 CANT HELP FALLING IN LOVE (HMV POP 1302)(UK b-side, May 1964)*rare gem; CD debut; a-side Gin Mill Guitar track 16 above.27 DARK EYES (HMV POP 1216)(uncharted UK a-side, September 1963)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Black Jackets not included here.28 IT HAPPENED IN MONTEREY (HMV POP 1248)(uncharted UK a-side, January 1964)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Lonely Night not included here.29 STRANGER THAN FICTION (Parlophone R 4113)(uncharted UK a-side, 1956)*b-side China Boogie not included here; re-released as (HMV POP 1592)(uncharted UK a-side, 1967)30 MACGREGORS LEAP (HMV POP 1535)(UK b-side, June 1966)*rare gem; CD debut.POSITIVE POINTS:1 The recent release Play In A Day (Jasmine Records, 1 CD, 36 songs) only covers until 1962. This current set represents the best overall coverage of Bert Weedons singles career, way beyond 1962, from 1959 to 1967. There are many rare gems that are making their CD debut.2 The sound is well remastered.3 30 songs. Good value.NEGATIVE POINTS:1 The songs are not sequenced chronologically.2 There is no essay. The bare-bone 4-page booklet simply put down the song title, composers and years. There are no label & number and no chart positions.COMPLETE SINGLES DISCOGRAPHY:Although Bert Weedon has only 8 charted singles in UK (never charted in US), I have just finished compiling a Complete Singles Discography, and found that he has actually 47 singles (charted and uncharted, a- and b-sides, from 1953 (under Max Jaffa) to 1979; but only 192 songs, not 194 songs because 2 were repeated releases). His singles labels are (1) Columbia (1953  1954), (2) Parlophone (1954  1958), (3) Beltona (1956), (4) Saga (1959, as Ragpickers), (5) Top Rank (1959  1961), (6) HMV (1961  1967), (7) Fontana (1970), (8) Grosvenor (1972), (9) Celebrity (1977), and (10) Polydor (1977  1979).FINAL THOUGHTS:Bert Weedon was born Herbert Maurice William 'Bert' Weedon on May 10, 1920. He was the first British guitarist to have a hit record in the UK Singles Chart in 1959, and his best-selling tutorial guides, Play in a Day, were a major influence on many leading British musicians, such as Eric Clapton, Brian May, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, John Lennon, Dave Davies, Keith Richards, and Pete Townshend. He was awarded OBE in 2001. He sadly passed away on April 20, 2012 after a long illness.If you are looking for concentrated coverage from 1956 to 1962, I would recommend Play in a Day (Jasmine Records, 2015, 1CD, 36 songs) with all the charted singles and good sound. But, if you are looking for a set that covers more extensively his entire career, in this case from 1959 to 1967, this current set, with many rare gems making their CD debut, is for you, and is highly recommended to all guitar fans.

CONTENT:Bert Weedon: Play In A Day! Hits, Misses and Collectables 1956-1962, released by reputable reissue label Jasmine Records from UK in 2015, contains 36 songs, covering most of his singles from 1956  1962. I have compiled a detailed song listing (including singles label & number, chart position, debut date, plus personal comments)(UK=UK Singles Chart; UK ALBUM=UK Album Chart):01 STRANGER THAN FICTION (Parlophone R 4113)(uncharted UK a-side, 1956)*b-side China Boogie not included here.02 HONKY TONK (with George Chisholm & The Bluenotes)(Beltona BL 2671)(uncharted UK a-side, 1956)*rare gem; CD debut; the correct label number should be 2671, not 2672 as noted in the booklet; I confirmed it by checking the original 78 label.03 FLANNEL FOOT  (Parlophone R 4178)(uncharted UK a-side, June 1956)*b-side The Boy With The Magic Guitar not included here.04 THEME FROM ITV'S 64,000 QUESTIONS (Parlophone R 4256)(uncharted UK a-side, December 1956)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Twilight Time not included here.05 SOHO FAIR (Parlophone R 4315)(uncharted UK a-side, May 1957)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side The Jolly Gigolo not included here.06 QUIET QUIET SSH! (Parlophone R 4381)(uncharted UK a-side, December 1957)*rare gem; CD debut; title misspelled as Quiet Ssh! in the booklet; sloppy mistake.07 BIG NOTE BLUES (Parlophone R 4446)(uncharted UK a-side, June 1958)*rare gem; CD debut; b-side Rippling Tango not included here.08 GUITAR BOOGIE SHUFFLE (Top Rank JAR 117)(UK a-side)(UK 10/1959)(April 1959)*first charted single.09 BERTS BOOGIE (Top Rank JAR 117)(UK b-side, April 1959)*rare gem; CD debut.10 TEENAGE GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 136)(uncharted UK a-side, June 1959)*rare gem; CD debut.11 BLUE GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 136)(UK b-side, June 1959)*rare gem; CD debut.12 I NEED YOUR LOVE TONIGHT (Top Rank TR 5004)(uncharted UK a-side, 1959)*rare gem; CD debut.13 ROULETTE (Top Rank TR 5004)(UK b-side, 1959)*rare gem; CD debut.14 NASHVILLE BOOGIE (Top Rank JAR 221)(UK a-side)(UK 29/1959)(November 1959)15 KING SIZE GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 221)(UK b-side, November 1959)16 BIG BEAT BOOGIE (Top Rank JAR 300)(UK a-side)(UK 37/1960)(February 1960)17 THEME FROM A SUMMER PLACE (Top Rank JAR 300)(UK b-side, February 1960)*rare gem; CD debut; nice addition to my Theme from A Summer Place collection with over 30 different versions collected so far.18 TWELFTH STREET RAG (Top Rank JAR 360)(UK a-side)(UK 47/1960)(May 1960)19 QUERIDA (Top Rank JAR 360)(UK b-side, May 1960)*rare gem; CD debut.20 APACHE (Top Rank JAR 415)(UK a-side)(UK 24/1960)(July 1960)*although written by Jerry Lordan, Bert has the original version; the Shadows released it after, but took it to No. 1 in UK for 5 weeks; the American version was by Jorgen Ingmann from Denmark (Billboard Pop 2/1961).21 LONELY GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 415)(UK b-side, July 1960)*rare  gem; CD debut.22 BONGO ROCK*from album King Size Guitar (Top Rank BUY 026)(UK ALBUM 18/1960)*rare gem; CD debut.23 SORRY ROBBIE (Top Rank JAR 517)(UK a-side)(UK 28/1960)(October 1960)24 EASY BEAT (Top Rank JAR 517)(UK b-side, October 1960)*rare gem; CD debut.25 GINCHY (Top Rank JAR 537)(UK a-side)(UK 35/1961)(January 1961)*chart position was stated as 29/1961; should be 35/1961; I have double-checked with 2 UK chart books; sloppy mistake.26 YEARNING (Top Rank JAR 537)(UK b-side, January 1961)*rare gem; CD debut.27 MR. GUITAR (Top Rank JAR 559)(UK a-side)(UK 47/1961)(April 1961)*his last charted single.28 ECLIPSE (Top Rank JAR 559)(UK b-side, April 1961)*rare gem; CD debut.29 GHOST TRAIN (Top Rank JAR 582)(uncharted UK a-side, September 1961)*rare gem; CD debut; his last single on Top Rank.30 FURY (Top Rank JAR 582)(UK b-side, September 1961)*rare gem; CD debut.31 CHINA DOLL (HMV POP 946)(uncharted UK a-side, November 1961)32 RED GUITAR (HMV POP 946)(UK b-side, November 1961)*rare gem; CD debut.33 TWIST A NAPOLI (HMV POP 989)(uncharted UK a-side, February 1962)*b-side Twist Me Pretty Baby not included here.34 SOME OTHER LOVE (HMV POP 1043)(uncharted UK a-side, July 1962)*rare gem; CD debut; again label number wrong in the booklet as 1041, should be 1043; I have checked the original 45 label for confirmation; sloppy mistake; b-side Tune For Two not included here.35 SOUTH OF THE BORDER (HMV POP 1077)(uncharted UK a-side, October 1962)36 POINCIANA (SONG OF THE TREE)(HMV POP 1077)(UK b-side, October 1962)POSITIVE POINTS:1 This set represents the most complete and comprehensive coverage of Bert Weedons singles output from 1955  1962 to date. As noted above, all the charted singles are included, plus many rare b-sides, making their CD debut.2 The songs are sequenced chronologically.3 The sound is very well remastered as per high standards at Jasmine Records.4 The most significant improvement for Jasmine Records is in the booklet. For the first time, a-side was clearly identified. Label & number are included, together with chart positions. Also, colourful pictures of picture sleeves are included together with labels. There are also 3 picture sleeves and 1 single label on the inner sleeve of the back cover of the case. As usual, we have an informative essay by Roger Dopson. Jasmine Records, if you can improve more by giving us a thicker booklet, like those by Ace Records. Keep up the good work.5 36 songs! Good value.NEGATIVE POINTS:1 As per usual practice with most reissue labels in UK, compilation would stop at 1962 because of local Public Domain laws. There are still 16 singles (32 songs) from 1963 to 1979.2 There are still many singles missing during the period 1953  1962, with some of the missing b-sides noted above.3 There are many errors in song title and label number as noted above.COMPLETE SINGLES DISCOGRAPHY:Although Bert Weedon has only 8 charted singles in UK (never charted in US), I have just finished compiling a Complete Singles Discography, and found that he has actually 47 singles (charted and uncharted, a- and b-sides, from 1953 (under Max Jaffa) to 1979; but only 192 songs, not 194 songs because 2 were repeated releases). His singles labels are (1) Columbia (1953  1954), (2) Parlophone (1954  1958), (3) Beltona (1956), (4) Saga (1959, as Ragpickers), (5) Top Rank (1959  1961), (6) HMV (1961  1967), (7) Fontana (1970), (8) Grosvenor (1972), (9) Celebrity (1977), and (10) Polydor (1977  1979).FINAL THOUGHTS:Bert Weedon was born Herbert Maurice William 'Bert' Weedon on May 10, 1920. He was the first British guitarist to have a hit record in the UK Singles Chart in 1959, and his best-selling tutorial guides, Play in a Day, were a major influence on many leading British musicians, such as Eric Clapton, Brian May, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, John Lennon, Dave Davies, Keith Richards, and Pete Townshend. He was awarded OBE in 2001. He sadly passed away on April 20, 2012 after a long illness.Jasmine Records cleverly chose Play in a Day as the title of this set. If you are looking for a set that covers more extensively his entire career, I would recommend The Very Best of Bert Weedon (EMI Gold, 2002, 30 song, from 1959  1967). This current set concentrates in the years 1959  1962, with many rare b-sides. The sound is excellent. The entire set is very enjoyable, and is highly recommended to all guitar fans.

CONTENT:Etta James Rocks the House, released by MCA in 1992, contains 8 live recordings, taped at The New Era Club, Nashville, Tennessee, on September 27 and 28, 1963, plus 3 bonus tracks (previously unreleased on CD at that time). I have compiled a song listing (with the songs original label & number, chart position & debut date)(BB200=Billboard Album Chart; BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100; BB R&B=Billboard Rhythm & Blues Chart; CB Pop=Cash Box Singles Chart; RW Pop=Record World Singles Chart):LP ETTA JAMES ROCKS THE HOUSE (Argo LP-4032)(BB200 96/1964):01 Somethings Got A Hold On Me (Argo 5409)(a-side)(BB Pop 37/1962; BB R&B 4/1962; CB Pop 20/1962; RW Pop 25/1962)(January 1962)02 Baby What You Want Me To Do (Argo 5459)(a-side)(BB Pop 82/1964; BB R&B 35/1964; CB Pop 101/1964; RW Pop 93/1964)(December 1963)03 Whatd I Say (Argo 5459)(b-side, December 1963)(RW Pop 96/1964)*double sided hit.04 Money (Thats What I Want)05 Seven Day Fool (Argo 5402)(b-side, October 1961)(BB Pop 95/1961; CB Pop 75/1961; RW Pop 61/1961)*double sided hit.06 Sweet Little Angel07 Ooh Poo Pah Doo08 Woke Up This MorningBONUS TRACKS:09 Aint That Lovin You Baby10 All I Could Do Is Cry (Argo 5359)(a-side)(BB Pop 33/1960; BB R&B 2(1)/1960; CB Pop 23/1960; RW Pop 30/1960)(March 1960)11 I Just Want To Make Love To You (Argo 5380)(b-side, December 1960)POSITIVE POINTS:1 This is a wonderful album, recorded live at The New Era Club, Nashville, Tennessee, on September 27 and 28, 1963. It really captured the emotion, excitement, drama and spontaneity of Etta James in action. The location was carefully chosen by Etta herself, with the correct atmosphere, receptive audiences, and good acoustics. This album is a pot of gold. The three bonus tracks, although readily available in 2015, were making CD debut in 1964, and I consider this icing on the cake.2 The sound is very well remastered, capturing all the details and spontaneity of the live performance.3 There is an 8-page booklet, with an informative essay by Don Snowden, and also the original LP liner notes by Ralph Bass. Here, we get more insight into the making of this live album. A beautiful coloured picture of Etta James in action was nicely done.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Etta James Rocks The House is her 8th album release. The entire album really rocks the house, and is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

70/1963)(December 1962)POSITIVE POINTS:1 Compared to other similar compilations, like The Anthology (Not Now Music, 3CDs, 2013) and Tough Woman: The Early Recordings (Jasmine, 2CDs, 2011), this current set by Real Gone Music (UK) provides the most complete and comprehensive coverage of all of Etta Jamess singles from 1955  1962. Furthermore, besides getting a complete singles collection from 55-62, you also get 4 complete albums on Argo label, plus some extra rare album tracks.2 The songs are sequenced more or less chronologically.3 The sound is very well remastered.NEGATIVE POINTS:1 As per usual tradition at Real Gone Music (UK), no booklet is available, and compilation will stop at 1962 as per Public Domain law in UK.2 No label & number and no chart position were given.COMPLETE SINGLES DISCOGRAPHY:Although Etta James has 30 charted singles on Billboard R&B chart, I have just finished compiling a Complete Singles Discography, and have found that she actually has 67 singles (charted and uncharted, a and b-sides, from 1954  1996)(only 123 songs, not 134 songs because there were 9 repeated releases and two b-sides belonged to other artists). Her singles labels are (1) Groove (1954), (2) Modern (1955  1957), (3) Kent (1958  1959), (4) Argo (1960  1965), (5) Cadet (1965  1970), (6) Chess (1970  1976), (7) Elektra (1978), (8) Warner Bros. (1978), (9) MCA (1980), (10) Island (1988), (11) Capitol (1989), and (12) Chess (1996). As noted above, her last charted single was an old recording of I Just Want To Make Love to You that charted in UK (UK 5/1996).FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.If you are looking for a box set covering her entire career, I would recommend The Very Best Of Etta James: The Chess Singles (Spectrum, 3CDs, 53 songs, 2005, covering 1960  1975). The best overall box set that covers her entire career, extending into 80s & 90s, is Heart and Soul: A Retrospective (4 CDs, 84 songs, 2011, Universal Music), but rather expensive. This current set, with complete and comprehensive coverage of her songs from 1955 to 1962, good sound and cheap price, is highly recommended.

CONTENT:Pat Boone: Duets, released by Pats own label Gold Label in 2015, contains 13 live recordings, duets taken from Pats own TV shows. I have compiled a song listing:01 I WISH I WERE IN LOVE AGAIN  Pat Boone & Ella Fitzgerald02 IT DONT MEAN A THING (IF IT AINT GOT THAT SWING)  Pat Boone & Ella Fitzgerald03 IVE HEAR THAT SONG BEFORE  Pat Boone & Count Basie04 NATURE BOY/POISON IVY  Pat Boone & Nat King Cole05 TOM DOOLEY  Pat Boone & Kingston Trio06 YOURE THE CREAM IN MY COFFEE/THE COFFEE SONG  Pat Boone & Anna Maria Alberghetti07 MY HAPPINESS  Pat Boone & Connie Francis08 FOLK MEDLEY  Pat Boone & Jo Stafford09 STRANGER IN PARADISE  Pat Boone & George Shearing10 ROCK-A-BYE  Pat & Shirley Boone, with the Boone Girls11 TENDERLY  Pat Boone & Andy Williams12 COWBOY MEDLEY  Pat Boone & Roy Rogers13 MAY THE GOOD LORD BLESS AND KEEP YOU  Pat & Shirley BoonePOSITIVE POINTS:1 These are one-of-a-kind recordings, performed live in Pats ABC television show The Pat Boone Chevy Showroom with famous stars, such as Ella Fitzgerald, Jo Stafford, Andy Williams, Nat King Cole, Count Basie & His Orchestra and George Shearing, just to name a few.2 The sound is good.3 There is a 4-page booklet with an informative essay by Pat Boone himself, telling us his own feelings and experience singing with the various stars. In the booklet, the fonts for the words Pat Boone are exactly the same as those for Billboard magazine logo with the same colours. On the disc itself, since Pat Boone was on Dot Records for almost his entire career, he chose the Dot Records logo, replacing the word Dot with the word Pat. Both very clever.NEGATIVE POINT:1 13 songs only!? Pat, you could have done better with more duet songs from your TV show.FINAL THOUGHTS:In the years immediately prior to the British Invasion, only one performer rivaled the chart dominance of Elvis Presley, and that was Pat Boone. With his trademark white buck shoes, perfectly combed hair and gleaming smile, Boone was the very essence of wholesome American values, and at a time when the rise of Rock N Roll was viewed as a sign of the Apocalypse, he made the music appear safe and non-threatening, earning some 38 Top 40 hits in the process. In 1957 Pat Boone began hosting his own ABC television series, The Pat Boone Chevy Showroom. The half-hour variety show aired from October 3, 1957 to June 23, 1960 and featured the young star (at the time the youngest person to host their own network variety programme) and a host of top-name guest stars. In all, there were 115 episodes. In this special collection of never-before-released LIVE recordings, Pat has hand-picked 13 memorable performances that pay tribute to some of the best music and entertainers of that time.Pat, if you still have the video for those shows, could you please release them on a DVD box set? Or, instead of just 13 songs, please give us some more. Pat, aint that a shame that you only gave us 13 songs? Being a Pat Boone fan, in addition to the recent CD release R&B Duet Hits, this current set is also being treasured.

CONTENT:Life, Love & the Blues by Etta James, her 25th domestic album release by Private Music in 1998, contains 12 songs. I have compiled a song listing which is as follows:LP LIFE, LOVE & THE BLUES (Etta James)(Private Music 82162)(1998):01 Born Under A Bad Sign02 I Want To Ta Ta You, Baby03 Here I Am (Come And Take Me)04 Running Out of Lies05 Inner City Blues (Make Me Wanna Holler)06 Spoonful*remake of her earlier duet with Henry Fuqua in 1960.07 Life, Love & The Blues08 Hoochie Coochie Gal09 Cheating In The Next Room10 If You Want Me To Stay11 The Love You Save May Be Your Own12 Ill Take Care Of YoPOSITIVE POINTS:1 In the essay, it is stated Etta James has, at last, (pun semi-intended), given us the album we always knew was within her. A blues album. With her own guys: The Roots Band too. Thank you, Etta. This album was originally conceived as a tribute album to icons like Muddy Waters, Howlin Wolf and Willie Dixon.2 The sound is very well remastered. Of course, the spine-tingling voice of Etta James is the centerpiece. The backing band was also up to the task, with her sons Donto James on drums and percussion, and Sametto James on bass.3 There is an 8-page booklet with an informative essay by Bob Merlis.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. Life, Love & The Blues is her 25th album release (excluding live albums) and is also found in the Complete Private Music Albums Collection box set. The entire album is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Etta and Blues are perfect combination and so endless fascinating. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

CONTENT:All The Way, Ettas 33rd domestic album, released by RCA Victor in 2016, contains 11 songs. I have compiled a song listing (with personal comments)(BB Pop=Billboard Hot 100):LP ALL THE WAY (Etta James)(RCA Victor 76841)(2006):01 ALL THE WAY*big hit by Frank Sinatra (BB Pop 2/1958); Ettas bluesy voice mixed with outstanding lonesome wailing horn02 STOP ON BY*the pulsating and pumping rhythm mixed with tenderness.03 STRUNG OUT*Ettas gruff and gripping voice backed by great keyboard.04 SOMEWHERE*big hit from West Side Story; Ettas voice is like a fine, mellow wine that you want to experience again and again.05 HOLDING BACK THE YEARS*big hit for Simply Red (BB Pop 1(1)/1986)06 IMAGINE*big hit for John Lennon (BB Pop 3(2)/1971); Ettas haunting voice is both magical and provoking.07 I BELIEVE I CAN FLY*big hit for R. Kelly (BB Pop 2(4)/1996); Ettas attention-getting, commanding voice mixed with great orchestration makes this song highly inspirational.08 ITS A MANS MANS MANS WORLD*big hit by James Brown (BB Pop 8/1966); Ettas soulful vocal mixed with the flamboyant strings and flamenco-style guitar intro!09 PURPLE RAIN*big hit for Prince (BB Pop 2(2)/1984); the underlying, funky, answer-style guitar and keyboard church-chord accompaniment will send chils down your spine.10 WHATS GOING ON*big hit for Marvin Gaye (BB Pop 2(3)/1971) and Etta puts on hurting on it.11 CALLING YOU*this melancholy, mood-altering side begs for low lights and a stiff shot of something heavy; for me, I just switched off all the lights in my audio room.POSITIVE POINTS:1 This CD marks another milestone in the senior, savvy, sassy Ettas career, including a super-reduction in weight, translating into Ettas metamorphosis to show biz success. She is constantly renewing herself, and whose recordings encompassed nearly every music genre, here again, lends her melodious vocal branding to these previous chartbusters. What a refreshing change!2 The sound is very well remastered. This album was jointly produced by Ettas sons: Sametto and Donto James, with Donto James on drums and percussion and Sametto James on acoustic and electric bass.3 There is a 12-page booklet with an informative essay by Lithofayne Pridgeon. There are a few beautiful colour pictures of new-look Etta James.NEGATIVE POINT:None.FINAL THOUGHTS:Etta James was born Jamesetta Hawkins on January 25, 1938 in Los Angeles, California. She was nicknamed Miss Peaches. She has a long illustrious career.  Her singing style spanned a variety of music genres including blues, R&B, soul, rock and roll, jazz and gospel. She has frequent bouts of heroin addiction, but finally cured in the late 1970s. In 1996, her album Mystery Lady: Songs of Billie Holiday won Best Jazz Vocal Performance Grammy. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2008. She died of leukemia on January 20, 2012 (age 74). Her mighty, moving voice is sorely missed.After collecting all her 123 songs (as singles, except one song Bring It on Home to Me her duet with Tony Orlando), I am in the process of collecting all her domestic albums. All The Way is her 33rd album release (excluding live albums). The entire album is totally enjoyable, and will be treasured. Naturally this set is highly recommended.

VIDEO (2D):Terminator Genisys 2D arrives on blu-ray with MPEG-4 AVC 1080p 2.39:1 encode. The transfer comes with fantastic resolution and details. The imagery is razor sharp and crisp. Contrast is excellent with deep blacks. The colour palette is natural. This is a reference quality video. (5/5)VIDEO (3D)Terminator Genisys 3D arrives on blu-ray with MPEG-4 MVC 1080p 2.39:1 encode. The 2D to 3D conversion is state of the art, done by Stereo D, Prime Focus and Gentle Giant Studios. In addition to all the positive accolades above, the dimensionality is impressive, as in perceptual depth. Foreground and background exhibit incredible realism. The spatial dimensionality of the 3D version is preferred. (5+/5)AUDIO:The Dolby Atmos/Dolby True-HD (in my case only the latter) 7.1 channel soundtracks are extensively dynamic and immersive. The bass is powerful. The orchestral music score is spread wide and deep and aggressively extends to the surrounds. This is an exceptionally well executed sound design that delivers an impressive immersive, exciting and thrilling experience. (5+/5)MOVIE:Terminator Genisys is the fifth instalment of the Terminator franchise. It comes in with great respect for the original two, somewhat ignoring the latter two (Rise of the Machines and Salvation), and carries the fun and entertaining feel of Terminator 2: Judgment Day. Great credit must go to the Game of Thrones director Alan Taylor, unlike his lack of control in Thor: the Dark World by Marvel, now delivers cinematic fun, with creativity, playfulness, and grace. It is the best that the franchise has been since T2. (5/5)PACKAGING:Terminator Genisys (3D) comes with 3 discs, each having its own flipcase: 3D blu-ray, 2D blu-ray (feature film + special features) and DVD.FINAL THOUGHTS:Throughout Terminator Genisys, Arnold's aged T-800 model is starting to fail mechanically. When his capabilities are called into question, he replies that he's "old  not obsolete." This same response can be used to describe the Terminator franchise after five installments: it's old, but at this point, it's far from being obsolete. Without question, this is the best that the franchise has been since T2. Both the video and audio are reference quality, but if you have a 3D set, the 3D version is preferred.
