Zen filmmaking... ummm no. No budget, laughably acted, acid-trip-like visuals... but, it does have Joe Estevez!!!!But no, unless you can catch this for free, def don't waste your money. These Scott Shaw films are probably great, fun when he and his buddies get together. But, for the real viewing audience, "Zen filmmaking" = lazy, nails-on-a-chalkboard videos.

Great bags and tissue - perfect for the bachelor, like myself, who is completely incompetent when it comes to wrapping gifts. These take all the work out of it - just open the bag, drop in and fluff up some tissue, place the gift inside, and cover it with the rest of the tissue - easy !!!! :)
Freaking love these microfiber bathroom rugs - great color, very durable, and perfect for a bachelor pad.

As a former alcoholic, and having watched the two Coreys when i was growing up (Lost Boys, epecially), this series really shows the devestating impact of addiction. It's interesting to see how Feldman went one way and Haim another (RIP).

Tolerable microbudget indie sci-fi found footage video... The acting ranges from actually pretty good to cringeworthy. But, overall, it's free on Amazon Prime, Im a huge fan of this subgenre, and I'm always on the lookout for diamonds in the rough. This is not one of those, but I did find I could sit through it, if taking a few breaks during the really tedious parts. I honestly can't say this is a terrible video, however. It is what it is - small crew, no budget, group of friends getting together to make a sci-fi found footage thriller.There aren't any real thrills or chills, but it's not one you'll turn off (in my opinion) because it's one of those in the glut of unwatchable hack jobs. It's slickly edited and shot, and, again, the acting is really what saves it (with a couple notable exceptions - sorry "Andrea", you'd make a great Maxim model, but I think she was really added to the production - as they ironically state in the video - for eye candy purposes. And she definitely fits the bill on that one. Hell, I'd watch this again just to catch her scenes. But, seriously, there are some really decent actors in this film, and they save it from being a totally boring train ride to nowhere. Even "Foster", the over-the-top stylish-hipster-photographer was incongruous in the overall ghost hunting team.If I had to sum it up, I'd say it's like the cast and crew of an adult video production got lost on their way to the San Fernando Valley and ended up making a mainstream indie film instead.

First, I want to be sure to note that I received this product free of charge in exchange for an unbaised review.Second, I just got back from a trip overseas (Dubai, via Los Angeles and NYC), and wanted to wait until I returned to write a review. That said, this credit card and passport protector worked great. I am an experienced traveler, and also a former government agency employee, so security issues - especially with regard to identity theft and travel are always a priority with me. This pouch replaced my former hand-held, leather (unsecure) document holder.I'd definitely recommend this product for anyone who plans to travel not only internationally, but even domestically. Goodness knows, there are plenty of people at airports who are there solely to pickpocket and commit other crimes. This pouch goes a long way to enhancing your travel document security and greatly complicating identity theft at those locations. Not to mention, it certainly makes cards and passports (including the new passport card) much more secure.
Always works - always has!!!
Awesome addition to my home gym :)

Sad to see Dr Mitchell's paranoia take over like this. Certainly, he's got the qualifications on paper and in real life, but here he just demonstrates his mental slip that so many commentators in the UFO community and debunkers alike have noticed. He's an American hero, but this was sad to watch. I know many UFO'ers and extraterrestrial life fans love to trot out Mitchell as their poster child, but this is another path down which they lose their credibility by banking on a guy who is just losing his grip as he gets older.
Interesting documentary series - particularly when it comes to the episodes about compulsive exercise.

Kind of a combo between 13 Sins and Unfriended. But, this one's a bit more boring than both. All in all, it's really a "13 Sins meetsapps" video. By the way, if you haven't seen 13, it's worth checking out for horror fans :)

First, I want to be sure to note that I received this product free of charge in exchange for an unbaised review.That said, I've found this infuser an excellent change from my regular outdoor water bottle. I have a much larger version (bought from another manufacturer) that I keep in my refrigerator to fill smaller water bottles. I'm a big water drinker, so I've found these infusers a very nice change from plain ole water. I particularly like this one, as it doesn't require me to constantly refill from the larger version if I want to have some flavor in my water. Specifically, I use sliced lemon from my backyard tree. But, I've also used various other citrus and fruit varieties. I like using lemon, lime, and cucumber, as they hold up the longest. I've tried strawberries, other berries, etc., and tbey've just proven too fragile and break down too easily. Anyway, this sport water bottle has been a very welcome addition - and heavily used addition - to my daily water intake.

1:05 Mins This is an absolutely fantastic privacy screen for my 12.5 inch screen laptop. I installed it on my Dell XPS 12 (2-in-1) laptop and it is a perfect fit. What is also great is that I maintain my touchscreen functionality even with this installed. A do have to apply a slightly increased amount of pressure when I touch but not much and certainly not enough to be annoying.From a privacy perspective this thing works flawless. as soon as you begin looking at the screen from an angle it blacks out, keeping the screen only visible to me. The accompanying instructions and installation were a piece of cake. I actually applied it directly to my screen like a screen protector and it works great, though you can use the accompanying sticky tabs to be able to slide it in and remove it easily.Really high quality as well. Doesn't scratch easily and good quality materials and construction.Highly recommended!

3:13 Mins Such a fun cowboy and horse musical toy! It rolls around on multiple types of surfaces and keeps you guessing which direction it will go next, my kids have absolutely loved this toy! They love chasing it around and playing with the large purple and green wheels!It plays two different songs by pushing the cowboy's hat down, the horse's main and tail light up, and move up and down while it moves around on the floor.It is made of a durable hard plastic and every piece is securely fastened together leaving me with no concerns about small parts that may present choking hazards. It has two different volumes (low, high) both are great to use and won't get on your nerves listening to repeatedly.Great little toy for most ages, my kids are 10 months old and love the excitement of chasing this little cowboy around! Great quality product especially for the price, totally a great buy and I'd highly recommend it for those looking for a engaging toy at a great price!

6:01 Mins So much fun!! My kids absolutely love these little cars. They are high quality toys that I know will last a very long time. They have vibrant colors and great detail on each of the drivers in the cars. Each car is the perfect size for small hands, but not too small to be concerned with choking.Each car has a piece that is interactive, a dump truck, a trailer that has a tailgate that opens and hooks to another tractor, cement truck that can "empty" the cement, and a traditional tractor used for loading up dirt or digging holes.These are so fun to play with and teach your kids about different kinds of cars and what they can do for different jobs. I really love the friction "push and go" feature and makes for great playtime! You can make the cars go forward, backward and really fast or slow.I highly recommend these cars, they make great gifts, simple designs, but allow for creative play and learning! And they are also priced great for the quality of product and the number of cars/pieces you get!

I've actually tried a few different versions of shower tension rods for storing products in the shower. This one's design is uniquely simple and effective. Prior types that I'd used were such a pain to assemble and involved awkward twisting or selection of various sized poles to get the tension right.This one is so simple. You simply push in the final "tension" rod and it's spring-loaded feature makes it easy to put in place and keeps it perfectly secure and stable. It is also very well designed in that the plastic trays are easy to put on the rods and they actually stay in place. Other types I'd tried in the past had the plastic shelves constantly shifting and sliding down. That's definitely not the case on this one.Another problem I'd had in the past with different products was rusting. I've been using this one for a good while now and no rust or signs of rust whatsoever!I've been incredibly happy with this product and would definitely recommend it!

These are extremely nice sunglasses, especially for the price! They have a very sleek and stylish look to them are and very durable.They definitely don't have the look and feel of the typical low cost-sunglasses you find at stores. These have the look and feel of a much more expense set of sunglasses. I have had several pairs of oakley's and these are just as good as any of them, you just don't have to pay an arm and a leg for the name! I also like the polarized feature which is a big bonus for the price!They sit not only very secure on the head but also quite comfortably. They are great for running or other outdoor sports. I've gotten a lot of compliments on them as well.I've been very happy with mine and would highly recommend them.

These are absolutely fantastic high chairs! I love the clamp on feature which not only works very well, but makes these things compact and easy to store when not in use!I was worried about how strong they would be and if the clamps would hold very well but they definitely hold incredibly strong. Our babies are totally secure in these and they have the included buckles within the seats which are a great safety feature as well. They don't damage our table whatsoever which is a nice bonus too.The seats are quite comfortable and our babies really love sitting in them! (We ordered two for our twins). Because of their excellent design and functionality, as well as their comfort, I definitely give them five stars and would highly recommend them!

This is an awesome little desk clock. I love the fact that it senses when it gets dark and automatically lights up. It is very simple and easy to set up the time and I like the fact that it has temperature as well.It has a very contemporary and sleek look to it and it is plenty durable. It looks great on my desk and I like having the large numbers on the display for quick and easy time reference.I've been very happy with this clock and would definitely recommend it!

This is such a fantastic lighted mirror, especially for the excellent price. I was a bit skeptical about its quality before I received it given it was so affordable (competing products can cost several times more!), but I've been extremely pleasantly surprised by its excellent quality. It has a normal mirror side and a magnification mirror side and the light along the edges (one both sides) is very bright and perfect!I would definitely recommend this mirror to anyone!

This is a really nice high-end coaxial cable that is not only solidly performing but especially easy to attach to things. The twisting bolts on the ends of the cord are very smooth and easy to grip versus other cords I've tried, which makes this cord a piece of cake to install. I experience much less interference with this cable than other, cheaper cords.I've been very happy with it and would definitely recommend it!

This is an extremely nice desk lamp. The multiple and very bright LED lights provide an excellent amount of light. Previous desk lamps I've tried simply didn't provide the amount of light I really needed to see and work well. This one definitely solved that problem.It is also extremely well constructed and doesn't feel cheep, flimsy, or chintzy like other lamps I've used before. The adjustable/bendable metal necks on it has just the right amount of tension to get it positioned perfectly without it shifting around unwantingly.I also really like having the magnifying glass and clamp features for working on various projects. These are really convenient additions to the design!I've been very happy with this LED desklamp and would definitely recommend it!

This is a very nice rollerblade bag. It just the perfect size for any size kind of rollerblades and is made from a very durable material. I like that it is also breathable so that the skates can air out when not in use. Additionally, the pockets on the side are nice for storing stuff. I've been fairly rough on the bag but it has held up very well and is very convenient for storing and transporting my rollerblades.Highly recommneded!

These are such a great solution for creating additional storage space. We use them in our apartment to store various baby items, clothes, toys, etc.They are very durable and also very simple and easy to set up. They definitely aren't flimsy like other products we've tried in the past.I would definitely recommend them!

This is an excellent smartphone windshield mount!The hose is strong and sturdy and doesn't shake around much at all when I'm driving, and I love that it has the little clip on base stand to basically eliminate any vibration. The suction cup is extremely powerful and very durable. I've had similar products in the past where the little knob you use to engage the suction cup breaks, but not so with this one, very well made.I also love how easy it is to operate the phone clamp. It can pivot and tighten in any position I want and it is a piece of cake to put the phone in and out of due to just squeezing the clamp. No flipping little switches and then manually opening and closing the clamp which is great!I've been incredibly happy with this windshield smartphone mount and would definitely recommend it!

This has been a perfect little adapter for me to convert mall small bulb socket into a regular size one. It is well constructed and designed and I've had no issues whatsoever with it.Highly recommended!

These are hands down the best tongue scrapers I've been able to find. So many of the different styles and types of scrapers I've tried simply don't work very well. These really get the job done and are very durable, not flimsy and breakable like most!Highly recommended!

Extremely well made and durable resistance band. I ordered the big blue one to help me get started with pull-ups, providing a great deal of resistance. The quality of the rubber is very solid and I have no concerns with them ripping, tearing or breaking. I've been using it for a while now and have been very happy with it's quality, durability, and functionality!Highly recommended!

Very simple but very nice high quality coaxial cable. Does just what it needs to do.The twisting bolts at the connection ends also don't seem to jam up sometimes like other cords I've tried which is great.Recommended!

These are absolutely fantastic rollerblades. One thing that sets these apart from other similarly prices sets I've used are that they are very comfortable. They also provide a great deal of ankle support and are very easy to adjust with the laces, the power velcro strap, and the buckle.They are very durable as well and have held up quite well for me through many many rides. The wheels are a perfect size and softness and the bearings included do a great job keeping the ride smooth. I've been following the included instructions for rotating the wheels to keep them wearing in a symmetrical fashion and it is really simple and straightforward.These also have a really nice look to them, not too flashy but still very sharp looking. I would definitely recommend these!

The space saver ziploc bags are so great! It is so convenient to have these for moving and for storage. The plastic material they are build from is very reasonably durable and it is so incredible how much they can shrink stuff down once vacuumed.A must have for moving and storage and I would definitely recommend this pack!

Very nice little blacklight bulb that puts out a very respectable amount of black light compared to other bulbs I've tried in the past. Its also very strong and durable which is nice as well.I would definitely recommend it.
This is a very simple yet very well made splitter that does exactly what it is supposed to do very well! Not too much to say about it other than it is very well built, simple and performs great!

This is such an excellent watch that has a very classy and sharp look to it. It is very durable too. The leather band has held up very well for me over a long period of time.I love the timeless, classic, and simple look of the face of the watch. It is also very easy to set with the side knob and stays extremely accurate. I really like the way this watch is very versatile as far as the types of outfits that it compliments. Not only does it look great as just a day to day casual watch with class, but it also compliments a suit very well.I've been very happy with this watch and would definitely recommend it!

Absolutely awesome and totally halarious cardboard stand-up. It took about 1 minute to set up and has been a total hit. It is a high quality cardboard and the printing is quite clear and nice as well for a good image.Highly recommended!

Absolutely awesome and totally halarious poster stand-up. It took about 1 minute to set up and has been a total hit. It is a high quality cardboard and the printing is quite clear and nice as well for a good image.Highly recommended!

This is a very good quality and effective vitamin C powder. I use it as a part of my dietary plan to improve immunity and energy and it has been working quite well.The product is very pure and i've been very satisfied with it and would definitely recommend it!

These are a very respectable set of skates. They are overall fairly comfortable, durable, and well designed. They seemed to fit a tiny bit on the wide side, but certainly not significant.The wheels are a good quality as well as the bearings which makes for a nice smooth ride. They also have a really nice look to them.For the price it's really tough to beat these and I would recommend them.

This is a very simple but very nice and lightweight gimbal for either a DJI phantom or, in my case, a SYMA X8C. The carbon fiber construction makes it incredibly lightweight, and the overall design and craftsmanship is top-notch.The rubber vibration absorbers that connect the two plates do a great job reducing/eliminating any jello effect. Because the gimbal is so simple it is really straightforward to assemble.I've been really happy with this gimbal on my X8C and would definitely recommend it to others, especially because of how light it is and how simple and easy to set up it is.

Very nice set of bluetooth earbuds. I especially like the fact that the earbuds themselves do not have the bluetooth chip built in to them (which always makes for a huge thing sticking out of your ear) but rather the chip is placed inline with the cord.These produce very respectable sound and the earbuds themselves do a good job isolating your ears from outside noise.Bass and treble performance is very good, especially for the price of these. I use them for sports and exercise and have had no problems at all with moisture shorting them out.The bluetooth functionality is a simple as can be and the setup is very straightforward. You probably won't even need the simple provided instructions if you've used bluetooth before.Overall I've been quite happy with these and would definitely recommend them.

1:26 Mins This is such an awesome drone. I own a couple of this thing's smaller predecessors (the X5C-1) but decided to upgrade to this larger drone primarily for the ability to lift a heavier payload (specifically either my gopro or mobius cameras). This thing shoots decent 720P footage (with a bit of the "jello" effect though), but can easily lift a gopro or other action sports camera of similar size and weight.Pros:1. Size and power: it is basically the same size of the dji phantom but obviously doesn't have the gps system. However, it is still easy to fly and has sufficient power to lift a heavier camera than the stock one (lifts my gopro hero 3+ without a problem).2. Easy to fly: any drone flying obviously takes some practice, but this thing is very user friendly, simple, and straightforward to fly. It's overall size and weight make it quite stable and solid in medium winds (up to about 15 mph before it becomes to hard to keep stable). Additionally, this drone has the option to fly in "headless" mode (push and hold the top left button for about two seconds and wait for 3 beeps to activate). Headless mode simply makes it so no matter what direction the drone is facing, the forward/backward and left/right controls are always consistent. Make sure you active headless mode with the drone facing straight away from you, then even if you turn it sideways or even back toward you, pushing the control forward still moves the drone forward and away from you and likewise for the other controls...no need to flip the controls mentally when it is pointing to or from you.3. Quick and easy setup: You simply attach the landing gear, propellers, and the batteries and your flying in no time. There are youtube videos that show how to install the propellers but basically you put on the prop first, then the little white piece (you'll know what I mean when you see it) then you slide the little metal bar on top of the white piece and through the propeller pole. Then finish it off by pushing on the chrome propeller caps.4. Affordable parts and accessories: parts are easy to find and relatively cheap for this drone. There's obviously a bit more pricey than the parts for the smaller X5C sized drones because everything is bigger, but still much cheaper than parts for like a dji phantom or other more expensive drone. Batteries are here on amazon for about 15 to 17 bucks each. Extra propellers are a few bucks too.5. Super durable: I accidentally flew this thing pretty hard into the ground at one point, causing it to bounce and flip and roll along the field...but absolutely no damage aside from some negligible scuffs. It's built like a tank though, very solid.6. Battery life: I consistently get 10 or 11 minutes even with my gopro attached. Even after several recharges on the same battery I'm still getting north of 10 minutes every time. And I usually don't even wait for the battery to totally die, I just either see the lights start to flash or notice a bit of power loss and bring it in for a fresh battery, and this is consistently above the 10 minute mark still.Cons:1. Jello effect on camera: This can be mitigated by adding some electrical or duct tape to the camera to keep it extra steadyIt's not horrendous though and again, just making the camera even tighter with some tape really reduces the issue. Honestly though, one of the key benefits of this drone is the ability you have to upgrade its camera to a gopro or mobius etc.Other notes:1. This drone is can easily and cheaply be customized with other cool parts. For example, I bought and attached some aftermarket dji phantom wide and tall landing gear, which fits this drone as well. Now I don't have any landing gear in my video when I use wide angle on my gopro.I hope you enjoy the flight footage I've uploaded. I've been super happy with this drone and for the price, it's really tough to beat. The next step up in drones costs hundreds more.

This is such a fantastic trunk organizer. It is very beefy and well built so I can put anything ranging from groceries to tools to sports equipment in it. I hate it went stuff rolls and shifts around in the trunk space so this has been a perfect solution. I also love that it has very solid handles on the sides for carrying it in and out of the car. It has a very durable nylon material with a stiff construction, yet it collapses easily for storing without taking up much space. Highly recommended!

This is such a fantastic item! I got it in the hopes that it would help our 8 month old twins fall asleep at night by keeping them distracted with the cool lights and music and it definitely does the trick!. I'm really happy with the high quality construction and excellent function of the unit and the remote and would definitely highly recommend it!

Absolutely fantastic kit of accessories for my gopro hero3+. I really love the long arm mount piece because I was able to use it to set up a stoller-cam for our jogging stroller, super fun! The quality of these products is definitely equal to gopro brand accessories but just way more affordable. The sticky tape that it comes with for the mounts is also the same quality 3M brand tape that really holds strong. I love having a chest harness for rollerblading, and the headstrap for filming my drone flights. The suction cup mount is also great for the windshield. I have been extremely happy with this set and would highly recommend it!

1:26 Mins Very nice camera! This thing shoots a very clear and crisp full HD video and takes great photos as well. The compression for uploading my video to amazon doesn't do the quality justice. I've had lesser cameras similar to this one before that didn't do very good in either low or very bright environments. This one performs very respectable in both. It is also very lightweight. It is much lighter than my GoPro Hero3+ with the lcd backpack mounted, and I love that this one has a built in lcd screen.The number of settings and customization that you can do with this camera is fantastic. The case is perfectly waterproof and we use it to shoot family videos at the pool and lake. Because it is so lightweight, I can also attach it to my smaller drone and it lifts it just fine. I've attached a video of the aerial video. I also like that it comes with two batteries so I can record for longer periods of time when I'm out. Plenty of great accessories too.I've been very happy with this camera and would certainly recommend it!

Very well made and designed, and super convenient item. I wanted to be able to split the signal from my bluray player to two separate tv's and this little gem does the trick extremely well. It's a solid plastic and the hdmi ports fit the cords nice and snug without the wobble I sometimes get in other ports. I would definitely recommend it!

Very well designed and constructed genuine leather wallet. I was tired of not having enough slots and pockets in my old wallet so I upgraded to this one and I'm glad I did. Whilst still remaining reasonably sleek and compact, this thing can store all of my cards, cash, and other wallet items with ease. I've had cheap "leather" wallets in the past that fell apart rather quickly, primarily because of poor stitching. The stitching on this wallet seems really solid and has held up very well for me so far. The leather is quite strong too. I keep a magnetic key-card in my wallet for accessing a couple places and I usually just hold my wallet up to the scanner and then use my wallet on the handle to open the door. The leather holds up very well even to this atypical rugged use. Overall I've been very happy with the style, quality, and most importantly, the craftsmanship of this wallet and would certainly recommend it.

Love love love these bibs! I love the silicone material on these bibs, makes them flexible, comfortable and the easiest thing to clean after feeding time with my babies. I have used them now a dozen times with my twins and it has made feeding time a simple no hassle experience!The neck is adjustable and fits around most any neck size perfectly. It lays on the shoulders and drapes down the chest so it easily captures any droppings from feeding time! With this type of customizable adjustment these bibs will grow as your baby grows.Easy clean up! I have used a simple baby wipe or disinfectant wipe to clean it up and the material has maintained its integrity! I have also tried washing mine in the dishwasher on the top rack. It comes out perfectly clean each time and shows no sign of deterioration. I now do not need to undress my twins down to diapers for every feeding.Excellent buy! I plan on getting more to have hand and to take with me when we go out! Highly recommend this purchase, every parent with now be stress free during feeding time. Feeding time will still be messy, but I love that I no longer have to worry about the mess winding up on their clothes and staining!

I really love this product! As a mom I needed something that is easy to use and clean, safe and simple. This product meets each of those requirements and then some! The orange portion of the bath rack is a grip material that will keep a wet baby in place, but is also comfortable and will not leave baby's skin irritated. The "arm rests" on the side keep baby securely in place while allowing arm room for them to play with a few toys during bath time. At the bottom there is lip that goes between the legs keeping them from sliding down and out of the rack. I really loved this feature because my little ones are squirmy and this keeps them in place for bath time!It is lightweight and easy to clean given it is a plastic surface. It has suction cups on each of the legs that will lock it securely in place wherever you are doing bath time for your little one(s). I have tried it in our bathroom sink and also in our portable bathtub. It works excellent in both places and suctions to both surfaces perfectly.I highly recommend this rack if you are looking for something that is simple, yet still maintains a high level of safety for your little one. Doesn't take up much space, easy to clean, and allows your little one to have fun and still be safe during bath time!

These motors are awesome! I have a couple of Syma X8C drones and they both made a slight scratchy sound from the motors on occasion (though it didn't seem to impact performance). These motors have eliminated that problem for me and are actually noticeably better than the stock ones.Thanks to the plug-in system on these they are a piece of cake to install. After installation, I immediately noticed better response and power from the motors. Sometimes when the X8C is on a downward drift it can take a bit of time and full throttle to get it to stop moving down and to begin gaining elevation again. That problem has also been eliminated for me with these new motors, with them providing a noticeable increase in power.I'll definitely be looking to get another set for my other X8C! If you enjoy your X8C and want to optimize its performance, these are a worthwhile investment!

Absolutely fantastic little kit for taking a variety of different types of photos from my smartphone.The fisheye does a great job picking up a wide perspective, making for really cool panoramic shots.  The versatility of the set with its many options is also a huge win.Also, the lenses and the contraption that connects to phone ads all high quality, nothing chintzy at all!Highly recommend!

This is a top notch projector. I got it to replace a smaller one that simply didn't have the brightness I needed for a crisp image. This one does a great job producing a clear and bright image that can been seen well even with lights on. Of course, the image is best and clearest with the lights dimmed or off.It is incredibly simple to set up and configure. It has every kind of input port I need, HDMI, VGA, composite, etc for hooking up all my devices. It definitely has a solid hd image quality. Highly recommended!

I purchased two of these and absolutely love this product. The way this mount hooks onto the poles of the headrest allow you to either place it on the back of the front seats, or if your little ones are still rear facing you can install these on the front side of the back row of seats. Very durable and easy to install. Perfectly placed nobs for a custom fit for your car. I have these placed just below my mirrors that allow me to see my twins who are still rear facing. Would totally purchase these again!

These are perfect for little hands, and I love that every part of the "ring" is chewable. Easy to clean and you can chill them by putting them in the refrigerator. Totally worth purchasing if you have little ones that are teething and need something that is easy to hold and gentle on sore gums!

9:59 Mins This is such an awesome drone. I own a couple of this thing's smaller predecessors (the X5C-1) but decided to upgrade to this larger drone primarily for the ability to lift a heavier payload (specifically either my gopro or mobius cameras). This thing shoots decent 720P footage (with a bit of the "jello" effect though), but can easily lift a gopro or other action sports camera of similar size and weight.Pros:1. Size and power: it is basically the same size of the dji phantom but obviously doesn't have the gps system. However, it is still easy to fly and has sufficient power to lift a heavier camera than the stock one (lifts my gopro hero 3+ without a problem).2. Easy to fly: any drone flying obviously takes some practice, but this thing is very user friendly, simple, and straightforward to fly. It's overall size and weight make it quite stable and solid in medium winds (up to about 15 mph before it becomes to hard to keep stable). Additionally, this drone has the option to fly in "headless" mode (push and hold the top left button for about two seconds and wait for 3 beeps to activate). Headless mode simply makes it so no matter what direction the drone is facing, the forward/backward and left/right controls are always consistent. Make sure you active headless mode with the drone facing straight away from you, then even if you turn it sideways or even back toward you, pushing the control forward still moves the drone forward and away from you and likewise for the other controls...no need to flip the controls mentally when it is pointing to or from you.3. Quick and easy setup: You simply attach the landing gear, propellers, and the batteries and your flying in no time. There are youtube videos that show how to install the propellers but basically you put on the prop first, then the little white piece (you'll know what I mean when you see it) then you slide the little metal bar on top of the white piece and through the propeller pole. Then finish it off by pushing on the chrome propeller caps.4. Affordable parts and accessories: parts are easy to find and relatively cheap for this drone. There's obviously a bit more pricey than the parts for the smaller X5C sized drones because everything is bigger, but still much cheaper than parts for like a dji phantom or other more expensive drone. Batteries are here on amazon for about 15 to 17 bucks each. Extra propellers are a few bucks too.5. Super durable: I accidentally flew this thing pretty hard into the ground at one point, causing it to bounce and flip and roll along the field...but absolutely no damage aside from some negligible scuffs. It's built like a tank though, very solid.6. Battery life: I consistently get 10 or 11 minutes even with my gopro attached. Even after several recharges on the same battery I'm still getting north of 10 minutes every time. And I usually don't even wait for the battery to totally die, I just either see the lights start to flash or notice a bit of power loss and bring it in for a fresh battery, and this is consistently above the 10 minute mark still.Cons:1. Jello effect on camera: This can be mitigated by adding some electrical or duct tape to the camera to keep it extra steady, but for my review I didn't want to tamper with it's stock condition so my attached video shows a bit of jello. It's not horrendous though and again, just making the camera even tighter with some tape really reduces the issue. Honestly though, one of the key benefits of this drone is the ability you have to upgrade its camera to a gopro or mobius etc, so once I finished the video I shot for this review I just stuck my gopro back on it.Other notes:1. This drone is can easily and cheaply be customized with other cool parts. For example, I bought and attached some aftermarket dji phantom wide and tall landing gear, which fits this drone as well. Now I don't have any landing gear in my video when I use wide angle on my gopro.I hope you enjoy the flight footage I've uploaded. When the video rendered the timing between the drone camera and my gopro got a bit off but I think you'll still get the gist of it. I've been super happy with this drone and for the price, it's really tough to beat. The next step up in drones costs hundreds more.

0:58 Mins This is a fantastic desk or office space humidifier. I put it on my desk at work to keep my nose and eyes from drying out and it works like a charm. After turning it on and within just a few seconds, it emits a perfect stream of water vapor.It also holds a decent amount of water despite its compact size which allows it to last hours for me, which is fantastic. I also like the soothing yellow like that it produces.It has a very sleek and contemporary shape and style to it as well which I really like. It is really well made and definitely has the look and feel of high quality too!I've been super happy with it and I would highly recommend it!

This is such a fantastic inflatable chair. It is made of a solid and durable rubber like material. It has three different compartments for air so that you can adjust the pressure and softness in various spots which is great. Also, I love the feature of being able to quickly fold out the cushions into an air mattress for sleeping. We purchased this for the purpose of furnishing a short-term corporate apartment (it was cheaper than renting furniture) and it has been awesome! Highly recommended!

This is an excellent product and a great buy!It is an excellent way to open up counter space in even the smallest of bathrooms. It is super easy to install on any wall surface with it's damage free adhesive backing on both the toothbrush holder and the toothpaste dispenser. It is made of a really nice white plastic which makes for easy cleaning, and looks great on any wall.The toothbrush holder has slots for 5 total toothbrushes, we only have need for two toothbrush slots, but are able to utilize it for our other teeth cleaning items as shown in the pictures. I love that the holder has a cover shielding the heads of your toothbrushes from dust and other germs prone to be found in the bathroom. The way your toothbrushes are stored allows you to grab your toothbrush at the base rather than from the head portion which goes in your mouth, another hygienic factor I love about this product!  What is also great about this holder is the cover opens easily and will stay open on its own, which allows for easy access to pull out, use your toothbrush and quickly return it and then close the cover only the one time. I really love this type of holder over your standard counter holder. For this holder alone I would buy this product again.The toothpaste dispenser absolutely great! It is easy to install any type of toothpaste that has a twist off cap so you can just install the tube itself. Which I've also shown in the included pictures. You simply push the plastic lever back like you would at a soft drink machine and the dispenser will dispense the perfect amount of toothpaste onto your toothbrush! Hands free and no more needing to break your hands trying to squeeze every last ounce of toothpaste out because this does it for you!Overall, a fantastic product, high quality and creates the most convenience for a daily routine process. It's easy to install, holds a large quantity of toothbrushes and is still easy to clean. Highly recommend this product and would totally buy it again!

Excellent electric pump! Easy to hold and perfect set of adapters to fit all your inflatable needs. Blows up our inflatable couch and chair in just a minute or two. It's easy to store wherever you need it. We've used it a number of times and still works perfectly!

These are a great buy! I wanted something that was perfect for packing lunches for my husband and were cheap so that he didn't have to worry about bringing home a Tupperware at the end of the day. These are microwaveable and very durable. They are a lot more sturdy than I anticipated which was a plus. Definitely will be buying more of these. The only thing I would change about this product is the overall size. I think it could be a bit bigger especially when it is divided into 2 compartments it makes it hard to pack in enough food for lunches.

Great set of luggage, that is lightweight yet durable. The sizing is perfect for your carryon and personal item for air travel. They are still spacious and do come with an expansion option (didn't use the expansion, using that might take it out of meeting the size requirement for carryon items). Plenty of smaller sippers and pockets in the roller bag to fit what you need for several days. The small shoulder bag is a great size. I personally used this as an additional diaper bag for my twins when we were traveling. The shoulder strap is pretty simple and doesn't have any padding so it isn't the most comfortable, but this set was perfect for us and was a perfect price!

This was my first purchase of any kind of Pack 'n Play and I was totally happy with the purchase, especially for the price! You can go to stores and pay double the price and get less quality than this! I love the bassinet feature, which is how I am currently using mine. The pad isn't the most soft, but after wrapping a small blanket tightly around it, my baby sleeps really well in it. Since I purchased this I have actually purchased another one. These are one of the more compact PNP's that I've seen when it is completely folded up.Only Con - The arch that holds the dangling stars. The stars are only attached by Velcro and my babies are strong enough to pull them off. They stars are fairly big so I'm not sure they would be a complete risk of choking hazard, but it isn't safe in my opinion, plus it is an added loose piece to pack with you which is a negative to me. I just don't put mine on and that solves the problem.

This is my second Graco Pack 'n Play and I love it! I love the bassinet option on this and that once your baby gets a bit bigger you can remove that and place a mattress at the bottom and make it more of a crib. The pad for the bassinet is not very soft even when a sheet is added. I personally purchased a soft small blanket and wrapped it very tightly around the pad and then placed it in the PNP. The setup and take down is really easy, done in just a few steps. I have twins and have these setup in our bedroom side-by-side and they both take up less space than one of my full size cribs, so this is great for on the go.Con - The one thing I don't like about this product (not enough to deduct a star) is the arch over the bassinet with hanging stars. The stars only attach to a dangling string by Velcro...my babies are strong enough to grab those and pull them off...The star's sizes are not a concern for choking unless they really tried to stuff them in their mouths...either way, these should be either permanently attached in some other way or not included in this at all. I just don't use it personally.

I am a bit torn on if I love or just sort of like this product. The clear "extraction" portions at both ends say they are made of a soft rubber. The actual blue portion of this is a soft rubber, while the clear portion is actually a more firm hard plastic. It does limit how deep you can enter your child's nose, which is good, but a lot of times their boogers are farther back, so I end up using a bulb to get it closer to the front and then use these to do the rest of extracting. I have tested this on my twins ears and they work excellent for cleaning out ears safely! Would recommend this for a great ear cleaner, but not the greatest solution for cleaning out noses. Plus I could never get away with using this while my babies slept. It would wake them right up. Overall, any okay product that I'll keep using sense I have two, but still will utilize my other gadgets along with it. Easy to clean and small so it doesn't take up a lot of space like other booger removing gadgets.

I bought this teething blanket along with another style and like them equally. This is a great size, a bit bigger than I originally expected, but that was a plus in my mind. Each corner of the star provides some sort of touch stimulation for your baby, along with the center having some sort of crackling paper inside the fabric. The reason again for 4 stars is that the bottom right (blue) corner is the only surface for teething, which is why I bought this. I think it serves more as a sensory toy than a teething blanket. I still love it for my twins, they love playing with it and do use the actual teething portion to chew on, it would just be nice if a greater portion of it was made of a chewable rubber.

Received this yesterday and really like it overall. I bought it for the purpose of having a variety of things my twins can chew on for teething. For a toy it's excellent, but it seems to me to be bit of a stretch to call it a teething toy because only the small hands are made for teething/ chewing. Overall my twins love it. Great sensory beginner toy.They love all the bright colors and especially the rings on the two bottom bear legs.

Awesome wide and tall landing gear for either the dji phantom or even the Syma X8C (which is what I used them for). Absolutely no landing gear interfering with my gopro or runcam video shots now, even with the widest angle settings on. These are very lightweight and also quite durable! A fantastic upgrade to either of these drones indeed!Highly recommended!

0:37 Mins This is such a great headlamp. It is very comfortable to wear and the straps are very adjustable. It is also extremely well made and very durable with its aluminum alloy construction.The light is super bright and can be adjusted easily to be a wide spotlight or a more narrow light.I also really like the rechargeable feature so that I don't need to keep replacing batteries like I do with my substantially less-bright rei headlamp.I've been really impressed by and very happy with this headlamp and would definitely recommend it!

0:30 Mins I've been blown away at how well made and incredibly bright this flashlight is. I also love the zoomable feature which allows me to adjust the size of the spotlight. The aluminum alloy construction and the super thick glass lens make this thing nearly indestructible.The included charger and extra battery are great to because it allows me to keep an extra battery charged and ready to go at all times. I've attached a video to help provide a sense of just how bright this flashlight is as well as its zoomable feature.I also like the fact that it comes with a nice metal clip as well as a hand strap for carrying it around. The grip on it is very comfortable in the hand as well.I've been super happy with this flashlight and I definitely recommend it!

0:25 Mins I've been so impressed by and happy with this headlamp. Bestfire has done it again with this headlamp! It is so incredibly bright and comfortable to wear.The alloy construction of the light itself makes it super durable so if you're like me and you use this camping you'll not need to worry about babying it.The overall construction and design of the straps and shape make it quite comfortable and also secure on my head. I also wear it on top of my baseball hat sometimes and it stays very secure. The light can pivot to multiple angles and has several modes. I've attached a video to help provide a sense of just how incredibly bright this thing is as well as its different modes. I've worn it in fairly heavy rain and it was totally fine with its waterproof feature.I've been super happy with this headlamp and definitely recommend it!

0:24 Mins This is one of the better headlamps on the market. I've had a substantially more expensive headlamp from rei that was not nearly as bright or as durable as this one. I've attached a video so you can get a sense of just how bright this thing is as well as its different modes.It sits very comfortable on the head or on a hat. It's easy to pivot the angle of the light. The straps are easy to adjust and are made of a nice thick stretchable material.I like that I can also attach this with the includes accessories to my bike or baby stroller too. It's so incredibly bright!!I would definitely recommend this headlamo!

0:31 Mins This flashlight is so awesome! It is unbelievably bright. I have a surefire led defender that cost four times as much that isn't nearly as bright. Definitely avoid shining this directly into your eyes though as it is super intense.It can easily be used as a spotlight and lights up a large room light it was midday. The alloy construction is solid as a tank making this flashlight as durable as can possibly be. I've attached a video showing just how bright this thing is. It comes with the needed four batteries and you can also buy extras and a charger for relatively cheap, which is what I did.This flashlight is so awesome and I definitely recommend it!

0:50 Mins This is one of the best flashlights I've come across. It is incredibly solid with a nice thick aluminum alloy construction and comfortable to hold in the hand.In the attached video I tried to provide a sense of how incredibly bright this thing is as well as its different modes. The sleek bronze looking color is quite nice as well.This thing is no doubt going to last a long time because it is essentially destruction-proof. It's also nice that it can with a charger and two batteries, of which is only requires one so I can keep one fully charged and ready to go at all ttimes.I've been super happy with this flashlight and highly recommend it!

0:42 Mins Great infrared thermometer here. It comes in a nice case for convenient storage. It does seem to be reasonably accurate when compared to other thermometers. Of course a manual thermometer is always your best bet but this is great for a quick and easy temperature reading. I also like the fact that you can take ambient room temperature. I check the temperature in my home occasionally with this as well.It is very well made, certainly not chintzy. The batteries were conveniently included as well. The user manual was straightforward just like the operation of the unit itself.I have been quite happy with it and would recommend it!

0:28 Mins This is an awesome headlamp! It is incredibly durable with its aluminum alloy construction. The light itself is incredibly bright and powerful! It also has a handful of different brightness levels as well as a strobe light for emergencies.I've attached a video so you can get a sense of just how bright this headlamp is as well as how you can adjust the angle of the light and its different modes. It lights up a large room without any problems.It is also quite comfortable and secure to wear and has adjustable straps.I've been super happy with this headlamp and definitely recommend it!

What do the Starship Enterprise and these Cottonelle Flushable Cleansing Cloths have in common?...They both orbit Uranus wiping out Klingons.Nothing wrong with these cloths, they are great. Recommended.

Having grown larer since my last swimsuit, I ordered this in a large.  It arrived, I threw it in my bag, and went off for a weekend in Palm Springs.  When I tried to put it on, I realized that it was impossible.  Because of the racerback, you can't slip into it like a regular tank suit. because you are trying to jam you entire body through the neck.It might work fine for someone with no hips to speak of, but if you are a large and shaped like a woman, get something else because you won't be able to cram your body into this.

You know that beautiful pan you see in spreads about high-end kitchens?  The one that's all shiny and not spotted with reminders of dinners past?  This is it.There is much to love about this pan:When you clean it, it looks just as good as it did coming out of the box.It's big enough for your turkey... or a spatchcocked chicken lying in the pan, wings spread wide.Traditional turkey roasting pans are ugly.  This is not.You don't need to dig out a pair of pliers to get the rack out when there's a a hot heavy piece of meat on it and you need to get to the pan drippings.It's solid.  It won't warp or bend or any of those annoying things flimsy pans do.The handles are nice and sturdy when you're dealing with heavy meats.You can put it in the dishwasher!It looks cool sitting on the counter.It fits in my not0huge vintage Wedgewood oven.Thanksgiving turkey?  Bring it on.  Holiday prime rib?  I'm ready for you.

The story is told from the POV of two women who, when they were twelve, were kidnapped and held for a summer before they were returned to their families.  Back then Carly May was a beauty pageant contestant whose horrifying stepmother hauled her to multiple pageants cashing in on her golden locks.  Lois was smart as a whip, quite disenchanted with her family, and a spelling bee champ.  Their abductor, who they called Zed, never laid a hand on them.Despite this, their abduction obviously affected them.  Now Carly May, still beautiful but perhaps a bit worn around the edges with a drinking problem, is an actress who goes by the name Chloe.  Lois is a college professor who wrote a novel about their abduction and seems relationship-challenged.  The novel is being made into a screenplay and guess who is cast in it?Yep.  Chloe.To up the stakes a bit, Lois is writing another novel about Zeds unknown son.  Both Lois and Chloe are heading to the cabin in the woods where the film is to be shot.  Chloe is not sure how she feels about her life being turned into a screenplay without her knowledge.  And, oh yeah.  Lois has a stalker.Let the games begin.While the story kept moving, and many creepy secrets were revealed, it left a lot unexplained.  Yes, I was entertained by the book.  I was turning the pages and reading late into the night.  But I had questions.  A LOT of questions.Like:1.  If Zed didn't abduct them for money or creepy abductor reasons, why did he take them?2.  What was the story with Zed's family?3.  Why was it so easy to take the girls?  And why did they not try to escape when they were still traveling to the remote cabin?4.  How does a college professor with a full caseload have time to crank out two novels?5.  How did Zed choose the girls?  Was he looking for a spelling champ and someone wasting her intellect in beauty pageants?  It's not like they lived remotely near each other.And for the plot holes through which you can drive a truck:Time-wise it made no sense.  It takes a long time to get a novel optioned into a screenplay.  It takes a long time to get a script approved of said novel.  Then there's all the wheeling and dealing that occurs before pre-production even starts, and then there's a lot of preproduction time.It felt like when Maggie Mitchell couldn't explain something, she just moved on to the next chapter.As Ricky said to Lucy, and I say to Mitchell, You got some 'splainin' to do!

Ever worry that your family might be a wee bit dysfunctional?  Worry no longer. Your flaws are nothing next to these folks.Meet the Mercer family: Alex, Millicent, and their son Max.The story begins when young Max boldly enters the neighbor's house in search of his cat.  Alex, ever the protective father, follows.  Neither seems too disturbed about the fact that they're wandering in someone else's home.  Then they discover te neighbor dead in the bathtub, apparently electrocuted when an electric iron fell in the tub.  For some reason, Alex thinks it must be a suicide... though I have a lot of troble figuring out how (or why) one would kill oneself by tossing an electric iron into one's bubble bath. Failing that, Alex thinks the eath must be accidental.  Again, I have trouble understanding how someone could be accidentally electrocuted in his own bathtub with an iron.  A radio, Maybe.  A hairdryer?  Perhaps.  But a iron?!The police, a bit less clueless than Alex in matters of bathtubs and irons and death are justifiably suspicious, first of Alex, and then of Millicent.Alex and Millcent, meanwhile are having their share of troubles, and the neighbor has heard them arguing, calling each other a variety of names one should never use with a loved one (though Alex claims they were using the words "ironically.")  Accusing first one, then the other, of murder does not help their relationship a whit.  And then all sorts of unpleasant secrets about their lives start to emerge, giving them all sort of nifty motives.Meanwhile, son Max is acting increasingly bizarre.  Understandable after what he witnessed whilst traipsing though the neighbor's house.  Alex and Millcent hurry him to a shrink who, at times, seems as clueless as Alex and Millicent as to what's going on.  And Max starts revealing some secrets about Alex and Millcent that do nothing to help the unraveling we are witnessing.Does Ben McPherson write well?  Yes.  His dialog is crisp, his descriptions evocative, his characterizations of Alex, Millicent and Max creepily real, his ponderings on the importance of family worth reading.  He even does a reasonably coherent explanation of circuitry (though, to tell the truth, it didn't make sense to me.)  And he has come up with his own category of creepy.But the iron in the bathtub, to me, feels like a plot hole one could drive a truck through, and a clear indication of who the murderer is.I'm a 3.5 stars on this one.  And I have vowed to never ever iron in the bathroom.

Show of hands from the writers out there.  Would you make a pact with the devil, or someone creepily like-but-not-exactly-the-devil to write a best seller?  Or even just to sell your book?  I suspect a number are timidly raising hands.That's what Philip Murdstone does.  Kind of.You see, he was once a successful YA author of thoughtful sensitive books about boys who are, to quote Minerva Cinch, his agent, "inadequate."  Philip made enough money writing what Minerva calls the "Sensitive Dippy Boy genre" that he was able to buy a rustic cottage in rustic Devon and pretty much hide from civilization.  Only now the books aren't selling, and Minerva can't get even a nibble on his latest work.  Philip needs a hit.  Soon.  And Minerva has a plan.  Philips needs to write a fantasy.  High fantasy.  Spelled with a p-h.  With magial swords and maps and wizards and deep meaning that no one understands.Philip panicks, as would any writer whose genre is definitely not fantasy (or phantasy). Minerva has a formula which she maps out for him, and sends Philip back to write some high phantasy.After getting drunk, Philip embarks on research.  Lots and lots of research.  It helps him not a whit. Until one night, after over-indulging on a new artisinal beer called Dark Entropy, he goes stumbling out into the bogs and meets the aforementioned kind-of-like-a-devil character, Pocket Wellfair, with whom Philip makes a Faustian pact.When Philip returns home and sits down to write, it's like the book is writing itself.  But keep in mind, he's just made a pact a somewhat unsavory character from another realm, and things are not going to go well.  And so it begins.Want a top ten list of things that are geat about THE MURDSTONE TRILOGY?  Easy.10.  Minerva's blueprint for writing high fantasy is hilarious, and probably spot-on.  If you read nothing else in the book, read that.9.  Mal Peet actually did write sensitive YA fiction.  This is his first book aimed at adults and, sadly, his last.  He died of cancer in 2015.  But there is a legacy of sensitive books once you finish this one.  It was Peet who said, "Writing is a form of licensed madness."8.  The book is funny.  And bizzare.  And bizzarely funny.  If you are not a LOL person, this just might make you LOL.7.  Peet takes square aim at the publsihing industry today: its greed, its insensitivity to the art of writing, its commercialsm and all that is wrong with it.6.  Character, character, character.  Philip is both schlemazel and schlemiel.  He is brilliant and an idiot. You probably wouldn't want to hang out with him in real life but that's okay; he wouldn't want to hang out with you either.5.  If you love puns, you'll enjoy the multitude of them.  If you don't, well... there's always the fine art of skimming a passage.4.  Faust was never this much fun.  This is a funny, if painful, romp through publishing, the world of phantasy, and misty legend places.3.  Like black comedy?  This is very black comedy.2.  Peet captures the character of the oh-so-elegant and oh-so-greedy literary agent with flair and humor.1.  The ending.  Enjoy the ride and wait for it... wait for it.It's phantastic.  ;-)

When my beloved Nespresso machine died I was devasted.  I mourned.  I went through the stages of grief.  And then I got a De'Longhi ECP3420 15" Bar Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Machine.  And you know, it's pretty cool.So here are things that are cool about it.1.  You can use pods or you can use your own.2.  It comes with three inserts: 1 cup, 2 cup, and pod and they store in the convenient storage space.3.  It has a sleek modern look with smooth easily cleaned surfaces.4.  It heats quickly and easily, with understandable controls.5.  It holds about a quart so, depending on your coffee consumption, it can last you a while.6.  It's easy to refill the water.7.  The steamer is awesome.  It works well without fancy technique.  Yoi just stuff it in your milk and it works fine.Also it comes aprt for easy cleaning.8.  It has a small footprint; it fits easily on your counter.9.  The top gets warm, making for a nice heating device.10.  It heats quickly.11.  It makes a fine espresso.Does anyone need about 93 Nespresso pods?

I found SO YOU DON'T GET LOST IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD under mysteries and thrillers, which is my usual spot of book comfort.While I found Patrick Modiano's writing to be exquisite, the book only made me feel like I was stuck in a very sad Jacques Brel song on a continuos loop.Modiano references many neighborhoods in Paris, and does so in a very evocative style.  The characters are perefctly mysterious in a creepy sort of way.  But as I read, the song that kept playing in my head was:I don't want to work, I triedI don't want to grab a biteI want to forget outrightand then I smokeJe ne veux pas travaillerJe ne veux pas djeunerJe veux seulement oublieret puis je fumeRather than take up smoking Galouises, I stopped reading.

This is not the sort of book I generally read, preferring instead to escape into fiction where, when something dreadful happens, it's not real.But I am friends with far too many people who face or have faced cancer, so I began THE GIRL WITH THE NINE WIGS.Why?~ To understand the randomness of the disease, how it can strike someone as young as 21-year old Sophie in the book or someone who has chain-smoked his entire life or some random middle-aged person previously leading a quiet life.  My understanding, alas, in that it is not understandable.~ To "look" at the horribly invasive procedures done to thwart the disease, which certainly gives meaning to the phrase "battling cancer."  Not only is one's body being attacked by wildy misbehaving cells, but it's being brutalized by the cures.~ To strengthen resolve to try to do nothing to attract this dreadful disease.~ To know more ways to help a friend fighting the battle.Sophie van der Strap's memoir is powerful and moving, and helps shed light on some of the answers.

If you're the sort of person who can't start the day without your Sudoku, or the sort of person who deals with stress with a good game of Spider Solitaire or Mah Jong, then this is the game for you.While DIMENSION seemed a little complicated at the start, after a few rounds it became the distracting obsession that many of us seek.For beginners, I would suggest reducing the number of cards from 6 to 5.  This makes the first round or two a little easier... until you are hooked.Once I got the hang of the game, I found it to be compelling, challenging, and, thanks to the egg timer, a fast-paced puzzle game.The pieces are satisfying to hold and use.  The spheres are nicely weighted and te game board seems durable.This can be played as solitaire, or as a group game with up to four players.All those solitaire rounds you played will give you a nice edge when you move to the group game.  ;-)

After gasping at the price of high-end cocktail cherries like LUXARDO and BADDA BINGS, I decided I would make my own.  And so I purchased the PREPWORKS CHERRY PITTER.  I lined up cherries and pitted them cleanly.  First I did them with no stems.  But then I thought about the prefect maraschino cherry and its stem (no, I have never tied a knot in one with random body parts), and left the stems on.  If you arrange them carefully, you end up with perfectly pitted stemmed cherries.The birds and squirrels, btw, ADORE the little pit bits you leave in the feeder.So there I was with a mason jar full of perfectly pitted cherries.  I used the recipe from one of my cooking magazines, with sweet vermouth and brandy.I waited until they were supposed to be ready and BLEARGH!  Awful!  My perfectly pitted cherries were unspeakably dreadful.And by then... cherry season was over.Note to self: find a better recipe for next season's perfectly pitted cherries.

When we were in Venice, we sat at a bar and sipped Negronis from tall glasses. Inside each glass was the most spectacular long curl of orange peel.  It was thin; it twisted and turned, and knotted and released all its pungent oils into the liquid.My husband, always looking for new goals, vowed to make orange peels as beautiful as the ones in his venetian Negroni.Once we were home he set to work with the vegetable peeler, with a knife, with an itty bitty knife.  No matter how hard he tried, he could not replicate those spectacular twisting peels.Then we found the STARFRIT 93209 ROTATO EXPRESS - ELECTRIC PEELER.Put in an orange, turn it on, and watch it go.  The peeler works its way around the orange in perfect circles, peeling one beautiful continuous peel -- a bounty for your Negronis.I suppose it works for potatoes and apples and all those other round-ish fruits and vegetables.But my husband is content.  He has his perfect Negroni orange garni.

Everyone has a target zone: a part of one's anatomy that reacts to stress, environmental factors, life.  Mine is skin.  I itch.  A lot.  Use the wrong detergent and itch.  Handle the wrong metals and itch.  Use a band-aid and itch.  Walk within a mile of a bug, be bitten, and itch.It was once explained to me by a medical professional that itching is borderline pain, and from someone who suffered from a 2-year run of hives, I can attest to the truth of that.  Itching is also time-consuming.  We itchers spend a lot of time trying not to scratch, scratching, and thinking about our itching.I am always looking for something to stop the itch, and I am rarely impressed with what I find.  So I was a bit dubious about CUREL ITCH DEFENSE SOOTHING MOISTURIZING SPRAY.But it did the (near) impossible.  It stopped my new array of bug bites from itching me to distraction.  It calmed sown an erupting hive.  It allowed me to stop thinking about itching for a while.I was concerned that the spray might stain clothing, but it did nor appear to do that.  My only complaint would be that the spray is hard to manipulate and aim, especially with arthritic hands.But you know... I will find a way around that because IT STOPPED MY ITCHING!(And that's a good thing.)

Ryder Creed is an ex-combat  veteran with a past and a passion for search and rescue dogs.  He once (apparently) had a wild fling with FBI Agent Maggie O'Dell.  When Creed and his dog are called to the scene of horrific mudslides, one would think it was to do search and rescue work, finding survivors.  Unfortunately, it's because he owes a favor to the extremely unlikeable former commander Logan.  And Logan isn't at all interested in Creed doing anything humanitarian at the site.This, of course, doesn't stop Creed and his dog from doing some good work (and getting swept up in a mudslide, emerging with a concussion, a few broken ribs, and a pile of mud-caked lacerations) before Logan shows up and reveals his true purpose: he needs Creed to stop slacking and find what happened to a secret military lab that was chock full of all sorts of extremely creepy chemicals.To add to the mix, who should show up buy Maggie O'Dell, who has been sent by her current boyfriend.Meanwhile, back in Washington, hearings are going on re: testings done on children and civilians back in  the good old days of the cold war.Things only get more complicated from there.This was my first Alex Kava book and, while I wasn't totally mesmerized by the characters, with the exception of Creed and his dogs, I *was* totally mesmerized by the search and rescue elements of the book, its pacing, and it's slow reveal of the past.That being said, here are the Top Ten Things That Are Great About SILENT CREED.10.  Everything to do with the dogs is fascinating - how they are trained for search and rescue, their specialties. what they respond to, how they signal...  All of that makes for a great read.9.  One of the scariest most engrossing descriptions of mudslides ever.  Kava captured everything from the shifting earth, the total path of destruction, the power..  I plan to stay very far away from cascading mud.8.  Creed's tough-love relationship with other veterans, struggling to live normal lives after dealing with PTSD.7.  While I didn't think Kava did much of a job on female characters, she can conjure up nasty scheming jerks beautifully.  There are characters you'll love to hate.6.  Kava captured the feel of rescue operations magnificently: the urgency, the danger, the despair, battling the elements...  You'll want to curl up somewhere warm and dry.5.  She also captured the ambience of those gyms and auditoriums where the locals get together to feed and warm and take care of those who have come to the rescue.4.  Creepy creepy creepy old military testing.3.  An homage to those who have been damaged by chemicals or war or being exposed to something no one should be exposed to, and their struggle for justice and medical care.2.  Some great heroic moments of triumph.1.  Did I mention the dogs?  The dogs are amazing.Go hug a dog and check out this book.  Then you'll need to hug another dog or two.

The Cool Coolers are very... cool.  I got them to use in insulated lunch pails, and they stay frozen until lunch time.  They are easy to clean, and freeze up nicely overnight.  They are also flat enough that they don't take up too much space in the lunch pail.They are also good for a little game of air hockey on your kitchen floor.At least, that's what the cats and the dog tell me.

My rodent invasion is rather extensive.  It's Southern California, and the living is nice.  And warm.Add to the mix, I have a large aviary where seed spills like the falling rain, and any additional seed is there as a tasty snack  I also have underneath the house areas where I keep canned good and tasty paper, which apparently is high on the rodent hors d'oeuvres scale.So yes.  We have rodents.And yes, I have cats.The rodents are winning.Victor M805 Scent-Away Natural Rodent Repeller seems to slow them down a bit, along with traps (into which I hot-glue walnuts), electric system rodent deterrents, aforementioned cats, and Victor M805 Scent-Away Natural Rodent Repeller.It helps.  A little.  I am also adding cotton balls soaked in peppermint oil and a nice overall spray of Dr. Bronner's peppermint soap.So, while the rodents are still winning...life smells better.

We celebrate Halloween pretty much year round at my house, and I am always on the lookout for Halloweenalia.  I've collected a lot of pieces from Halloween artists and display them year round. The DII HALLOWEEN LACE TABLE RUNNER is the perfect complement for them.  It's sturdy enough that it doesn't snag or tear when it meets up with a rough surface.  And it drapes perfectly, without clumping or lumping.  While it's not an elegant fabric, it is washable... which is very useful when the pumpkin starts to go.So here are 101 Uses for the DII HALLOWEEN LACE TABLE RUNNER.  Or thirteen.1.  Table runner beneath Halloween treasures.2.  A seasonal shawl.3.  A spidery drape across a window.4.  A coffee table boogie board for out-of-control cats.  Yep.  They took a nice slide arcoss the coffee table on this.5.  Inspiration for garden spiders.6. Surface for displaying pumpkins.7.  Great gift for your Halloween-freak friends8.  Perfect setting for a creepy candelabra.9.  A nice drape across several shelves.10.  Good prop for helping someone get over their arachnophobia.11.  Creates a nice effect when draped over a mirror.12.  Hang it from the ceiling and adorn with fake spiders.  (Or real ones.)13.  It will fit nicely in the coffin when I decide to put it away.

Pre de Provence Soap Shea Enriched Everyday 300 Gram Extra Large French Soap Bar in Beautiful Gift Box is a lovely little box of pampering.  You can shower with it and step out feeling like a goddess or god. Then you go clean the cat box, unclog the disposal, sort the recycling, and hunt down the funky smell in the refrigerator, still bathed in its aura.  It lathers beautifully, smells like a spring bouquet, and soaps you up nice and clean.But wait!  There's more!  Here are 101 Things You can do with your Pre de Provence Soap Shea Enriched Everyday 300 Gram Extra Large French Soap Bar in Beautiful Gift Box.1.  Give the cool excelsior in your box to the birds for nesting material.  (It's the real deal and not the paper substitute where the colors run and suddenly the birds are bathing in purple water.)2.  Give the box to the magician in your family.  I guarantee said magician will come up with some nifty effect that absolutely needs that box.  Failing that, it's a cool sturdy little box for your collection of push pins, safety pins, buttons, paperclips, coupons... You get the idea.3.  Store the soap in a drawer with your undergarments.  According to my mother (whose word was not to be doubted under any circumstances), this gives the soap a chance to dry out, giving it a longer life, and scents the drawer nicely.  It also kicks the soap's scent down a notch since the smell is a bit strong straight out of the box.4.  It's the perfect gift for the soap-o-philes on your list.  You know who they are. The ones who can't pass a Lush store without going in "just to see what's new."5.  Drive nails with less risk of splitting the wood by first rubbing some of the soap on the nail shank.  Then your nail will smell nice, too!6.  Stretch those arthritic fingers.  The bar of soap is huge and grasping it gives the fingers a nice stretch.7.  Let your skin suck up that shea butter.  Shea butter is an excellent moisturizer and it has healing properties for your skin.8. Take a shower with the soap.  Or a bath.  Or wash your hands.  It's soap!And a very nice soap, at that.

What's scarier than a hit man? A hit man who hits hit men.  Though that's probably not what one lists under PROFESSION on a tax return.Michael Hendricks is former special ops, who lost his entire unit (except for his best friend Lester) in a mission gone bad.  He's officially declared dead.  His best (or sole surviving) friend, who can crack code and figure out anything, is confined to a wheelchair for life.  For these secret mission guys, there are no honorable discharges because what they did never happened.  Best friend buys a bar and tries to drink himself to death until Hendricks shows up.  Together the two come up with an original, if ironic, kind of business model where they figure out who's about to be hit... and, for a price, hit the hit man.  That is, unless the target is some unredeemable creep.  Then they take a pass.  As a result of his high rate of success, the mob wants Hendricks eliminated.Adding to his vulnerability (if it can be called that), Hendricks was in love with Evie, who thinks he's dead and is now married and pregnant.  But Hendricks still loves her and watches out for her and sends her money under some phony trust fund set-up.The mob calls in perhaps the creepiest of creepy hitmen -- a sadist named Engelmann, who is more than happy to take down Hendricks, and anyone else who happens to be in the way.  The fact that he's being paid one million Euros to do the deed is just icing on the cake.  He'd probably do it happily for the opportunity to torture a few people along the way.  (Did I mention he was creepy?)And then there are the Feds, who are also after Hendricks.Let me point out that I am not the target audience for this book.  It's far too violent for me (despite the fact that I apparently read all kinds of horrifyingly violent books).  But Holm has done a masterful job with his story so, with eyes occasionally shut, looking the other way, humming a happy hum to myself, I finished the book and present to you the Top Ten Things That Are Great About THE KILLING KIND10.  Do you love guns?  (I don't, but apparently Chris Holm does)  You'll meet all kinds of guns here and find out all sorts of things about them.9.  Do you love irony?  A hit man trying to hit a hit man? Figuring out if a hit man can be a good guy?  Irony and questions of morality abound.8.  Did you think code was just something that makes a web page look like it does?  Or makes Facebook work?  Or tells you how to get from A to B and avoid traffic?  It can also be used to designate hits.  Feel better now?7.  The loyalty of two men who served together is always touching... even if they spend their days picking out new targets to kill.6.  A nice glimpse of the town of Portland, Maine.  Don't worry; it's safe to go there now.5.  Scenes where hit men disguise themselves as tourists or cowboys or bumbling idiots are fun, and a nice respite from blood and gore.4.  If you're an FBI dude who is dismissive to female agents, watch out for karma.  Well, not karma exactly.  Maybe more like over-the-top just desserts.3.  You'll learn so many ways to hide, steal clothing, get wheels...  There's a whole primer of felonious behavior.2.  Pacing.  The story moves.  It races.  It careens toward the finish line.1.  A great MacGyver moment.If it's your scene, it's a roller coaster ride.  Great pacing.  Tons of suspense.If you're squeamish, there are other great books out there.I'm going to hum my happy hum some more.

It's the summer of 1972 in rural Peckinpaw, Kentucky, where couples sit on Liar's Bench as the world goes by.  In many ways, the town never emerged from 1860, when Fannie Crow, a slave who was a victim of rape and assorted cruelties, is found guilty of poisoning the mistress of the house and is summarily hanged.
