I have a daughter who was blessed to have a lot of hair, and I mean A LOT.She will be 2 next month and I was in need of some hair accessories since she has grown out of the headbands I had for her.I actually prefer these better because I have more control where to put them.The ribbons come in a 15pack and all are not just one color they are all different.You have some that are different variations of the color but not all the same.I really love the variety because you can dress up any outfit since there are so many and best of all this will last me a couple years for hair dos with her.She will not outgrow these like a headband.This would definitely make a great gift idea as well if you wanted to, or decorate a diaper cake with these sprinkled around.One particular feature on this which I show in my video, is that the clip is metal that they use and it holds to the hair perfectly and securely.They also have the metal part hidden where it would have been exposed so you do not see the metal part at all like some bows do.I really am enjoying dressing my daughters hair up with these adorable boutique bows.(3" in size) From a mother who has a daughter who is active I would definitely recommend them.They stand up well to her daily activities and the ribbon itself is pretty durable.Don't forget to check out my video as I show you up close the quality of these premium ribbons.*Complimentary Sample was provided to me during a promotional offer in exchange for my honest evaluation.

4:29 Mins I absolutely love this car mount it is nice and compact perfect for my iPhone6Plus & Hubbys phone.One of the great things I liked about this car mount is that it can be mounted to your dashboard or windshiled which is nice.Most car mounts I have used can only be mounted on a certain area because the way it is designed.This one does not obstruct my views when driving at all which is a big plus for me.This one is nice and short at the base allowing the support to hold my phone but at the same time out of my view of driving.I can see the cars clearly and I do not have any blindspots with this one.The car mount is a clip which makes it easy to install and remove your phone quickly and easily.It has rubber like grips that hold my phone securely in place.I also like that it can accomadate any phone size since it does not have side brackets limiting the size phone you can put in it.There is a lever on the bottom to create a nice suction when installing the base to the surface of your choosing and locks it into place.You also can move the phone around 360degrees to suit your needs.I would definitely recommend this car mount if you are in search of a good plastic one.No magnets or anything of that nature needed.Just simply open the clip and place your phone in and your ready to go.*Complimentary Sample was provided to me during a promotional offer in exchange for my honest unbiased evaluation.

This is a very high quality tilt/pan ip camera.  I like that it is IP because you are not tied to one specific iphone app i or ecosystem.  You can use this with any ip cam viewer.  Setup is fairly straight forward if you know what you are doing and have set up an IP camera before.  The one star deduction is that you would have a very hard time setting this up if you were a real novice.  The instructions are quite thin and unclear.The camera itself if typical foscam 720p quality.This was provided to me in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is really a great solar pathway light.  It comes on dim at dark.  When it senses motion, it gets very bright and really lights up a path.  It seems to last all night if it was a sunny day.It is good looking and unobtrusive.  Fairly small.I like this a lot.It was provided to me in exchange for a fair unbiased review.

These are extremely thin sheets that are NOT soft at all.  200 thread count?  Maybe.  But these are neither soft nor thick.  Comes with fitted, flat and two pillowcases.  The edge trimmings are not very well finished.

The tools themselves seem to be standard fare, but perfectly adequate tools for nail care.  They seem to be stainless steel and all operate smoothly with sharp edges.  They feel substantial in the hand.  The case itself is adequate, but the clasp is low quality - hence the one star deduction.  Mine arrived with the tools all over the place in the box and the case was open.  I had to look at the listing photo to see how everything was supposed to fit together.  No problem tough in the end.This was provided to me in exchange for an unbiased review

Smells like windex.  Seems to cover up (or mask, whatever) pet urine or poo.  It does not clean much better than simple water.  My dog (who is usually perfectly house trained) had an accident because we forgot to walk her (happens).  A small pee puddle on hardwood.  Wiped up the pee.  Sprayed this stuff.  She hasn't been sniffing the spot or anything, so I guess it worked
It is a small tin disposable baking pan.  Good for pot luck dinners.  Does it work for bacon?  No clue.  We're kosher.

Best UBS outlet available.  It is tamper safe (so, up to code).  It charges two 2.1a devices at the same time.  It fits in a double (or more) gang outlet box easily.  It has simple screw down connections.  It comes with a decora and a screwless wall plate too.  Great outlet.  Highly recommend.There is something about a recall out there, but that is much older batch numbers.  I got this in Nov 2015 and had 1U21508 on mine.  Well past the trouble batch.

These are REALLY Soft.  If you have never tried bamboo towels you are in for a treat.  These are very heavy and dense, but SUPER soft.  The colors are an interesting mix - a bit lighter than shown in the photo.  Thin but dense heavy weight.  Sizing is exactly as listed.

These are made with 3.8% recycled materials.  That is not very much.  They are also nearly three times more expensive than comparable batteries without the eco marketing.  They work just fine.  They aren't  too thick and fit easily in my aaa devices.  Do they last longer?  Who knows.  I'm not a testing laboratory, but my impression is that they function no differently from any other battery out there.If the very low recycling content and super price premium are attractive to you, you should buy these

This is a nice very small light.  It uses one aa battery.  You can adjust the light beam from spot all the way to a lantern candle.  There are also different patterns you can push the tail light to get it to strobe or do SOS, but those functions are not well documented.The light cannot do a tail stand.I received this in exchange for my unbiased review.
This smells way better than the dead sea.  And it smells way better than my feet.  But it only seemed to have a negligible effect on the softness of my feet.

My daughter twisted her ankle just to test this.  She said it works great. She really liked the wide 4" width that made it easy to run around her foot and up her calf.  The real breakthrough is the clasp.  It uses a clip and velcro!  Wow.  No more spikes into her leg!  She was so psyched!  It snapped right onto the end and didn't pull the bandage thread by thread. It all stayed together.  My little girl was back walking in no time. No thanks to the Ace Brand Black Elastic Bandage with Ace Brand. . .

These work fairly well.  There is no middle, so the last few sheets are somewhat wasted.  The TP is soft and absorbant.  Not anything like the 200 grit sandpaper I had been using.  Also, way better than that shiny three leaf plan that had been offered to me.  No, this is soft and luxurious.  It is also good for the environment, because there is no center tube.  But then how will I see the stars?  Where is my free telescope?  It just works.  That is all I can say.

This really does a nice job.  It fits all standard beer can size.  It keeps your beer cold.  It covers 98% of the beer can label so you can be a bit more discrete.  There is a rubber seal at the top lip that seems to keep the can in place.  The only odd thing is that I feel like my can still has something in it even when empty because the sleeve adds a tiny bit of weight.

Interesting product.  I tried it on my Kohler stainless sink and I can't really say it was any better than just using some Bar Keeper's Friend and a sponge.  Also, it is a bit dangerous to have this left around the sink if people don't know what it is.  If this is used on your nice chrome faucet, you will no longer have a nice chrome faucet.The package contains a single (fairly small) sponge.

Extremely light and feels fairly unsubstantial, but works perfectly and has reasonable sound.  I use this for capturing ideas throughout the day and really like how small and light it is.  I almost forget this is even in my pocket.  It just works.

Mat works very well.  No change in cooking time or temp.  Out of the box, as instructed, I washed well with soap and water - once dry, I coated with cooking oil.  Cookies worked great - easiest clean up ever.  The mat lays flat and does not curl.

This is a very comfortable, yet very wide, belt.  It is 1 3/4" wide.  The holes are reinforced, so you will not create ovals from circles.  The word "WOLVERINE" is embossed on the loop, but it is barely noticable.

Originally, I thought this was a great lock, but then it completely failed me.  I thought this was so good I bought two and have been using them on my boat all summer.  Each gets used maybe once or twice a week.  They are not sitting in salt water or anything - just on deck under an overhang - maybe exposed to a tiny bit of rain and spray.One day, out of the blue, this past weekend, one of them simply wouldn't open.  The combination entered was correct (it is the same combination we have been using all summer).  It just simply WOULD. NOT. OPEN.  Had to use a hacksaw to cut a perfectly good cable.  If this had been on any important gear, it would have been terrible.Nobody changed the combination and the lock was not abused in any way.  The tumblers turn just fine.  I entered the same combination I had been using all summer, and it just wouldn't open.  We also tried one digit in either direction of each of the four numbers.  Spent over an hour fiddling with it.  It is still locked closed.I have now replaced both of these locks on my boat, because I simply cannot trust it.Very disappointing.  Total waste of money - not to mention the damage I had to cause to free the item from this terrible lock.

This is a very nicely made kids watch.  It fits my 7yo daughter's wrist perfectly.  I like that it is water resistant (says 30m, but the button style makes me question that).  My daughter already knows how to read an analog watch, so she really wanted a digital one.I received this in exchange for my honest review.

This is a nice comfortable standing mat, but one star deduction because it is pretty slippery.  I would not use this in front of a sink other area where the mat would get wet.  Once wet, it is really slick.  There is no real traction to the surface.  It is smooth.  The edges are champfered and it always lays flat.  The corners do not pull up

nice quality cups, but 9oz is a bit small.  12 or 16 oz are more standard.  9oz is good for kids juice or water.  These do not leak and stack nicely.  The texture is nice so that you don't easily lose your grip.  They are a bit small for the cupholders on my boat.

Great art.  This is a wrapped print that comes on three panels.  The picture is clear and reasonably high resolution.  Th canvas is fairly smooth, not much texture to it.  Hanging clips are included.  Nice addition to any naked walls - but probably not for the formal area of a nice home.The three panels look best with a max 4" gap between the panels - for a total width of 68"
Line is okay, but the black color was a mistake.  It marks up my white gelcoat.  The line also tends to get caught on the dock splinters.  I used it for awhile, but ended up replacing it.
Great amp.  It is easy to hook up, uses a reasonable amount of power and gives great sound.  I use this on my boat in a protected location.

Sound quality is very very good, but not audiophile quality.  It adds bass, which is what I was looking for.  These are mounted to the hardtop on my boat and they seem to be doing fine in the weather.

This is a terrific tool for your car.  The tire gauge is well made and easy to use.  If you have ever struggled getting just the right angle to the tip of your valve, this is just perfect.  It has a red led light to help you spot the nozzle in the dark.  It also has a small flashlight, a seat belt cutter, and a window breaker.  It also uses two perfectly normal aaa batteries.

Pretty easy to use and set up, but the apple app does not sync well with the health app and the apple app does not automatically download and transfer from the device - you have to do it manually.The blood pressure monitor seems to give fairly accurate measurements, but memory and user functions are very limited.  The hard plastic case is a nice plus

Great beach bag that easily fits back in its storage bag for easy storage - about the size of a pair of rolled up tube socks.  The mesh is nice because it not only lets the sand out and lets you see what is inside, but it also acts to allow some air flow so things dry out and don't get moldy/musty.Be aware, your stuff can be seen from the outside.  Not much privacy
High quality notebook with easy to remove pages.  There is a plastic divider that can be moved anywhere.  The spine is fabric bound and can be written on with a market.  I like this a lot.

I was incredibly fortunately to receive this set at no charge.This is a fun little Star Wars spaceship set; great for kids young and (ahem) old.There are a variety of six ships included.  These are indeed "Hot Wheels" sized ships (so they are tiny - one to two inches long each).  Each also comes with a small plastic stand, which makes these easy to display.  There is a little "finger" hole that allows you to "play" with each ship.The ships are well made out a combination of metal and plastic.  They have lots of detail, are durable, and don't feel cheap (much better than what you might get in a cereal box for example).  I'm particularly impressed with the paint and coloring on each ship.In summary, this is an awesome little Star Wars set for fans of all ages!

This is a great little wind measuring speed device.  It comes with a case, and is a nice hand-held size.  I was able to fire it up, changed over to miles per hour as the measurement, and now can measure the wind speed of my air ducts to get better readings on which ones have air flowing properly, and which ones need opening up.  It feels very precise, and measures to the tenth of a mile per hour.  The rotors on the device spin incredibly easy (which is good), and the readings seem to be consistent with what I would expect.  All in all, a great little device if you want to measure wind speeds (for the AC guys, storm chasers, etc!).

0:43 Mins This is a wonderful RC offroad vehicle.  It is what I would consider to be a midrange toy.  You can get cheap toys for $20, or pay $2,000 for a high end racing RC vehicle, and this one fits somewhere in the middle.First of all, the packaging says for ages 14 and up.  While I personally think any 10 year old would be fine with it, that is an indicator of the type of toy we are talking about; it is FAST and powerful, and if not used properly could cause harm (I can see my 10 year old self building ramps and jumping it over my friends ... would not have been a smart idea).And this thing is big.  It is 1/12 scale, and as you can see from the photo, it dwarfs a foot long ruler.The construction is good and solid.  The tires are real soft rubber.  The suspension works well, and it can take a beating.  However, note that my pug (which goes crazy over RC vehicles) managed to immediately break the rear "spoiler", which is just a cosmetic weak point.  My pug also pulled one of the tires off, but I popped it right back on and everything was fine (after a pounding, the suspension and parts that matter hold up admirably).The remote is just "ok".  The steering wheel has a foam rubber surface for good grip, and it has a pull trigger gas pedal (and reverse).  The controller has lots of other fake buttons, which adds zero value and is just distracting.The driving experience is awesome and fun!  Yes, it is very very fast in my opinion; much faster than any other RC vehicle I have ever operated (which to be fair are cheap ones).  The box says it goes 18 KM/hr, which is 11 miles per hour.  That is a very fast run (sprint speed for a kid or someone who isn't in great shape).  It accelerates VERY quickly to the top speed, so driving can be a challenge.The only downside with driving is that the steering is very wide; in other words, you will not be making sharp turns with this.  The turning radius is roughly ten feet.  This makes it easier to drive, but tough to navigate small areas.  The steering does not slowly adjust; it is full on left or right when you turn the wheel.  That is fine for a fun toy, but "pro" RC racing vehicles allow for turning sharp or gradual, not just all or nothing.  But for my purposes this is fine.The set includes a charger and TWO battery packs (as well as a 9v for the remote).  This is wonderful in that you don't need to buy anything else to be up and running immediately.In conclusion, this is a really fun toy; it isn't perfect, but is miles ahead of lower priced RC units.

This is an exceptional "industrial strength" USB hub.  It is USB 3.0 compatible, although I only have USB 2 machines.  Regardless, the unit installed with no issues or drivers needed, and I have had no issues with devices that are connected through it.  It looks fantastic, and with a separate power supply, it provides plenty of juice for devices (such as a cell phone charging cable).  If you want a fantastic USB hub for your powerhouse machine, look no further; highly recommended!

This is an excellent set of small travel bottles!They are well constructed, and so far have not leaked a drop. I am confident in using these with any liquids; the last thing you want is leakage, and I do not expect to have any with this set.You get nine vessels to hold liquids with the set: 1 spary bottle, 3 squeeze bottles, and 5 small twist cap bottles.For an inexpensive set, this one really covers all of the bases. Highly recommended!

I had the opportunity to review the product at no charge.My first impression out of the box is "wow, this is a nice and well made piece of hardware."  This is the type of item (as you would hope) that you'll probably have in your toolbox forever, and if you have children they will inherit it.The size is similar to a hammer; a bit longer, but it is not a giant tool (mine is the 16" long model).The head is adjustable and has a perfectly curved surface that make prying or lifting a breeze where other tools fail.I used this recently just to lift an edge of a very heavy piece of metal furniture where I needed to get my fingers underneath to lift.  I can see where it will be extremely useful for future projects (prying boards apart, lifting a heavy corner of an item to insert something underneath, etc.In summary, this is a great little pry bar - highly recommended!

I had the opportunity to review the book at no charge.I am a property manager, and have mostly "winged it" without getting outside help.  Most property management is common sense, but there are some "gotchas", and those can cost you dearly if not handled properly.I recently had my first major run-in with a former tenant regarding their condition upon move-out, and the amount withheld from their deposit to get the property back into condition.  I was lucky that no lawsuit was filed, because if so I likely would have lost out on labor charges (which seemed completely appropriate to me, but this book would have steered me in a slightly different direction which could have avoided some of this conflict in the first place).  The book focuses on practical scenarios, and has what I would consider to be excellent advise throughout.In summary, if you are new to property management, this is a must read.  If you are already a property manager, you can survive without the book, but I still would recommend it as a great supplemental resource.

This is a fantastic little solar light.  It measure about 5 inches long by 4 inches high by 3 inches deep (the solar part is angled on top, with the lighting angled towards the ground).Installation is as easy as can be.  The only thing to remember is you MUST use the included little metal "key" (basically like a paperclip) to click on the light for the first time.  There are included screws, but really you just need one screw and can quickly slap it on the side of a house, a tree, etc.The motion detection is not adjustable but works perfectly; just right for my application of having this on the side of my house.The brightness is quite nice; the 8 LEDs are very bright and put off maybe half the brightness of a small flood light.  So while the light isn't going to blow you away, it provides a very bright area of around 10 feet by 10 feet.In summary, for the money this is an excellent light!

I cannot tell you the reader how much I love this CD / DVD burner. But I will try.Yes, it is a fairly generic CD/DVD reader and writer. It comes with the USB cable you need, and you can just plug it into most machines and it will work great. I tried it with a Windows 7 machine, and with a MacBook running OSX 10.8, and both worked flawlessly with no hiccups or hassles. Note that this drive is USB 3.0 compatible; unfortunately I don't have any machines that are new enough to try out the faster speeds. But USB 2.0 works great.The reason I am blown away with love for this unit is that it works with my Korg Kronos keyboard (basically a $3,000 professional music workstation / keyboard / synth). One of the features of my keyboard is you can write music, plug in a CD burner, and burn CDs. After two years of trying out different drives (all "major brands") with no luck, I plugged in this VicTsing drive in, just for grins. And sure enough it worked right off the bat without a single issue. I have spent literally dozens of hours trying to get other burners to work without ever successfully burning a single disk (and those drives worked fine everywhere else), but this new one finally solved my problem. I will be reporting my results to Korg and posting this for other frustrated users out there (there are plenty). Finally a solution that works!Bottom line, this is a fantastic little burner that will do everything you need, and even outperforms all other brands in my specific scenario of trying to burn a CD from my Korg Kronos keyboard.

I was quite lucky to get to try out this product at no charge.How good or bad can a good leash be?  Well, a bad retractable leash tangles, does not wind up consistently, is noisy, and can have a button mechanism that won't lock or functions poorly.  I have a couple of pug dogs (20 - 30 pound range), and they are all over the place, so have a good retractable leash is a must.After trying out this one, I now know what a good leash feels like; I love it!  The "reeling" action is smooth and flawless.  The retraction tension is perfect and withdraws nicely.  The button that locks the leash works great; not too much pressure is required, plus it has a small ridge that helps your thumb engage.Bottom line, this is a nice looking premium retractable leash - highly recommended!

This is a fantastic idea!  We have two Chinese pug dogs.  They are wonderful indoor animals, but shed like crazy.Well, this is basically a "mitt" that has grooves on one side that remove the hair.  I have tried using the Furminator type of products for years; they are ok, but my hand gets tired and the dogs don't like the metal rakes.  This product is much friendlier for both the animal and the groomer; our pugs just feel like they are being petted (and not "tortured"), and the products offers me a natural neutral position to work on the dogs without getting hand cramps (my arm and body can do most of the work; much easier).  And yes, it really pulls the hair off (gently, but enough that I can "defur" my dogs outside, and there is very little shedding indoors).Overall a fantastic idea and a great product; highly recommended!

I have been using Energizers for years.  While I am more of a rechargeable guy, alkaline batteries absolutely have a place at the table for powering items like remotes, AC wall thermostats, and outdoor thermometers (applications without large drains where you do not want to mess with recharging batteries every few months).This is an 8 pack of alkaline AAA batteries.  So far they seem just as good as any others I have tried.  The packaging for these has "ECO" stamped on them, as if these are environmentally friendly.  Well, they are made of 4% "recycled" content, which means they are 96% as "bad" as any other battery.  I suppose that is better than nothing, but it isn't like every one of these batteries sold will result in a tree getting to live.  But the real benefit is that they (according to Energizer) DO indeed last a bit longer (12 year shelf life versus 10 year for their normal alkalines).Bottom line, you are getting a top quality alkaline battery; no, they still aren't "good" for the environment, but for the right applications they should last for many years (which IS good for the environment and your pocketbook!).

0:49 Mins This is an awesome little RC car!  Yes, it is not equivalent to the ones that are several hundred dollars at the hobby shops.  But it is fun, fast, includes everything you, need, and so far is VERY durable.The packaging looks nice; definitely would make a fantastic gift for any kid (or, err, some adults might actually have fun with these).  It comes with a 9V battery for the remote, a rechargeable battery pack, a plug-in wall charger, and of course the wireless remote and the car.The car is about a foot long and has "off road" style tires and suspension.  It works best indoors, but it also does fine in the dirt (not enough ground clearance for grass though).  The steering is incredibly precise; it even has fine adjustments with a "clicker" on the bottom of the car.  The suspension offers more than looks; when my one-eyed pug saw this thing racing around the house, he had to pounce (see video review).  Botton line, the car has held up admirably to an assault by a giant pug, so it should be fairly kid-proof (it has limits, but I'm sure if it gets dropped and played with it will keep going).In summary, this is a great little RC car; highly recommended!

I was incredibly fortunate to try out the product at no charge.In summary, it is awesome!  The "big" thing for me is the size; 64GB holds a nice amount of photos and videos (or whatever files you need to move around).I tested this thumb drive versus a "nameless" 4GB USB 2 drive I have from about 5 years ago.  I am using an old Dell Latitude laptop running Win 7 that has USB 2 connectors.  The new Samsung is USB 3, but since I don't have a USB 3 port I figured that the speed should be the same (limiting factor being my laptop).  The results of an identical file transfer of 500MB size:Nameless 4GB USB2 drive - 1:45Samsung 64GB USB3 drive - 0:23Yes, the Samsung was more than 3 times as fast.  I don't know why that is; perhaps the way the memory is addressed is somehow more efficient with the Samsung.  Regardless, even for those of us with older USB ports, this drive is an excellent performer.Finally, I like the look and metal construction; feels solid and industrial.Highly recommended!

Works great for my 15 foot Sea Doo jet boat.  The cover is a nice canvas style material; seems to be the right combination of thickness to hold up and keep out the rain, but just porous enough to allow moisture to evaporate.  Perfect if your boat will be sitting in the sun or outdoors for extended periods of time.There are about a dozen straps included; this seems like overkill, but they include enough (with fasteners that easily "click" into place on the cover) that you can wrap up the boat nice and tight, perfect if you need to tow.  And let me tell you, if you are new to boating and tow a boat in wet weather, expect the boat (interior and all) to be a huge mess when you get to the lake; a cover is really a necessity if you will be travelling with the boat (and also provides at least some level of security, especially for quick stops at convenience stores or places to eat.I will provide further updates if I experience any issues, but so far this seems to be an EXCELLENT cover; highly recommended!

These are some sweet grocery bags.I LOVE:- The look great!- Incredibly strong; you can load 'em up with heavy cans for example, and they will not break or rip.- Very easy to store in my car's side door pockets (no more rooting around the trunk for my traditional bags).I HATE:- Nothing to dislike; they are sized a little bit small, but that also helps keep them portable and easy to stow in my car's door pockets.In summary, these are some nice looking, portable, and durable bags; highly recommended!

This is an EXCELLENT wireless camera. I have seven cameras and five different brands, and this one ranks at the top of the list.PROS:- Great image quality. 720P sharpness, which is about as sharp as you can realistically expect (and higher resolution doesn't do much good, especially when live viewing over a cell network).- Easy setup. It was truly a breeze. Download the app, create an account (as simple as providing an email address and password), plug in the camera, enter your router's password into the app, and presto, the magic happens!- Good app. The app not only allows you to set everything up initially, but it great and fully functioned, AND they do not nickel and dime you by trying to sell you a full-featured app. Out of the box the app can send you notifications if motion is detected, you can pan and tilt with the live view, and you can record automatically if motion is detected. Plus the app worked great with no "fiddling" required (works on my LG G2 phone with Sprint 4G).- Camera is fully featured and well made. The camera has a micro SD slot so you can record directly to a memory card. It also has a speaker and microphone, so you can hear what is going on as well as speak (fun for messing with my pug dogs!). Oh yeah, it also includes a metal mounting bracket (the unit looks great on my tabletop, but nice to be able to mount it).CONS:- I have yet to find any flaws; I will post additional information if I run into any hiccups, but so far, so good!In summary, if you are new to the IP camera world and want one that is easy to setup and comes with everything you need to get up and running with nothing else to buy, this is the one to get!

I had the incredible opportunity to try out this product at no charge.In short, I love it!  The whole package is incredibly slick and obviously had plenty of input not only from engineers but from users.  This is basically the "Mac" of microphones; looks great ("cute"), and most importantly it accomplishes the primary mission of being a great microphone.PROS:- Packaging is possibly the best I have ever seen for a consumer product.  Seriously.  SPOILER: the mic comes in a little beehive.  The userguide is printed using hexagonal paper.  It is just plain fun unboxing this thing.- Construction is first rate.  The microphone feels like something made in the 1950s: sturdy metal is used here.  The mic looks like a piece of art.  The black finish feels more like a quality powder coating than paint.- The knobs are useful.  Microphone sound, microphone volume, and headphone volume are included.  You have a USB jack to connect to a PC or Mac, and a 1/8" headphone output.- Truly requires no drivers; plugged it into my Mac and Logic Pro immediately recognized it.  Nice.- The microphone quality sounds professional.  The "music" setting captures every crisp nuance, and the "voice" setting turns you into a podcaster in a snap!  The "normal" setting just captures sounds exactly as they are made with no "enhancements".  If you are an aspiring musician or an aspiring podcaster, this mic will fit your needs until you make it to the big leagues and record in a professional studio.  For me, it is just plain fun to use this thing.CONS:- The retail price isn't cheap (but you get what you pay for).- The knob positions are not readily visible (I'm reaching here, but you do have to rely on your ears to adjust this thing, not a big deal since audio is what this unit is all about).In summary, this is just a fun-tastic mic; highly recommended!

I am incredibly fortunately in being able to review this product.I recently shorted out my old late 90's Cobra radar detector (while trying to hard-wire it into my Subaru WRX's rear-view mirror power supply).  I decided to buy a cheapie $35 replacement Cobra detector.  Funny enough it is basically identical to the one I bought 17 years ago.  But it works fine.Well, I had the opportunity to try out this new "fancy" model, loaded with bells and whistles.  I'm not at an age where bells and whistles do not easily impress me, so I was skeptical on what this unit could really deliver (and let's face it, at a cost of around 10 times their low-end detectors).In short, I am completely WOWED by what Cobra has produced.  Here is what I like:- By far fewer false alarms.  When this baby goes off, there is a pretty good chance there is a cop nearby.  It isn't perfect, but I would say it produces fewer than half of the false alarms as my other detector.  Bells and whistles aside, this is my favorite thing about this unit.- Truly leverages your smartphone and confirmed radar gun sightings from other users.  There is a little button that you can click if you spot a "for real" radar gun, that gets uploaded to Cobra's servers, and then gets distributed to everyone who is running these units.  The radar detector then warns you when you get close, regardless if any signals are being detected (which helps prevent the instant-on situations).- Nice display screen.  My other detector just has the LED lights that can be confusing.  This one has a nice screen similar to what you would see on a cell phone (it isn't a touch screen, but is a nice lit LCD screen that tells you what is going on).- Nice sounds.  My old detector had too many literal bells and whistles; you all know the beeps, they get old and you start tuning them out.  This detector has nice voices that announce when you change from city to highway mode, etc.  Much more pleasing to passengers and easier to interpret for drivers.- Compact size.  My other detector is small, but this one is even smaller (I would say about a third smaller than most detectors out there).- Power cable included.  Everything you need is in the package, including a car plug cable that has a convenient additional USB slot (nice!).- App is easy to download and get started using.  It was free and easy to download the app; in about one minute I was registered and connected.  The app also shows useful information on a map such as speed traps, traffic lights that ticket you for running red lights, etc.This detector is not just a fun gadget; it really works.  If I had to estimate how much my older detector helps prevents tickets, I would say it decreases my odds by roughly half.  It isn't perfect, but provides a decent warning about half the time.  Well, this new detector probably cuts that in half again.  I would say about 3/4 of the time this thing could save you from getting a ticket.  Of course if you speed all over the place or drive a "cop magnet" like I do (WRX), then nothing can prevent you from getting tickets sooner or later; nothing will ever be perfect.  But this unit is a revolution in radar detection that is more significant than anything since detectors first hit the market.  The only downsides are expense, and that for you to get information "real time" about radar guns other users are seeing, those users must also be connected and willing to click the "report" button to show that a radar gun is really in the area.  I have always been a guy who flashes lights to warn oncoming traffic of a cop, so I hope this will catch on and more drivers will help each other out.  Last comment, please drive responsibly; use this as a tool to protect yourself, but don't use it to drive like a demon and endanger the lives of others (I used to drive like a moron and I'm ashamed of it).In summary, if you can afford it, highly recommended!

For this amateur or aspiring pro musician, this microphone offers truly excellent pro quality.  It is heavy (not too heavy though), feels very well constructed, has the XLR connector, and has a microphone stand sleeve / clip.  It also includes a case, and is well packaged in protective foam.  This mic is a significant step up from the "prosumer" level mics that you will find at your local electronics store.  I have a $200 condenser microphone (which requires the additional power source, etc), and I can hardly tell any difference between the sound quality.  For the vast majority of uses, in my case vocals or acoustic guitar, this mic performs wonderfully; very highly recommended!

This is just a fantastic looking watch!  It has a classic stainless finish that will be popular probably in hundreds of years; this is a watch I will keep for a lifetime.  The construction is heavy and solid.  The band is metal, and does require the little pins to be removed to adjust (one-time "setup").  Not too hard, but does take some time and patience (or take to any jewelry store and they'll probably adjust it for $5 or less).  The watch face size is perfect for me; not too big, not too small.  The time was set at the factory, and was exactly correct when I opened the box, so I do not see this watch needing much if any adjusting during normal operations.  Bottom line, this is an excellent looking and appears to be a high quality watch; very highly recommended!

This is an excellent fitness tracker!  I have used the classic Fitbit band for years, then I used a Pebble watch, and now have tried the UP2.PROS:- Looks great.  This is not a plain rubber band that goes on your wrist; it looks decorative enough that it could almost be a bracelet.- Comfortable.  Feels much better than the classic rubber material bands on the Fitbit (and even more comfortable than the Pebble watch).- Great app and easy setup.  The software (which is equally as important as the hardware) is excellent.  Setup is a breeze, and the app works great right off the bat.  I would give a very slight nod to Fitbit as far as the functionality and ease of use of their "ecosystem" goes (apps, web tools, etc).- Battery life is long.  Fitbit required me to charge it twice a week, and this lasts a full week.- A healthy ecosystem of accessories is available, including a scale (I have a Fitbit scale which I love that is not compatible with this, but you can buy Jawbone compatible scales that should work nicely).CONS:- Not a watch (same complaint as my original Fitbit, and what lead me to go with the Pebble).- For the money, no other complaints!Note that my Pebble watch offers fitness tracking that works with the Jawbone system, plus of course it has a screen and many other functions.  However, the Pebble just makes for an "ok" fitness tracker; results are inconsistent, connecting can be a nightmare, and it locks you in to not wearing other watches (where a dedicated fitness band is expected to be combined with wearing a watch, and I like to wear different watches).In summary, I highly recommend the UP2 fitness tracker!

I am a videogame nut, but lean much more towards the retro side, and I love the history of videogaming in particular.  This is an excellent addition to my gaming book library; while there are plenty of titles (almost all which I have) dedicated to 80s and 90s gaming, this one primarily addresses games from the early 2000's and on, and it mostly explores the artistic aspects.  There are 40 videogames profiled, and most of those tend to be Japanese based (but all released in the US; you just will not find many "western" developed games here).The printing is on nice heavy glossy paper, and the colors of the artwork pop on every page.  The book is hardcover, and is truly a coffee-table quality that any gamer would be proud to show off.While I am drawn to older more "traditional" games, I found myself quickly engrossed and amazed at the artistic range demonstrated in this book.  There are true artists that show their work through videogames, and even non-gamers can appreciate the incredible talents that those who worked on these games have.  Bottom line, this is a gorgeous book to flip through, with every page flip revealing dynamic magical worlds.In summary, this is a highly recommended book if you are interested in the artistic side of gaming from around 2000 and beyond.

This is an incredibly nice watch; I LOVE it and have received numerous compliments on it, even after wearing it for just a few days!The construction is heavy and solid.  Time will tell the tale, but this feels like a watch that will last a lifetime or more if cared for properly.  The band is metal, and does require the little pins to be removed to adjust (one-time "setup").The face of the watch has the main dial, and then three (not two) smaller dials.  The third dial (hard to see because it does not have the same black background) is the second hand for the chronograph.  But in person you can see it just fine; I really like the design.  Also note that the watch face size is perfect for me; not too big, not too small.Bottom line, this is an excellent looking watch; very highly recommended!

This is a great camera; I have tried numerous ones over the years, and this one definitely takes the cake as being the most solid, having the best image, and easiest to setup.The construction feels heavy and solid; this is not a toy.  It has a flat black finish, and looks great.Setup was a breeze; I did not need to hack my network or anything, just followed the instructions, installed an app, and was up and running in 5 minutes.The free app works well with my LG G2.  The camera pans and tilts nicely.  The image is super clear, and it works well on my cell phone (4G signal).My only minor gripe is that the camera is not listed on the "IP Cam Viewer" app that I use for all of my other cameras; I imagine it will be added at some point, but for now I'm stuck using two different apps for all of my cameras.  Of course if you are starting from scratch and you have multiple cameras of the same brand, you can use the Amcrest app to manage all of the cameras.In summary, this is a great camera, highly recommended!

These are exceptional headphones; the sound is quite crisp, and frequency range is wide (including nice low frequency response / bass).  I am a bit of an audio snob, and these are more than adequate for my needs.  The microphone also works nicely.  No complaints; highly recommended!

This is an incredible device (well, when used with a smartphone).  I have an LG G2 Android phone, and it works great for this application.The instructions are easy to follow; basically just unfold the box, slip in your phone, and you are good to go (once you figure out how to install the software, that is; start by downloading the Google Cardboard app, and then you can also find other VR apps).I am completely impressed by how well this thing works; it is much better than any other VR devices I have tried (which admittedly are mostly 90s relics).  In summary, if you are looking for some amazing and inexpensive entertainment, look no further; the future is here!

I have the large sized bed; my two pugs love it!  It is perfect sized to fit both of them (both around 20 pounds).  The bonus pillow is also fun; the pugs enjoy that as well.The construction is excellent; this is well-sewn, well-made bed.  Time will tell the tale, but after a couple of weeks of solid use it has performed admirably.  I wouldn't be surprised if the bed lasted several years.Much to my surprise, the bed cover IS indeed removable; there are zippers hidden on the inside part of the bed.  So fear not, if you have dirty beasts you can easily remove the cover and wash it!  Note - my apologies for my initial incorrect review where I did not realize the cover is removable.  Rest assured, they thought of that feature.I can't imagine having a better dog bed; very highly recommended!

DISCLAIMER: I had the opportunity to review this product at no cost in exchange for an honest review.UPDATE: these photos were taken 8 days apart.... sorry for sideways orientation but Amazon upload forces that.  But as you can say, in 8 days I already have a fairly dense and green lawn!First of all, let me state my location: the hot and dry climate of Austin, Texas.  While the local "big box" stores sell the product, it is not officially recommended for my climate.  I actually have quite a history with the product and have used it for a couple of years, with different applications in mind (and different results).  I quite successfully grew seeds in a purely dirt area, I have successfully filled in "gaps" in my grass, and I have unsuccessfully tried to fill in large thin areas of grass.KEY POINTS:- Scotts has a quality product, and quality seeds in my opinion.  There really isn't anything else they can do to make the product "better" (without doing some silly packaging gimmicks, which thank goodness they have not).- These seeds will absolutely grow IN THE RIGHT CONDITIONS.  The right conditions are not just "sprinkle the seed, grab a chair, and watch the grass grow"- You MUST adequately prepare the area.  You need loose dirt to begin with, you need to put the seed down, and then you have to rake in the seeds and really get them in the ground.  You will NOT be successful just sprinkling the seeds on top of bare ground.- You MUST adequately water these seeds.  A bunch.  Every day.  If they get a good soaking, in a couple of weeks you'll start seeing blades, and in a month or two you'll really see nice results.  Even after the seeds become grass, if you stop watering the grass, the blades will die.- You MUST plant in an area that is appropriate; full sun will cook this grass (at least in Texas) and it will die.  On the flip side, you cannot plant the grass in an area with zero sun; nothing will grow in a cave (well, cave crickets, but you know what I'm saying).- Expect to have to fill in spotty areas; even with my successes, the initial version of the grass has been spotty (think mangy dog).  You will have to go back and fill in areas (and again, be prepared to use a rake to get the seeds in the ground, water the heck out of the seeds daily, etc.).- Be gentle with the grass; the first time I mowed my "new" grass, the mower wheels ripped up some areas.  These grass is just a bit more delicate than other grasses, so go easy on it.In summary, if you treat these seeds right, you will be rewarded with some nice grass, but don't expect magic; growing anything takes work.  Thanks for reading!

DISCLAIMER: I had the opportunity to try this product at no charge.I will get right to the point: these razors work great.  At a price point of about $1 each, that falls somewhere between the low and high end of the shaving world.  The cheapie razors are utter garbage; I have tried them all, and wound up gravitating back to Bic's higher end offerings.  These razors so far have held up admirably to multiple uses, and feel 90% as good as the most expensive razors out there (and 100% better than the cheap ones!).  Bottom line, Bic's semi-budget offering offers no frills but clean shaves; highly recommended!

I was quite fortunate to be able to review this product at no cost in exchange for an honest review.To get to the point, I would call this an attempt to make more money using the Monopoly name, but poorly executed.  We love travel and my son loves Monopoly, so we thought Monopoly World Edition would be a fun twist on regular Monopoly.  This could be a good game, if they hadnt tried to sell it as a Monopoly version.  The main premise is that you travel around the board collecting passport stamps and when your passport book is full, you win.  However, other players can steal your stamps.  In real life, you get a stamp by going someplace and it is stamped in your passport, others cant steal it from you, this is a strange quirk and a not very thought out aspect of the game.  A better choice would have been to have souvenirs from the place you visit and you win by collecting a certain number of souvenirs.  It would make so much more sense to trade or steal souvenirs than passport stamps.  We also thought that the kids would learn something from this game, but the cards are so generic, you dont learn anything about the world or the places you visit on the board.If you want a really quick game (our games were under 30 minutes each) and to teach your kid how to move a piece around the board, you might enjoy it.  If you are looking for a real Monopoly experience but want to try a different version, I recommend Monopoly City.  For my family, this just is not a great game and will likely collect dust until our year 2023 garage sale.  Others obviously enjoy the game, so best of luck, and thanks for reading!

These feel like very high quality (think Ray Bans or better) sunglasses at a price that doesn't break the bank.  They are very slightly heavy compared to cheapie ones you might find on a convenience store rack.  But they look great.  The tinting looks great from both sides of the lens.  So far after a week's use (including a drop or two, some cleanings, and general use) it looks perfectly brand new, so it does not appear that the tint will wear on the lenses that you normally see with budget priced sunglasses.  The case is a nice touch and will keep the sunglasses nice if stored in a car / boat / purse / etc.  Overall these are some nice sunglasses - highly recommended!

I was very fortunate to get to review thisitem at no charge in exchange for an honest review.In summary: meh, not the greatest thing since sliced bread.OK - the good:- LOOKS great; fancy, stainless, wow!- Includes lots of accessories including a recipe bookThe bad:- Hard to use; confusing, leaves you trying to read the manual to figure out- Relies too much on digital controls (was wishing for some old-fashioned knobs)- Will not replace your crock pot- Recipe book was impossible to follow and has some inaccuracies (was obviously translated with only so-so results)- Difficult to cleanBottom line, I will be sticking with my regular pots and pans (and crock pot in some cases).  I really wanted to love it, but I don't.  If you have every kitchen gadget in the world and want to try something new, sure, give it a try. But don't count on it to magically save time or replace what you currently have.

This is a fascinating light bulb that uses LED technology to recreate an "old time" style light.  It is incredibly bright and fairly large (a bit larger than standard bulbs).  If you are looking for a unique looking bulb, look no further!

This is a GREAT flashlight.  It is metal and feels well-built.  Rechargeable batteries are included.The BEST thing is that it DOES seem to be waterproof.  I dove down to about 20 feet underneath my boat, and not a drop entered the flashlight.  Bottom line, for the price this is an EXCELLENT and brilliant flashlight!

I was fortunate enough to get to try it at no charge in exchange for an honest review.In short, this is an accessory I never knew that I needed!  I do NOT have a GoPro, but I do have a waterproof point and shoot camera with standard tripod threads, and this screwed right into it.  I LOVE being able to comfortably hold this with my wrist; I can take much steadier shots and the tips of my fingers stay out of the frame.  Bottom line, if you have a GoPro or just want to try a different mount for your camera (any that accept standard tripod threads), I highly recommend this product!

I was lucky enough to get to review this product at no charge.The image is bright when viewed in a very dark location using a screen area of about 60" or less; however, note that this is rated at 120 lumens of brightness.  That is only about 5% of what most projectors are rated, so you cannot expect it to really compare well head-to-head.  The unit is small and looks nice.  The sales price is VERY inexpensive for what you get (this would have been a $1000 projector a few years back).  The lamp life is rated at 20,000 hours, which is probably TEN times better than a conventional bulb projector.  Unfortunately there are no buttons to change inputs on the unit; you have to use the remote.  Well, I fired up the projector, hooked up my DVD player to it via HDMI, put in new batteries in the remote, and ... couldn't change inputs.  I tried three different sets of batteries before giving up; mine shipped with a completely dead remote, and unfortunately I have not been able to obtain a working one so I can thoroughly review the unit.  The other reviews are overwhelmingly positive, and I'm guessing I was the "lucky" one to get a dud.  But unfortunately a dead remote knocks off a couple of stars.UPDATE - I decided to give the remote another fresh try, and the original one DOES indeed work.  Perhaps I didn't try it correctly to begin with; the sensor is on the back of the unit; I tried it from all angles, but must not have tried hard enough.  Plus the remote responsiveness seems slow (but is acceptable, because changing inputs is mostly a one-time thing, plus there IS a dedicated on and off button on the unit).So I did get to give the projector a legitimate try since I could change inputs, and I walked away a little disappointed.  I'm showing an image in my review that was taken during the day on my kitchen wall.  The image is dim, and at night would definitely be better, but nowhere close to a "real' projector (even another 10 year old Dell projector I have beats the pants off this one, and you can buy that used projector for about the same price).  But the worst part is the entire screen would not focus at once; if you make the image crisp in the middle, the edges go blurry (and vice versa).  You can see this to some degree in the photo I attached with the review (my apologies on the sideways orientation of the photo; cannot rotate it correctly in Amazon).  Bottom line, and to be fair I am something of an audio video snob, this unit will not really cut the mustard for me to watch movies.  For some it may be fine (for example, kids watching a late night movie outdoors).FINAL UPDATE - the customer service has been very responsive, which bumps this up another star.  I truly believe I got a bit of a "dud" and that the majority of users will be happy with the product given the price.

I was incredibly fortunate enough to be able to try out a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.  My review does not take into account the price point of this product (which I am certain is the opposite of "cheap").My first impression of this rolling travel bag is that it is unbelievably light.  I have been travelling for years and used a variety of bags, but for the size this one takes the cake for being light.  Which should not be confused with not being well-made; the seams, construction, zippers, handle, and wheels (4 wheels so the bag can roll without having to tilt) all seem first-rate; all mechanical functions are "buttery" smooth.  There are a number of compartments that should satisfy even the most demanding of travel pros; this is truly and excellent carry-on size bag that is great if you want to avoid checking luggage, and it is sized to accommodate international baggage size limit standards.Lastly (but not least in my wife's opinion), the bag looks wonderful.  It screams "I'm a travel pro" and is something that anyone could be proud of when rolling up to the airport, or to stow away in a day meeting where you have to catch a late flight.  Bottom line, if you are a frequent traveler or if you just simply want the best bag that I am aware of to travel, this is the one; highly recommended!

I was fortunate enough to receive the watch in exchange for an honest review.In short, I love it!  Note that the face IS indeed huge.  The band is also fairly large and wide; quite frankly, this watch will work best for larger males (I am very tall and could stand to lose a few pounds, and even I feel like the watch makes my wrists look small!).The color is a light slate grey; just gorgeous.  So far the face seems to be a good quality crystal that is scratch resistant; will update the review if I get any fine scratches, but none so far.The controls are on the left side.  This is my first watch with this configuration; I wear the watch on my left wrist and find the controls much easier to operate using my thumb.In summary, this is a large, fairly heavy watch that looks and feels expensive.  I collect lower priced watches (up to about $400 range), and this one is probably the nicest one in my collection.  Highly recommended!

For this amateur musician, these microphones offer truly excellent pro quality.  They are a significant step up from the "prosumer" level mics that you will find at your local electronics store, yet are offered at a price point where you can set up your entire band or have extras for the home studio artist.  I have a $200 condenser microphone (which requires the additional power source, etc), and I can hardly tell any difference between the sound quality (and these D38 mics actually sound a little bit warmer; which I prefer).  Also, I have tested recording an acoustic guitar, and again the mic performed admirably and revealed an incredibly accurate recording of my strumming (warts and all).  They are a bit heavy, and have a very high-quality feel; these will not be confused with toys or cheapie mics.  They come in a nice hard plastic case, so if you will be transporting them that will offer plenty of protection.  For the vast majority of uses, these mics will perform great, and for the money will be tough to impossible to beat; very highly recommended!

This is an excellent HDMI cable!  The cable works great (as any new HDMI cable should).  However, the real benefit of this cable is that it is a flat (rather than round) design.  I use it to squeeze through a flat opening in my entertainment center than has historically pinched standard round cables until they stop working.  So far so good with the cable; there is no pressure now on the cable, so I forsee the cable lasting for good with my current application.  Oh yeah, the cable looks really sharp as well!  In summary, highly recommended!

These are some great batteries for the money.  Note that they are only rated for 1000mAh hours, which is fairly low compared to other AAs.  I did a flashlight test with these paired up against the Amazon Basics AAs rated at 1900mAh hours, and sure enough the results were almost identical; both powered identical LED flashlights for about 6 hours (at the end the Amazon Basics were very slightly brighter, but almost no difference).  These batteries should be great for applications that do not have high drain (remote controls, wireless thermometers, etc).  In summary, for the price, highly recommended; they seem to actually be better than the advertised rating.

The NB Vazee running shoes are awesome!  I am a heavier runner (close to 200 pounds), and have found these to be great for speedwork training on a track, or for running short races (5Ks to 10Ks).  I have had problems over the years with sinus tarsi syndrome and plantar fasciitis, and have had zero issues with these shoes.  The size is spot on; when wearing Asics I usually go an extra width, but these in D width seem to fit just fine with zero rubbing.The shoes are the lightest I have ever worn (outside of track spike shoes).  It almost feels like you are wearing nothing, except there is sufficient cushioning (much more than you will find in a minimalist type shoe).  For long-distance training or races I am still using heavier shoes with more cushioning.Bottom line, these are some great shoes - highly recommended!

These are fairly standard boat bumpers; they work great for my application (2012 15' Sea Doo Speedster boat).  I keep these stowed in the ski locker, and when docking I put two on the side facing the dock.  The "hinged" design allows it to fold to meet the rounded contour of my hull, and does a great job of protecting the boat.  Ropes are included.  If you have a nice boat and want to protect it, this is a must-have; highly recommended!

This is an excellent set of five stainless steel measuring cups, ranging from a small 1/8 cup to a full cup.  They have a nonslip grip that also insulates you from heat; this is a simple but very nice design.  Appearance and build is similar to what I would expect from any high-end manufacturer (Kitchen Aid or better).With the stainless construction, I would expect to be using these for the rest of my life (they do come with a lifetime guarantee).  If you are looking for a nice set of measuring cups for you or as a gift (showers, etc), this is a premium set at a reasonable price.  Highly recommended!UPDATE:  After a couple of weeks of use and washing, still love 'em!  Also, another reviewer was WRONG, these definitely CAN be detached from the clip ring (hard to see, but the clip ring CAN be "split" to allow removal of the cups).

If you like to play the game "stare at the sun", look no further!Seriously, this baby pumps out some of the brightest light outside of a full-size multi-million-candlepower floodlight that I have ever seen.  There are THREE lights for full coverage, which also allows for plenty of options for lighting strength.This is a headlight, and it fits my large head quite comfortably.  It is fully adjustable, and should fit anyone from child size up through large adult.Also included are the batteries and charger; the batteries alone can be quite pricey, so it is nice that these excellent high-power batteries are included with the kit.In summary, VERY highly recommended!

This book reminds me of why I read books.  This is a well-written and completely engrossing story about friendship and adversity.  The book is a reminder of the struggles and sacrifices that previous generations endured for the benefit of those who enjoy our freedoms today.  I wouldn't be surprised if this deservingly becomes a hit movie; regardless, if you enjoy amazing history, then give this amazing book a try.  This outstanding work comes highly recommended!UPDATE: This is the first time I have ever come back to update a review on book.  Why on earth would I do that?  Well, the book has stuck with me.  I think of it daily; that seems crazy, but that is the case.  I think of the sacrifices that these guys in the book made (especially what the Marines went through in those beyond horrible conditions in Korea), and I think of the men and women throughout our military that continue to make sacrifices in many ways that allows the US to still be the best country in the world.  There are sections in the book that literally drove me to tears, which is fairly unusual for my personality.  A great book really imparts a sense of learning and understanding, and this book accomplished that many times over.  I also happen to be a writer (with zero association of the writer of this book or the publisher), but I can honestly state that if you only buy and read ONE book this year, make it this one.  It is that good, it is that amazing, and it is that important, at least in my opinion.

This is a solid fireplace key that looks great and is inexpensive.  Note that it fits the 1/4 inch size valves; some fireplace feeds use the slightly larger 5/16 inch size (and if you are unsure, you might want to buy the universal model that fits both).  If you are looking for a nice basic fireplace key for the 1/4 inch valve, look no further, highly recommended!

This is an EXCELLENT and inexpensive mouse.  I am using it with an older MacBook (OSX 10.6), and it works perfectly.Cleverly "built in" the mouse is a tiny USB plug.  I plugged it in, put in batteries, and was instantly using the mouse (wasn't even prompted to install anything).  The mouse has three "modes":  on with light, on without light, and off.  I use the on without light setting, and it works great.  I have been using it for several weeks now, constantly in the on position, and it has had no issues with needing batteries (I do use AAA rechargeables).The ergonomics are fairly standard but work great; I have larger hands and have no issues with the mouse.  The resolution feels great as well; I'm constantly using it to do audio editing on a small laptop screen, and the movement works perfectly.In summary, highly recommended!

This is a short story that is well worth the read.  It reminds me of some of my favorite short stories found in the Stephen King collections; short, sweet, immediately captures your imagination, and has an unpredictable outcome that sticks with you.  Dark, yet fun.  My only "complaint" is that it is short; I could see this concept being developed into a full-length novel, or even a series of books.  If you are looking for a quick diversion and creepy tale, I highly recommend giving this a read!

I received the product at no charge in exchange for an honest review.This is an EXCELLENT little container. It is the approximately size of a standard water bottle, except that it rolls up. The material is rubbery, so it is not very firm (but it stands up on it's own just fine). Storage capacity is 18.9 ounces (so somewhere between your standard 16 ounce and 20 ounce plastic bottles you commonly see). This is a great bottle for backpacking or hiking (where you have your own water filter but don't need to pack in all of your own water). I also plan on taking it on road trips as a spare container for water for my dog.In summary, this is a great and well executed idea - highly recommended!

This is a massive charging device that charges the 3.7V gigantic rechargeable batteries (that look like AA batteries in a photo, but in person are double the physical size of AAs).  There is a 3-level LED indicator above each battery slot that shows how much of the battery is charged.  This is truly an industrial strength charger - well made!

I received these batteries to test for free in exchange for an honest review.  One to the review ...UPDATE:  OK, I procured a flashlight that these are designed to work in (SecurityIng 700 Lumens Cree XM-L2 LED Flashlight), which accepts either two CR123 batteries or one of these baby's (the 18650).Well, the 18650 performs admirably and provides several hours of intensely blinding brightness; they last MUCH longer than a flashlight I have that is about half the brightness and uses AA batteries.  If you want what I consider to be an industrial strength rechargeable battery, just be sure this will work in your application (again, some flashlights but NOT all that take CR123 batteries can use this), and these babies won't let you down!............. original review:PLEASE READ - Don't be an idiot like me - these batteries are not AA batteries.  I feel completely stupid for thinking so, but based on the picture I made the wrong conclusion.  These look exactly like AA batteries but are double the physical size.One of these batteries I believe are intended to fit in place of two CR123 flashlight batteries (commonly used on higher quality LED flashlights).  The size is very close to one that I have, but this battery did not quite fit (I might have been able to force it in the tube, but did not want it to get permanently stuck).  I have a couple of flashlights on order, so I will be using and testing these batteries with that application.Note that a special charger is also necessary (will NOT work with most normal chargers that are geared for C, D, AA, and AAA batteries).Seems like a solid product, but take my review with a grain of salt at this point since I was unable to test in a flashlight application.

First of all, let me state that I received this product at no charge in exchange for an honest review.  On to the review...This is an EXCELLENT little 64GB USB drive.  It works just like any other USB thumb drive I have ever used, EXCEPT that it has both normal size and mini USB plugs (one on each end).I tested it on a variety of machines, with reading and writing files to and from:- Windows 7 Dell laptop- Windows 8 tablet (Dell)- Android phone (LG running 4.3)Long story short, I had ZERO issues using this device with any of these devices.  The 64GB size is large enough to handle an entire music library (a gigantic one), or tons of photos and movies.  You could easily use this to transfer pictures and videos from your phone to your computer, for example.In summary, this is a great tool to add to my techie toolbox.  VERY highly recommended!

First of all, let me state that I am reviewing a free copy of the book, but I have zero ties to the author, and am providing a completely unbiased review.This was an entirely enjoyable and surprisingly outstanding book that encompasses multiple facets, most which completely hit "home" with me.First of all, the author is a brilliant writer.  I flew through reading this book, and that is rare for me.  As a child of the 80s and as an adult who is searching for more (and trying to fill some gaps in my youth where I was extremely athletically challenged), I couldn't have enjoyed the book more.Reading the book has inspired me to commit to my own quest to win the master's division in a 10K foot race ("old folks" 40 years of age or older) that is sponsored by the author's own newspaper, the Austin American Statesman.  My odds are slim, but I believe it is technically possible, and I intend to enjoy the journey in reaching the starting line next April 10th.  Not that anyone will gave a rat's behind, but I will update my review with my success or failure.Can't remember the last time a book truly inspired and entertained me like this one.  Well done sir, bravo, highly recommended, A+!

I am truly an independent (when it comes to voting or all other matters).  I am fiscally conservative and socially progressive (which seems to account for most of America, but few politicians truly embrace these two basic concepts).This book does shed lots of interesting light on the business of outrage.  The writing is extremely current and relevant to topics in the news today (and broaches topics as recent as the end of 2014).  The observations are interesting, but quite frankly most of the points mentioned in the book I was already aware of, at least to some degree.  But for those who lean extremely left or right and blindly defend a certain network (be it CNN, Fox, etc), then I would highly recommend this book.In summary, this is a thought-provoking and surprisingly balanced perspective of the climate we live in today.

First of all, I received the product at no charge in exchange for an honest review.Now to the good stuff - these are a great set of headphones!  I am fairly well qualified to judge; as a hobby I create and product music (including remixes), and I have used a wide range of headphone products (cheap to very pricey).SOUND - A.  Most important to me is the sound quality.  These are the best sounding non-wired headphones I have experienced.  Light years ahead of some wireless Sennheisers I used to use that were a couple of hundred bucks.  While I do not plan on using these to talk on the phone, a brief test showed that they picked up my voice with about the same sound quality as my cell phone.ERGONOMICS - A+.  These fit great, and have plenty of adjustability.  The top extends like most headphones, but the ears swivel (which is very unusual and welcomed).  Also, the ears are at an angle that fit my head perfectly.  These are incredibly comfortable, and would be suitable for a long-haul flight, for example.  The control buttons are located on the headphones for skipping around tracks and volume, and are easily accessible.SETUP / ELECTRONICS - A.  Thorough instructions are included.  Setup was easy on my Windows 8 tablet; the device shows up as "A1" and the password is "0000".  Range is about 30 feet from your Bluetooth transmitting device.  At first I was confused in not seeing blinking LED indicators, and then I realized that they are "inside" one of the earphones (and quite visible once you look).OVERALL - A+.  These are solid, sound great, and are affordably priced.  Highly recommended!

These made for some great 70's style glasses (not "cool" glasses, but normal glasses that real people wore back then).  They look fine and are constructed well enough that they can easily endure an evening of costume partying.

For the money I didn't expect much, and my expectations were not met.  I knew that the wig was not included; only sideburns, mustache, and chest hair are included.  Well, the mustache and sideburns are GIGANTIC sized and would never fit on a normal human, plus the material is basically a super cheap felt.  There are tape strips that my wife and I spent about 30 minutes trying to peel; we never succeeded, and in desperation finally fell back to using spirit gum as an adhesive.  We also had to use scissors to cut the pieces down, which looked terrible.The reason this gets 2 stars instead of 1 is the "chest hair".  That was awesome.  Yes, it also had the same defective sticky tape strips, but once I completely removed those and used spirit gum, I sported a nice thick chest pelt that got rave reviews.In summary, buy this ONLY for the chest hair, and be sure to order spirit gum with it.

First of all, I had the opportunity to review this product at no charge.If you are looking for a "second skin" type of product (yeah SUPER creepy, I know), then you have found the right one!  I am 6'2" and about 210 pounds (all flab and bone).  I ordered the XXL size, and it fits perfectly (tight but not restrictive).  As far as fit and comfort goes, I couldn't be happier.The quality of the material and sewing seems to be top notch.  There is a zipper that extends from the back of the head to the lower part of the back (you need help to get it zipped up completely).  This out fit could be used for professional productions / plays / projects (my plans basically consist of using this to scare my wife and nephews).Now let me tell you, it hugs the body and show all, just like a second skin.  And I mean everything.  As in guys, you might want to slip on a pair of shorts.The one area that was a bit strange to me is how poor the visibility is; the visibility is about 20% of what you normally see, so it is barely enough to be able to function (you certainly couldn't drive while wearing one of these; reading a book would be possible but very difficult ... not that these are advertised as "second skin ... for book lovers!").In summary, this is a well crafted "second skin"; highly recommended!

I just purchased these for my 2013 Gibson Les Paul Standard with chrome hardware.  These match the hardware fantastically!  And did not require any alterations to my guitar (I can easily go back to stock if I ever wanted).  They are Schaller, so you know the reputation they carry with professional musicians.  Let me tell you, these are solid.  The button rests in the cradle side of the lock, with a spring loaded pin that inserts into the button and keeps it in the cradle.  Installation is very easy, as all you need is a screw driver to set the buttons on the guitar.  It comes with a couple of different length screws.  Just pick the length closest to whatever you just removed!  You'll need a couple of wrenches to install the lock on the strap.  Make sure the hole in your strap is large enough to let the lock stay flat (usually just needs some very minor trimming).  Be careful grabbing the cradle when torquing the nut onto the lock, if you use a wrench, make sure its flat against the base or you could potentially bend the metal of the cradle.My favorite part is the compatibility with all my guitars.  I now have these on my 2001 Gibson ES-335, 1995 Fender American Standard (it is compatible with the Fender branded locks) and my Epiphone Jazz bass from 1986.  And one strap to rule them all!  (OK, I have 2 straps...)  Dunlop is another good brand, but I honestly have never tried them, there has never been a need!5 stars!

I've been thru glad bags, and all the others for my simplehuman trash can.  This is by far my favorite liner.  They have never torn on me and do a great job keeping smells where they belong!  I particularly endorse the 3pk set as it is the most economical set to buy without getting a ridiculous amount of garbage bags.  This lasts me about a year, so I'm happy with making that amount of purchase at one time.5 stars!

I am not a luthier, so I've spent quite a bit of money on having simple setups done.  Now that I own 3 guitars (Stratocaster, Les Paul and ES-335), I figured it's time I learned how to do some of the basic stuff.  The word truss rod used to scare me, but after finishing a satisfying basic setup on my stratocaster with a tricky tremolo, not anymore!To do this properly, you will need some good basic tools and this guage takes care of most of the precision measurement you'll need.  Here is a list of other tools you'll need:-Truss rod tool (look in your case candy if you have a Gibson, and American Fenders use a 1/8" hex key, MIM use 3/16" hex)-0.050" or 1.3mm hex key for setting saddle height/action on a Fender stratocaster American standard-Philips head screwdriver to set the bridge intonation (both fender and Gibson)-a capo for holding down the first fretI found the specs for my guitars online (I would start with the manufacturer website), even some helpful youtube videos to help me thru my first attempt.  I setup each of my guitars and I was really happy with the results.  You can immediately tell this is a high quality guage.  It is made of fairly high guage steel.  The markings are engraved rather than painted on.  In addition to the fine measurement edges, the instrument has a clever fret height guage, fret rocker for locating high frets and a handy units conversion table on the back. Excellent!  I did notice that the fret rocker (3 sides of varying length) is a bit long for higher frets.5 stars!  Well worth the cost!

I'm a big fan of Engineer brand tools.  For basic wire stripping, cutting and crimping, this is a fine tool.  It's made in Japan so you know it's good quality.  I've used alot of individual hand tools that have been better than this one for for a 1 size fits all type tool, this does very well.  It regularly keep it in my tool bag and is one of my go-to tools for wire work.5 stars.  Great tool!

These Hozan diagonal cutters are amazing.  You can cut ridiculously close to a surface with these.  Probably my favorite wire cutters in my tool bag!  I've had them now for 7 years.  They are an integral part of my daily tool kit!  These are made in Japan, and the quality shows!5 stars!

I've had these pliers for 7 years now.  I got them in Japan.  They are definitely an integral part of my tool kit.  Not one of those tools you buy and use once but I mean use frequently.  They've developed a bit of surface rust but still cut clean and pivot totally smoothly.  I use them to grip and twist things as well as side cut things like wires or tie wraps.5 stars!  A great tool!
