The only thing noticed was that my leg strains weren't quite as bad after taking it a few days. Overall, Varidux is an okay product.Note: I would like to point out that the capsules have Gelatin in them.

I received several different dietary supplements over the summer to test out and review on here. Out of the ones I received, the EstroVoid is by far my favorite from the bunch. It's meant to block estrogen from a man's body and help increase testosterone levels. It can also reduce recover time after a workout as well as give you a boost in the bedroom.Overall, the EstroVoid isn't a bad supplement. I've seen a decrease in body fat, especially around my chest and arms, while I've been taking this.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I received a complimentary sample bottle in exchange for my honest thoughts awhile back and I just forgot to write a review for it! Well, that is until now!I was sick a few weeks ago with the flu and during that time I started taking the Probiotic daily to give my digestive track a boost. To be honest, I was having digestive problems prior to getting sick. While I'm not 100% cured, I have felt better taking this supplement.

The Dental Tartar Scraper and Remover Set is very sturdy and is very easy to use. Just use the dental mouth mirror to look for any tarter and plaque on your teeth use the pick or scaling tools to remove clean everything up. If you see any possible cavities, then make an appoint with your dentist. Overall, I'm impressed with the the Dental Tartar Scraper and Remover Set and I recommend it to others.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I received the dietary supplement awhile back with a few other supplements to review. After taking it I wasn't hungry for breakfast or lunch, but by mid-afternoon I did have some cravings as well as around 10 o'clock at night. Overall, I the Eatmor is just alright. Maybe somebody else will have better luck with it than I did.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

About a month ago, I was sent the Smart Water Flosser by GREENCO to test out and review. The oral irrigator puts out a powerful jet of water that rinses between your teeth, gums, braces, implants and bridgework.If you've been to the dentist, you might recall the dental assistant blasting a bunch of water into your mouth to clean everything. Well, the Smart Water Flosser is basically a smaller version of it that you can use in your own bathroom. This brand comes with two nozzles and comes with Ni-MH rechargeable batteries.It's pretty simple to use - make sure it's fully charge, fill it up with water and push the off button, but do make sure that you have the nozzle (which can rotate 360) in your mouth before turning it on or water will go all over place. There are three different modes: normal, soft and pulse.This was my first time using a water flosser and I'm glad to say that I have enjoyed using it. Even on the soft mode, it pushes out a powerful blast of water that cleans in between your teeth & gums fast. Overall, I've been impressed with the Smart Water Flosser and I recommend it to others. I received a complimentary copy in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.
The cable is pretty good. I used it to hookup the soundbar to my TV and it's been working just fine so far.

I started getting a receding hairline when I was teenager. I'm now in my 30s and I would like to keep what little hair I have left. Hairsentials is a multivitamin for your hair. It's not going to regrow the hair that you already loss, but it's meant to support any thinning hair you have on your head. It features 2000 mcg of Biotin, which is known to improve the quality of a persons' hair. After about a week of taking the vitamin, I noticed the hairs on scalp were standing up taller. Overall, Hairsentials is a decent multivitamin. I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.
While the soundtrack and the film wasn't nearly as good as the first movie, they're still entertaining nonetheless. I only purchased this soundtrack because I like Jessie J's Flashlight song.

While I don't sew myself (my mother does though), I'm well aware that Wonder Clips are used to hold the binding in place on the edge of a quilt while it is being sewed and a few brands (especially the ones that are sold at Walmart) can be a bit expensive. I reviewed an off brand clips and gave them to my mother for Christmas last year. She absolutely loved the clips. When I was offered to review a complimentary sample of the Attmu Wonder Clips, I eagerly said yes.This set has 100 little clips that are made from plastic and a small metal clip. One side of the clip is see-through yellow and the other side is clear, which features two seam allowance markings. Despite the small sizes, the clips are pretty sturdy.Overall, I think the yellow Attmu Wonder Clips are great. 100 clips for under ten dollars is a wonderful price. Just like last year, I'm going to put the clips back and give them to my mother for Christmas.

The flu bug hit me at the end of last month and when my stomach started bothering me, I would just take two or thee of the Activated Charcoal capsules and it would help calm everything down. I would like to point out that if you take any medications, you need to wait a few hours befores taking the Activated Charcoal as it will absorb up the medicine. Overall, I do like the Nature's True Medcine Activated Charcoal and I plan on using it again.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

The Little Paris Bookshop is the complete opposite of the books that I normally read, but that's a bad thing as I ended up liking this title. The author did a great job of creating an interesting character with a deep emotional depth. Overall, The Little Paris Bookshop is a wonderful read from start to finish.I received a complimentary copy in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

The Eye-Popping Oddities begins with a two-page biography of Robert Ripley along with a never-before-seen photo of him. The book has 10 different chapters/sections:Believe It! - This chapter features some of the weirdest things, such as a cat with thumbs and ceramic inflatables.World - Showcases oddities found around the world, such as cups made from skulls, a hotel in a cave, an upside-down house and a tornado fire.Animals - Here you get a cath with long whiskers, a frog with extra legs, a mother cat feeding a baby hedgehog, a snake massage, 40-inch long dinosaur poop, a monster earthworm and much more.Body - From weird tattoos, to the Twins form Yucatan, to a cheek hole, etc., you won't believe it until you see these amazing photos.Pop Culture - People take their love for movies and television a little too far with cardboard movie scenes, A Simpsons tattoo, a Game of Thrones wedding, pop plates, etc..Transport - Yep, there are a lot of odd automobiles in the world, including a car made from human hair, a bone truck, a sheepdog car and a beetle robot.Feats - Learn about several odd feats & facts, such as the superman swoop, sleeping on a bed made of wire, a man pulling a car by his nose and human cannonballs.Art - People can turn anything into art, including building a trash zoo, 3-D drawings and making art from Barbie parts.Food - You'll learn about the pie-scraper, a robot that will ride on the shoulders of a runner and feed them tomatoes, benefits from drinking cow urine and many other things.Beyond Belief - In the final chapter, you'll find things that you can barely believe is real, such as scary selfies, a running track on a roof, a teddy bear butcher, an SUV stuck in a tree, elf ears, etc..I've always been fascinated about the world of Ripley ever since my parents took me to the Ripley's Believe It or Not! museum in Branson, Missouri when I was a kid back in the 90s. I discovered the Annuals about three years ago and I get a kick out of each book. There are a lot of weird things throughout the pages of this installment. It's jammed packed with beautiful, colorful pictures as well as amazing and unbelievable facts (though all of them are real). Overall, I had a blast reading and looking at the photos in Ripley's Believe It or Not! Eye-Popping Oddities.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I owned a small ab roller when I was in my late teens and it was poorly made. It had two wheels and every time you tried to use it, the wheels would split apart. I never thought about getting a new one until I reviewed a new ab roller earlier this year. Then earlier this summer I was offered a complimentary AB-WOW Pro Ab Roller Wheel, which I accepted in exchange for my honest thoughts.This ab roller is made out of solid materials, so the wheels never s apart while in use. I like the 2 resistance bands that can be attached to the handles. It also has the footstraps, so you can attach them to your feet.Overall, I'm impressed with the  AB-WOW Pro Ab Roller Wheel and I recommend it to others.

If I'm going to drink a protein shake, I want it as healthy as it can be. This 3-pack is 100% natural, so you know that you are getting the best for your body. The protein can be mixed with either water or milk, though I prefer the latter as it sweetens it up. Not that it needs to be sweeten at all as the dutch chocolate tastes great by itself. Overall, I loved trying out the Super Plant Protein and I recommend it to others.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

While Papa, Brother, Sister and Honey Bear are featured on the cover, they don't have anything to do with the book. Instead the authors retold the biblical stories of The Creation (Genesis 1), David Meets Goliath (1 Samuel 17), Daniel in the Lion's Den (Daniel 6), The Birth of Jesus (Luke 1), The Good Neighbor (Luke 10), Jesus in Jerusalem (Matthew 20) and He is Risen! (Matthew 28) with words and illustrations in the style of The Berenstain Bears' world.This is a cute little book for young readers and a great way to introduce the Bible to them. All the illustrations are beautiful. Overall, The Berenstain Bears Storybook Bible For Little Ones is an adorable novel that both children and parents will enjoy reading together. I plan on giving my copy to my little cousins to read.I received a complimentary copy in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

There has been some criticism from fans of the series about Mike Berenstain using Christian themes in the most recent books. I just read one Amazon reviewer whom was upset that Mike added his own religious beliefs into the books. Personally, I don't mind the new angle for the series. I mean it is published by a ZonderKidz, which is a Christian publishing company. Overall, I thought both the story and illustrations for The Berenstain Bears' Harvest Festival was nicely done. The Christian theme works well here without trying to preach too much children.I received a complimentary copy in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I had been looking for a way to cover up the cap between the sides of the stove and the cabinets for  awhile now, so I was excited to receive the Silicone Counter Gap Covers last month. I had to trim down the length by an inch or two on both sides, but besides front that the covers fit perfectly and easily hides the gap. It's like a splatter guard, so I no longer have to worry about accidentally spilling something while cooking. The covers are easily washed with a soap, water and a dishrag. Overall, I'm impressed with the Silicone Counter Gap Covers and I recommend to others.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I'm almost completely bald on my scalp, so I wasn't expecting much form the Folliform. Therefore I didn't see any follicles or scalp health differences while testing this out. However, I did see a slight boost of energy on the days that I took this, maybe because it has green tea in it. I also has nettle root extract and saw palmetto, which both ingredients are known to help with male's libido. Overall, the product is just okay.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I received several complimentary dietary supplements to test out and review on here last month, which for some reason included Fertiliform, which is meant to be taken by women. Though the ingredient Dong Quai can enhance orgasms for men, I decided not to even attempt to test it out. Instead I gave it to a female friend, whom stated that she didn't see any health benefits from taking this. Therefore, I'm only giving this two out of five.

I received this with a few other supplements last month to test out and review. I suffer from anxiety and sleep problems, so I was looking forward to trying it. Though it didn't do a thing to help me sleep better. Overall, the SeroThin is just okay.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I received the Male Storm awhile back with a few other supplements for me test out and review. Like other testosterone boosters, this is supposed to increase your overall performance in the bedroom. Slowly, I've been replacing the old plastic measuring cups in my kitchen with stainless steel ones. The problem with the plastic ones is that the measurement engravings have worn off them and a few of the handles have broken off.This stainless steel set features five different sizes  1/8 cup (30 mil),  cup (60 ml), 1/3 cup (80 ml),  cup (125 mil) and 1 cup (250 ml). Each cup is pretty sturdy, but the handles are a little thin and can be easily bent. Overall, this stainless steel measuring cups set is pretty decent and can be useful in any kitchen.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I had just painted the basement bathroom/laundry room last month and I was looking for a big picture to put on the wall behind the washer & dryer. Luckily, I was sent the complimentary Lake with Wooden Bridge Pier Under Sunset Panel set in exchange for my honest thoughts.This is a 3-piece 20"x30" canvas set, so you need plenty of wall space for this. The canvases where heavily bubbled wrapped and I had to use a knife to carefully remove it from each one. The pictures have been beautifully printed on each canvas.The wall brackets were not attached to the back of the canvases, so I had to use a drill to drill a small hole to screw (the screws are included) the brackets into the back frame. It also comes with screws to mount the canvases to the wall, but it doesn't come with any wall anchors.Overall, I'm with the Lake with Wooden Bridge Pier Under Sunset Panel set. The canvases look great  and adds a bit of color to the bathroom wall.

This is a pretty big billfold. It has a brown stylish checkerboard color on the outside and a bright tan color on the inside. It features seven credit card pockets, one SIM pocket and one flip ID holder. The dollar bills area has a cloth divider in it.Let me start out by stating that at first glance the billfold looks great, but it's cheaply made. The SIM pocket is only big enough to fit a micro-SIM card, but there is a small gap at the bottom of the pocket, which means the card might fall out. While the other card pockets can easily fit a credit card, it cannot hold one that has a sleeve protector.Overall, this isn't the best billfold in the world, but for the price it can make a good starter wallet or a backup wallet.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

Unlike yoga straps, this strap doesnt have a plastic buckle, but instead it's just one piece with ten spaces to place your foot or hand into. The strap is pretty long, so you can easily adjust it to your height and flexibility level. Overall, I've been impressed with the DanceCrazy Ultra Stretch Strap. It's very simple to use and it does me out during my yoga exercisesI received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I received the bottle of L-Arginine about a month ago. I went by the directions and took two capsules a day with a meal, which is prior to when I take creatine. The L-Arginine is supposed to help the creatine absorb into your body faster.I'm glad to say that I haven't had any side effects from taking it.Does it work to increase muscular endurance and energy?I didn't see much a boost in energy during the last month, though I wasn't as sore from my workouts the next day after taking it. I also noticed the muscle cramps in my legs wasn't as nearly as bad. Overall, the L-Arginine might not work for everyone, but I'm satisfied with the product for the most part.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

I'm a little behind in technology as I just purchased my first MP3 Player around Christmas last year. While I have enjoyed the player, it doesn't have the best sound. That being said, I was more than excited to try out the complimentary Tomameri MP4 Player in exchange for my honest thoughts. At first glance it does look cheaply made, but it isn't that bad of a player. It features just four buttons (Menu, Volume, Reverse, Forward). The player can play music (MP3 files), play videos, browse photos (JPEG/GIF), read e-Book text files, record voices, and plays FM Radio. It comes with earbud headphones, a USB cord and a 16GB micro-SD card.Once fully-charged, the battery can lasts for several hours. The overall sound is pretty good with decent bass. I was surprised that the FM Radio works great. So far I have enjoyed using the Tomameri MP4 Player.

I loved the first three books in the series, but the last two books weren't as good, though I still liked them. I wasn't for sure what to expect from the sixth installment when I started reading it this morning. At around 100 pages, the author creatively wraps up the storyline for all the characters. There are few sad scenes, but in the end there is a satisfying ending. Overall, A Heart's Home is an emotional ending to a great series. I received a complimentary copy in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

While I have heard about the legendary Troll 2, I've never watched until this week and it's just as bad as everyone said it was. First off, there are no trolls in it, just goblins. The special effects are horrible and the acting is even worse, though I have to admit that I did get a kick out of the troll queen.

While this is no way a four star rating, I'm still rating it with four stars as I have fond memories of watching it when I was a kid, way before the other Harry Potter books & movies came out. While there are plenty of plot holes, Troll is still fun to watch.

Let me start out by mentioning that this is a unflavored container of creatine, so you might want to add it to juice or a protein drink/shake. Personally, I don't mind just adding it to a 10 ounce glass of water and gulping it down. It's not exactly tasteless, but you might not like it at first, but eventually you'll get use to it. Overall, I do like the Activa Naturals Creatine Monohydrate Powder as I'm less sore the day after I lift weights. It's a pretty big container, so it should last me for several months.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

This is my first time using a Turmeric Root Powder and let me just say that you don't want to mix this with just water as it taste very bitter! I recommend mixing a teaspoon or so in with whatever smoothie or protein shake that you usually make. What are my thoughts on it? Well, it's alright. I'm not for sure if I've been taking it long enough to see any actually health benefits from it, but I haven't had any sort of side effect from it either. Once mixed in a chocolate protein shake, I can't even tastethe turmeric in it. Overall, I do like the Organic Wise Organic Turmeric Root Powder.I received a complimentary sample in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own.

Good, well-organized collection with an active table of contents so you can read any of the  Sherlock Holmes tales in any order you choose, but doesn't include the dozen tales comprising "Tales of Terror and Mystery" such as 'The Leather Funnel' , 'The New Catacomb' , 'The Case of Lady Sannox' and more. While you can probably pick up the remainder of the tales separately for a reasonable sum, you can't hardly call it  complete without them hence the lower rating. Otherwise a fine bargain for fans of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

But when I kiss you, it's like kissing...my brother." Dam*, has it been 30 years already?  Man, I must be getting old! One of the better sci-fi / comedy trilogies that I've enjoyed from long ago and am now giving the set to my daughter for Christmas whom was a whopping 4 months old when the third installment was released (did I say I was old?) Gonna enjoy watching these again with her as they were definitely a blast from the past! With Star Wars: Episode VII just weeks away, maybe some of you  remember this famous line from the original Back to the Future, too, "Last night Darth Vader came down from planet Vulcan and told me that if I didn't take Lorraine out, that he'd melt my brain..." Great bundle, terrific price, delivered in a mere two days and how can I not help but  recommend!

Good, brief book with minor editing hiccups. Glad to see all the planes mentioned corresponded with the appropriate images, but while Richthofen  was mentioned I felt compelled to deduct one star for not providing an image and description of most famous fighter plane of that period, the Fokker Dr.I triplane. Bottom line, I did like the book!

Realistic story line, complex plot twists, and plenty of action made for an engaging read that was hard to put down once I was fully immersed. With multiple subplots, flashbacks, and chapters that jump around chronologically you'll definitely want to make note of the date changes of each chapter to keep abreast of what's happening when, but well worth it in the end and I do recommend!

...Tracks - - from a giant bird, it appears." Children's book with sing-songy rhymes similar to "The Night Before Christmas" and a fine message about changing one's ways that reminds me some of Charles Dickens' "The Christmas Carol." Good book overall and just in time for Thanksgiving which is now only a week away!

Hard-boiled as I like them, engaging plot, plenty of suspense, and realistic characters made for a fun, quick read that I had done in a day. I liked how the author was able to convey how particularly tense moments were as in this passage, "Keeping her mouth shut was the wisest thing to do, and her silence became more and more nerve-wracking . It was like driving around with a hand grenade rolling around loose on the floor..." Could do with a bit better editing including this passage at location 2017, ' "You don't what you're talking about," Erlacher shouts',  but overall I'd have no qualms reading more of the Jack Rhodes books.
Characters and villains I've enjoyed since my youth together with a great comic plot and formatted superbly for kindle. Sure hope there's more Batman to come as I'm a BIG fan!

...[yet] American writer Ernest Hemingway (and a plurality of others I suspect) later said that "all modern American literature comes from" Huckleberry Finn ' the very book Twain will surely be remembered for most and set against of all places...the Mississippi!. Very good, brief account of the life of Mark Twain complete with photos and quotes that definitely brought forth his sometimes sarcastic nature and made me laugh like, "The mind that becomes soiled in youth can never again be washed clean...I cherish an unappeased bitterness against the unfaithful guardians of my young life, who not only permitted but compelled me to read an unexpergated Bible through before I was 15 years old."  Very good book and I did enjoy!

Chilling book given the current times, tho book is actually a crime book set 70 years in the past concerning a mind-altering drug, mobsters, and a down-on-his-luck pi caught in between trying to solve the disappearance of his former lover's brother and just staying alive.  Book has a fine plot, good twists and realistic characters tho ends in a cliffhanger that leaves me wondering what comes next. Leave you with one further quote to pique your interest, "Beware! For there are wolves living among us..."

Starts off with a brief introduction concerning the difference between 'poisonous' and 'venomous'  (venom usually entering the victim's body through fangs or stingers whereas poison by other means such as ingestion, inhalation, absorption, etc.) before launching into the body of the book. Active table of content will take you to any of the 25 animals in any order providing you with a photo and details of the critter including where found, habitat, what it eats, description and even toxicity ratings on a 5-point scale. Books ends with 25 multiple choice questions and answers making this one well-organized, factual children's book that I really like and I do recommend!

Three quirky characters (with help from an angelic source) combine to battle a demon whom is inspiring others to become mass murderers. Characters were truly offbeat including a french-speaking priest, deep-south sheriff and a female tech looking for romance that made for some whimsical dialogue. Given the short page count (224 pages) this book made for a quick, entertaining read having some gruesome scenes and limited course language making it more a supernatural read than your common Christian offering. Bottom line - I liked it!

...Actually ended up with 6 prospects so gets the full five star treatment from me! Took the 50 obscure movies listed and then run them thru the website Rotten Tomatoes to further screen them before seeing if they were available on Netflix streaming. Three of the titles I look forward to viewing in the very near future are "Blue Ruin" , "Tucker and Dale Vs Evil" and "The Giant Mechanical Man." I'm always looking for a lead on what's worth watching on Netflix so I greatly appreciated this book title. Thank you!

Good Information but pictures are a mess for kindle, as for example one will have a shot of an arm one page then next page will show the other part of the body, another will show a photo of half the Jackson Five team on stage with the remainder half same stage on a subsequent page, one shot had Michael and Princess Diane with Charles cut-off on another page, there would be parts of other photos no longer than a tiny vertical strip by themselves running along the edge of a separate page and so on. Could be a good book but is currently in need of better formatting.

Includes photos and important facts including scientific name, length, wingspan, weight, population, when present together with a wonderful narrative of over three dozen species of birds. Some things I'd like to see added would be to alphabetize the order and have all lettering dark to make for easier reading on my black and white kindle but otherwise absolutely superb  and I did enjoy!

Been wanting to read this book for the longest time as a foundation for the great film version I've watched in the past. Xist version is well-formatted with active links from the table of contents and better font than what is present in the generic version making for an improved read. Good book and did enjoy!

Interesting to think that Ike was our top general opposing Nazi Germany yet he himself was of German heritage (a rarity as for US presidents). Also noteworthy that his forefathers fled Europe because of religious persecution and were decidedly anti-war yet he eventually joined the military and read many such books on the subject at an early age that actually belonged to his mother. While known most for the Transcontinental Highway it's also noteworthy to remember him for his involvement in the Civil Rights Act, Suez Canal Crisis and the Space Race of which I didn't realize. Very good book ending with several of his State of the Union speeches if ever you are interested.

Book includes a poorly formatted Image gallery with no captions, sometimes crushing several different sized images on same page and offering no explanation as to why Fess Parker dressed in his role as Daniel Boone should even be present (weird). Good for the story alone but wishing there were a better illustrated version out there.

Great natural photos complete with narrative that includes the info on the region from which the photos were taken which for me gets high marks since too often this knowledge isn't presented in pictures leaving me wonder where to find it if ever I should visit. Generally well-written, too, as I only noticed a couple instances where the letter 'i' was dropped such as "Storks frst, always!" at page 3 location 31 and '...smoked fsh, called "Zivi" ' at page 8 location 42. Well done, I liked it!

Just wishing the kindle book had more of an interactive nature since you can't get the answers to each of the 20 questions per section until the very end since there is no handy link present which forces you to remember/write down the question and your answer before flipping forward to see the result. I imagine it would be entertaining for large groups with a wide age spread otherwise. Good book!

Well illustrated cartoons, the cleaner ones being my favorites including the stone out in the plains with a reefer saying "Stone! I'm manned!" , the distraught shipwreck survivor approaching a small island only to be told by another man already arrived the single word "Occupied!" or the fan and vacuum cleaner squaring off one saying ""You suck!" and the other one "You blow!" Very good book that I did get some laughs from!

Eight unique horror stories with a handy link from the table of contents so you can read them in any order you choose including:1) The Initiation of Ryan Cadle2) The Sleepwalker3) They Don't Sleep4) The Haunting of the Monroe House5) Spring Cleaning6) My Childhood Friend7) The Game Master8) Fitness GuruFavorites would have to be the bookend tales "Initiation" for the great twist at the close and "Fitness Guru' for the painful imagery of the punishments the protagonist had to endure whenever he fell of the wagon. Very good book that I did enjoy!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

Interesting blend of a lite Western and  Werewolf-type aka 'skinwalker'  tale including mention of a Colorado cannibal/prospector by name of Alfred Packer whom I will want to do further research on later.  Action and characters kept this book moving at a good clip and am hoping there are more western/horror mash-ups out there to enjoy. Very good book!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...can't get the 3d images to work using red-cyan glasses on my basic black and white kindle. Good book otherwise and had no problems viewing the photos directly.Author did respond to my concerns and am bumping up my star rating as a result (overall pictures were very good as mentioned before). Thanks again for the response!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

Eclectic assortment of horror tales, my favorites including "Beware the Death Angel" from which I pulled my title, "Follow the Leader" which involved the Lemming-like quality of people and how it can lead them to ruin and last but not least, "Mother Mary" which  was a very good creature story involving a protagonist that should have clearly known better. A creepy collection that I did enjoy!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...some are BIG, some are small." Easy reader for the very young with colorful, engaging picture of monsters that made for a fun book. Ran maybe half the length (14 pages/clicks) on kindle versus the paperback version.  Good, quick book that I did like.Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...I can almost taste that precious meat." Author does a fine job getting you involved in the everyday life of a young couple with baby before pulling the rug out from under you when a creepy homeless person arrives to tell them their young son is possessed by a demon or in his own words, "It doesn't want you. No it don't. It don't. It don't..." I already own "Demons and Other Inconveniences" by same author aw well and look forward to reading that, too. Very good book!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...You could never be too careful with strangers." Three unique horror shorts including:1) So Long - a story about never really knowing who it is that crosses your path2) Ellie's Monsters - What an abusive father doesn't know about his daughter3) Read Twice - How to cope with unruly neighborsFirst tale was far and away my favorite tale for the multiple twists involved but all were very good and memorable in the end. Well done!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...that's God's punishment what I done."  Dark, noir period piece loaded with horror revolving around a demented bar owner who likes to feed his problems to one monster gator. Had me on board early with the image of a ragtime piano player loosing his digits one by one followed by gripping passages like "With the bottleneck lodged in his throat, he could only gargle blood, his final breath hissing like a punctured tire."  Superb book and looking forward to reading more from this author!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

Book grabs your attention from the first chapter as you're left wondering what a modern day cop killer has to do with a century old vampire tale, but once the prison riot starts and the blood-letting begins about 40% in then it become just a no-holds bar fight for survival against  the Nosferatu in the classic sense within the confines of a prison block. Author does a great job developing his character and plot line together with some nifty twists that I don't want to give away less I spoil the fun. Very good book and leave you with one more passage to sink your teeth into, "I've been saving you for dessert, but the woman smell is so strong around here I can't help myself any longer. I have to have at least one bite."Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

...and we will drown it with our shadows," the demon informed Baker. Well-written  horror short complete with a pudgy balding vampire that threw me for a loop, Pagan rites and a good old-fashioned exorcism. I rather liked the characters and am looking forward to reading more of them in "The Giving of Things Cold & Cursed" (part of the Single Shot Short Story Series). Very good book and I did enjoy!Part of my third Annual (and maybe final) October horror reviews. Have a Happy Halloween!

A tale of two teen hero's journey complete with a descriptive world environment, likeable characters and the usual assortment of orcs, trolls, dragons and bloody battles that occur later in the series. While I realize this is geared more towards a younger audience it still read good for even an old coot like me. Very good series that even saved me $3 (that I appreciate) were I to buy all six books individually.

Truly only 4 pages long as all this "book" contains is the header page, copyright protection page, table of contents with nothing beneath and one more page with title/author name listed and not a @#&* thing more. Paphos Publishing needs a wake up call and make good to  actually put the content back in this book as I was really interested at first. Book (if you can call it that) really blows as it is. Don't bother!

...She'd shown him what awaited him beyond this life. And it was hell." Tech geek loner marries computers with a sex doll only to have it possessed by a demon. Slick, dark horror book that definitely has me wanting to read more from this author. One more passage to light your 'fire' , "I can help you, Joseph. I can make the world see you for the man you want to be. I can make them pay, Joseph. I can make them all pay." Very good book!

Loved each and every one of these ghost stories for both their originality and giving me the creeps!  Lots of passages I really enjoyed like -"For a moment Marge didn't answer, continuing to stare at the garment like it could come alive any second and strike." - Death and White Satin"When candles burn blue and dogs cry with fear, Get thee a bible, for spirits draw near." - Dance of the Ancients"Yes!" the buzzing hiss confirmed. "I do smell Danford blood...and blood must answer for blood." - Legacy of Flies"Whatever you do, don't look away from her. If you do, she's gonna be right in here with you." - Storm Chase"Carol was right. The phantom was waiting. Somebody would die tonight." - A Long, Cold Forever of a NightExcellent collection that begs the question, "When comes volume 2?" This author can flat out write!

Well-written tales together with a nice introduction by the author.  Lead tale about a psychic called "The Sign" I wouldn't hardly classify as a horror short, but made for a good mystery with a nice twist at the end. Horror fans (like myself) should get a charge from the zombie cows in "Beef" tho the tale about the serial killer "Art in Everything" was probably my personal favorite. I'm still thinking about that passage "I wonder what the police would make of it. Would they get what I was trying to convey with the piece - that my assailants had the guts to try and attack me but lacked the intelligence to pull it off?" Very good book and I did enjoy!

Loved the 18-year old female version of a crazed 'mad max'  with dialogue like, "Your kind killed my parents. I may have hated them, but they were still mine. And no one touches what's mine" & ' "You were a tough bast***, I'll give you that" she whispered. "I salute you." She shot a halfhearted salute from her forehead out and quickly turned it into giving it the middle finger. ' Great concepts including  a 'patient zero' who is more than just another zombie since it is able to heal itself and reclaim part of it's former humanity so long as it eats only brains instead of flesh.  Interesting to think that a warped world could also have birds and other animals susceptible to the virus (how does that change the dynamics of how one survives?) Problem is with awkwardly worded phrases I'm still struggling to understand even today such as this one at location 2528  "Thing only evidence he wasn't alone anymore was the hairs on his neck standing in attention at the static electricity humming between them." Were it edited properly this would be an even better book, as it is it's ok tho I hated having to lurch thru segments that didn't really read right and took away from the flow of the story.

Superb, creepy suspense story about to what lengths an individual will go to acquire a new family. Author gets you inside the demented individuals' head  with passages to set you squirming including "I had to hear her voice. I called it at least twice a day." , "That's what was happening to my dreams, they were dying off" and "I wished those two little boys were mine, I wish that wife was mine. I wish I had a family again. It became addicting." Why, oh why, doesn't this author have another book available for kindle? Superb!

Well-written paranormal book looking at the world thru a ghost's eyes and eventually the investigator whom seeks to help the spirit find rest. Read like a fairly realistic approach as to how it might actually happen, and am wondering even now about the author's background / life experience. Very good book and I did enjoy!

...Beyond it, she knew, was a world so wonderful and magical that she spent hours pretending that she belonged." Author does a tremendous job putting real flesh and bones on her characters such that you really feel for the plight of Jenny and her older sister caught in a back-country world were women are only tools of the men that keep them. Story ends leaving you hoping for more at to 'what lies beyond the blue door? Very good book and I wouldn't hesitate to read more of this authors' works!

...They didn't have to look in the eyes of the ones they loved and decide their end." Generally well-written book that alternates between over the top action sequences together with lengthier segments all about the dialogue and how what's left of society came to be. Doesn't really break any molds (unless wild dogs chowing on the dead isn't something commonly written of in zombie books) but author does a fine job developing his two major characters and I did enjoy this one overall.

Six stories total,well-formatted for kindle including handy links from the table of contents so you can read them in any order you choose. Titles including:1) Peppermint Tea in Electronic Limbo2) Springs and Bootblack3) Anomalocaris4) The Bakers' Barista5) Banshee6) Supermarket AmbushI liked the bookend titles best as they were lengthier and had more of an ending than the short flash fiction stories sandwiched between. Peppermint was a great lead story with sci-fi elements of a dying man wanting to be assured of saving his consciousness long past death and what can result if recessed memories aren't otherwise disclosed. Book finished well with Supermarket being just a fun what-if a blackmailer and her patsy met up and the patsy suddenly decided he didn't give a dam*  about the threats any more. Those two made the collection worth it for me.

Shares some similarities with other interactive books I've come to enjoy in the past like "Dangerous Animals of the Sea" and "The Human Brain" in that you have to make a choice as to what selection you believe is true before proceeding. I'd be curious as to how many total different combinations this puzzler presents tho ultimately I have this creepy feeling that none are apt to end all that well (I for one thought that suspecting what was around the bend it was every man for themselves!) A fun book with a few glitches as mentioned by another reviewer in the very beginning (first selection didn't automatically advance the scenario so I likewise had to page forward) but, yeah, I'd be game for more!

Ghostly cornfield apparitions, a hulking monster, pentagon-patterned crop circles, dismembered bodies, and eerie light beams from the sky all combine in this creepy novella that made for an engaging read. I enjoyed the female protagonist since she wasn't your typical blond-haired, screaming airhead but kept her wits about her as best she could, and I found the dialogue realistic for the most part until all hell broke loose at the close. One of the better horror shorts I've read of late (this being the season were I concentrate mainly reading/reviewing horror books) and definitely an author I want to read of more. Very good book and I did enjoy!

Pleasing, well-written short story, more of a suspense yarn than that of the macabre or frightening. Takes me back to bygone times like that of the 1953 film version "House of Wax" with Vincent Price that I always enjoyed. Good book!

...Ha, Ha," laughed the witch, as she stuck her hand in a dish, then pulled out a handful of smelly, dead fish. ' Cute children's book just in time for Halloween! Find out how a kindly skunk turns the witch's hard heart inside out in this fun tale that was also well-formatted for kindle. Very good book and one of many I own and enjoy from Sally Huss including WHAT'S FOR THANKSGIVING DINNER?, LUCKY PENNIES and CHILDREN OF THE WORLD among others.

Great twists a hallmark of each of these three fine horror stories (another reviewer mentioned Twilight Zone endings and I'd certainly give a shout out for that) together with well-developed characters and plots made for superb reads. My personal favorite was the first number "Recalculating" as I find it hard to entirely trust GPS devices myself and this tale just gives me one more reason. One final passage to hopefully give you some incentive to make the plunge' "Maggie! I can hardly see the road in front of me much less drive in reverse in this damned weather!" Maggie opened her mouth to reply, but was cut off. "Turn left in one mile." ' Terrific!

...controlling my computer and in a way controlling what I can't and can't do." Evil entity and a human host go head to head challenging one another  in a life or death struggle over whose story gets to play out in real life. Novel concept, fine dialogue and characters I could empathize with made for a fun horror read. Very good book!

...Moral: Children, especially attractive, well-bred young ladies, should never talk to strangers, for if they should do so, they may well provide dinner for a wolf." Not every Little Red Riding Hood story has a happy ending in this fine collection of 11 versions each headed by it's own distinctive illustration for kindle. I also enjoyed mention of the dozen different movie versions in the back of the book to follow up on at a later date including The Company of Wolves (1984), Freeway (1996) and The Red Spectacles (Japan, 1987). Very good collection and I did like!

Thought I'd give this book a read as I was most interested in Joan Fontaine (given this was her birthday month) as well as the other three notable actresses. Loved the photos included and learning of the sibling rivalry she and her older sister had for one another as evidenced by passages like Joan's comment on Olivia de Havilland's newest spouse "All I know about him is that he has had four wives and has written one book. Too bad it isn't the other way around." Can't hardly rate it higher tho since it excludes three other fine actresses that made some of Hitchcock's top five movies of all-times including Eva Marie Saint of "North By Northwest", Tippi Hedren of "The Birds" and who can forget Janet Leigh's performance in "Psycho" (one of my favorite horror classics).  Very good book overall but incomplete in my opinion.

...Or to know whether he'd be happy to have a leg amputated?" Scary short novella that slowly cranks up the gore until the ill-fated conclusion. Still wincing over scenes containing mention of scooped eyeballs and arterial blood spurting, so have to say it has a lasting impact even now. Generally well-written tho I think the author meant "peccadilloes" rather than "predictions" at location 58. Irregardless, very good book that I did enjoy and looking forward to more fine horror reads from this author!

Several aqaintenances opt to camp in Aokigahara Forest overnight "a place where people came to die" only to experience more horrors tha they bargained for. Author does a fine job developing his characters while slowly ratcheting up the tension as each of them begin to drop one by one. Reminds me a bit of "Blair Witch Project" in some respects withe passages like "Twenty feet ahead, hanging from a branch by red suicide ribbon, was a crucifix with two small sticks and string. Then I spotted another. Then another beyond that." Read like a traditional horror story which I liked and looking forward to reading "The Catacombs" by same author next!

"Laurie, are you high? What the hell is wrong with your eyes?" I say...Short horror book that reads all so normal until late one night, early in the morning when Laurie comes back and the story takes a sudden veer into the Twilight Zone. Some surprise ending and an author I definitely want to read of more!

Really grisly which is how this book started for me since I used the active table of contents to flashback and view the photos first which certainly set the mood (dark, very dark!) Surprised to find some killers associated with the photos weren't highlighted in the book, but of those that were I'd say Richard Chase and Ed Gein were by far two of the worst. I'd highlight some phrases like using human skulls as soup bowls and consuming raw animal organs but got to be even too sick for me. Frankly, for those that really enjoy these type of works I thought it might have been better to list half as many serial killers over the 445 pages so as to give an even more thorough account, but in the end it was quite a book that left a lasting impression.

Classic horror book complete with an image gallery at the close including two photos of first edition covers, an example of Stoker's handwritten notes, photo of the author and of his former home, a lobby card of the 1931 film version and screen shot of Bela Lugosi and more. Fine book for what was a freebie at the time and I do recommend!

Suspense book that starts you off in a graveyard and then weaves a tale of intrigue  complete with superstitious town folk, a macabre pastor who enjoys taking pictures of the dead, and a beastly specter traipsing among the caves. Book had a complex story line, plenty of well-developed characters and a finish that most definitely caught me off guard. Very good book!

Slick British historical thriller that feels as if it turns the works of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle on it's head and trades out Holmes & Watson for a vampire and his helper as they seek to uncover the whereabouts of a cult-like group that are wanting to hunt them down. Had a good time with this book and would gladly read more of the series!

Unique blend of horror stories complete with the occasional illustration to live things up. Personal favorite would have to be Circle Five; Wrath & Sullenness which encompasses a man wrung with cancer and making everyone's life a living hell (can't imagine a man with thoughts any more mean than this individual!) All seven sins are represented in this offering with an active table of contents so you can peruse them in any order you choose. Very good book and I did enjoy!

...You will pay the price for my sin and I'll be free." Unique blend of horror/fantasy as a female visionary with an ancient mirror capable of speaking with the dead confronts a satanic ghoul. None too shabby having an angelic protector with a wicked sword on your side as well which makes this short book a good one with broad appeal.

Action-oriented zombie apocalypse book with a novel twist  since the dead are extremely quick and can survive a head shot, but at least they burn when the sun is high. Turns into more of a military style book at the half way point as rogue groups are wanting what the others have so hardly ever a point where the story line 'shambles.' One thought that crossed my mind was whether fire would have made any kind of deterrent as I was always hoping they'd give it a try. Very good book and leave you with one final passage, "There was an alertness there in the dark pits. Some kid of awareness of him. But as what? Food, maybe."

Gripping tale about a boy's dread of his father countered by the love for his dog, only to be put to the test one day much like in the Bible. "Then I want you to take this knife and cut Isaac's throat for me..." Chilling, dark ending that will stick with me long after and truly hoping this author as more novellas in the works. Superb!

We have been using this product for a few years. It is nice paper and the most important part is the reinforced edge with the holes. This is really helpful with school papers when the teacher requires the use of the three ring binder and grades it and it gets used for a full semester. I rate this 4 stars not 5 because I feel the writing going down the reinforced edge to market the brand is visually distracting and students need to pay attention in class and focus on note taking without their eyes being diverted. I keep rebuying it as I don't see a decent alternative.

My husband is a wet shaver using a puck based shaving soap and formerly he used high end shaving cremes (i.e. Nancy Boy). This was his first use of a FOAMLESS shaving creme. He said it performed well and gave a nice shave so he likes it, but he prefers a thick lather. The scent is light and mild. I was curious what the specific ingredients were but there is no list on the tube and this did not come in a box. It says it has "Dead Sea minerals" and that is the secret to the nice shave.

I was drawn to this book as I am in my second year of being the owner of a cottage business and have been questioning what it takes to turn a profit versus when it's time to just give up and designate it a hobby. I wanted to hear some business advice specifically for entrepreneurs. I wrongly assumed this would be a typical business "blowing sunshine" type of self-help book but it is anything but. From the start, Tobak blows the lid off myths and tells it like it really is with citations from credible sources (i.e.US Census Bureau).The method of writing is a combination of personal stories from his career and stories from big names in business. He then compares what most people who think they want to own a thriving business actually do with their time compared to the very different things that the successful ones do. He calls out the notion that branding and a steady flow of information via social media sites is the way to get famous as that is nothing more than yelling into an echo chamber. After asking you to take a hard look at who you are and how you are spending your time he lays out information on next steps to take to really move you toward fulfilling your goals.The stories are interesting and when he has a point to make he makes it clearly and succinctly. This book was enjoyable to read, not stressful or a slog, it moves along at a good pace, and I underlined throughout and made notes in the margins. I love the refreshing no baloney attitude and I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

I am so excited that this is available now. I had formerly bought a crock pot not to cook in but to keep my food hot during transport and to use as a service device (not plugged in). Every time I drove my food in a crock pot to the pot luck party it spilled. The first time was on the minivan trunk's carpet so the food stink was hard to get rid of. After that I devised more elaborate protective ways involving several layers of cardboard boxes that saved the rug but still made a mess (sauce sloshed down the sides of the crock that had to be wiped off before presentation at the pot luck).So for me the main benefit of this is the safe transport of food. This is a sturdy lidded food crock with four strong lock down lid clasps. It has one thick handle on the top for easy carrying so you do not touch the hot part of the crock to carry it. It is a nice shape and easy (versus the oval of a large crock pot).This claims to keep foot hot for 12 hours or cold for 18 hours. I assume that do that the lid must be kept on. (There is no instruction manual to clarify this.) For my purposes I will never need a food piping hot for 12 hours or cold for 18 so this suits my needs. The stainless steel construction is more sturdy than crocks in crock pots and cannot chip or break. I will be careful with the lids and clasps though during washing and handling because this type of plastic cannot be repaired if you break it.This fits a big need for those of us who frequently bring food to pot luck parties and is a fraction of the cost of replacing you car's carpeting and a deep clean after a big spill. Just ask my friend whose entire crock of lobster bisque spilled in the minivan...rated 5 stars = I Love It.

Thanks to the LED bulbs the arm which the bulbs are in is narrow and thin, this is a big difference from the former (older) lamps. I like the adjustable arm so you can move it to where you need light. However it does not throw light strongly over a large area of the desk and to get the light I need it must be on the highest setting; there are three brightness levels. I cannot see a reason to use the other two dimmer lamp settings since this is a desk lamp or task light.My original intent for this was for a better desk lamp for my husband as the ceiling fan's overhead light is too dim to read and do paperwork with however I like it best for a task light for knitting. I have been using it in the family room to light my hands holding the needles and yarn so I can see it well without the use of a strong whole room overhead lighting. The way the bar moves means I can angle the light to throw it just where I need it and there is no light getting in other family member's way of viewing the television. The room light can be off and I can use this desk lamp for my project.The base is heavy and the arm moves easily. The power cord is a separate piece. It seems pricey. I am rating this 4 stars due to the brightness having three levels and because I think the two lower levels are not suitable for any deskwork, reading, or crafting work.
Nothing in the Amazon product description explains this is about 1/5 the original book. I figured it out after buying it when I saw the publisher was Pearson ESL and I know what ESL means. Beware!

This is a tricky review to write and due to the title I am rating this book 4 stars = I LIke It. The book title promises 1600 practice test questions and yes, those are in the book. The font and layout is nice and non-cluttered. There is barely any strategy taught in this book, each test section has less than two pages of introduction or tips, then you take the tests. There is no review section as is normal with other test prep books (i.e. Kaplan, Barron's) but the title does not promise any review.However the online exclusives marketed on the cover are a bit deceptive. By purchasing the book you may register for a free online account. There you can take more quizzes (totaling 1100 more questions) and then it predicts your possible test score. There is an algorithm that leads you to practice taking more and more of the type of questions that you need to practice on, which is great.If you really want to review and learn the Grockit strategies and tips you will need to pay $99 to unlock the video library. I did not do that so I do not fully understand if other test practice work and what else is available or not available.The tagline "Grockit does not waste your time" is honestly, what all the companies do, they do a general practice of all topics then they tell you to study and focus on what you don't know. Nothing new there.Overall this is a slender book of 291 pages which is less intimidating and seems do-able compared to the Kaplan and others on the market.

Lacking from this book is general instruction and explanation about what a body butter is and how one would formulate a recipe but worse is her inclusion of fresh fruit into body butter which is a high risk for bacterial and mold contamination and therefore dangerous to use.This is only a compilation of 30 recipes, there is no base information or instruction for a general education on the topic. The ebook lacks a biography or explanation anywhere of who this author is and what her credentials are to justify her expertise in presenting these recipes. Even her author page on Amazon is skimpy and there it says she has a soap business and she teaches but no business name is given so it lacks credibility.Oddly the measurements vary from ounces to grams to volume, this should be standard and it is should be in weight not volume.There is no explanation of what an essential oil is, something very basic to include. She also refers to vanilla cookie essential oil which is impossible, that's a fragrance oil and any soap maker or skin product maker should know that.Also important is it never says she created these formulas, so I am starting to suspect she culled them from the internet. For example the recipes lack any cohesion. For examle some have 2 parts butter to 1 part coconut and 1 part light oil while another has 1:1 ratio of butter to coconut oil and another has 1/2 cup coconut oil to 2 Tbsp shea butter, this makes no sense! These are all different products that will not produce the same type of product in the end. In the beginning she says that body butters are "sticky, oily, and greasy" then on the next page she says that these are designed to absorb into the skin and NOT be greasy. Which is it?The grammar is poor and in broken English. Grammar errors also exist on her Amazon author page.I do not trust this book and will not be using these recipes.

I have been using a flat surface foam roller for a few years to work out tight back and hip muscles, it's good but not great. The GIAM RESTORE DEEP TISSUE MUSCLE MASSAGE FOAM ROLLER brings working out tight muscles and knots to a higher level. This is unbelievable. It has a hard plastic cylinder core which is super strong and does not bend or give under the body's weight. The surface is a hard foam with ridges intended to work out the adhesions and knots. It's amazing and I rate it 5 stars = I Love It. It also comes with a pamphlet with exercises to do with the roller but I am using it per my chiropractor's instructions to loosen my target areas using methods Gaiam did not include in the exercise list.

This probiotic blend was designed by Dr. David Permutter, neurologist and author of Grain Brain and Brain Maker. It is now known that inflammation starts in the digestive system and then moves on to affect the brain and mood. Dr. Permutter has released one formula for men and one for women. The men's has the same starting "base"  and the women's has two special strains for women's health.Garden of LIfe has released a new style bottle for this product where the entire bottle is lined with a dessicant. This allows the bottle to be stored at room temperature (is "shelf stable") instead of requiring use of a refrigerator. It is also good to know that the dose is one capsule a day and they are not horse pill sized.If you want to learn more about the microbiome and its affect on our health besides what Dr. Perlmutter's books, I suggest you read the new book The Microbiome Solution by Robynn Chutkan MD.This product is gluten-free, dairy free, soy free, and vegetarian. I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

This is a lovely cookbook of 100 recipes which are labeled which are gluten-free, vegan, and/or paleo. The foods covered are: breakfast, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, appetizers, soups, salads, side dishes, main dishes, and of course: desserts. The book is laid out artistically and the color photos are beautiful and tempting. There seem to be more recipes that are more contemporary than Betty Crocker, with a range of foods from around the world and some with bold flavors. A few are: layered beet and carrot salad, maple pickled ramps, and balsalmic carmelized onion pizza with arugula and maple drizzle. Some of the more plain American foods are: baked beans, maple ranch dressing, and maple walnut chocolate chunk cookies.I am a cookbook collector and when I lived in New England I taught myself to do backyard maple sugaring using books, and loved making my own maple syrup. Now that I live down south I buy the pure maple syrup from New England and enjoy cooking with it. I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

The first one our family bought of this product was the black color and I have been using it daily in the car for my iPhone for almost six months. The attachment of the wire area is stronger and more durable than the Apple brand's cord so it does not break. The first Amazon Basics cord I own is still perfect. I got this to use as a backup. This is a low cost and is durable so I rate it 5 stars = I Love It.

I was drawn to read this memoir because it was about how helicopter parenting and a sheltered privileged teen was left unprepared to protect herself and unable to advocate for herself correctly which hurt her and changed her intended life plans. I mostly wanted to read about what it felt like to be helicopter parented as that story and voice is not one we hear much about yet. The cover tells the gist of the book.I found the author's storytelling style engaging and interesting. I was never bored and wanted to know what happened next. Matis' path to healing is not one that many people will want to duplicate; she found peace and comfort in the wild as people were seen as a danger and a threat. Most Americans today are ignorant of nature and the wild and would fear such a journey. She was not that experienced and trekked with barely any gear, going against so many recommendations of what emergency equipment is necessary for backpacking. Trust in others cannot be praticed or lived in isolation so it makes sense that she learns that also on the trail when she connected and fell in love with a fellow through hiker on the trail.I rate this memoir 5 stars = I Love It.

This is my son's second pair of DC "fashion sneakers". They last about nine months of daily wear before they are full of holes in the cloth. They fit well and he has wide feet and these are fine for him. It's hard to find sizes and the right colors in stock in local stores so buying from Amazon was a convenient time saver.
This is a classic Lenox style. It's of high quality and sewn well. The color is more of a cream color than a bright white. Very nice so I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

This tutorial teaches how to use the TI-84, TI-84 Plus CE and TI-84 Plus C Silver Edition graphing calculators. The writing is clear and the objectives are outlined. You may skip around to learn something you must know right now or you can read it from front to back. The directions and information are in the formats of paragraphs, charts, illustrations and diagrams. Grayed boxes help short sections with tips pop out and stand apart from the longer sections.The purchase of the paperback book entitles you to also download all versions of the ebook. It will be convenient for use while away at college so the student doesn't have to bring the hardcopy book to campus.This teaches everything you need for high school math and to become proficient so you can use the calculator in the SAT. It's clear and straightforward. I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

Read the product title very carefully, it fooled me. I thought the silver colored part of the earring was rhodium stone clusters but it is sterling slver bumps of various sizes and on top of that are 5 stones randomly placed. The rhodium does not even catch the light to sparkle. The rhodium blends in completely with the sterling bumps unless you put your eye right up to it. The bumps look weird and cheap. I am really disappointed and rate these 2 stars = I Don't Like It.

Lumo Lift is a device you wear which prompts you to sit or stand with correct posture. It links to your smart phone and uses bluetooth to connect to update the data. When you create you account via the app on the phone you input your weight, height, gender and age. Lumo Lift tracks the number of steps taken in a day. This then calculates to a number of calories burned in a day. It is NOT a heart rate monitor. Thus if you exercise in some other manner your calories burned will not show on the app correctly. For example if you swim and burn 500 calories you would have to add up yourself. Also if you are active in another way you can get away with doing less than the 10K suggested steps walking in a day.TIps and ChallengesThe device is small and must be worn flat against the body a couple of inches  under your collarbone. You cannot wear it on loose clothing. Thus it is recommended to wear on the bra strap or the undershirt for men.It fits my regular bra perfectly but it does not fit on my sports bra. So fitness walking with my sports bra cannot count toward correct posture time (goal 4 hours a day) or toward steps taken (goal 10K steps a day).Use of the seat belt while in a vehicle can make the device fall off and get lost. Since you forget it is on, this can be a problem. It fell off me and down my shirt and fel to the ground when I got out of the car. So when driving you should wear it on the right side of the body and when a passenger, wear it on the left (or opposite of where the belt lies).Pros and CommentsLumo Lift cannot be felt when wearing under a bra strap so you forget it is on which seems to be a godo thing.  However  to switch it when getting in a car can be something you forget to do.Lumo Lift is customizable. It defaults to vibrate when you have sat for 2 minutes with slouching. You can shorten this.Every time you put it on you are supposed to align your body correctly the press it twice to caibrate it. I know I was slouching and it was not going off so I am confused by the imperfection of it. For example if you just do not have your shoulders back it does not consider that slouching.If you lean back or lean to the side to lean on a couch or chair it reads that as slouching. It will keep vibrating every two minutes. The solution is to press it three times to mute the vibration. Then when you are back to typical sitting posture or standing you would double click it to recalibrate it and wake it up.The directions did not say how to power it off (for bedtime). I read online you just lay it down horizontally and it shuts itself off.It comes with a silver square magnet and a black one as well as the bra strap. These magnets are what holds it to your bra or tight shirt. If wearing it on an external surface that people see they would see a little square on your shirt. This is less obtrusive than the Fit Bit wrist band. If your shirt is skin tight there would be a little bump seen.On the morning of day three I was prompted by the app to charge the battery. They said it would last five days but apparently it does not. The battery takes two hours for full charage. It comes with a USB charger that you plug into your own AC plug or into any USB port to charge (computer or back of the TV - a good tip for hotel stays).I suggest you write a cheat sheet of number of presses for what action and keep it near you until you have it memorized.I rate this 4 stars due to the shorter battery life and it being imperfect about signaling poor posture. It is a training and awareness tool for a specific purpose. I love the idea of this as I have aways been a sloucher and this is a gentle prompt to help make a behavior and physical change. Lacking the pulse heart rate montior does not make this on equal standing to the Fit Bit. It's not a Fit Bit plus posture coach. (The Fit Bit can be edited in the app to add your other physical activity for an accurate calories burned count and you can add foods eaten to track calories in and calories out).

This stapler works great on large stacks of paper of 8-50 sheets. It did not work on sheets of 7 or less; the staples did not close. This stapler is plastic and lightweight except for the mechanical parts which are metal. I think the stapler being lightweight is easier on the hand muscles and joints especially when doing a series of stapling.  I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

This is a print on canvas that is mounted on a wooden frame. It does not have a hanger mounted on it nor do they give you one, you must provide one and install it yourself before this can be hung up.I am a fan of Banksy and this is a portion of the original photograph image of the site, the full image you can view by seaching "There's Always Hope" which has a dark area above the girl, the edge of a stairway ledge which provides a visual focal point for movement across it and contains the handwritten words by Banksy, "There's always hope". That is also offered as a print and to be honest I think the visual of the entire "piece" is better than the closeup and I like that written message.I rate this 4 stars for quality of product. I feel the price is pretty steep for the size of the print. Also it's really cheap to not provide us with the hardware to hang it or have that already mounted on the back.

These SteelSeries Siberia X300 are indeed comfortable and lightweight. You can almost not feel them while wearing them. The downside is the faux leather can make you sweat when wearing them for five hours or more. However, when not wearing them for that long they are fine. The sound quality of the game is great and hearing the voices of the other gamers talking is a good volume. The microphone is adjustable so you can put it at the right spot for best pickup of your voice when you speak. The adapter is poor quality and only worked three times then we had to replace it with a new one we purchased (we chose another brand). We have been using these for over three months, I updated this review to rate them a 5 = I Love It because compared to other brands this is the most lightweight and most comfortable due to the headband that distributes the weight properly.

I assumed this was large enough to make grounds for a pot of typical American coffee or at least for my 32 oz. French Press with one cycle but I was wrong. The unit itself is small and it comes apart to make it ideal for travel. The amount of grounds it makes was made to suit the Aeropress, which is a new variation of a French Press. The Aeropress uses a specific water temperature (175 degrees F), a different stirring duration (10 seconds) then no wait to steep but a 20-30 second long plunge. The screen size of the Aeropress and the technique, temperature and grounds size creates what is supposed to be the most superior tasting and low acid coffee ever.To use this took some time. I did not mind the hand grinding but suddenly realized how much easier it is to use the electric grinder (albeit its imperfection). Using the Tanors Ceramic Burr Manual grinder is more like a labor of love process that you should feel it a part of the experience and just accept it, kind of like accepting that to clean and cut fresh vegetables just takes certain steps that cannot be rushed or skipped through. That you might be able to use a food processor but after the hand washing and prep of the vegetable why bother and just proceed with manual cutting with a knife.If you want to use the Aeropress get this burr grider. The beans come out nice and consistently ground. There are two settings for fine or coarse. The device is well made and was designed in Germany.On a side note I was researching the new cold brew method of coffee making and it uses three times the quantity of beans that a French Press uses to make 32 oz of cold brew uses 3/4 of a cup of grounds. Thus the lazy way of making a low acid coffee uses more beans. People who care about not wasting a precious resource and who worry about labor conditions in the other countries where coffee beans are grown, and about travel cost and not being very "green" in the whole process, if they care about natural and human resources and being sustaiable and not exploiting other humans or nature, they would use a method to make coffee that would not waste the beans. Point being if you want all that use this grinder an an Aeropress for low acid, great tasting coffee.

The low price was tempting but they are far from ideal. The headset is lightweight but they make you itch so they are not comfortable. The microphone is terrible and other gamers complain they cannot hear what is being said. To explain: usually headsets have a flexible arm that you move toward your mouth with the microphone at the end. This X100 does not have that, it's a mic on the headset itself so it is not near your mouth.This is the issue with headsets: should you pay under $100 but have a set with serious issues, because you are on a tight budget and feel that under $100 is what is best for your finances, only to find out they are horrible and not fully functioning? Or should you pay $150 or more for something that fully works, is comfortable and has great sound quality. I understand not everyone wants to spend over $100 but really to pay this price for what these are seems overpriced and a waste to be honest.I rate these 2 stars = I Don't Like It

These shipping tags are exactly what Avery says they are. They are cardstock tags with a reinforced hole and a double wire for attaching. I use these for mixed media artwork. No complaints, I rate this 5 stars = I Love It.

This case is slippery on the sides and it is heavy. It does not hold a charge and is useless after three full uses (charging the unit, using it, then recharging). After this debacle and it not being a low cost either we have decided to go with an external battery instead of a case. This was a total waste of money.Update: I contacted MaxBoost customer service, the only way they let you is by online submission form. They wrote back and said they told me to to mail it back to them but they never got it. Well I never got the first email. Anyhow they said to mail it back with a tracking number and they will replace it but they are not providing me with a mailing address for the return. It is not on their website or in their FAQ. Customer service fail! I wrote back twice, let's see if they reply with the information this time.

This is a sturdy steel rack with a black porcelain coating. It is made in China and mine does not sit flat, it was constructed imperfectly and off kilter. I rate this 4 stars = I Like It as it works great at high temperatures in our Big Green Egg. I would have liked it if the open areas were smaller.For the purpose of this review I compared with other STEEL porcelain coated roasting racks on the market for price and design. There are many which are not steel available at lower prices. I found one that was steel and black colored but it only said "nonstick coating". Certain other popular nonstick treatments for cookware would not withstand use at high temperatures on a Komando style grill, so that's an issue. Some have even larger open areas which is not good for ribs. The only other that I found with this same style was 33% more expensive than this one.

Holds 5 full iPhone charges. Dirt cheap. Heavy but I do not carry it on my person 24/7. I do not use it daily. I charge it every 3 weeks.Works great for Ingress players whose batteries get sapped by the app.

One of my two cats had been drinking less water and ended up in the pet ER on a holiday weekend for dehydration. He had been peeing outside the box and the start of a chronic common kidney problem was detected. In follow-up our vet pushed hard for me to rush out and buy a fountain which she said the cats love and it would encourage drinking. There were cheaper ones but they were ugly and I knew we would have to look at it. I also wondered of other ones that were plastic (not ceramic like this) would impart an off taste to the water.The cat who needed it is scared to death and will not use it. So it was a waste. I should have bought one for a quarter f the price to test if they would use it.The other cat loves it but the fountain is a pain to deal with. She splashes water out of it for play and I had to rig a mat system. It was hard to find a spot where people (mostly guests) would not walk into it. You have to monitor the water and refill a few times a day. My house is dry due to the AC or heat running every day of the year due to living in humid Houston. If the water gets too low the motor can burn out and break. The cat who likes it is not discriminating so we do not need this.Oh and the fussy cat, I discovered, just hates the tap water taste. I give a couple in ounces of Spring water and he loves it. I just out a new 2 oz a few times a day and he drinks that. Or he drinks from the toilet!
