Go figure!One more tip: a cat behavior book I read said to out the water not near their food dish.Thus fountain was an expensive thing to buy to not be able to use. Since it was used I did not feel it qualified for a refund return.

This is a gripper tool to lift a grill grate out of the grill. The fact that it is metal means you can now remove the grill when the grill lis still hot and not burn your hand. Prior to having this tool when absolutely necessary we lifted the hot grill grate with a pair of food tongs which did not hold it correctly, it wobbled, and sometimes resulted in a dropped grate, or we waited until it was cold to do cleaning and moving ash or charcoal tasks. When picking up a cold dirty grate with your bare hand it is messy. This grill gripper helps a lot. The metal is easy to clean.This is a simple design and it's effective so I will rate it 5 stars = I Love It.

I have been using this for 2 years. You spray it on towel dried hair then style. What I love it is really does help your hair do the style you want and it holds it there but without touching your scalp (unless you spray it right onto your scalp). There is not glop as with gels. Unlike mousses it does not go on thick or coat the scalp. You just spray it where you want it and as much or as little as is needed. I do use hair spray afterwards on some occasions where I know I will be in the wind or when I want it to stay perfect such as for formal events. For everyday I do not use hairspray. This was recommended to me by my hair stylist. I thought the full retail price was expensive but I hardly use any so the bottle lasted me well over a year!

Was this meant to be comedy?It is no wonder that Miliam treatment centers themselves don't tell their inmates about this book. It is hilariously bad and nonsensical throughout. I mean, a new book by their Guru, you world think, especially after all of these years, would be seen as a big deal, yes? A huge deal? Epic?(Insert sound of crickets here). Nothing. They don't talk about this book. I do not wonder why, having none read it carefully. It is a fishing trip.I especially love the part (sarcasm) where he slams the co-author of his other fishing trip, Under the Influence, because she dared to write a book on nutrition that this little Napoleon didn't approve of. He flat out states that he only used her for her writing skills and only because she allowed him to bully her.I can go on all day about this passive aggressive (against AA mainly) masterpiece on how not to write a book on addiction, but I won't as it isn't worth any more of my time.Reckless is a gentle way to describe it.Miliam is retired now but his legacy runs quite a treatment center scam in the Seattle area. I wouldn't even know where to begin in trying to describe this program of theirs which is designed from the ground up to generate repeat business.P.S. The photos I have attached to this review show that I have in my possession his way out of print "ECCA" as well as a first printing hardcover of his other book, "Under the Influence". I posted these pictures so that you would know, dear reader, that I am not just someone who is talking smack against this or any other Milam work. Since I reference these two works in a comment to this review, replying to someone who claims to be Milam himself, I wanted to prove that I actually do have them in my possession, that I am not lying. Both works are very rare. In fact, the ECCA is practically impossible to find-- even a casual read of ECCA makes it pretty clear that this rarity is probably quite deliberate. Now then, that being said, I am not trying to attack the man, but I am definitely attacking his work. They are reckless and dangerous works in my opinion, an opinion which I am allowed to have, when taken out of context in the deliberately prejudicial way that they are presented to the reader.This isn't a review so much as it is a warning. Stay clear of this joker. He HAS been thoroughly debunked and is running quite a treatment center scam in the state of Washington, which is a state with VERY LAX laws on this sort of thing. In WA, almost anyone can call themselves a "treatment specialist" or whatnot. It's a "wild west" thanks to the Hughes Act and poor state laws on this subject. Relentlessly terrible treatment centers are quite a racket in WA, causing all sorts of damage to the few respectful, legitimate sources of true recovery that are still available.Thank you for reading. :)P.P.S. For anyone interested, William R. Miller (Emeritus Distinguished Professor of Psychology and Psychiatry at the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque) and Ernest Kurtz (RIP Ernie, he passed away recently and is very much missed by many including myself-- author of "Not God" which is ISBN-10: 0894860658 and ISBN-13: 978-0894860652, etc.), two EXTREMELY respected authors, archivists and researchers in the fields of alcoholism, addiction, psychology and psychiatry, temperance movement history and much more?Well, they got together and wrote a paper called "Models of Alcoholism Used in Treatment - Contrasting A.A. and Other Models with Which it is Often Confused". Milam is prominently discussed within it. Actually, I am being nice. He is actually pretty thoroughly debunked (read: torn to shreds) by it. Much of Milam's rhetoric is deeply dismantled, piece by piece, in it. This fascinating article is 100% free and can be downloaded in PDF here: hindsfoot.org/tcek08.pdfIt is quite enlightening.
Why Glock doesn't give you these as standard dumbfounds me.It really is the perfect finishing touch.
A great bargain and it worked perfectly. 13 months for well less than the normal price of 12. How can you go wrong?

Perfect. Great quality and they do not jam. Reliability makes them worth every penny at twice the price. And yet, they are a great value.Whenever I did buy cheap staples I have always regretted it. No more. Just drop some of these in and go to town. :)

I already own over half of their games. They are an absolute joy to play.They are worth the money normally but as a FAOTD this are a must-download.Don't miss this. If you like puzzle games at all you will most certainly enjoy it. :)

I absolutely love this game.Very well written and the computer is very clever indeed!some different game mode I am still exploring but I am having enough fun with the default as it is. Contains flurry analytics (I am done worrying about Flurry because frankly they are among the least of the analytical evils out there) and amazon game circle but I find no adware, spyware or malware and so the app is safe to install.Enjoy this game especially while it is the free app of the day. :)

I bought a bunch of these because I have a lot of microphones.They do come in a package that has been vacuum sealed so they are distorted and miss shaped when you first take them out of the package. They also smell when you first take them out. But this problem was easily remedied: I washed them in some Woolite and let them air dry. Now they are in perfect shape and smell wonderful.They are well constructed and obviously durable.Have no fear if you purchase these; you will be happy with your decision to do so.

I already have a nice qi pad. I bought some spare batteries for my Note 3 (a phone I will die with because I will NEVER give up an SD slot and removable batteries!) And stuck these onto them. Now not only do.I have spares but charging the battery that is in the phone is as simple as setting the phone down. I love it. And I do not have to worry about breaking the microSD charging port on the phone either.Awesome.

Not only does this add valuable trace minerals and electrolytes back to water that has been subjected to, say, reverse osmosis or even strong filtering, but this also makes it taste amazing-- like expensive mineral water.Win/win!

I don't even know where to begin. This app gives Android so much power to do so many advanced networking applications that it has become indispensable on all of my devices.Of course it isn't for everyone. Most people would have no idea what most of these options are. But that is okay. They don't have to . The fact that an app like this even exists literally doubles the power of Android as far as I'm concerned. You don't even have to root your device to be able to use most of the protocols here.I often use the FTP server and I love to use the web server for portable prototyping, for examples.And so much more.Wonderful! Genius. 5 stars!
A brilliant work in every way. Pulls no punches and is fascinating in the extreme.

Let's face it, "Fa(s)t Food" isn't really food at all, and surely we all have seen tragic examples of what this stuff can do to people, right?That being said, this app is a godsend for those who, by choice or by desperation, find ourselves in these dens of nutritional inequity.With this app, it is at least possible to try to separate the lesser evils from the 7th Layer (burritos) from Hades and at least have a Layer One or Two quickie.Well designed, informative and better than what the chemists that make this filth are willing to make convenient for us to figure out. Odd, isn't it how until now only the "food" was convenient?Props to the developers for gathering, organizing, facing and then "delivering" this information to us in this manner. I just hope that they didn't gain too much weight by osmosis in doing so ;)5 stars!

II want to also attest that, as a user of this product for years, the "new" formula is absolutely terrible. By removing the enzyme system and replacing it with what looks like (more) glycerin it is quite obvious to me that this new owner of the brand is trying to save money by making as cheap of a formula as possible-- and those that the old formula helped can be damned.Also, the current description is misleading in part and more true than they care to admit in part. Here is the bullet-point description:-Plastic-A soothing mouthwash that cleans and refreshes the mouth-Gently cleans a dry mouth, moisturizing minor irritation-Alcohol-free and refreshes the mouth without burning-Helps protect against the odors associated with dry mouth-Uses the LP3 salivary enzyme-protein systemOn point 1: YES, it DOES taste like plastic now.On the last point: Deceptive advertising as this enzyme system has been REMOVED and no longer exists in the product, thus making it worthless....and it really DOES taste like plastic now.When I noticed that they changed the formula I stocked up. I was lucky enough to be able to do so. But I use it so sparingly now because I dread running out of it and do not know what to replace it with. This corporation has NO conscience for doing this to us! It's clearly a money grab. Why would they ruin such a great product like this and then IGNORE our complaints other than to reply with COOKIE CUTTER responses? Of course they want us to CALL. THAT wouldn't be documented like this.To all: please write your own reviews and keep it up! Maybe we can finally help this shameless company see what damage they are doing in the name of PROFIT.ONE star is one too many.P.S. They ruined the entire line of products, not just this one. BEWARE.

What an annoying app! They really normally charge for this? Even as the FAOTD, who wants a weather app that crashes so often (about once in every 3 launches for me where even one is one too many)  and nags for ratings, etc. when it does decide to run?Absolutely terrible. No thank you. Not in a paid app. No way, not ever.

I do love Tunein Radio as well especially but that is for everything NON Clear Channel. This app, owned by Clear Channel last I checked, is pretty much only their media and holdings, all on one place. Not bad for what it is.It is my 'go to' for listening into KFI Los Angeles. :)No complaints. The app works fine. I used app ops to turn off some of its permissions and feel like I can listen without being watched.

A combination of 2048 style gameplay with a nod to Tetris.Quite challenging in that one must think carefully as well as think ahead in order to complete the puzzles and advance. I find myself having to truly focus and even think a few moves ahead (nods to chess) in order to succeed on most puzzles.Not many puzzle games actually exercise the mind to this degree. I can see those who like puzzle games to be easy becoming frustrated fast. But this is not the developer's fault. Someone has to make the games for those of us who like a real chess-level challenge and Noodlecake has delivered.Grab this especially as the FAOTD.No adware. No addons. No spyware. Just clean code in a challenging puzzle game.5 stars!

I want to love this app but it contains one major flaw: IF you are going to call this an office calculator with "paper tape" then you need to make said 'tape' printable and exportable into useful formats (such as Excel or formatted .RTF or whatever) so that the 'tape' becomes more than just eye candy novelty.In the real world, the tape on an office calculator (and this developer DID name the app as such) is a critical part of looking for mistakes if there are any and is used to validate correct calculations over the course of the entire project. It is quite literally the paper trail.It blows my mind that there is no easy way to print or export the tape out of this so-called "Office Calculator PRO" app. In fact, not being able to print or to sensibly export the tape is a showstopper. -2 stars due to this easily fixable flaw that people have complained about for years and that the developer can't seem to be bothered to address.Very poor customer relations when multiple requests for a critical but unimplemented feature is ignored.
I have yet to find a better bulk deal on the name brand stuff.This is it. Look no further. Buy it. :)

What a great deal! However, I almost docked one star because they weren't even placed in a bag first, they were just tossed into an envelope. Why oh why would they do that!I'd rather pay a few cents more for the bag.Please? You can't just toss these around! Kitties won't stand for it! ;)
GREAT value! Absolutely required in any first aid kit.

The best tasting salt in the world, and the best for you, too. Unprocessed, contains the trace minerals and a bit of iron (that's why it is pink) and ground to perfection. They even give you some free sand. Yes, it's that pure. :)I salt load with it and it has replaced all salt in the house. We even use it in the bath.

I add this to my alkaline ionized water. It remineralizes it and tastes fantastic! I don't use 40 drops though. Instead, I "micro dose" with it. I can definitely feel the difference. But have patience. It takes time for the body to become happy again. At first it won't even believe you and will hoard the supplement (or so it seems) and will only release it to your system once it's convinced it won't starve again. Just a theory of course but it sure does seem that way.

I MUCH prefer the 2% because I can just use two drops instead of one and when I only WANT to use one, I have that choice. 5% also gives me chemical burns transdermally. This does not.It is also a much better value in terms of price if you do the math and iodine is what you are after. Who cares if it is more concentrated when you get so much more bang for the buck at 2%? 5% is way overpriced anyway.I apply this, let it dry, then lightly coat with pure coconut oil. No harm to the skin whatsoever.This is wonderful stuff! I use it alongside Nascent, so that my body doesn't have to work so hard converting one form into another. I just give it what it wants by letting it distribute the different types of iodine as it sees fit. And I ONLY supplement transdermally! Why would I take this internally and kill off my GOOD intestinal bacteria as well? IN most cases, that seems silly. Applying it on my skin allows my body to bypass my digestion, take what it wants and distribute it as it sees fit. Much better, I think.This is the best brand I have found and this is the best deal on four bottles.Recommended! :)

OUTSTANDING BOOK!There is not much that I can say that wouldn't be an echo. I just wanted to say thank you out loud to Carolyn Dean for this amazing, incredible book which has helped myself and my family in such a large degree that I don't even know how to elaborate.EVERYONE is deficient in magnesium pretty much. Read this book to find out not only the scope of it, but what you can do about it.Getting magnesium back into my system is a game changer. I cannot believe I suffered as long as I did without it!
Clever clever clever! Allowed me to put my newer SIM cards into my older phones when I need to (like when I drop my Note 3 and have to repair it, ugh!).These are useful. Great to have around.

Buy this, then buy the 15ml bottles I also reviewed, then put this into those. MUCH less evaporation. More bang for your buck.And Nascent Iodine is a game-changer. It's absolutely amazing. Read up on it and don't take my advice. I just know that there is no way I'd ever let myself run out of this stuff, but you make up your own mind.And if you do buy? Again, transfer to smaller bottles. Much less evaporation. The air in the bottle becomes more and more of a problem as the bottle becomes more and more empty. This is such a deal though. And the 15ml bottles are reusable. It's all good.

Absolutely required if you like to plink with hyper-velocity like I do. No worries about a cracked block in THIS 10/22! :)Easy to install and quite durable. No lockups, no FTFs (other than the usual), no FTEs (other than the usual). In fact, I'm still on my first one after a few thousand rounds and at least a brick of hyper-velocity on top of it. The gun just keeps running and running like a 10/22 should.These buffers allow me to be a plinking fool with peace of mind. And peace of mind doesn't often come cheap these days.Highly recommended!

Simply the best ionic form I have found. Selenium is very important but be careful with it, one CAN overdose! I also buy the ionic Boron from this company and it is amazing quality as well.Recommended!P.S. Bonus: re-use the bottles when you're done! They rock!

The best deal around for the only real solution I have ever found for my magnesium deficiency.Yes I know, Ancient Minerals would rather sell you the "oil" and they may even have a point that theirs is better processed, but making my own still works great for me and my family and the benefits are huge.Don't waste these flakes by dumping them en masse into your bath, either. If you are rich enough to do that, give some to me instead because I am not (lol). But even if you have the money to burn on this, why waste these flakes when there are better ways to get the benefits from them? Please, do keep reading:While soaking, just put about a teaspoon on your damp but exposed arm, leg, stomach, whatever and let them melt. Gently spread the "oil" and let it soak in for about 20 minutes or so. If it is too irritating for you, bail by rinsing, then just put on the oil after you leave the tub. Or put oil on while in the tub instead and rinse it off after 20 minutes.If you do the above, these bags will last you a long, long time and become and even better value then they already are by buying 32 lbs. at a time (offered elsewhere here on Amazon). You can save some money that way.

For some reason, the local brick and mortar stores carry the green ones. They are much larger than these. Lots of people tell me that I have a big mouth but it isn't that big! These are perfect. Far better than toothpicks. These are shaped to fit. Just be gentle with them. Put one in your mouth first and let it get "primed" and it will become much more flexible (and durable). Then go to town.

The best deal around for the only real solution I have ever found for my magnesium deficiency.Yes I know, Ancient Minerals would rather sell you the "oil" and they may even have a point that theirs is better processed, but making my own still works great for me and my family and the benefits are huge.Don't waste these flakes by dumping them en masse into your bath, either. These are just perfect. These are great for alcohol based tinctures (like nascent iodine) because the smaller bottles allow for less evaporation. Just buy the big bottles of whatever you buy, and save money doing that, but THEN load the contents of them into these. Your mileage will greatly increase because as the large bottles get more empty, the alcohol in the tincture will evaporate into the air of the bottle itself. Thus, every time you open the larger bottle, you increase the evaporation rate, which only gets worse and worse as the bottle becomes more and more empty.Smaller bottles go a long, long way towards solving this problem. Fill up a few of these with the contents of your bigger bottle instead and you will notice a huge difference in how much use you get out of the tincture over time.Try it. :)And buy these. They are a great deal. They rock! :)

These work and work well BUT they really are made of glass it seems. It doesn't take much to chip or crack them. But hey, begtter them than the screen, right?Gorgeous when applied to your phone. They fit almost perfectly but are a bit small. No matter, just center them. They do work really well. My first one lasted about a month, until I accidentally dropped my keys on to the phone from about one foot away -- this cracked the guard. Hairline crack. No matter. At this price, easy enough to just replace.Buy a few. This price sure is right. I personally like them a lot better than regular screen protectors and all of the bubbles they come with.Four stars. They shouldn't be THIS fragile. But maybe I shouldn't be so rough on my phone either?
EXTREMELY high quality at a GREAT price! What more could I ask for?

Interesting escape game. A bit harder than the usual ones that I figure out in a flat 3 minutes per screen. Yes, this works the same as they all do: 1) click like mad until something happens. 2) Take note of what happened 3) When things stop happening, put together the pieces and figure out the escape code.That being said, if you're into this genre (and I do enjoy it myself from time to time) I've seen far, far worse. As the FAOTD (as I write this), this is a no-brainer. Try it out, you may enjoy it.The graphics look hand drawn and I really like them.Absolutely NO permissions. DOES advertise other games by the developer which you have to click out of to exit the game but at least the game does have an exit. I'm not annoyed by this, in fact, I welcome it. I think that this app proves that it is possible to advertise your other works in a paid game without grabbing permissions that the app does not need.Recommended!

JUST SAY NO. Please do not support this business model. IAP in a paid game is nothing short of double dipping and it is downright greedy and sick.Please, vote with your wallet, please do not support this sort of model. If we don't vote with our feet, they will never get the message.Removing this from my device and library. No, thank you, Ubisoft.
...but I cannot support a developer who is either a) lazy or b) trying to double dip by monetizing an already paid game.JUST SAY NO!
This doesn't slowly chew through the piston seals. It works very well. A little goes a long way!
I use this to hook up a condenser mic to my recording PC. Low noise and high quality. No complaints!
I take these when I am not taking the Immune formula during Flu season. The quality is top notch and this is an outstanding supplement.
Since taking a course of these this part winter, everyone around me caught everything that was going around-- except me.This was the difference. I know it.

Docked one star for undisclosed the Flurry analytics add on which is embedded in the app. Developer: please DISCLOSE THIS STUFF!There is another version of this game called "Smuggle Truck". It is identical save for a different um, theme, and graphics that to some may be seen as very politically incorrect-- but being from Los Angeles myself,  I have to admit that I like that version better (and that is all I an going to say, just Google it if interested).In this version, you tilt your device to control the angle of your truck while touching your screen to accelerate. The idea is to get from point A to point B safely without  bouncing around so much that you lose passengers. Of course there is more, much more, as the have is loaded with various missions.This is a ton of fun and it truly deserves five stars. However, no developer of a paid app will get five stars from me when they show disrespect for their customers by installing third party addonsb that are known to violate our privacy and without disclosure.Fix this, Owlchemy Labs and you willl get five stars from me.

It is so hard to find these in stores anymore and I wonder why? Luckily I can still order them here.I plan to stock up. These are better than any toothpick AND any gum massager, all in one perfect sliver.Grab these and stock up!

One of his earliest works, a book written by a child that I have not fully digested in over 20 years of studying it.Every single time I read it and I have read it over one hundred times, I get more out of it.What more needs to be said? This is an incredible work.

First off, this app contains only the usual Amazon add-ons and they don't scare me.  I can find no strange behavior with third party servers or anything so I would not equate any of it with adware or spyware.Okay then, as for the game, it reminds me in a way of a classic arcade game called Jungle King/Hunt. In that game, you would swing on a vine/rope through increasingly more dangerous environments with the prize being a girl in a cauldron that you got to save, hooray! ;)Sound familiar?That being said, this is not a bad thing. This is an instant death type get as far as you can game which is all the rage nowadays. It plays well, is quite fun, iseasy enough to control (tap to launch a rope in midair and time it so that you connect with something) and the difficulty ramps up fast but not too fast.The game keeps track of the furthest distance you have ever made it so far and I admit to a certain satisfaction when I can surpass my previous best. Now isn't that the essence of replayability?I can find NO fault with this and happily grant it five stars.Download it and enjoy it, especially for free. But even at price? This is a keeper!

Holds a charge about as good as the original OEM battery. I may come back here and remove stars if the longevity proves the battery defective, but for now I would declare this to be an excellent buy if you are looking to replace your battery.
A little goes a long way! The only way that I can describe this fragrance is "pure female". It has an absolutely heavenly scent!

The first thing this game did was try to get my location.Ummm... No.As for the game itself, I spent about 15 minutes with it and am over it besides, for the controls are just too awkward to actually enjoy the game. I don't need to elaborate other than to say that the "fun factor" just is not there.Regardless, we must not support developers who are so willing to ask for permissions that they have no need to ask for legitimately. They are selling the game already! They should not EVEN try to double dip! It is WRONG!
This is for when the Mancs come to town, especially. :)

First of all, this is merely a game, and not a good one at that. Don't expect to actually learn any songs like the description claims.What really annoys me though is the huge FULL VERSION banner on the splash screen which one sees right before the ads to buy more songs in more "full version" apps. This is done in a shallow attempt to hide the fact that this is nothing more than an IAP (in-app purchasing) workaround which bypasses any IAP settings one may have.Shady developers must be called out. Mission accomplished. One star is one too many. Developer? Get a clue.

It is called "double dipping" and I believe it to be pathetic. I already detest the "freemium" so-called business model, but when a developer not only charges a pretty high price for such an average game but then has the nerve to use that business model on top of it? It disgusts me. Avoid this app like the plague even as the FAOTD.And please try not to support the "freemium" business model either. Think about it, WHAT mobile game is ever ever worth this kind of money??

Combine this with XnExpress Pro and add text functions, etc. and then this would be something special. As it sits, it is a clear attempt to sell us deliberately gimped apps so that they can sell us pieces of the whole instead.This seems to just be a sneaky way to avoid in- app purchasing by simply dividing full apps in half and selling us the pieces.No thanks. There is so much better out there, even for free. The value just isn't here.

A permissions nightmare! Here is a list of the ones that individually and in combination are quite suspect.  Read from external storage  Allows sending in-app billing requests and managing in-app billing transactions  Open network sockets  Access information about Wi-Fi networks  Access the list of accounts in the Accounts Service  Read the user's contacts data  Access information about networks  Allows an application to receive messages via Google Cloud MessagingReally? No thank you.Besides, I played the game on a sand boxed copy of Android and frankly, it's boring. Jump around and knock stuff over. Over and over again. But that is beside the point. There is NO EXCUSE for all of these permissions for a GAME. NONE.And for good measure, the developer included some ad network code without disclosure, as well.SO yourself a favor, even as the FAOTD... don't just run... POUNCE away from this mess of an app!

As a photographer (by that I mean I have gear, will and do travel and have been paid to do it) I can only wish that a reference like this was available when I was first starting out.Explains often tricky concepts beautifully. Nothing to dig through to get to the useful information. No filler. Well organized. Expertly composed.I highly recommend this app. It is quite useful and informative. I also love how they tossed in EV and DOF charts as a bonus. Nice touch!5 stars!

There is so much wasted potential in this way too short, dreadfully easy (even at the hardest level) too simple game. Just a bit more effort could have really exploited the story. The game just screams for more levels, enemies, skills to earn, etc.It took me all of two hours to plow through it and then tried the hard level. I stopped halfway through because it just wasn't hard.This game reeks of potential. As it sits it is only worth a play as a free app but just doesn't have the value to justify the normal asking price.It is a five star game that never happened. I have no choice but to rate it low because of the lack of value for the money. Add content. Add more worlds. Add more of everything and it will earn more stars.

This app just is not ready for primetime. I tried to convert multiple files in multiple formats and the behavior was always the same: pretty much anything that is not dead simple will not convert properly. Most times, entire pages do not get converted or text will be missing in the output file.What good is a conversion app that doesn't work and that cannot be trusted? Answer: it's not.Avoid.

They took a game that was already a privacy invasion before the "revamp" and have turned it into a privacy invading nightmare. It is not even worth elaborating on at this point but suffice it to say, they have ruined it.
Will not even install on a Galaxy Note 3. For shame for shame. What is the point of making this the FAOTD?

If you put the iron ball into the cannon in scene 6 before you pick up the pieces next to it you will no longer be able to pick up the pieces next to it and then can not advance in the game. I'm not starting over just to find another bug after wasting a few hours of my time. Game over.

Remarkably similar to a classic 8 bit game called Arkanoid. Runs absolutely beautifully on every device I have tried it on, including my old motorola droid 1 that I tried it on just for fun. No permissions issues to speak of and no embedded third party code of note. This is an excellent game and it plays wonderfully. A great value at price, but as a free app of the day it is a no brainer. 5 stars!

There is terrible collision detection so if you go all the way to the right to where the castle door is you can go right through it and then go below the world or above it, or even completely off the screen.The rest of this so called simulation is just so bad that it is laughable.Really really really really bad.Seriously, this is terrible and I can't believe that somebody would normally charge money for this. As a free app of the day, it's still not worth it.You will never be able to unsee this so please do not even bother to look.

TIM is one of my favorite games of all time. I was thus, of course, skeptical of this when I downloaded it. I must say I am pleasantly surprised!This is a physics puzzler, very very much like The Incredible Machine, except that you use various items in order to somehow collect the three stars that are on the screen. The puzzles I have worked through are clever indeed and I must say that it is nice to see Rovio not milking their now very tired Angry Birdies franchise anymore. This is a good effort, even if it isn't nearly as original as AB was when it was first released.I am still enjoying this much and find no fault with it.Contains Flurry Analytics, which I believe should be disclosed by developers... so when they don't, I will.

I believe it is doing it because it is using the Adobe AIR library. However, in the interest of full disclosure and since this is a children's app, I think parents should know that the app is doing this. The reason for it may be entirely benign but I think you will agree that a children's app should not be tracking your location, especially a full version app. It's a shame too as it appears to be a very good app. But until we know why it is behaving this way I have to rate it at only three stars as an alert. If the developer explained this behavior I will change my review accordingly.However, I felt it necessary to warn parents that this is happening.The tool that I used to see this behavior in this case is a program called Xprivacy and it needs a rooted device to work.

I'm not sure this is worth a dollar in its current state however I happened to get it for free today for some reason when I stumbled upon it and saw that it was free.I thought I would give it a try. Now while the interface is extremely basic and looks like it was written for Android 2.1 or earlier, the information, which is of course the core purpose of this app IS accurate and valid.So, as long as this is free it is a five star app to me. But for money, I would think this app needs a little bit more polish and maybe some more information and data--  especially in the compounds section.But for free, this is wonderful. 5 stars when free. 4 stars when not.
Fantastic! The batteries work great once broken in and the charger is of nice quality. I am happy and would buy again if I ever need more.

Made VERY poorly. The proprietary power plug on the back is so poorly constructed that the plug will not even go in all of the way. It easily disconnects which is not only annoying but very bad for both the computer and the drive itself.The "cooling" fan is so bad it scrapes against itself and makes a loud whirring and banging noise as it turns.The front bezel snapped in half when I was gingerly trying to slide it off to put a drive in.Seriously, this thing is a piece of junk and this company should be ashamed of themselves.AVOID!

Way, WAY too difficult. The game controls sluggishly yet is extremely unforgiving-- a frustrating combination indeed.As a "bonus," both Flurry analytics and Flurry advertising code are embedded in this "pro" app without any disclosure. Well, if they won't disclose, then I will.This isn't worth the trouble, even as a FAOTD. I recommend you just skip this one.

An educational app should have its facts straight. And no mention of the exoplanets is also a huge negative.I do love the graphics and for that I give one extra star but an educational app that is inaccurate or incomplete is simply not working. I cannot recommend something that teaches facts wrong, ultimately.

I have to give a couple stars because the developer is very responsible in that there is no embedded adware or anything on under the hood of this app.The game itself is a simple two-stage puzzle game were you pick the words out of a basic grid and then rearrange those words into the quote. Sounds fun and it would be, except: Both phases are very very easy and I blew through about 20 puzzles in less than 20 minutes.The game definitely needs some more difficulty. ANY difficulty would be nice.I can't give this more than three stars because it really is too easy. I'd rather read a presidential quotations book and relax into those then to do a mind-numbingly simple puzzle just to get to the next quote.It's a great idea but it needs a lot more.
Has some pictures of one of my ex girlfriends and a show that I booked once.What's not to love? :)

While It's a great concept, and an easy design to set up, I simply cannot give this grill a positive review.  It's just too flimsy.  My unit arrived with the locking mechanism of one of the risers broken, so it cannot be carried by the shoulder strap or handle the way it is supposed to be carried, and the grilling plate appears to be rather fragile- some sort of ceramic. One of the nubs that secures it into place with the grill side up was already broken off of it.  As for use, while it is easy to light, it simply does not get hot enough for efficient cooking.  Certainy, you can ultimately get your burgers and such to cook, but you will not have any searing, leaving  the darker char marks you would expect from grilling... even when run on high.So, while a practical concept, there are some serious design flaws that must be fixed.

***** decent fidelity from bass through treble, no drop-offs***** Easy to use***** Comfortable***** Secure fit***** Easy Access Controls***** Long lasting chargeIn most cases, I find earbud-type headphones have a serious weakness in the bass range. The Blackzebra bluetooth headset, however, has reasonable sound through all ranges, similar to my experiences with other headsets of this design type. The fidelity is is decent, from the bass through the highest treble. There is no break-up of the sound in the bass range, which can often be a problem in headphones and speakers alike, and while I would prefer they were stronger in the bass and midrange, for a headset of this price these are excellent.The mic on this headset is easily understood by people on the other end when I'm in videoconferences at work, with little echo. It pairs easily with all of my bluetooth devices, from phone to computer. The bluetooth range is somewhat better than several other, similar headsets I've tried. These have excellent battery life, giving the user hours of listening pleasure. When power runs low, these are easy to recharge using any micro-USB cable.These come with several sizes of ear buds, providing sizes that should fit snugly in most ear canals. The loops that help secure them to one's ears make these an excellent choice for the person with an active lifestyle. I've never had any problems with these falling out, and the shape is quite comfortable.While the controls are somewhat stiff, I do like the fact that they're not directly on the ear-piece, which makes it easier to know exactly what you're doing and less likely to press the wrong button.In all, these are a great choice for those needing a comfortable and functional headset for an active lifestyle.*Free product provided by manufacturer for review purposes

The packets are pretty much identical to the ones you can get of Kirkland brand at Costco, at a similar value, without the need for a club membership.  They appear to clean well, with my whites coming out white and my colors not bleeding.  For heavily soiled laundry, you will want to use two packets, as with similar products I've tried.  I still prefer the unscented varieties, but for those who aren't picky about fragrance, these are a great value.

I had hoped to find a product that really gets between teeth and truly flosses them.  The Philips Sonicare Airfloss fails in this respect.  IT gives three squirts of mouthwash every time you press the button, and it isn't even high powered enough to have any "flossing" effect.  At best, it will rinse your teeth with mouthwash and leave you with fresh breath, but if you're looking for something to floss, You may prefer to go for something that actually gets between the teeth a bit better.  I'll grant that this is gentle, but it's too gentle to do the job it's supposed to do.

***** decent fidelity from bass through treble, no drop-offs***** Easy to use***** Comfortable***** Long lasting chargeIn most cases, I find earbud-type headphones have a serious weakness in the bass range. The Aukey Sport bluetooth headset, however, has reasonable sound through all ranges, similar to my experiences with other headsets of this design type. The fidelity is is decent, from the bass through the highest treble. There is no break-up of the sound in the bass range, which can often be a problem in headphones and speakers alike, and while I would prefer they were stronger in the bass and midrange, for a headset of this price these are excellent.The mic on this headset is easily understood by people on the other end when I'm in videoconferences at work, with little echo. It pairs easily with all of my bluetooth devices, from phone to computer. The bluetooth range is somewhat better than several other, similar headsets I've tried.  These have excellent battery life, giving the user hours of listening pleasure. When power runs low, these are easy to recharge using any micro-USB cable.These come with several sizes of ear buds, providing sizes that should fit snugly in most ear canals. The rubber attachments that help keep it in one's ear make these an excellent choice for the person with an active lifestyle. I've never had any problems with these falling out, and the shape is quite comfortable.In all, these are a great choice for those needing a comfortable and functional headset for an active lifestyle.*Free product provided by manufacturer for review purposes

Galen, my Service Dog in Training is a very picky eater, which is pretty typical to shepherds. An 8-month-old Shiloh Shepherd, he also has a rather sensitive stomach. As such, it is difficult to find foods he can both tolerate and will eat. While he is still a puppy, he is now old enough to transition to some adult foods, as his growth has begun to slow and his metabolism can handle any calcium excesses other foods may have.While I can't say Galen is a fanatic for this fish and sweet potato food, it does appear to be one of the few foods that Galen will both eat and agrees with him. Because of his sensitivity, his diet is now mostly seafood, his primary food being a salmon based grain free limited ingredient diet by Canidae. Secondarily, he gets Nutro Limited Ingredient Diet Potato and Kangaroo formula, which I discovered he loved and tolerated well when we tried it for review purposes a while back. Now we have a wet food he likes in addition to the Tripett Green Beef Tripe he gets (tripe contains enzymes that aid digestion).The Nutro fish and sweet potato appears to be reasonably nutritious, and is gentle on digestion. The sweet potato provides the bulk needed for stools that are of a firm, healthy consistency. In all, I'm quite pleased with a number of Nutro's recent additions, and this is no exception.
