There are no surprise ads, in-app purchases, or anything inappropriate for our kids.Some parents may easily be looking for more in a tablet for their kids, especially those closer to 8 or 9 that may be ready for more. For the younger kids, I feel that this is an excellent option that is fun, educational, safe, and it offers a very wide range of games. This is exactly what we were looking for.

She loves playing with the shapes, I love that it's so portable! It's flat enough to stow away in the baby bag, yet it opens up to a full size toy. The sides are soft, while the base and top are sturdy. It's easy to put she shapes in, and the trap door on the bottom opens easily enough to remove the contents. The shapes are actually sets, with two of each shape. She can stack them, or take them apart and put each in individually. I'm embarrassed to admit that I had a hard time popping this thing down at first, because it felt awkward - it kind of twisted when I tried to push it down. Once it's in place, the lid closes and everything is secure. Easy to pack for travel, and everything stores neatly under the lid when flat. It's a great idea for a toy, and she really likes it.

Baby Z has been having trouble getting the hang of the potty. We thought this cute froggy potty would help, and she definitely likes to sit on it. Not always for the intended reason, but she is still drawn to it. The height is just right for her and she seems to feel comfortable on it. We had to park it against the wall because it doesn't have any non-skid pads on the bottom, so it slides easily. However, that's the only problem we have with it. The bowl is easy to remove and clean, and the whole unit is lightweight and easy to move if needed. Overall, it seems well made and the design is adorable!

This is a super cute toy that is fun for the little one, although it's slightly lacking in quality. I was surprised that it could topple over so easily. We play with it together, so no accidents will happen. We play with it on her play table, not on the floor. It really is a lot of fun. I wouldn't exactly call it an educational toy. It repeats ABC without additional letters. However, that's pretty good for the younger toddlers. I like that all the parts fit inside for storage. I can teach her that everything has a 'home' and that's where the parts for this toy go, so it helps her learn to keep it tidy. The sounds that it makes are not too loud, and nothing sounds annoying. Overall, we both think it's a pretty good toy. It's not perfect, but we like it.

This little activity table is amazing! It's filled with so many different things to do, and everything makes noise. Baby Z loves it!The legs are sturdy and just the right height for her to play with. The plastic parts are thick enough to hold up to a lot of abuse, without breaking. The sounds are not too loud, and it doesn't make annoying noises. The colors are bright, and everything is very cute.Overall, we are very pleased with this toy. It keeps her busy, and she loves moving from one section to the next. It keeps her attention much longer than we expected. She runs straight to it whenever she visits. Highly recommended!

We have been using this smoker for about a month, and we love it more and more! It does a fantastic job smoking meats, but it's also great for smoking foods you might not have considered, such as tofu and baked beans. It's easy to use, once you read the directions, and it seems to be very well made.We seasoned the smoker as instructed in the directions, before using it the first time. We didn't read the directions again, like we should have, and didn't realize the smoker would not work without preheating first. The first time we tried to smoke something in it, we set the temp and timer, and thought it was working. A half our later we realized it was cold. You must go through the preheat stage, which lasts 40 minutes, before you can set the temp and begin smoking your food.This smoker is also fantastic if you are a vegetarian or don't eat a lot of meat. We eat mostly plants, and we were surprised by how much we could put in this smoker. We like to fill pans with baked beans and smoke them for about 2 hours at 275 degrees. It's amazing! Tofu, tomatoes, eggplant, corn, and more - all taste so much better smoked! We smoked tomatoes and crushed them, then froze in small containers to pull out and add to chili or other recipes this winter.Each rack is large enough to hold a 9x13 inch pan. The racks remove easily, in case you need deeper space. You can lay most items directly on the racks, which is probably best for most meats.Overall, we are more than pleased with this smoker. We had an older smoker for about 20 years until it bit the dust. The design was different from this one, and we much prefer this one. We would easily recommend this model.

I love the scent of this hair product. I also love how it makes my hair feel - nice and soft, as long as I don't see myself. Unfortunately, it weighs my thin, shoulder length hair down terribly and it looks awful. I can't go out in public when I use this product on my hair. I tried it on damp and on dry hair, as directed, with poor results each time. However, my granddaughter had a different result.My granddaughter has very thick, very curly, long hair that is difficult to style. I can't even count how many hair products we have tried, but we can never seem to tame it. Tresemme Shine Lotion really made a difference in her hair because it benefited from the heaviness, yet it still left it feeling soft and smelling great.I may be the target audience, but this product did not work well for me. My young granddaughter loves it and it made her hair look terrific.

Colgate Daily Repair toothpaste does an okay job cleaning my teeth, and it's affordable. It promises to do much more than just clean my teeth. Does it work? My teeth don't feel any cleaner than they do after using other toothpastes. Though it tastes normal while brushing, it leaves an odd aftertaste in my mouth. That might be worth it, if it performs the miracle claimed in the ad copy. Unfortunately, the company would or could not substantiate their claims when I contacted them by email and by phoneThe claim in the ad copy says "Repairs early teeth and gum damage. Strengthens teeth by remineralizing weakened enamel." I thought that sounded great, it's just what I need! How long would this take to occur? How could I learn more?  I couldn't find any references to studies or data on their website, so I sent them a quick email. How long does it take for this to occur, and where are the studies behind it? That seemed simple enough. Getting an answer seemed tougher than pulling teeth.I submitted my question multiple times via email over a one month period, and each time I was told that my question needed additional time to research and someone would get back to me. Each time, I was left hanging.I was finally told that there were no studies they could point me to that would substantiate their claims. I was basically told to blindly trust their ad copy without any evidence. I thought this was strange, in an age where companies are quick to link to PubMed studies or other reliable sources to support their claims. I would have been happy with a brief synopsis comparing results between this and another brand.I finally called customer care. After placing me on hold for a few minutes, the rep told me that there was no set time for the product to work, it was different for everyone. I said their studies had to have taken a specific length of time to establish that it worked, how long was it? 2 weeks? 2 months? 2 years? Again, she said the time was different for everyone and there was no one answer.I realize that this may seem like a small issue to many people. It's just toothpaste, right? In this case, a company is making claims they seem unwilling to back up, in an effort to promote their product over other brands. The product contains controversial ingredients, and it's possible that it could take years of usage to produce the benefits promised in the advertisement. Even THEY don't know how to answer that question. I feel kind of insulted. I'm going to toss this tube in the can, then I'm going to the natural food store to buy something safe, natural, and without controversy or empty promises.

We use an old-school laminator at work that does a good job, but it's heavy and bulky and I wouldn't want one in my home. In comparison, this Scotch model is very compact, it's faster, and it does a good job. It heats up quickly, and it's easy to feed the pouch through for a quick lamination. Once done, it's small and easy to store, especially since it's designed with a place to stash the cord. These are good features to have in a home laminator.This laminator comes with 2 starter pouches, one each 3 mil and 5 mil. The thinner one is for regular paper, and the thicker one is for photos and thicker papers. I had hoped that I would be able to cut the pouch to use as needed, but the manual says you must use a full uncut pouch or it could get rolled into the machine. However, I can purchase pouches as small as business card size if I need them, and the largest size it will hold is letter size.The directions say you may have to run your pouch through the machine more than once, if it doesn't seal properly. Both of my pounces sealed in one pass. They were free from bubbles or voids, and they looked smooth. The unit has a jam release lever in case of an error, but thankfully I didn't need it.The kids are excited because this will be useful for school projects, particularly science fairs. You never know when you might need a tool like this. There are some things you can't laminate, according to the manual, such as credit cards and stamps. They recommend not laminating historically significant papers or one-of-a-kind items.Overall, this is a nice laminator. It's compact, easy to use, easy to store, and it's efficient for small jobs. I would recommend it.

This is a sleek looking lamp that offers useful features and a unique design. It has a heavy base that will stay put, an extra long power cord, and It's beautiful and appears well made. It's not very bright, but it's still useful as a desk lamp. It's not perfect, but it's nice.The tech specs at the bottom of the page are not quite accurate. Actual specs, out of the box:4 pounds, 12 ounces (weighed on a postal scale)20 inches tall, including the base - about 19 if you remove the baseBase: 8x6 and 3/4 inch thickRemovable lamp head: 8 7/8 inches long, including the carrier loopPower cord: 9 feetWhat I like:* I love the long power cord, 3 yards is an ample distance and much longer than the cord on other lamps. This makes it easier to find good placement for the lamp.* The rechargeable lamp head can be removed with the press of a button, so it's easy to carry if you need to.* The allen wrench stores under the base, and can be used to tighten the position so it won't budge. Find the sweet spot and make sure it stays.* Manual says light operates for an hour if power goes out, but it lasted 3 1/2 hours in my test.* USB port makes it convenient to charge my devices* Dimmer with 3 levelsWhat I don't like:* The shiny, black base arrives scratched due to the way the cardboard packaging was wrapped around the parts, and it did not have a clear protective film, like similar products.* It's just not very bright, even on the highest level. It's bright enough to read for a while, or for short term use. It can't compare to my full-spectrum desk lamp in brightness, and the light isn't white enough (for me personally) to read by for long periods of time.What's iffy:* If the power goes out, this lamp will automatically turn on. That's great - unless I'm not at home. In my test, the light turned on when power was disconnected from the lamp. It turned on at low level, not the brightest level, so it conserved energy. It lasted 3 1/2 hours. Let's pretend that the power goes out 3 hours before I get home or can get to the lamp. The internal battery will be drained before I need it the most. If I designed this lamp, I would include a feature to allow it to auto-cutoff after 5 or 10 minutes. I could then manually choose to turn it on and leave it on as needed.Overall, this is a very nice lamp. It's beautiful, solid, and offers nice features. It's not perfect. I would recommend it, unless you are looking for a brighter light to read by for long periods of time.  I like it, but I don't love it.

We are really pleased with these pants. The size fits as expected, and they feel very good. The stitching is tight, everything about them is well made. The lining is thin, but very warm and it feels good on the skin. We were concerned that the lining might shrink after washing, but it held up in size and fit without any issues. The lining doesn't feel bulky, so it doesn't interfere with movement. They are perfect for working out doors in cooler weather. The leg width fits well, and the cuffs pull over workbooks just fine. Overall, this is a very nice pair of pants. Highly recommended.

These are wonderful pants! They fit true to size, and they are very well made. The stitching is tight, I didn't find any loose stitches or problems with the workmanship. The pockets hold a lot, and The fleece lining is thin enough so it doesn't feel bulky. It's almost like fuzzy flannel, and it's very soft to the touch. These pants will be a blessing this fall and winter when working outdoors.

This little light works well and it's easy to install. We put it by the door on the storage building, since there isn't electricity for a standard light. The size is fairly small, but it holds 12 LED lights so it gives sufficient light. The motion trigger works very well, we had no problem getting it to detect us and turn on when we reached the storage building. The light is bright enough that we can see to reach the door safely. The light only stays on for about a half minute or a little longer. It requires 4 D batteries, which the manual says should last between 6 and 12 months, depending on how often it's used. It slips open to change the batteries without having to fumble for a screwdriver. Overall, this is a nice light! It's brighter than I expected it to be, and it works exactly as described.

I know that this little lunch kit is designed for kids, but I'm keeping it for myself! The size is perfect for packing snacks for work, or even a light lunch. The plastic is thicker and sturdier than I expected. Usually similar kits bend or warp, but not this one. It's not so rigid that it would crack easily, either. The lid closes very securely, and it's easy to flip open or closed even when wet. It doesn't seem to hold odor, and I pack some pretty smelly snacks, like hummus and peppers. It cleans up easily, and it's easy to carry. It's cute, colorful, and I like the little window. I'd love to see one just like it in a larger size for grownups. Until then, I'll just have to act like a kid.

I'm happy with this cable. I chose the 3 foot length because it's perfect to connect my modem to my router. They are not side by side, and my traditional yellow ethernet cable looks awkward and it doesn't wrap the way I need it to. The Belkin flat cable is much easier to maneuver through my tight setup, and the black seems to disappear from view. The ends connect tightly without any risk of poor connection. I haven't noticed any lag in performance. They seem to be high quality, and the price point is very good. I would recommend it.

These chips are seriously delicious! I love roasted seaweed and eat it daily. I like brown rice chips, they are crunchy and light. I've never had both combined in one chip, but the result is pretty darned satisfying! They are light and crunchy, salty and easy to eat. I can taste the seaweed, although it's not very pronounced. I was particularly excited about the gochujang seasoning on these chips. I love Korean food, and gochujang is a fermented red chili paste that has a little bit of a pungent flavor. That unique taste is missing from the seasoning on these chips. They taste more like sweet chili to me, and that's still good. Just not what I was expecting. Still, these chips are very delicious and satisfying. I received one bag as a sample, now I have to buy a whole case. I love them!

I'm very happy with this light switch. I bought the matching wall plate and installed them in my bathroom. Once installed, it works very smoothly. The switch is easy to depress and doesn't take much strength, so it's perfect for those who might have problems with dexterity. The plastic is smooth and slick, and it's easy to wipe clean. I like that it helps reduce the spread of germs. I have a lot of grandchildren running in and out of the bathroom, and their hand washing habits are not as good as I'd like. Hopefully this new switch will help reduce the transfer of germs and illness. Overall, I'm happy with it. I like the way the switch works and looks, and would love it even without the perk of being antibacterial.

I wanted to like this shampoo, because I am probably the target market for this product. However, it left my hair feeling awful. It was difficult to lather up - had to shampoo twice each time I used it. It seemed to rinse cleanly, but my hair felt heavy after it dried, and it was limp and difficult to style. Despite smelling very good, my hair looked dirty. I normally use shampoo from the natural food store - chemical free, sulfate free, etc, and my hair feels clean and looks full and shiny. With Dove Youthful Vitality, my hair was a mess. The container says it is weightless, but that was not my experience. I used it 3 times over the last week and that was enough. This is the first time I've been disappointed in a product made by Dove. It's inexpensive and smells great, but it doesn't do a good job cleaning my hair.

I've been using Wholly Doanjang for over a month and I'm astounded by the difference between this and the brand I was using. Everything about this paste - the scent, color, flavor - is miles ahead of the little square plastic container of supermarket paste I had been using.When I opened this jar of soybean paste, the room instantly smelled pungent - of course in a good way! It's naturally fermented, so the fragrance is quickly released. The flavor is salty, but very savory and rich. My old square tub of paste lacked scent, and it was very hard and dark in color. The Wholly Doanjang is softer, easier to spoon out, and looks lighter in color. You can tell that it's a better, more natural product. It makes all the difference in a recipe.Wholly Doanjang is made with just soybeans, water, and salt, and it's naturally aged and fermented for 3 years. My old brand contains these ingredients, along with wheat flour, alcohol, and more, and it's quickly processed. It doesn't have time to develop the level of flavor that Wholly Doanjang possesses. I had no idea what I was missing!I eat LOTS of vegetables, and I love to experiment with flavors. I eat spinach a few times a week, and my favorite way to prepare it is with doanjang. I briefly cook fresh spinach until it's just wilted, then squeeze out all the water. I blend a very small amount of doanjang with a smidgen of gochujang (fermented chili paste) and a drop or two of sesame oil. Massage it into the spinach. It's simple, quick, and addictive, I can't eat spinach without it anymore. Some people add minced garlic, but I prefer it without it.This paste does cost more than supermarket brands, but it takes just a tiny bit in a recipe, so it lasts a long time. I can't imagine going back my old brand after this. If this brand becomes unavailable to me, I'll just have to learn to make it from scratch.

I like this little solar charger. It's about the size of a cell phone with a thick case, although it's quite a bit heavier. It's compact and easy to store in the glove-box or a backpack. The flashlight is bright and it stays lit for a long time. This charger works reasonably well. I tested it on a Kindle, BLU phone (battery is similar to iPhone 6 Plus), and I ran the flashlight as long as it would go on a full charge, and will describe my results below.I initially tried to charge my charger via sunlight, from dawn till dusk. By dark, 3 of the 4 charge lights were lit. I then plugged it in via a USB cable to finish charging it. The third light began blinking, then soon the fourth light blinked. It didn't take much longer before all 4 lights were solid, indicating that it was fully charged. Plugging it in produced a faster charge than sunlight, but it's good to know that I can still get a substantial charge if I'm hiking or without access to a power source, as long as I'm patient.My Kindle Fire HD 7 power was down to 16% when I plugged it into the fully charged Dex unit. It reached 77% after 1 hour and 45 minutes, at which point the Dex ran out of power.My BLU 8XL phone has a 2920mAh battery, which is a smidgen more than the battery used in an iPhone 6 Plus (2915mAh) and more than the typical 1800'ish mAh of many other phones. I depleted my battery to 15%, when my phone alerted me to charge it. It charged slowly and took 2 hours and 40 minutes to charge it to 100% full charge with the Dex. That sounds fine to me, and the Dex didn't die too soon.The LED flashlight is bright, and it promises to last up to 14 hours. I fully recharged the Dex overnight by plugging in the cable. I covered the solar panels by taping a piece of cardboard over it so that it would not gain additional charge during the day. I turned on the flashlight in the morning, then timed it to see how long it would last. It lasted 13 hours and 10 minutes, which I felt was very good.I think this solar charger is a helpful tool to have available in case of an emergency. The unit has a green hook on the back that opens to make a stand, which is nice. It would also make it possible to attach it to a backpack so it can soak up sunlight while outdoors. Overall, I'm happy with this and would recommend it.

This is a nice, small sized notebook that is a good size for slipping into the smaller compartment of a backpack or handbag. The plastic covers a good thickness - not so thin they curl, but thick enough to provide support. The fabric spine hides the spiral binding, so it doesn't get caught on anything. It's stitched on with a very wide stitch which looks like it would unravel with the slightest catch. However, I picked at the loose ends to see if it would come loose, and it stayed on tight. One neat feature of this notebook is the moveable plastic pocket divider. It's designed to come loose, then you can slip it somewhere in the middle of the notebook. It slipped out easily, but took a little finagling to slip it back in. Not a problem. The divider has pockets on both sides, which is pretty handy. The only thing I wish it had was a loop or other method to fasten it closed. That would make it more perfect for tucking into a bag. I found a jumbo rubber band which will serve the same purpose. Overall, it's a good little notebook

I've heard of AHAVA for years, but have never tried it. This little sample tube of day moisturizer surprised me! It makes my face feel so soft and smooth. It's not oily or greasy, but it still makes my dry patches feel smoother. My skin is sensitive, but I haven't had any problems with this lotion. My makeup goes on easy, and the soft feeling seems to last. I really love the scent and plan to buy a full size bottle of body lotion. It's good stuff!

I love how this moisturizer feels on my skin. It's not too oily, and it makes my skin feel soft. Makeup glides on over it, so it's easier to get a smoother look. I really love the scent, and wish I could find a body lotion that smells just like this. My only complaint is the color. I wear the palest shade of porcelain foundation that I can find. I'm very pale. When I put this lotion on my face, it turns dark and looks muddy on me. I tried putting my makeup on over it, which helped, but I still didn't look right. Most people probably won't notice the color on their skin, because most people are not this pale. I would definitely recommend this lotion because it feels and smells great. However, if you are paler than porcelain, you might want to pass it up.

This soup tastes better than most processed tomato soups. I love to cook from scratch, but naturally sometimes it's more convenient or even necessary to buy food that is pre-made. Most canned soups taste too salty, and have a metallic, heavily processed aftertaste. I was a little concerned about trying this soup, but the simple ingredient list drew me in. It tastes better than I thought it would. The texture is very smooth, but also has bits of tomato pieces. The basil flakes are visible, and the soup is a dark red color. It tastes a little too salty, but the salt is not overpowering. The tomato taste isn't fresh, but it doesn't have a chemical aftertaste. I'm not sure I would eat this often, but I would buy it to have on hand for those times when I don't have time to cook.

My granddaughter loves this skirt! She likes the pleated design, and it fits her well. She's a size 14 and it fits true to size. The length is good, it isn't too short. The stitching is even and it seems well made. As a uniform skirt, it's cute and not too plain. As a regular skirt, it's neutral enough to wear with a variety of tops. I would definitely recommend this skirt.

I'm very happy with this reflector set. I considered several different models and shapes, but this one seemed to offer everything I needed. The low price was a very good bonus! The fabric is good quality and the construction seems solid. The zipper is sewn in securely and it zips shut smoothly. I had trouble folding it back into place, but I was able to do it after watching a video on line. It does everything I need it to at a bargain price. I'm happy.

It's cute and the size is great, but the quality just isn't the same as it used to be. Granted, it's been a long time since I bought a Trapper Keeper. I remember when they came out in the 70s. The closure has changed a few times since then, but they always sported a good size and various useful pockets and other features. The Hello Kitty Trapper Keeper that I have in hand doesn't have any frills, other than two inner pockets and a cute design.The metal button closure is weak and doesn't want to stay closed. It keeps popping open.  I will probably attach self-adhesive velcro to it because that's the only way it will fasten and stay shut.The inner pocket inside the back cover is made from a thin plastic that is curling up, and that's before adding or removing any contents. The inner pocket inside the front cover is also thin, but the shape is different and much better, in my opinionOverall, I'm a little disappointed in this Trapper Keeper. If you love Hello Kitty, it will be easy to overlook the lower quality, but the poor closure will still be frustrating to deal with. That's a pretty big flaw.

This little jumper is well made and attractive, but it runs a little small. The stitching is tight and even, there were no loose threads, and the zipper glides smoothly. Pink satin seam binding around the inside of the neckline helps hide stitches, and also makes it more comfortable if she happens to wear it without an undershirt. The belt is lined with a light pink and blue stripe fabric that is attractive.She wears a size 14, and this dress barely fits her. The shirt she wears underneath is thin, so it doesn't add bulk. Still, it feels a little tight if she bends or sits. I don't think she'll get much use out of it and we wish it were a size 16. The length is right, and it still looks nice on her.Overall, I would recommend this dress because it's well made and it looks good. I would definitely recommend choosing a size up.

This beautiful carry-on luggage is lightweight, loaded with compartments, rolls smoothly, and it STILL passes as a carry-on if the new ITIA proposals pass. Please don't be discouraged from considering this luggage due to the confusing new measurement proposals. More on that at the end of my review.This Tumi Tegra-Lite Max Continental Expandable Carry-On is very durable. The outer shell feels thin, but it's made from a tough material that can take a lot of abuse. According to Milliken, the company that makes Tegris, it can withstand strikes from rocks, baggage handlers, shrapnel, etc. It's very roomy, and the various compartments inside help keep everything organized and separate for safe travel.I have the graphite finish model, which has a basketweave appearance. It has a light sheen, but it isn't shiny. It can be cleaned easily if it gets dirty. The beautiful design makes it stand out, and it's also easy to spot. I learned the importance of unique luggage in a busy airport a long time ago.I initially thought the weave was just a print on a plastic-like material. After reviewing the Milliken website, it is actually a woven material that is fused together with heat and pressure. The weave is real, yet it's perfectly smooth.The wheels allow this luggage to spin incredibly easy. I dragged it down stairs, across rough pavement, down a long and bumpy sidewalk, and back indoors, and it's maneuvered easily across every surface. It's like sliding across warm butter.The zippers are thick and have durable metal teeth that grip well and should not come apart. The slider glides easily when opening and closing. The pull tabs are slightly curved and have a non-traditional shape. The design allows them to latch into the combination lock on the side. However, I personally find them a little hard to grip and pull.Be sure and register your luggage with Tumi as soon as it arrives. A serial number on each piece can help ensure that lost luggage makes it way back home.By now, you have probably heard of the new ITIA proposals that will reduce the recommended size of carry-on luggage, if it passes. As of this review, the proposal is on hold.  The new "Cabin OK" proposal does NOT change the maximum size for carry-on luggage, so this model will still be accepted if it passes. The proposal only suggests an optimal size which is a little smaller, and they said luggage that size can carry a special tag so it will not have to be measured when boarding. They have also stated that no one will have to buy new luggage, and the old maximum size will still be in effect. Therefore, this particular piece of luggage will still qualify as a carry-on if the proposal passes.This is a pretty spectacular carry-on. It's durable, beautiful, spacious, light weight, easy to maneuver over any surface, and it's so well made that it should last a lifetime. Highly recommended.

This is an amazing backpack! It's designed for hunters, but the multi-compartments make it useful for just about anything. It's well made, versatile, and comfortable. There are a lot of compartments, the stitching is tight, the fabric is thick and tightly woven. It's durable and should last many years.This backpack is loaded with compartments in various sizes, and each can serve a distinct purpose. Lots of straps hold everything tight and secure, while also ensuring a good fit.* Two waist belt compartments, 7 inches wide and 2 1/4 deep, zip open easily with large loop zipper pulls. Store ammo or keys, wallet, and a cell phone for easy access. No fumbling or losing anything important!* Two long wing compartments that flank each side and measure 17 1/2 inches high and 7 inches deep. The back side of each also includes a mesh pocket.* The main compartment is 25 inches deep. 2 large loop zippers are easy to access. Inside is a large nylon elastic pocket to help organize your gear.* On the outer flap is another compartment which is about 11 inches deep and 8 inches at the widest point, and it has an inner mesh pocket.* Below the smaller compartment is yet another compartment which unzips to reveal a gun or bow holder.* On the very bottom are two more zippers. One opens to reveal a rain cover. My zipper seems to stick in the middle, due to the contents, but it does open. The rain cover is an elastic edged shell that slips over the backpack to help protect it from rain. The other zipper reveals the meat shelf which unrolls and can hook to an upper strap.It doesn't show very well in the product photos above, but the molded foam back panel of the backpack looks like the inside of a turtle shell. It's flexible, but offers plenty of support for the backpack. The wide shoulder straps are very well padded, as is the waist belt. They are lined in soft fabric that should help keep it comfortable during long treks, while still preventing slippage. It weighs almost 6 pounds, which isn't bad since most of the weight is on the back.Overall, this backpack has a lot to offer. Plenty of compartments, extreme comfort, and durability.

This is a fantastic dog food! I recently switched to a fish based, limited ingredient kibble because my chihuahuas had trouble with poultry, which solved their problem. I'm very familiar with Honest Kitchen dog foods, as I have used them off and on for years. (My dogs do better when we switch occasionally) I was intrigued by their new limited ingredient fish based food and was anxious to see how my dogs would do with it. When I first opened the package, it smelled very fish. The fishiness seems to have gone away, or perhaps I've just gotten used to it. It smells much better now. The fine powder is mixed with warm water until it creates a slurry, which then thickens a little as it sits. My dogs seem to prefer a thinner mixture. I transitioned my dogs to this over a few days and they didn't experience any digestive problems. Their stools are firm and not too smelly. They have a lot of energy, too. I'm impressed with the quality of ingredients in this food and I know it's safe for my dogs.

I am sorry to say this, but I'm disappointed in this little USB flash drive. It holds a lot of data and it checked out fine when tested via a flash drive testing software program at the office. However, the body is very flimsy. It's made from a type of plastic that I consider 'crunchy'. It reminds me of the kind of plastic used for those little free toys that came in cereal boxes back in the day. Actually, that might have been better quality. It's obvious that it would crack with the slightest pressure and turn into a mess of shards that would make it unusable. I would be hesitant to use this to store anything important. Even then, I would store it in a very safe place and I would not carry it with me. I'm not sure how many times I would be able to insert it and remove it before a disaster might occur. It comes with a little lanyard, but I've still not been able to insert it. I'll save this for an occasion when I really need a flash drive and all my others are full.

This ProTeam commercial backpack vacuum is perfect for anyone who has to clean large office buildings. It also comes with a 'home kit' that helps if you are a professional housekeeper or if you do home renovations and need a good vacuum that will clean everything from the ceilings to the floors. It comes with a variety of accessories and a 50 foot extension cord.I'm using this in our 10 room family business. We have hardwood floors, and we have a lot of shipments going in and out every day. Cardboard dust and various bits of debris really makes a mess on a daily basis. No one likes to clean it up, particularly since our vacuums are all designed for residences and are wimpy and cumbersome in our environment. The ProTeam backpack vacuum made it a breeze to get every nook and cranny clean! The long handle and thick felted brush tool allowed me to cover a lot of territory in a short time. I found a video online demonstrating a sweeping motion to make vacuuming more efficient. The floor tool grabbed everything along the edges and in small spaces between furniture. The accessories worked exceptionally well when cleaning behind boxes, etc.When I took this vac out of the box, I was worried because it felt very heavy. Once it was on my back, it felt very comfortable. It wasn't heavy at all. The harness is well padded and I was surprised by how comfortable it was. I had to set the backpack on a table and walk backwards into it. The base of the vacuum is thick rubber, so the unit will not slide around easily. The straps adjusted easily and it felt secure as I used it. Having the power switch on my waist was very helpful.The suction is excellent! We didn't have any trouble cleaning up the the worst corners in our office.The 50 foot cord is a heavy duty extension cord that is not built into the unit. You can easily switch it out with a shorter or longer cord that matches the electrical rating.This vacuum is great for the office, but it's also perfect for deep cleaning my home when I want to cover every square foot, from ceiling to floor. It's comfortable to use, not too loud, it's very versatile, and the quality is very evident from the moment you take out out of the box. I would highly recommend this for commercial use. Get it for your office and you won't have any trouble finding a volunteer to use it.

Batiste dry shampoo works very well, after you get the hang of it. It makes hair seem fluffier, less oily, and it smells better. I bought this can to the office and had previously asked my coworkers not to shampoo today. We took turns using it, with mixed results. It was easy to initially spray too much on, which resulted in white hair. We found that it looked better if we used the end of a comb to lift sections of our hair to spray, without spraying on the outermost later of hair. Miss E is blond with brighter blond highlights. Her hair looked white and dull after using this. She was the first in line, so the next guinea pig received more careful treatment. The rest of us are brunettes and we managed to successfully freshen our hair without it looking unusual. I can't say it looked spectacular, but it did look better than the lifeless messes we walked in with. We lost a little shine, but overall our hair looked and felt cleaner. This is definitely a product I would keep on hand for one of those days when I don't have time to shampoo. I used to think dry shampoo was just something to use if you were sick or in the hospital. Now I can see it as a more routine hair care product. I like it!

I love a lot of things about this DVD player. It's very small, it provides clear 3D playback, it has a lot of apps, and it can double as a Playstation!  There are a few things that I don't like, such as limited audio output options and a slightly cumbersome app interface.I'm impressed by the small footprint of this unit.  It measures just 9 inches wide, 7 1/4 inches deep, and under 1 1/2 inches tall. It's barely noticeable, which is just the way I like my electronics.DVDs load and play pretty fast. Playback is clear and smooth. I connected it to a 3D TV in my bedroom, as well as a 3D Epson projector home cinema. It played regular and 3D DVDs beautifully.There are a lot of built in apps, but that's pretty standard these days. The app interface isn't the sleekest I've seen, but it's easy to use.A unique feature of this unit is the ability to stream and play PlayStation Now games. It's easy to navigate, and there are plenty of games to choose from. You need a controller, such as a DualShock 4. This controller may be wireless with a regular PlayStation, but you need to connect it to work with this system. Fortunately, extra long USB cables are very inexpensive these days. The qualtiy of your game will primarily be limited only by the quality of your Wi Fi connection. I chose to pull out the old ethernet cable for this one. It was a lot of fun for the kids and the grownups! This may not replace a PlayStation console for many people, but it's a great way to pack a lot of game into a small space for someone who doesn't have room for more, or who only plays occasionally and doesn't need more.I wish this DVD player had more audio outputs. The digital coaxial cable output is a start for many people, but I need a digital optical output (toslink). Therefore, I can't currently use this in the room I would prefer. I'll still be able to use it in my study, and the small size of the unit makes it optimal in that room.Overall, this is an excellent DVD player with a lot of options. It performs beautiful, especially at this price point. I'm happy with it.

I've been buying these oats for several years and I love them. The flavor is always consistently fresh and delicious. I rarely run into hulls, unlike with some other brands I've tried. I don't cook them, I soak them with almond milk and fruit, such as bananas or raisins. I don't even add sugar. I mix it in the bowl and cover it, then come back after my morning shower. The oats are soft and delicious.

When I bought The Honest Company multi-purpose cleaner, I wondered if it would really clean well, or if it would just smell good and look pretty on the counter. I've used it on my kitchen sink, counters, stove, inside my refrigerator, on my floors, and in my bathroom. Everywhere I've used it, it's done an excellent job getting the surface clean! I've not found anything I couldn't clean as well as or better than conventional cleaning sprays.Thankfully, it also smells wonderful and looks gorgeous on the counter. The bottle is too pretty to tuck away!My only complaint is the addition of a preservative, methylisothiazolinone, that may be questionable in some circumstances. I don't know what amount of the preservative is necessary to cause a problem, but it is the last ingredient on the list. EWG ranks it 7 out of 10 on the safety scale, with 10 being the worst. They also say this is based on limited data. Use restrictions seem to be based on cosmetic use. So I guess no matter how good this smells, don't squirt any behind your ears! I personally feel comfortable using it as a household cleaner.

This is a gorgeous laptop, inside and out! The case is sleek and beautiful, the keyboard is large and easy to use, and the back light makes it easier at night. The touch screen removes all of the typical frustration associated with laptops since I don't have to deal with the little touch pad. I also love being able to enlarge the screen with a pinch and pull. It's so much easier on my old eyes. It's so easy to do everything I want when I'm online. It's also extremely fast to boot up and operate.I'm still getting to know Windows 10 (I'm a Mac girl) but it's easy to see that Toshiba has created an impressive laptop with all the features I need. There are plenty of ports. The screen is very bright and clear. I love the flexibility of this model because I can flip it around into a tablet, or stand it open on the table. I initially thought that was gimmicky, but now that I'm using it this way, I can definitely see the benefit for many users.I was curious why this model came with 128GB drive when the standard seems to be at least 500GB these days. I found out that Solid State Drives, such as this one, are twice as expensive to make so they usually start smaller to help keep the overall costs down. PC Mag says they are also much faster, more durable, and more efficient than regular hard drives. They are quieter because they don't have moving parts, and data is stored on chips. Apparently SSD is better if you need speed, HDD if you need more storage. I'll take speed.This laptop comes with minimal documentation - basically showing you how it can be folded in different directions, along with a drawing of the various ports. After that, you are on your own. Windows 10 looks and feels different from previous versions. I mainly use a Mac and only use a PC at work. I had to tinker with it to get the hang of it. But it was easy. The last windows computer I bought came with a backup DVD. I found a brief mention of needing to create a recovery drive for the laptop, so I bought a 32GB USB drive to create a recovery drive as directed in the help files. It says you need 16GB, but a 16GB drive only contains about 13GB of usable space. Grab a 32GB thumb drive when you order this machine.Overall, I'm very happy with this laptop. It weighs about 5 pounds, so it's easy to carry around. The size is perfect, it's much faster than I expected, and the picture is beautiful. It's pretty fantastic!

I bought this to create a recovery drive for my laptop. The laptop requires 16GB of space on the recover drive, and of course a 16GB drive is not sufficient since it only contains a little over 13GB of useable space. The 32GB version is very affordable, and it's definitely sufficient for the drive. My laptop did not have any problems creating the recovery drive on this unit, and my computer recognized it when inserted again.The exterior is white with a red loop end which can be attached to a keyring if you need it. The end cap on the other side closes very tightly without any risk of slipping off. I prefer the white exterior of this model because I can label it with a black sharpie.It's a great deal, it's efficient, and it seems to be well made. I'm happy with my purchase.

This MaxCraft tool is loaded with features that I never realized I needed. I have tested out all of the features, and they work perfectly. The unit is easy to use and it's compact. It's about 6 3/4 inches long and it weighs slightly over 6 ounces with the batteries installed.The pressure gauge seem to work very well. I tested all of my wheels, and it's so much easier than using an old fashioned pencil style pressure gauge. The digital reading is easy to see, with numbers about 3/8 inch high and a blue back-light for day or night viewing.I tested the seat belt cutter on card stock, which slid right through it. Then I found some old webbing in the garage and it also cut through it with power. I had to tug a little for it to make the first break, but the rest was like butter.The last time I owned a map light, it was installed in my 1979 Pinto Wagon. It swung down and pivoted in any direction. I was impressed. The map light in this tool is red, to reduce eye strain, but I can't imagine it being useful for anything. I didn't read maps in 1979, and I don't plan to start now, especially since everything I need is available at the push of a button. The white LED light is going to be more helpful.  It's not a substitute for a good flashlight, but it's still a good addition to this tool.The glass hammer pops out with the flick of a switch. I didn't test it on glass, but I did take out outside and banged it on a brick. It broke the brick, and it stayed in place without folding back into the tool.I never knew a product like this existed until this one came along. I'm not surprised by it, I just never gave it any thought. I try to be a safe driver, and I never think about the worst that can happen. When I mentioned to my coworkers that I was getting this, I was surprised by how many people either already owned this type of tool, or were planning to buy one. I guess I was the only one that felt invincible. After reading all of the ways this tool can be used, and giving it more serious thought, I'm glad to have it.

I put this Germ Guardian air purifier in my study. I have the slightly larger version in my kitchen. My dogs hang out in my study a lot, and I spend the mornings with the windows open. The result is a room full of allergens when the windows are closed. My study is small, 8x12, so I don't need a larger air purifier. I like this model because it's small, but it's very effective. It's only 22 inches high, and the sides are about 9x7. This makes it so easy to find a place for it. It needs about a foot in every direction to operate properly, so you can't put it against the wall.  A little bit of normal maintenance is required, such as quick monthly swipe of the filter with your vacuum. The HEPA filter will need to be replaced every 6 to 9 months, and the UV light will also need to be replaced at some point. Both are super easy to access, so it will be a breeze. The machine will let you know when you need to replace either part.This particular model has a Clean Air Delivery Rate (CADR) for tobacco for this unit is 118. That makes it perfect for small to medium size rooms. This unit can clean the air in a room up to 183 square feet, which is a pretty good sized room.It's very quiet! There are 3 power levels, as well as a button to turn on the UV light if you wish. The lowest setting is so quiet that you can barely hear it. If you have an odor problem, or if have a lot of allergens in the room, you can turn it up to medium or high power. They are still not too loud, unlike many other air purifiers on the market. The air in my study cleaned up very quickly. I left it on overnight, and when I walked in the study it smelled like nothing. You couldn't tell that my dogs have spent so much time in there, and it didn't smell like an old study. It smelled like nothing. That's why I love it!

This sauce is delicious! As described, it starts with a little bit of sweet and tangy flavors that have a lot of depth. The flavor is fresh and clean, and I appreciate the lack of chemicals and artificial ingredients. You can tell that they didn't take any shortcuts in making this sauce. The rich flavor is followed by spicy kick that you won't soon forget :) I'll be more sparing with this sauce next time because a little goes a long way, both in flavor and in heat.Regarding freshness: I ordered this sauce on July 24, 2015, and the bottle has has a best by date of Feb 10, 2016. It will be long gone before then.

I bought this Roku 2 about 6 months ago and I love it. It's not my first Roku - this one is replacing one of the earlier generation models that I've used consistently for many years. I cut the cable many years ago and never looked back after discovering Roku. The older models had a lot of bells and whistles that the new ones lack, but the technology was older and couldn't keep up with the new apps, etc. I chose the Roku 2 over the Roku 3 because I needed an audio output to connect to my Epson projector, since I don't have a traditional setup or television where I use it. The original Roku could handle a digital optical audio cable, s-video, composite video, component video, hdmi, etc, and it had an Ethernet port. As Roku continued to develop the inside of the box, they excluded the various ports that could have provided so much benefit to customers. When I finally needed a more advanced Roku to handle the newer apps, I had to give up all of the connections that made the original Roku so useful. Otherwise, the Roku performs fabulously. My apps load quickly, the unit doesn't lag, and it makes my life a little nicer. My fingers are crossed that they will release a Roku 4 model that will include, at the very least, a digital optical audio output.

I recently switched to Wellness Simple Salmon and Potato because one of my chihuahuas has shown signs of allergies, which our vet said could be caused by chicken. It was hard to find a poultry free, grain free food that was also small enough for his tiny mouth. We gave this food a try and we're now on our third bag. It's working well for him. The kibble looks and smells like cat food. The pieces are very small triangles, and they smell fishy. However, it doesn't smell bad or too strong. He loves it and he scratches and chews much less now.  I'm happy with the short ingredient list, and the dog food advisor ranks this food very highly. I'm comfortable with it, my dog loves it and digests it very well, and the price is great. It's a winner in our household!

I bought this container to make kimchi because I wanted something foolproof, as well as something that would help keep my fridge smelling fresh. The e-jen did everything I hoped it would! It's very well made, is the perfect size for my needs, and it made making kimchi less messy, less smelly, and much easier.The plastic container is not flimsy, and the vacuum liner fits snugly in place. The hinges on the locking lid just fold away from the lid, if that makes sense, and are not the type with pins. However, they seem durable and I don't think they will fail on me. This is one area where many similar containers fail, since repeated use can cause them to break.I bought the .9 gallon size. My kimchi recipe called for 5 pounds of napa cabbage. That's a lot of cabbage, but by the time I brined my cabbage and it shrunk and became pliable, my completed recipe fit perfectly in the e-jen with room to spare. The inner vacuum liner slipped easily into place. I unplugged it while I slid it down onto the kimchi until just a little liquid came out, then I plugged up the hole. I used a paper towel to blot up the liquid, then I closed the outer lid securely on the container. The next night, I peeked and the liner had raised up due to the gasses from the kimchi. I unplugged it and pushed it down again as before. The next day, I put it in the fridge.I didn't notice any smell coming from the container.  It's sealed tightly! In the past, I have found that produce next to a jar of kimchi would spoil quickly due to the gasses coming from the jar. I once watched a lemon turn black on the side next to the jar. I didn't have any problems with the e-jen. My fridge smells normal. My kimchi turned out great.I'm very happy with my e-jen. I had it in my wish list for a long time before I finally treated myself, and I wish I had bought it sooner. I'm going to buy another so I can make two different types at the same time. I would definitely recommend it to my own friends and family.

I like the compact design of the Germ Guardian air purifier. It does a great job removing odors, and it isn't too loud. It doesn't have an automatic sensor, so it stays on at one level until you adjust it or turn it off. The sleek finish makes it easy to keep clean, and the filters are easy to replace.The Clean Air Delivery Rate (CADR) for tobacco for this unit is 129. CADR ratings are usually provided for tobacco, dust, and pollen. Germ Guardian only publishes the CADR for tobacco, but that's usually a pretty good indication of how well the model performs. CADR can range from 10 to 450, and the rating determine what size room it can handle. The higher the rating, the larger the room. This unit is efficient up to 199 square feet.This unit is tall, at 28 inches, but it measures just 7 inches wide and 9 inches deep. You have to place it at least 1 foot away from your wall or furniture, so it gets good circulation. The air blows out both sides of the unit, unlike many air purifiers that blow out the top or back. The air is pulled in through the back.This air purifier is made of glossy black plastic and it doesn't have grooves or textures that trap dust. It's easy to wipe clean as needed. The blue circular light, as shown in the photo, turns on when you have the UV option enabled. Otherwise, the front is solid black.I put this air purifier in my kitchen because the tall, compact size fit well in there. I have a smaller unit in my study. I live in an old house, have two indoor dogs, and I cook a lot of fish. I am the target market for air purifiers and I've used quite a few different brands and models in the past. Some work better than others. Some are practically worthless. I would rank Germ Guardian at the top of the list for efficiency. It does a great job and doesn't take up a lot of space. I wish it had a sensor so it could increase power as needed, but that's my only complaint about this unit.

Charming book of letters between an American script writer and an English bookstore following World War II. The best part about this book was the insight into life during the late 40's though the 70's, especially in London immediately after the war. Through the letters you become acquainted with not only the author, but many of the employees of the store. A short, delightful read.

I purchased these to use with Creative Haven Whimsical Gardens Coloring Book (Creative Haven Coloring Books). I love the colors, but they do wear down quickly. There is a nice range of colors in this set of 36. I love the case they come in.

This is the first adult coloring book I have purchased. The pictures are delightful, I just wish everything wasn't so tiny. I've had fun coloring in the pages with colored pencils, but I can't do it for too long or it gives me a headache.

2:00 Mins A fun way to personalize your phone case. I like the clear case and the way it fits my phone. One insert came with the case and it is easy to put in or take off. I especially like that I can use the insert as a template and make my own design. The insert is about the weight of photo paper, so you could easily cut a 3x5 or 4x6 picture down to slip inside this case. With a little imagination you can easily make a one-of-a kind case.

1:04 Mins This game is like a 3D version of scrabble. It really gets the mind going as you are not only trying to build words across and down like a crossword puzzle, but you can also build the words upwards by adding letter tiles on top of one another. Takes a little bit of brain power, but you can finish the game in under 30 minutes. I like that you can literally change the game and make it harder for your opponents to plan out their next turn.The board game is raised. The tiles are nice and large. Perfect for older grandkids to play with grandparents. Also would make a nice classroom gift.

3:43 Mins Well constructed and designed, this suitcase is built to last. I am very impressed with all its features. There are lots of separate compartments which help keep the items I am packing well organized. The small bags that are part of the interior securing system are great for putting in accessories. It really helps me from forgetting items like belts, jewelry, etc.The suitcase is easy to roll. I like how long the extendable handle is. A superior suitcase all around.

3:21 MinsThis castle features a tower with two trap doors, doors that lock shut and lots of space to play. It took my 13 year old 30 minutes to put it together all on his own. There is a lot of little pieces, but instructions are clear.The castle comes with three knights, weapons and one horse. My son was excited to review this item as he said it was the one thing he wanted from Playmobil this year. Sure to make any castling loving child happy.

1:00 Mins Nice fitting case. Shows off the back of your iPhone, if that is the look you are going for.  The openings for charger, audio, etc had a bit more space than other cases, This is a real plus. Cover snaps on easily and stays on well. I like the look of it. Not bulky.

1:00 Mins Case fits well as does the insert. We weren't impressed with the design on the insert. Seems like it should really come with at least two inserts to be any fun at all. Case itself has all the right openings in all the right places.

1:41 Mins Absolutely brilliant! I purchased one book, planning to give it my kids for Christmas. When the book arrived and I got a chance to look through it I immediately went online and ordered more so my kids could each have their own copy. My kids are young adults and teens. This is the book that they will keep hold of and read outloud to their kids. The artwork is marvelous. It absolutely captures the scenes and emotions ofHarry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. I hope and pray they produce the same quality book for every book in the series.

The relationship between the young handsome vicar and well-worn detective is what sets this series apart. The support cast is equally as interesting and well acted. The story plots are not over involved, but interesting enough.  It really is the relationships and character growth that keep you watching this series. Can't wait for season two.

Update 10/14 After using these headphones for a few days my son gave them back to me. "Mom, I can't wear these. They are painful. They make my head hurt. I would give them one out of 5 stars" So there you have it.I expected more from these headsets even given that they are priced right around $20. The head set came separated in the box and I had to put the headband together. It wasn't really hard to do, but because of the construction I was afraid I was going to break them before I even had a chance to try them out.Pros:1. Price is right2. Flexible microphone bar.3. Ear piece was comfortable.4. Standard audio jack so that you can use these headphones with XBox and other devices.5. Audio input and output work well.Cons:1. Despite padding, headband is not comfortable for long. In fact, my son described them as painful.2. Feels like construction is flimsy3. Small to medium fitFor the price these headphones are ok, but I think by spending just a little bit more you could get a much better product.

1:01 Mins Perfect commercial trash can. Here is what I like about it:1. Looks sharp2. Heavy duty and well constructed.3. Comes already assembled. All you have to do is pull it out of the box.4. Only has 3 parts: base, top, trash can insert.This trash can works great for business or commercial use.  All looks sharp enough to use at home as an outdoor trashcan on patio, deck or play area.

0:44 Mins Good duster. Wish the handle was a bit longer. I have with the extended handle that I get more use out of. Works great on different types of surfaces. I use it on lamp shades, screens, fan blades, book shelves. I especially like using it in corners, as the 360 duster touches all sides of a corner and works great at removing spiderwebs.

I love the look of this necklace!  The silver round celtic knot is beautiful and well made. It comes on a fine 18 inch silver chain.  This pendant is so versatile. You could wear it with super casual, dressy casual or business casual attire. Very attractive. I love it!

At first I didn't like any of the characters in The Girl on the Train, but I still could not put this book down. The writing at times was confusing until I understood the author's rhythm. The main character is an addict, so the timeline can be a bit jagged, as this character occasionally blacks out and then has to go reconstruct what happened during those lost hours.My book club read this book. It gave us lots to talk about and everyone liked it. A couple of us figured out who the killer was before the end of the book and a few were totally surprised.I would compare it to Gone Girl, but I did like this book better.

We love Gravity Falls, with its quirky sense of humor and strong family bonds.  This is a cartoon for the older crowd, as it might be a little scary for young children. We found the second season to be darker than the first. We are a family of teens, young adults and parents and we love this show.I think you would like this show if you enjoy shows like Doctor Who, Season 9 or The Scooby-Doo Show Season 1
Good, basic cotton briefs. Fit well and last a long time. I recommend and will purchase them again.

Trying to find jeans for my 6'9" young adult son is nearly impossible. These jeans both fit and look great on him. They are a good quality jean that are built to last. I am so happy that I found these!  I will be purchasing more.

My daughter is very light sensitive at night. I looked and looked for an alarm clock that is actually dim enough at night that it wouldn't bother her. This small, battery operated alarm clock ended up being the solution to my search. It runs great and was very easy to set up.I really liked that this clock includes the day of the week, the date and room temperature, as well as the time. The clock display is large, making it easy to read. By turning the night sensor off, the display is totally dark until you press the snooze/light button. The clock is small, so it fits perfectly almost anywhere.We are very happy with our purchase and recommend this product highly.

3:50 Mins Mountain House has a very good reputation among Scouts, hikers and campers for have above average dehydrated meals. This 3-day emergency package includes some of their most popular meals.  My Boy Scout son favorites include the chicken and rice, chicken teriyaki and biscuits and gravy.These meals have a shelf life of over 12 years. (Kinda of scary when you think about it).  I find them very easy to prepare. You simply add the correct amount of boiling water, stir, seal package and wait 10-14 minutes (stirring once about 4 minutes into the process). The packages range from 2.5-3 servings of 1 cup. On a hiking trip my teenage son eats at least one entire package as his big meal of the day. One cup serving ranges from 200-300 calories. So, if this truly is your only source of food for a few days you will not starve, but you won't have the calorie intake of your normal American meal.I think the food tastes ok. I cook a lot from scratch, so to me these meals have a very packaged taste to them. The quality of the dehydrated food, the variety offered, and the ease of preparing can't be beat.  Also, these meals individually sell for between $6-$8 apiece. So purchasing a case like this saves a little bit of money as well.

I applied generously to my face as instructions stated and was surprised to find waiting the two minutes as the packaging suggested that the mud was still very wet. After I rinsed it off, my face felt a little tighter, pores looked a little smaller, and skin felt a little softer. To be honest, I did not feel or see a noticable enough improvement to justify the cost of this mud mask.Other have remarked about the mask's scent. Well, it smells like mud. I appreciate that it doesn't seem like a lot of other ingredients were added. A list of ingredients was not provided on/in the package I received, which knocked this product down a star.According to the AHAVA website the full list of ingredients for this mud mask is more complex than I thought it would be:Kaolin, Silt (Dead Sea Mud), Aqua (Mineral Spring Water), Cocamide MEA & DMDM Hydantoin & Sodium Lauroamphoacetate & Sodium Trideceth Sulfate, Propanediol (Corn derived Glycol), Glyceryl Stearate, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract & Propylene Glycol, Glycerin, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Ceteareth-30 & Cetearyl Alcohol, Maris Sal (Dead Sea Water), Sodium Lactate, Zinc Oxide, Caprylyl Glycol & Chlorphenesin & Phenoxyethanol, Panthenol (Pro Vitamin B5) , Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Oil, Stearyl Alcohol, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Peg-40 Stearate, Allantoin, Lactic Acid, Dimethicone, Sorbitan Tristearate, Xanthan Gum, PEG-5 Cocoate & PEG-8 Dicocoate & PEG-9 & Iodopropynyl Butylcarbamate, Triclosan, Methylisothiazolinone, BHA, Tocopherol (Vitamin E)Not super impressed.

2:04 Mins When we went on vacation we took one of these docking stations along with my hubby's tablet. It  allowed us to plug his tablet into the TV in our room and access our Amazon Prime videos and Netflix. Besides that my hubby has several of these that he uses at home, his office and while traveling. The docking station allows him to plug in and use several different devices, like printers, keyboards, screens, portable hard drives, etc, to his tablet or laptop.The advantages of this docking station:1. Very easy to set-up.2. High speed, with one gigabit port and USB 3 ports.3. Stands upright, so it doesn't take up much desk space.4. Power plug can be adapted to use outside the United States (additional purchase required).There are 2 USB 3.0A ports as well as 1 USB 3.0B to connect to your laptop/tablet and 4 USB 2.0A ports. A possible disadvantage to some, actually, is that it stands upright - a double edge sword - since it cannot be hidden away and it raises the cables up off the desk into view.  Sits nicely, however, next to your monitor so you can easily access the ports, headphone jacks, microphone jack, etc.USB 3.0 provides exceptional speed, over 10x the speed of USB 2.0.  In fact, using USB 3.0 you have theoretical maximum throughput of 5gbps (640MBps), so the I/O of an external drive nearly equals the speed of an internal drive.  With 2 ports you can connect two back up/storage devices for redundancy, even setting them up with RAID 0 to double the size, or RAID 1 to provide redundancy.  For a really good backup solution, plug a 4 bay RAID box into one of the USB 3.0 ports using RAID 5,6, or 10 - you will never lose your data and can set up incremental backups of your device(s) you plug into the docking station.I give this docking station five stars. Watch video for full review.

I ordered these napkins for the first time and really like them for everyday use. I ordered this napkins using Amazon's subscribe and save program to get the very best price. For my family of five I order a case every 6 months or so. These are very basic white paper napkins, but are better than a generic brand.

I won't buy any other brand of saltine crackers. For almost 50 years I have eaten these saltine crackers along with soups, cheese, or peanut butter. They are top quality, not too salty, light and crisp.
Great disposable razors in fun pretty colors. We use these all the time. I recommend them.

My daughter had me order this lacy mask as part of her Renaissance Festival costume. The mask arrived very quickly and was well packaged. It fit well and looked like it did on the picture online. The lace can droop a little over time, but I think when this happens you can use a little starch to stiffen it up again. My daughter liked the look of the mask, except for the eyelashes.
Love the start of season 9. Much stronger storyline, writing was perfect, acting was brillant. Finally fell in love with Peter Capaldi as the Doctor, because up to this point I really hadn't.

3:50 Mins Mountain House has a very good reputation among Scouts, hikers and campers for have above average dehydrated meals. This 3-day emergency package includes some of their most popular meals.  My Boy Scout son favorites include the chicken and rice, chicken teriyaki and biscuits and gravy.These meals have a shelf life of over 12 years. (Kinda of scary when you think about it).  I find them very easy to prepare. You simply add the correct amount of boiling water, stir, seal package and wait 10-14 minutes (stirring once about 4 minutes into the process). The packages range from 2.5-3 servings of 1 cup. On a hiking trip my teenage son eats at least one entire package as his big meal of the day. One cup serving ranges from 200-300 calories. So, if this truly is your only source of food for a few days you will not starve, but you won't have the calorie intake of your normal American meal.I think the food tastes ok. I cook a lot from scratch, so to me these meals have a very packaged taste to them. The quality of the dehydrated food, the variety offered, and the ease of preparing can't be beat.  Also, these meals individually sell for between $6-$8 apiece. So purchasing a case like this saves a little bit of money as well.

2:42 Mins Since I have maintained over the 30 years that I've known my husband that my farts smell like roses, I couldn't very well use myself as the trial subject for this product. Using another unnamed family member I can say unequivocally that this spray does eliminate the nastiest of toilet odors.For this product to work:1. You have to have the time and forethought to spray the poo-pourri into the toilet before you go. This eliminates most parents of young children and woman over the age of 45, where getting to the toilet on time is the greater battle.2. You have to convince others that THEY really REALLY should use this product on a regular basis, since obviously, that smell is not a product of your own body waste.Who/what this product is made for:1. Your Great-Aunt Mildred. (the one that eats cabbage for breakfast)2. Would make a great white elephant gift.3. If you know this product is for you, you may want to purchase extra for your office restrooms. Your co-workers would appreciate it.4. Any chili parlor restroom.

"Who is like the Lord our God, Who dwells on high, Who humbles Himself to behold The things that are in the heavens and in the earth?" -- Psalm 113:5-6 (NKJV)Calling The Finkler Question a funny book is like calling Hamlet a humorous play ... just because it has the gravediggers commenting on a skull. There certainly is humor in The Finkler Question, humor designed to soften what otherwise would be too much angst and gloom for many readers to sustain.So if you are looking for a good old belly laugh, look elsewhere.If you want to learn more about identity, this is your book. Howard Jacobson has succeeded in providing the kind of multi-layer story that delivers new insights each time it is reread or thought about again. While on the surface the main story line is about a life-changing event that causes a Gentile to see himself differently, the application of that story is much broader.While I'm sure many people who are Jewish or know much about Jewish life will point out the inaccuracies in what is portrayed, I think that they will miss what I take to be the author's point in choosing to do so: identity looks much different from without than from within. For that reason, Jewish people will probably "get" more of the book's intended message ... to the extent that they don't take the details as an attempt to portray their own lives and beliefs.The book also has much to say about the forms of identity that form our foundation, contrasting identity through birth, connection to others, relative to others, and in contrast to others. Through the story's development, it's clear that Mr. Jacobson favors seeking a firmer foundation based on a sense of the uniqueness that defines a person.It's not an easy read. You have to chew on it. I took the book in small doses and felt rewarded for doing so over four weeks. Stop whenever you've got a mouthful and don't start again until that mouthful is swallowed and digested.Before you leave the book behind, reflect on who you are? Who is that person?Bravo, Mr. Jacobson!

"You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden." -- Matthew 5:14 (NKJV)I admire anyone who attempts to write a novel called "Paris: The Novel." I think it's an impossible task, but I deeply appreciate the opportunity to enjoy the best of what is provided. And I thought that the best in this book was pretty interesting: glimpses of the Eiffel Tower that reminded me of visits there and extended my understanding of its structure and history, spotlights placed on some of the lesser-known parts of French history (such as the Commune), and an interesting character who is well-woven into much of the plot (Thomas Gascon).Unfortunately, the book isn't as consistently interesting, focused, and detailed. The characters are often little more than sketches. And Mr. Rutherfurd loves to quickly switch centuries to make ironic connections between families that must be more amusing to him than they were to me. Many favorite spots in Paris receive only a quick dab. I think the book's plan was too ambitious. Cut it back to just following the last 150 years with fewer of the best-developed characters, and I think the book could have been a big winner. It's not a strike-out by any means, but more of a bloop hit rather than a line-drive after making solid contact.I do recommend the book, but don't expect that you will find the same Paris that you know and love. In many cases, you'll get more of a passing reference to names and places that are familiar ... but little else. The book is actually more focused on France than on Paris. But if it had been called "France: The Novel," the difference between the title and scope would have been even more obvious.Pay attention to the Family Tree in the front of the book (better yet, stick a bookmark there for easier access), or you may find that you are struggling to keep track of characters whose names are different, but whose characteristics aren't especially memorable.One final word: If you aren't especially interested in how the Statue of Liberty and the Eiffel Tower were built, you won't like this book as much as I did.Solid work, Mr. Rutherfurd!

"I am slow of speech and slow of tongue." -- Exodus 4:10 (NKJV)If you have never read a Nora Roberts novel, you will probably like this book better than I did. I expected a lot more than the book delivered. As I read it, the book felt to me as if it had been written as a brief plot draft and padded out to novel length. There was enough here to make a nice, tight novella ... but not enough for a novel. As a result, it's oh so slow!Having shared those views, the book has one redeeming quality: Abra Walsh is an interesting character, well developed in every way. Otherwise, I would have described Whiskey Beach as a one-star book. I hope Ms. Roberts will write a whole book about Abra Walsh. Now, that would make for good reading!The lead character, Eli Landon, reminds me of the lead sinkers that I put on fishing line to get the bait below the surface where only the fish will see it. Abra Walsh needed a male foil, but Eli Landon is as leaden a one as I've had the misfortune to read about in some time. Ms. Roberts could have just called him, "John Victim," and let him soak in his victimhood for 80 percent of the book ... and few would have noticed the difference.There are some tiny mysteries in the book (not much more than what would sustain a short story), and I don't think those will draw you in.While there is a love story here, it's more of a "nurse Abra takes on the self-crippled victim" than a love story that would inspire many readers.It's very watered-down whiskey, indeed!

"For My yoke is easy and My burden is light." -- Matthew 11:30 (NKJV)I have been using a reliable Lawn Boy for 29 years. My Dad was a gardener, and he relied on them for decades before that. Carburetor troubles this spring meant that the Lawn Boy was in the shop. Then, the rains came. My grass was two feet tall when I finally ordered this mower from Amazon.com. Although Amazon.com said it was in stock, they didn't send it for a week after I ordered it. But it came in two days.Having read that some people had trouble with this model and gasoline, I carefully read the directions which said "unleaded regular gasoline with no more than 10 percent ethanol." I bought some, poured the oil from the box into the crankcase, pulled the starter very easily, and took off with my new mower. It easily cut and mulched everything I tried it on, including vines creeping in from the forest. The engine never faltered, and I just went forward. The work was much easier than with my Lawn Boy ... and went faster.I think this mower is a great deal. Get one!

"There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear involves torment." -- 1 John 4:18 (NKJV)Regardless of your ultimate view of this book, I think you'll agree that pages 1 through 49 are as well written as anything you've read in a long time. Bravo, Mr. Hosseini! They are a remarkable achievement!!While anyone would envy an author who accomplished so much to open a novel, there's a problem. Readers expect the rest of the book to maintain that remarkably high standard.I believe that Mr. Hosseini has the talent to do so. The plot for this book, its scope, and length make it impossible to do so. You couldn't write War and Peace in many fewer words ... or a Tale of Two Cities. And the Mountains Echoed needs to be two or three times longer to flesh out his plan for the book.Without that length, the book comes across as a series of short stories briefly connected to one or the other of the two siblings in the book's beginning, Abdullah and Pari.
